name: Eveden: Next level card game
description: Eveden: Next level card game is a two player card game playing on 25 squares arranged in an five by five grid. You are the representative of champion from one of the six region. You earn victory point by defeating enemy card. Normally, you earn victory point equal to the defeated enemy card. You immediately win the game when you earn 10 victory points.

name: Magnet-Auto-Spiel
description: The objective of the game is to navigate a car through a nature track using a magnet underneath the game board. A driving pole is used to move the magnet underneath the board. The player that navigates the car to the end of the track with the least mistakes, i.e. knocking over obstacles, in the least amount of time wins.

name: The GAMES 100 Game
description:
The GAMES 100 Game is played on two boards, one for each phase of the game. Some spaces on the boards show snippets of photos from the Games 100 (in the same issue).

In phase one players move around the first board using chips numbered 1-3; playing a chip allows a player to move exactly that number of spaces. If a player lands on a space with a picture they claim it with a marker; other spaces have instructions which are followed. If a player cannot move they take one of the played chips.

When a player has occupied enough photo spaces phase two begins on the second board; the player ending phase one gets to transfer their markers to this board, which block the other players. The first player to reach the ending space wins.

name: Igni Ferroque: Great Battles of the Ancient World – Volume I
description:
Igni Ferroque: Great Battles of the Ancient World places some of the most important battles in the ancient world at your fingertips.

Complete maps, descriptions and army compositions that can be used with any Ancient rules set.

The sands of time reveal the struggle of power and control for those who dare.

Includes extra rules for SCUTARII.

23 Battles featured:
KADESH 1300 B.C.
MARATHON 490 B.C.
ASCULUM 279 A.D.
CALLINICUM 531 A.D.
BIBRACTE 58 B.C.
MAGNESIA 190 B.C.
TREBIA 218 B.C.
PLATAEA 479 B.C.
CUNUXA 401 B.C.
ZAMA 202 B.C.
ISSUS 333 B.C.
HYDASPES 326 B.C.
GRANICUS 334 B.C.
CHAERONEA 338 B.C.
ARGENTORATUM 357 A.D.
CHALONS 451 A.D.
NIHRIYA 1230 B.C.
BABYLON 1225 B.C.
AD DECIMUM 533 A.D.
NEMEA 397 B.C.
PHARSALUS 48 B.C.
RAPHIA 217 B.C.
PARAITAKANE 317/316 B.C.
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: School Year Diary: NTK class
description:
A co-op, school-themed, competitive, puzzle game for 1-4 players.

You are a teacher, an energized person loving school and classroom. You have desires to direct your students torward the best outcome. Each student brings their unique personality to each classroom. Each unlocked event brings new challenges for all members of the class.

You are going to:

Give out directives and all students will follow. They listen to you.
Collect unique items by unlocking experiences of your students. They share with you.
Collect medals when your students achieve the maximum score of a subject. You are rewarded.


In Co-op mode (Cooperative), all players win together after collecting all medal rows on board.
In Comp mode (Competitive), the 1 winner is determined by comparisons: have the most victory points (VP), have their turn earlier.

The games featured random starting deck for each unique replay. The puzzle combinations, the directives in teachers' hand, the events and experiences to be unfold in each play are totally different.

All students from the game add their personality to the progress of the game. Each student is unique, dependant to each other, you can play with any combinations you like.
Because of that, players can actually design and print out their own students, their experiences and add to the game. Notes: the cards's designs do not need to follow the same as the game.

The game mechanics revolve around basic geometric puzzle. Allow players to be flexible to enjoy learning the game earlier and mastering the game later.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Chaining, Cooperative Game, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hand Management

name: Advanced Premier Soccer
description:
Advanced Premier Soccer is a dice-driven simulation of English Premier League soccer based on actual league and player statistics and suitable for either solitaire or competitive play. Advanced Premier Soccer upgrades and expands the game system developed in the original Premier Soccer by including factors such as shot location, man marking, individual defensive ratings, professional fouls, and revised durability and fatigue rules for league play.

Players take on the role of the manager - choosing a tactical formation and playing style, selecting a lineup, determining marking priorities, making changes in personnel and/or tactics, and dealing with the issues of player discipline and fatigue. The basic unit of play is the possession - defined as a period of extended control in the opponent's half of the pitch that may result in a shot. A typical game features 30-40 possessions and takes about 40-45 minutes to complete.

All team and player ratings are based on actual statistics from the 2019-2020 EPL season. Team sets for 2020-2021 will be made available following the conclusion of the current season.

—description from the designer

name: Saving Mansfield Park
description:
The historic estate of Mansfield Park has fallen into ruin. Franny Bertram, a descendant of some of Jane Austen’s most beloved characters, has turned a few rooms into a bed and breakfast and is trying to restore more of it, but she needs your help to find small antiques she can sell to fund the project.

Search the rooms of the mansion to find the valuable items and collector edition books before a hotel developer makes it up the walkway and inside the house. If she does, she’ll take over the mortgage and tear the mansion down. Then Franny’s dream will be no more. There is a secret passage which could help in the search, but you have to find it first.

You get to make choices in how you conduct your search. The item tiles are scattered throughout the rooms face down, and their location changes each time you play. With a list of what you need, you can roll the dice to move throughout the mansion, picking up items when you find them. Each time you look at an item in a room, whether you collect it or not, you’ll draw an action card which may take you to a different place, and that may change your strategy for your next turn. The action card may help the hotel developer move forward to the front door, and that puts the pressure on you and the other players to complete the search before she makes it inside.

Since you also need to put together a set of collectible books, all of which are piled in the attic, it’s your choice when to go there instead of rolling the dice. And then there is the location to the secret passage. Each player has cards that offer clues, but you’ll need to know who has what to narrow down the possibilities. If you are the first to work out where it is, you’ll be able to move freely throughout the house, but you’ll have to decide if it’s worth it to spend your turn on the search for it, or if your time is better spent in other choices. Players who are familiar with Jane Austen’s books will recognize characters and situations, but no knowledge of them is required to play. It’s all about the search!

—description from the designer

name: La Martinique au bout des doigts
description:
La Martinique au bout des doigts is a game to test your knowledge of the island of Martinique.

A game for 2-3 teams of players who need to answer as many questions as possible for each card.

The categories covers gastronomy, heritage, music, literature, geography, economy, fauna, flora, sport...

It contains 200 cards, 3 pawns, an hourglass and a board

name: Der lustige 7ner
description:
Each player gets a game card and rolls two dice each turn. The result is covered with a game token on the game card. If a result is already covered it is only covered a second time, if the result consists of two identical numbers (für instance 4 and 4). On the roll of a 7 one token is removed from every number on the card. If the whole 2nd row is covered, the player uses only 1 die for the rest of the game.

The first player to cover all numbers on his card, wins the game.

name: Volley and Charge!
description:
Volley and Charge!

These rules are 1 page long.

They are intended for a quick and simple horse and musket game set in the middle of the 18th Century, using 25-30mm model solders.

They are meant for use at conventions or when time is short.

They are cut-to-the-bone version of Steady Bayonets 1756.

name: Bannum & Bellum
description:
Sinopsis:
The world is in war. War brings conflict, and violence and greed bring profit. You are a mercenary leader, a general. You have no land nor flag, and tou crave fortune, be it power, wealth or knowledge. The Lords you work for have given you the resources to fight their battles. Be cunning and lead your troops to voctory. Win the war!

Description:
BELLUM is a card game where players take the role of a war General. They will choose their units and send them to the battle.

Each battle takes place in a Battleground, where the players will put their cards to work for 1 coin each. The cards have different units, and they can combine with each other in different ways, supported by their Commander. The players’ objective is to arrange their troops in the best possible way to maximize their score.

When the battle (round) is finished, the winner will claim the Battleground and this will count as a victory.

The player who first achieves the objective number of victories will be the winner.

name: Grid Blocked
description:
Grid blocked is a fast paced 2 to 8 player game where players take turns rolling the dice and placing tiles to create different patterns. Players that get the best combo of shapes boost their points. Players interact with one another with their actions to get the most points each round. The first player to reach 100 points wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Trivial Pursuit: Champagne Ardenne
description: Discover or rediscover the region Champagne Ardenne, in North-east France, in 1800 questions in 6 categories by playing with this edition of the Trivial Pursuit.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game
publishers: Hasbro, Horn Abbot International, Winning Moves France

name: Champagne Ardenne: Toute la Champagne-Ardenne en 1000 questions
description:
A simple trivia game about the region of Champagne-Ardenne in North-east France.

As long as a player answer questions she/he can keep rolling the dice.

The winner is the first player to collect 5 city-stages, in any order.

1000 questions in 5 categories:

History,
Culture & traditions,
Science & nature,
Geography & tourism,
Sport & contemporary life
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Imperial Armour: Index – Forces of the Adeptus Astartes
description:
This is the complete reference book for using Forge World's range of Adeptus Astartes models in apocalyptic games of Warhammer 40,000. Within this book are over 70 updated unit datasheets for the heroic commanders of the Space Marine Chapters and the tanks, aircraft, artillery, and Dreadnoughts under their charges, as well as the Grey Knights, Inquisition, and the Sisters of Battle.

With some of the most devastating vehicles and venerable heroes know to the Imperium available as reinforcements for the Space Marines, Imperial Armour contains vital reinforcements for beleaguered Space marine commanders int he unending war against the foul hordes of the mutant, the traitor and the alien.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Murder of Crows: "'Twas the night before Christmas" Promo Card
description: Free promotional card for Murder of Crows card game. This card adds an additional "M" card for building your murder.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Word Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Spelling, Take That

name: Pays Basque: Tout le Pays Basque en 1000 questions
description:
A simple trivia game about the Basque country region Pays Basque, in South-west France and North-west Spain.

As long as a player answer questions she/he can keep rolling the dice.

The winner is the first player to collect 5 city-stages, in any order.

1000 questions in 5 categories:

History,
Culture & traditions,
Science & nature,
Geography & tourism,
Sport & contemporary life
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Fearless Franco
description:
Franco is an aging stunt daredevil. He wants to jump 10 more years and retire on top. His close associates include his trusty mechanic, his unethical doctor, and his gold-digging girlfriend. And there are also side-betting spectators.

Franco earns money and glory from completing jumps. The other players earn money from the cards they play. Every player has their own agenda. So the game can change from a co-op game to a screw-your-neighbor game in a second.

Each player has their own deck of cards and play cards during a turn. The cards might earn you money, or affect the next jump, or help/harm another player. Some cards are LD cards and laid down and then have benefits for every turn. The most important card is a players Hold card. It is placed face down and is a player's end-game strategy. Are you betting on Franco landing a great jump, or trying to profit from his fiery death.

Every few turns/seasons Franco will perform a jump. It could be a luck jump by rolling a die, or a skill (dexterity) jump by sliding his vehicle token up a ramp and onto a target. Bad jump landings result in damage to Franco's vehicle and injuries to himself. His mechanic will need money to repair Franco's vehicles, and his doctor will try to double bill for any hospital visits.

Each turn is a season of the year. So a game could last all 40 turns/seasons. However, the game could end abruptly if Franco dies or is forced into retirement because of excessive injuries. When the game ends, the player with the most money or glory wins.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Bribery, Finale Ending, Income, Negotiation, Slide/Push, Take That

name: Royal Show Hand
description:
In Royal Show Hand, players are ministers of the king, struggling to become the most influence person in the king’s court. But be careful, your king is very sensitive. He will not allow others have more influence than him in his own court.

In the game, players will collect a card pattern like a poker game in front to them, while your king will also form a card pattern in front of him.

At the end of game, the player who has highest pattern rank but lower than king’s pattern rank will win the game. If all players’ pattern rank are higher than king’s pattern rank, the player who has lowest pattern rank will win the game.

This game's basic rule can be played by a standard playing card deck.

-description from designer

name: Vocational Guidance for Androids
description:
Ever since our human creators were removed from the planet, many utility androids have lost their purpose. It is the Vocational Guidance Councillor’s task to decommission these androids. To avoid this fate you, as a poor carpet sweeper, will have to scavenge through discarded programmes and assimilate their code in order to prove to the councillor that you are worthy to sweep the streets.

As an ageing, defunct android, devoid of purpose, you must change your programming in order to avoid decommissioning by the Vocational Guidance Councillor.

During your turn, you will allocate action points across four rows of actions that you can perform with the aim of clearing the clutter, collecting energy cubes and purchasing code upgrades.

Initially, each row has a single action, but as you obtain additional programme cards to improve your Android’s “engine”, the more actions can be performed.

The game plays over eight rounds. Each round, a new programme card is revealed, clutter and energy is distributed across the three locations and the Vocational Guidance Councillor is moved. Players then allocate their action cubes to clear the clutter and collect energy cubes in order to obtain new programme cards.

The programme cards contain a mixture of VP, common actions as unique actions.

The objective of the game is to have the most VP by the end of the last round. In addition to VP shown on the programme cards, VP is also gained by storing clutter on the programme cards.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Resource to Move, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Frogs on a Lily Pad Game
description:
Frogs on a Lily Pad provides hours of fun for kids while teaching them their numbers. Who can collect the most frogs? Get it, play it, Enjoy!

How to play:


Spin the Spinner
Pick a number card that matches your spin
Collect Frogs


—description from the back of the box

name: Carbon Control
description:
A board game with an organic chemistry theme, not requiring any chemistry knowledge to play.

Playing is centered around collecting carbon atoms, which act as the currency of the game, collecting molecule cards from different functional groups, building molecules to secure the atoms and receiving test tubes that gives a player different advantages and abilities. The player first to collect six different test tubes is winner.

Carbon atoms can be exchanged for other types of atoms as well as regulating an e-level, which must be kept in certain limits. Every time a player passes the Start square on the board all atoms that are not built into molecules are lost.

In an advanced mode other players molecules can be attacked and destroyed.

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Income, Lose a Turn, Market, Ownership, Random Production, Secret Unit Deployment, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Player Powers

name: Necromunda: Underhive – Ancient Vox Box Tactics Card
description:
Promo found in White Dwarf issue 458 from November 2020.
Play this card when activating a fighter.
When this card is played, decide how many times the activating fighter will turn the crank (1 to 3 times). roll that many D6, add the results together and check the effect.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Alsa Ludo
description:
With Alsa Ludo, rediscover alone, with family or friends, the cultural riches of Alsace, by playing with 160 puzzle cards with detailed statements.

Among the many topics covered; Castles of Alsace & Alsatian Traditions: construction and specificities of many castles, famous people or families, significant events, village festivals, local law, gastronomy, costume, dialect, legends, tourist routes, music...

Object of the game: reach 10 points!

name: Magnytour Profil: Championnat d'Europe
description:
190 km of flat is on the program in 2019 for the title.

Theoretically, it's an ultra-flat profile in the Netherlands which should allow sprinters to become European champions, but beware of the verges.

name: Black Card Revoked: Still Petty Edition
description:
Black Card Revoked: Still Petty Edition is a 36-card expansion for any edition of Black Card Revoked created in partnership with website The Shade Room.

Petty (2017) / Still Petty (2018) - Expansion packs with cards dedicated to all-around pettiness, celebrity tea spilling, and shade throwing, Still Petty edition contains 36 new cards. Example photos show different cards in each set. Both sets were on sale at the same time. Originally called Petty edition.
mechanics: Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Klettermäuse
description:
The little mice want to grab the juicy apples that the wind has shaken from the tree. But here comes the sly fox, who also likes to eat apples. The little mice quickly climb the apple tree to hide. In order to get to the ripe apples in the meadow, the mice climb up and down: The little climbing mice hang onto each other and rappel down the tree. But who is the fastest and grabs the most apples from the meadow?

Two dice depicting different colors are rolled in turns. The main task for the players is to pay attention and react fast by finding the matching color combination of double-colored mice tokens by putting their hands on them.

Whoever gets the right mice first may take them - and either hang them on his branch of the large apple tree in the center of the table or - if they don't match in color - keep them for a later turn.

When a wind icon is rolled, the mice on the branches may be re-sorted and can be put together with the same colored sides, hanging from a branch in a domino-like fashion. If the chain of mice reaches 5 tokens, they get to the ground and players may pick up an apple token. The player, who gets to 2 apples first, wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Race, Speed Matching

name: Toymakers
description:
With just 18 cards and no other components, Toymakers is a full worker placement game; collect resources, construct buildings, make toys, spread joy!

Toymakers uses a resource management mechanism where the card you place your worker on is taken into your hand for resources. The cards double as buildings which provide more resources in a single action, and also can be upgraded to a toy, scoring you points! Time your upgrades correctly; when the last card is drawn from the middle of the table, the game ends!

—description from the publisher

name: Fauna Europea
description: Educational game in order to sensitize people about caring for the environment and the different animal and plant species focused on European fauna.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Lorraine
description: Trivial Pursuit: Lorraine lets you discover or rediscover the Lorraine region, in North-east France with questions in 6 categories.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Pays Graylois: Le jeu
description:
The game of the Pays Graylois is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the centers of the Pays Graylois: Val de Gray, Monts-de-Gy and Quatre Rivières...
and then go discover all the sectors with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities, traditions, heritage....
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: It Takes A Thief
description:
A modular 3D board game where players take on the roles of thieves to steal loot to complete objectives.
The thief with the most prestige point after a set amount of rounds wins.
Difficulty is modified by adding or subtracting "Guard" cards along with longer or shorter games via more or less rounds.
Tiles are placed on each turn, making the dwelling more accessible to the players.
Players have the option to: defeat or evade guards, and disarm or evade traps.
Inventory management by using a player board means that not every piece of loot can be taken.
Items are used to gain bonuses, or complete objectives, the players must choose wisely.
mechanics: Action Points, Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Map Addition, Memory, Modular Board, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Le Mans et son Pays: Le jeu
description:
Le Mans et son Pays is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the town centers in the department of Sarthe... and then go travel all the sectors with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities....

The winner will have to be the first one to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: The Birth of the Stone Monkey
description:
This picture book and game tells the story of The Birth of Stone Monkey. In Aolai Country, there is an island called Mountain of Flowers and Fruit which has a magic stone on the top of it. The stone receives the power from nature and bursts open one day to produce a stone monkey. The stone monkey leaps straight to the waterfall to explore and travel across the continents and oceans to worship Patriarch Subhut for learning skills.

Different adventure levels combined mathematical knowledge into the game to help children enlighten thinking, master knowledge, develop good habits of independent learning and active thinking. 6 games correspond to 6 education points: recognize three-dimensional graphics; recognize numbers; understand locations and directions; recognize time, and recognize plane figures and colors. It also includes an observance ability training activity.

To win 6 levels of the game:
- The Birth of the Stone Monkey: Fill the picture that shows the scene of the Mountain
- Jump into the Cave of Water Curtains: Help the monkey jump into the cave of water curtains
- Monkey King in the Cave of the Water Curtains: Help the monkeys host the feast
- Search for Three-Stared Cave: Find Three-Stared Cave
- Pass Down the Magic in the Middle of the Night: Find out the exact time to meet Master Bodhisattva
- 72 Transfigurations: Help Wukong learn three kinds of transfigurations

After you complete each level, insert the manual card to the corresponding page in the passport comes with the game. The first one who collects all 6 manual cards and fills the passport is the winner of the game.

-description from publisher
categories: Book, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Novel-based
mechanics: Memory, Role Playing, Set Collection, Storytelling

name: Uproar in Heaven
description:
This picture book and game tells the story of Uproar in Heaven. Sun Wukong returned after learning and found golden cudgel while he explores the Dragon Palace, signed the book of life and death at King Yama's place, and uproar in the Heaven.

Different adventure levels combined mathematical knowledge into the game to help children enlighten thinking, master knowledge, develop good habits of independent learning and active thinking. 6 games correspond to 6 education points: Master arithmetic within 20; Understand Spatial Transformation; Recognize shapes and locations change; Recognize plane figures and understand regularity. It also includes a reaction ability training activity.

To win 6 levels in the game:
- Treasure Hunt in Dragon Palace: Help Wukong escape the Dragon Palace.
- The book of Life and Death: Fold the book of life and death
- Uproar in Heaven: Defeat the rivals
- Casting spells in Peach Garden: Freeze the seven fairies
- Erlang Shen: Get to know the secret of 72 transfigurations
- Escape the Cauldron: Help Wukong get out of the Cauldron

After you complete each level, insert the manual card to the corresponding page in the passport comes with the game. The first one who collects all 6 manual cards and fills the passport is the winner of the game.

-description from publisher
categories: Book, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Novel-based

name: The Battle for Hamburger Hill
description:
This game challenges the players to re-fight the Battle for Hamburger Hill. Can you, as the U.S. player, destroy the NVA, capture the hill and deny the enemy their base area? Or will the NVA player triumph and hold their ground? Get ready to re-live or re-write history in the battle for Hamburger Hill!

The Battle for Hamburger Hill lasts 11 turn-pair game-days (with a night turn each game-day also). Each turn, players alternate moving and attacking each other’s forces on the game map, which is divided into hexes. Combat can include small arms firefights between adjacent units or fire missions that target hexes with artillery, airstrikes, helicopter gunships and mortars.

At the end of each combat phase, once all fire combat is complete, adjacent units may conduct close quarters combat (CQC) to decide which force will occupy contested hexes. Each game-day, after all movement and combat is completed, both sides draw cards to determine special actions for the future day’s turns and may get reinforcements according to card events, history and the roll of the dice.

As the North Vietnamese Army (NVA) player, your goal is to hold hill 937 and hill 916. If, at the end of the last turn, the U.S. player does not control both of the summit hexes, you have won.

As the Allied player, your goal is to control both summit hexes at the same time. Whenever the U.S. player has accomplished this at the end of a game-day, the game ends with a U.S. victory.

name: Tame Four Disciples
description:
This picture book and game tells the story of Tame Four Disciples. Sun Wukong was sealed under the Five Elements Mountain for five hundred years. Tang Sanzang released Sun and they finally met. After that, Tang tamed the white horse in Eagle's Sorrow Gorge, won over Zhu Bajie in Old Gao Village, and fought with Sha Wujing at the River of Flowing Sands.

Different adventure levels combined mathematical knowledge into the game to help children enlighten thinking, master knowledge, develop good habits of independent learning and active thinking. 6 games correspond to 6 education points: Understand graphical decomposition and combination; Recognize numbers within 100; Understand the set of the numbers, and draw route map. It also includes a focus ability training activity and a logical ability training activity.

To win 6 levels of the game:
- Five Elements Mountain: Help Tang Sanzang climb to the top of the mountain
- Band-tightening spell: Recognizing numbers within 100/dynamic memory
- Tame the Bailong in the Yingchou Mountain Stream: Guess and see who is fastest and most correct
- Zhu Bajie carry his wife: Scratch off the coating and see who Bajie is really carrying
- Tame Zhu Bajie in Yunzhan Cave: Search every corner of the cave
- Tame Sha Monk in Quicksand River: Defeat the rival

After player complete each level, insert the manual card to the corresponding page in the passport comes with the game.
The first one who collects all 6 manual cards and fills the passport is the winner of the game.

-description from publisher
categories: Book, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Memory
mechanics: Events, Memory, Movement Points, Set Collection, Storytelling

name: Flip & Phrase
description:
Flip & Phrase is a game that allows children to use Chinese words flexibly, make sentences by association, and makeup stories creatively. In the first half of the game, children do not need to write, so they can focus on their creation. The second half is "writing", using associative memory, writing out keywords, and recreating the scene of the story. In the game, there are 200 frequently used words from the Chinese primary school vocabulary list. The vocabulary list requires children to master the dictation of the words and be proficient in basic Chinese words. Using the form of "oral composition" and "extract keywords", the game lowered the difficulty of the composition and raise the children's learning interest in this subject. The game also makes full use of the means of "listening, speaking, reading, and writing", combined with a real-time feedback mechanism that children can fully use their imagination to break the shackles of thinking and master the skills of composition.

Game setup: Each player takes a player map and its corresponding scoreboard, a pencil, and a sheet of notepaper. Each player draws 5 word cards. Hold them in the hand and don't let other players see them

To start the game: Reverse the hourglass for timekeeping. All players have 30 seconds to prepare an impressive story with the 5 words on the card. After 30 seconds, all players place the cards face down on their map from left to right, starting with the first player and telling each player's story in a clockwise manner. To end the game: When all players have finished telling the story, invert the hourglass and wait 30 seconds, then write down the other players' words in order on a sheet of notepaper. When one player has written all the words can be remembered, place the paper in the center of the table and turn the hourglass around again. The other players have another 30 seconds to continue to recall and record words.

After all players submit their answers, the words will be revealed by the order of storytelling. Players will give their scoring marks to the player who first turned in the notepaper with all words in a correct manner. 1 point for each correct word (correct order and spelling), 2 points for each player who memorizes 5 words from your story, 2 points for each score mark earned from another player, and -2 points for the player's own score mark. The player with the highest total score wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Stack Poetry
description:
An education board game combined with primary school level Chinese classic poetry!

This fun game of reciting ancient Chinese poems has 105 poem title cards, covering 75 ancient Chinese poems that are required to be learned in the Chinese primary schools. The question cards focus on the design of difficulty levels, from a sentence of the poem, transition to a pair of sentences of the poem, and finally the whole poem. In the game, children can gradually get the sense of achievement of reciting Chinese poetry, through the rapid response mechanism, the game fully mobilized the enthusiasm of children. Once you start the game, you just can't stop!

Game setup: Each player takes one set of pagodas, put the bell on the center of the table. Based on the difficulty level, randomly select material cards, shuffle them into a deck. There are 105 material cards in the game, they are sorted into 3 different levels: primary material cards, intermediate material cards, advanced material cards, 4 sets of pagodas (5 pagodas in each set), one bell

To start the game: Flip one material card, according to the poem, setup the pagodas by the order of color of the sentence. The first player who rings the bell wins the card. To end the game: The first player who won 12 cards wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Poetry Express
description:
Come to appreciate the classic Chinese poetry!

Poetry Express contains 75 classic poems that are required to be learned in Chinese primary school. Children can read and appreciate these classic works of "painting in poetry, poetry in painting" through the form of games. In the game, children enjoy the learning experience of poetry with their endless imagination by describing the picture expressed by the poem, knowing the poem, expressing the poem, and imagining the artistic conception of the poem.

Game setup: Shuffle the cards into a deck, use the top card of the deck to form a 5*5 square matrix with the cards face up. Shuffle the question stick, put them into the container and set it at a convenient place, put the hourglass aside

To start the game: Shake the question stick container, randomly draw 2 sticks, show the 4 keywords on both sides of the display to all players. After all of the players have confirmed the keywords, the first play reverse the hourglass, all players find and take the poem cards that meet the requirements from the square mix. Players check each other's poem cards after taking the cards that meet the requirements or after the hourglass's time is over. If a player picks up a poem card that doesn't match any keywords, the player should put all the poem cards taken from this round in front of them with the frontside of the cards facing up. If the poetry cards you take meet more than 1 requirement, for each additional keyword meet the requirement, you can take an additional poetry card from the deck (with the backside facing up, without checking the frontside of the card) as a reward, put all the poems cards and reward cards in front of you with the backside of the card facing up

To end the game: The game ends when there is no more question stick to draw or cannot complete the 5*5 square matrix with the poem cards. Each backside-up poem card counts 1 point, and each two frontside-up poem cards counts -1 point. Less than two frontside-up cards will not count the score. The player with the highest total score is the winner.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time
mechanics: Memory, Random Production, Set Collection, Storytelling

name: Doppelt oder nichts
description:
In this game, at least four players try to get rid of their hand cards by discarding either the matching color, number or symbol on the discard pile. But since everyone wants to win, there is of course the possibility of repeatedly putting a spoke in your fellow player's wheel. Action cards can be used to attack them and prevent someone else from playing their last card first.

Up to this point, the principle sounds familiar to many, but in "DOPPELT ODER NICHTS" (German for "DOUBLE OR NOTHING"), some things work a little differently: For example, it is possible to defend yourself by deflecting the attack on a fellow player, who in turn has the same option to defend himself. In this way, it can hit anyone and you can never be sure to reach the goal without being disturbed.

Constant action is therefore the order of the day and does not end with the cards. Those who are willing to take risks can, sometimes under full physical effort, gain an advantage in this card game. Through interactive, cognitive or coordinated tasks it is possible to prevent the drawing of penalty cards. However, one should then think twice, because whoever fails the task receives double the penalty. The deal is: "DOPPELT ODER NICHTS".
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Nassau Pioneer
description:
Nassau Pioneer is a trick-taking game. During the game Player will deal with PirateTeam, collect goods, control the market. The game can be played with only 54 cards.

At the beginning of a new round, Players without any card in their hand, the game will be over. All Players show their IDcards and calculate the score, the player with the most VP will be the winner.

name: Al Abordaje
description:
Preparation:
Each player receives a ship and the 15 balls of one color, which he places in the hold of his own ship.

Roll of the dice:
In turn, the players roll the two dice and advance three balls at the same time through the game circuit as many squares as there are points on the dice. If a star comes out on the roll of the dice, the three balls are advanced as many squares as the other dice indicates, and if the two stars come out, the Discomatic mechanism moves in the direction indicated by the arrow.

Game system:
On each game turn, after the dice are rolled, each player must advance three balls consecutively placed on the board: if the ball located in advance is advanced, the two balls immediately behind must also advance; if you want to advance a ball located in between the heading ball and your boat hold, you must advance those located at its same point of advance or immediately behind it; if you want to play a ball that has not yet entered play, you must advance two others that are still in your own boat (in your side of the board).

The balls, which can only circulate in one direction: towards the opposing boat, can go ahead passing one over the other (even if they are from opposing sides).

In each square there can only be one ball, and if it falls on the square occupied by an opposing ball, it is taken prisoner and placed in the hold of the own ship. This rule also applies to orange squares.

Prisoner rescue:
When, with an exact roll of the dice, with no remaining points, a ball manages to reach an orange square on the opposing ship, it frees as many prisoners as there are points indicated by the immediate roll of a die. If a star appears, the roll is repeated. The ball that has reached the opposing boat is removed from play.

End of game:
The first player who manages to get six balls to the opposing boat wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Brains!: Promo Pack
description:
12 Promotional card for Brains (including the cover card)

Released alongside Kickstarter base game but packaged separately from it.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Zombies

name: Culture Shock: The Black British History Quiz Game
description:
Culture Shock is a fun and educational quiz card game that inspires learning about the history of Black people in Britain spanning over a hundred years.

With 52 question cards, players will test their knowledge on key figures in British history, key dates and events. Question topics range from sports to politics, music to activism.

Players can participate in teams or face off individually. Each question card is worth points. The player or team with the most points wins.

Culture Shock is the ideal game to play on a games night, while traveling or in a classroom.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Bobo: Hoera ik ben 4
description: Bobo celebrates his 4th birthday. Now he can go to school. In the box are four games: getallen memory (number memory), Bobo's wijzerspel (Bobo's spin the wheel game), Bobolino and kleuren-dobbelspel (color dice game).

name: Mosquito Family
description:
Mosquito Family is about assaulting unsuspecting people and pets with your mosquitoes to collect blood and increase popularity among mosquitoes.
But be careful, otherwise your mosquitoes will have to escape!

Object of the game:
Have the most blood at the end of the game.

Player Turn:
At each turn these steps must be performed:
1. Day or night
If you are the first to take a turn, in this round, turn the Day/Night card over.
2. Assault a target
Choose an available Target card that has the Blood face visible and draw Blood cards to assault a target. In case you draw a Look card, or you exceed tolerance limit of the target (based on the visible face of Day/Night card), stop immediately and the Angry face step begins. In the Angry face step, flip Event cards and try to run away!
3. Coming home
Place live Mosquito Tokens that have assaulted a target on the Player Card Blood Track, at the value equal to the amount of blood collected. You can place Mosquito Tokens over the others. Those Mosquito Tokens remain on the blood track until the final scoring.
4. Targets have recovered
If all the Targets Cards have the Angry face visible: turn them so that the Blood face is visible, keep the last 4 event cards and shuffle all the others face-down to form a new deck. In any case turn all Event Cards on the table face-down.

End of the game:
The game ends when all players have no Mosquito tokens to play.
The player with the largest amount of blood is the winner.

Single Player Mode and Cooperative Mode available.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Memory, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: San-Antonio: Le jeu
description:
San-Antonio Le jeu the game about San Antonio

Detective Superintendent Antoine San-Antonio is a kind of French James Bond with a "personal" slang rather than gadgets.

Progress along the board answering language questions.
mechanics: Real-Time, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: ASL Comp: Invasion Palestine! Sinai-Negev-Galilee
description:
This is the Invasion Palestine! expansion for owners of GENESIS 3 and MAGACH 73.
Also needed are ASL RB, and Nationalities, including Russians.

Scenarios:

Sons of Galilee – Deganiaa, Israel, May 20th 1948
Etziongrad – Kfar Etzion, Palestine Mandate, May 13th 1948
Fatih-Allah – Mishmar Hayarden, June 10th 1948
I Dream of Jenin – Jenin, June 3rd 1948
The Whiskey Wager – Haifa, April 21st 1948
Death to the Invaders – Near Hill 113 and Kawkba, The Negev, July 18th 1948
Molotov Inferno – Semach, Syria, May 20th 1948
Level the Villages – Kibbutz Mishmar Haemek, Palestine Mandate, April 9th 1948
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Flip'M
description:
The game comes in a cup. The object to be flipped is M-shaped when stood upright. Players press on the 'valley' of the M using the tip of the finger and the piece will shoot upwards.

The objective of the game is to score the highest number of points in seven shots. Two points for flipping the piece into the cup and one point for hooking it on the edge.

—user summary

name: Garbage Gatherers
description:
The amount of space garbage is growing and the Earth Government has decided that this is the moment to do something. And your mech company has been selected to do the job! Take your flies and your hulk mechs to gather the garbage, extract the valuable resources and mine more bytecoins than your opponents!

On you turn, you will select one of your mech to move. If you select a Fly mech, you can go around the factories to gather some garbage or you can cross over the factories to drop the garbage previously gathered.

If there is enough garbage on a factory, it will be automatically transformed into bytecoins. Don't miss the chance to move the Spider mech to try to gather those valuable bytecoins!

The other option on your turn is to move a Hulk mech. These mech also gather those valuable bytecoins from the factories, but even more important, they won't let other Fry mech pass!

The first player who get the target amount of bytecoins will be the best Garbage Gatherer, and thus, will win the game!

—description from the designer

name: Kanalratten
description: In the underground of Korrupttown - also known as Fastfoodcity, rat gangs fight for supremacy and divide the city amongst themselves. The rats are divided into four gangs by the color of their tails: blue, green, yellow, and red. Whoever controls the most feeding places have the most followers and power. The player who controls half of all the feeding places wins the game.
mechanics: Die Icon Resolution, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Live On
description:
In Live On you take on the role of a survivor and try to escape the onslaught of zombies. Find weapons, use your skills, try to survive alone or in a team.

In 4 different types of missions, each with 3 different map sizes, you have to try to meet the mission requirements and escape alive.
You also have the opportunity to design your own map and create your own missions.

How many zombies you have to fight against is decided by your luck when you roll the dice. Is it 2 or is it 10?
But not only the zombies are your opponents, you can also decide to play against each other.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Colorbot
description:
The life is sad in Robotcity. Hopefully you will be able to change that. On kid advice, the robots decide replace their dark fuel by color paint.

Colorbot is a print and play where player will color the bot they have in their laboratory (sheet).
Each turn will will pick two markers, then use the first one and the second one. Having fuel block filled :

of only one color will bring you 3 points and the robot will gain an eye (draw it)
of three different colors 2 points and an antenna


(If you have only two colors...0 points).
When two of your 3 robots are power-on, the game ends.

An other laboratory (sheet) is provided with advanced rules (more ways to score).

—description from the publisher

name: ASL Comp: Magach 73 – The Yom Kippur War of 1973
description:
Magach 73 is an expansion for Genesis.

One of the Genesis games is needed to play this, preferably Genesis II or III.
Plus the standard ALSer Modules with British, Russians, and the ASLRB.

-description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Schuß ... Tor!
description:
Each player gets 11 pawns he puts on the marked starting positions (white numbered spaces). The first player to get all of his 11 pawns into the opponents goal wins the game (I didn't know soccer is played this way and shouldn't there be a ball?).

Movement is determined by a die. Friendly meeples may never be jumped over, opponent meeples only if a 6 is rolled. If a meeple is on the opposite side of the playing field, the player has to mind the rules regarding the colored squares.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ASL Comp: Genesis III – Arab-Israeli War 1948-67
description:
Genesis III is an update on Genesis II.

Genesis II contained 22 scenarios while Genesis III contains only 14 scenarios (all of which appeared in Genesis II, though the new versions are different because of the new boards).

Half of the scenarios are set during the 1948-49 Arab-Israeli War, while three are set in 1956, three more in 1967, and one in 1973.

Locust Swarm, Hirbet Main, Israel - 1948-49
Buying Time, Kibbutz Tad Mordechai, Israel - 1948-49
Triple Play, Malkieh, Israel - 1948-49
Trapping Nasser, Hulequait, Israel - 1948-49
Palestinian Prokhorovka, Outside Nazareth, Palestine - 1948-49
The Archers Of Um Sheham, Sinai - 1948-49 War
Edge Of The Sword, Kfar Etzion, Palestine Mandate - 1948-49
Ben-Jabo! Ashdod, Israel - 1956
Ambush At Mitla, Mitla Pass, Sinai - 1956
Final Act, Katib El-Subha, Sinai - 1956
Push To Um-Katef, Um-Katef, Sinai -1967
Bloody French Hill, Jerusalem, Israel - 1967
Syrian Spirit, Tel Faq'r, Syria - 1967
Isolation Strategy, Fort Lahzanit, Bar-Lev Line, Israel - Oct.6 1973


The maps in this module are 11"x16" (instead of the 8" x 22")
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: ASL Comp: To The Volga! 1 – Fight for the Tractor Works
description:
This is Critical Hit's module in ASL-compatible format of the battle for the Dzerhezinsky Tractor Works in Stalingrad, covering the German assault in September and October 1942. The optional Winter Map expansion provides a winterised rendition of the map and covers the Soviet counterattacks in December 1942 and January 1943.

The factory was the third of the large industrial sites in the north of Stalingrad - the other two being the Red October and Red Barricades factories which are covered in MMP's Red Factories module.

The area is the usual city terrain with rubble, debris and shellholes amongst factories and buildings, together with gullies leading down to the banks of the Volga. The Germans will be trying to blast stubborn Soviet defenders from their positions using flamethrowers, demolition charges and close combat. Meanwhile the defenders will be fortifying locations, setting up crossfire, using the sewers to infiltrate behind the attackers and generally be as difficult to root out as their real-life counterparts were.

As a module, it is not a complete game in itself but requires ownership of the Advanced Squad Leader (ASL) rulebook and Beyond Valor module as a minimum.

There are 11 scenarios ranging from small engagements to larger battles which will enable players to experience the struggle whilst attempting to capture (or defend) a significant industrial complex. The Winter Map expansion adds a further 4 scenarios.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Armada: The Great Galleon Battle
description:
Armada is a game of strategy and accurate shooting. The objective is to occupy five islands by moving galleons to sea areas next to landing stages. Players can prevent opponents from occupying by sinking their ships and knocking down their flags. The first player to hoist his flags on five islands is the winner.

Players take turns either moving two galleons one sea area, or moving one galleon one sea area and taking a shot at a flag or a ship. Shooting is done using cannons positioned at opposite ends of the board.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Nautical

name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: ZOMBIES The Final Enemy
description:
Zombie outbreaks have been going on for centuries and tend to happen more frequently during times of major conflicts. Many leaders believe it is because carnage germs and infections allow for rapid mutations and the easy spread of disease. The Zombie outbreaks over the centuries are misreported or are simply covered up.

Lock 'n Load Tactical: Zombie The Final Enemy brings Lock 'n Load Tactical system into the world of Zombie horror and a different type of conflict.

The scenarios are designed around various missions and will have a different style. Many objectives will be straightforward. Other times, you will be searching for food, weapons, and events that will change your mission objectives. many times you will be going into situations where you do not know what or who you may find.

We have designed a Zombie Outbreak system allowing you to play with your current Lock 'n Load Tactical games and have the possibility of having a Zombie breakout during your battles. The scenarios span from World War II all the way to the modern-day.

The game includes eight scenarios with a high degree of re-playability. So grab your survival gear and get ready for something very different.

—description from the publisher

name: Einer für Alle!
description:
Each player gets one or more cards and rollt three dice. The result counts for every player (one for all). The goal of the game is to cover all spaces on ones card with colored tiles. The letter die determines the card (A-F), the color die the row (red heart, blue fish, violet grapes, green frog, yellow butterfly, black raven) and the number die (1-6) the number of tiles card owner may use to cover up the symbols.

The first player to cover up all his cards wins the game.

—user summary

name: Pays de Brest: Morlaix – Le jeu
description:
Pays de Brest - Morlaix, Le jeu is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the centers of the region and then go travel the 150 communes, from the Monts d'Arrée to Ouessant, from the Crozon peninsula to the Bay of Morlaix...
with 1000 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities....
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Zähnchen
description:
A 4-player-game for kids and family with some educational emphasis on brushing teeth. Like in pachisi players run around a parcours via dice-rolling but with only 1 pawn. The first to reach the goal wins.

The fields of the parcour feature eating meals, sweets or going to bed, which require to have rolled a toothbrush on a 2nd die. If not, 1 of 6 teeth (white dice in front of each player) get "darker" by rolling the w6 again. (even 2 sections if eating sweets.)

Other fields allow players to "brush" one tooth - get it 1 section "brighter" again -, acquire a physical toothbrush - which can be used instead of rolling a toothbrush on the 2nd die - or go back to the "DOC"-field, which totally "whitens" one of the players "teeth".

Some fields (going to bed and teddy-bear) also require the player to skip her/his next turn.

The final 6 steps in the "house" each require 2 eyes of the die and can only be passed if the corresponding "tooth" of the player is completely white. If not, the player has to roll the 2nd die every turn in order to try to get "whiten" this tooth 1 section again. The last step even requires at least a 2 on the W6 AND a toothbrush on the 2nd die.

name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Miller's Men
description:
This linked set of scenarios was originally part of Warlord' 75th Anniversary Campaign, collected in full here, with the complete Firefight! rules for convenience.

Take Captain Miller's rangers from the Beach-head on a daring mission to rescue a US soldier of the 101st from deep behind enemy lines in this series of linked scenarios.
Along the way, take out a radar station and defend the town of Ramelle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Collage
description:
A game of words, bluff and tactical decisions where you stick together letters to create a word, or let other players think you know a word with those letters.

Players hold a hand of cards where each card is a letter, or a special rule of word-making. They take turns adding cards to the board, declaring that they know a word that fulfills all the conditions in play. The game stops when a player doubts that another actually knows a word with that conditions. Winner of the challenge and all other players gain points, loser gains a special power for next round.

—description from publisher

name: Magnytour Profil: De Ronde – Tour des Flandres
description:
The most important cycling race in Flanders "De Ronde", nicknamed Vlaanderens Mooiste ("Flanders' Finest").

260 km of course strewn with hills and cobblestones.
Patience is key.

name: Danza
description: In Danza, which is subtitled "The Hilarious Game of Dance Expectations vs Dance Reality", challenges you to communicate dance steps to your teammates, with them trying to guess what you're doing.

name: Tanto Cuore: Astrid Wende
description:
Promo Card released as part of the Kickstarter for Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest.

This card requires Beer cards to play, so requires the use of the Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest base game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Problem Solver
description: Players roll dice and move their pieces around a monopoly-style board. It is designed to reinforce problem solving skills during adolescence. The activity is based upon five skill steps: 1. identify the problem, 2. assume responsibility for it, 3. identify different solutions, 4. try the best solution, and 5. try other solutions if the solution originally chosen does not work.

name: The Game of 49: GameboyGeek Promo Card
description:
This card has a minimum bid of $2.

"Helping you find the next board game you'll love!"
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Bottom of the 9th: Rob Daviau
description:
Promo card for Bottom of the 9th.

Featuring Rob Daviau as a Starting Pitcher
Playing for the Unpub Prototypes
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rikiki et le trésor de Barbe-Noire
description:
Rikiki et le trésor de Barbe-Noire is a cooperative course game. It is inspired from a children book character created by Marianne Barcilon. The players must collect all the treasures before the Pirate Blackbeard rebuilds his ship and catches them.

In his turn, the player rolls the dice and applies the result among:

arrows: the front player has as many squares as there are arrows.
the compass rose: the player draws an action card and applies its effect
Pirate Flag: The player draws a piece from Blackbeard's ship and begins to assemble it.


When a player stops on a treasure map, he collects one of the tokens there. If the token is the seagull that lays the golden eggs, it collects all the tokens present there.
The action cards allow you to replay, go back, move forward several spaces or even remove a piece from Blackbeard's boat.
The game ends when Blackbeard's boat is completed, the players have lost OR when all the treasure tokens have been collected, the players have won.

name: Bounce
description:
Bounce is played on two identical 6x6 grids. The rows and columns are labeled with letters and numbers, and each space contains a letter or number.

Each player uses one of the grids. On a turn a player marks an empty space in their grid, and the letter or number in that space determines the row or column where their opponent must play. That play will determine where the first player must play, and so on.

The winner is the first player to mark four adjacent spaces in a line.

name: Rise of the Round Table
description:
King Arthur has taken the throne of England. As the Ladies and Lords of the Kingdom, you will need to help the kingdom prosper. The king gives you quests to build castles, raise forces to defend the kingdom, and expand the Economic base for your lands.
Can you rise to the challenge to bring greatness to Avalon, and by happenstance, your own lands?
A euro game at heart. Use the unique Rondel movement system to position pieces on the board, gather resources, and complete tasks given by King Arthur.

—description from the publisher

name: BatKrun: Alons bat'karé La Réunion
description:
BatKrun is the contraction of the Creole word “Bat’Karé” (to walk) and Run (short for Réunion) and can be translated as “Alons bat’karé La Réunion”.
This game, which received the Innovation Award from the Technopole de La Réunion in 2015, offers its players a real immersion in the daily life of Reunion Island, with its traditions, its living together, its magnificent landscapes and is intended for all lovers of Reunion.

The goal of the game is to obtain the famous title of Ambassador of Reunion by gathering the 5 Ambassador cards of the 5 zones of the game: North, East, South, West and Les Hauts.

Gameplay: the player, called BatKareur, must travel through all the municipalities of the island, answer questions about Reunion, live endemic adventures, attack his opponents and protect himself from their attacks in order to become Ambassador of Reunion.
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Barbarossa Brief, 1941
description:
Brief as in both speed of play and File or Case or ... Dossier. :)

VERY small footprint Barbarossa game. Like Philip Sabin's classic Eastern Front, only **3** hexes from Warsaw to Moscow, although a different configuration of those.

4 2-month turns, basic hex and counter dice-resolved combat odds system. But lots of combat options including Pressed Attack, No Retreat! - isn't there a game by that name? :) - Siberian Reserve Gamble, etc. NO Zones of Control.

Playing time: est. 40 minutes.

Germans: 3 army groups, 1+1 infantry armies, 4 panzer groups, 2+1 panzerkorps. Romanian army group. Russians: 10 infantry fronts, 4 operational tank groups, the Siberians. +3 Russian tank factories (in Leningrad, Kharkov, and Stalingrad). So 31 pieces total.

Unlike in Phil Sabin's Eastern Front, rivers and hills/mountains *are* specified. At such a small scale, the Sea of Azov had to be tortured to fit, but all the surrounding areas/hexes relate properly, so .... (It *could* be done ... sort of ... Phil! :) )

Very adaptable to fast, easy solitaire play, as obviously as problems arise for both sides.

—description from designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Drop Racer Battles
description:
In the future, the most coveted sports prize is the Golden Drop Trophy. To win it, drop racers from around the world gear up their cars with deadly weapons and enter the Drop Arena. If a Racer can get the most drops in the Arena, they win. They have to watch out though, because cannons, lasers, and more will be aimed at them to try to take away their chance for victory. Do you have what it takes to be the next Drop Racer champion? Welcome to Drop Racer Battles!

Drop Racer Battles is a quick-playing dexterity game about flicking race cars on the table, collecting drops, and using weapons on your car to snatch victory from your opponents. The player with the most drops at the end wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: 4 Squared Card Game
description:
4 Squared is a simple game with mechanics akin to the classic Connect Four while pulling from the popular neon color palettes of the 80's!

The goal of 4 Squared is to be the first player to create a square of the color you have drawn before any of the other players; be it by brute-force, with cunning, deception, luck, or logic! You do this by out-playing your opponents and placing your 4 Squared cards with a matching color and position on top of other cards within the 4 x 4 square play area.

A typical round of 4 Squared is about 10 minutes long and can be played with anywhere between 2-4 players, each with their own hand of three cards!

4 Squared also has variations in it's base rule set that allows other ways to play!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Matching, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Instant Air Hockey
description: Play Air-powered hockey on nearly any table with this game. The set includes two nets with suction cups to secure the goals, two hand-held paddles for shooting and blocking the puck, and one battery-operated foam puck that floats on a cushion on air. Play on any table or flat surface. The player who scores the most goals within an agreed upon period of time wins!

name: Antenna TV Opoly
description:
A monopoly like game with properties that feature TV shows that air on Antenna TV.

Unique tokens include: Clock Tower, Mailman, Ferris Wheel, Jukebox, Cowboy Hat, and Convertible.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Climate Change 2030: The Tile Game
description:
A safe and just space on Earth is the ring between an environmental ceiling and a social foundation. The conditions affecting the ceiling and the foundation shift and change during game play.

Mitigate conditions, with hidden objective cards, to make a safe and just space on Earth by making sets and controlling areas to score the most points.

—description from the designer

name: Climate Change 2030: Running out of Time
description:
The year is 2021. Climate change is felt by many. The Earth is ravaged, and the people lack basic necessities. Can you create a Safe and Just space on Earth before the point of no return.

During each of ten turns from 2021 to 2030, you'll use a set of 5 mitigation cards to mitigate environmental or social conditions and to expand your research lab.

The cards and the lab allow you to remove 'danger' blocks and install 'protection' blocks from 11 conditions on the Safe and Just Doughnut Board.

At the end of 2030, you need to have removed all of the red blocks and installed all of the green blocks for the best win scenario, but beware, every year catastrophe can add more red blocks.

—description from the designer

name: Bushido: Hikari
description:
In life, Hikari was one of four sisters who found their shugenja abilities were amplified when they worked as a coven. The fateful night the sisters were offered a bargain with Yurei, the others readily accepted the power they would gain but Hikari stood firm and refused, knowing the bargain would never be anything but a yolk around their necks and a pathway to evil. The bargain was offered only to the whole coven so her sisters murdered her and accepted the bargain as three Yuta. Hikari is still powerfully linked to them so her sisters raised her as a Kairai and forced her to obey their commands but sometimes she finds the will to fight free.

Hikari’s unique connection to the Yuta means she offers even more flexibility to the Yuta box and, importantly she can use the Chaos Bolt Ki Feat and automatically win the opposed Ki test since she is Soulless. Choosing when to throw off her undead nature and assert control is key to making the best use of her profile.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Miyakomo Korra
description:
Daughters of the Waves, Sea Witches, Miyakomo sisters… known by many names these shugenja are some of the Jung’s most important allies. The very waves are Korra’s to command and she mercilessly batters her enemies with tide and waves.

Miyakomo's ability to move enemy models like the tides is very useful and combined with Fog of Hesitation, she is a powerful control piece; able to dictate where and when the Jung engage their enemies.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Moyasu
description:
Moyasu was cursed to burn forever without being consumed. She was offered respite under the ocean by the sea Kami but any part of her that extends above the waves bursts into flames! Like others with the blessing of the sea Kami, she has taken on some aspects of sea creatures.

On the table Moyasu requires a delicate balance as she can be as dangerous to your own models as the enemy, much like fire used as a weapon at sea. Her ability to hold a model in place while giving out many fire markers makes for a very powerful effect, if you can position her well.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Ryujin – Spirit of the Deep
description:
Ryujin is the Spirit of the Deep Ocean, one of the most powerful Kami in the Jwar Isles. It is rumoured that the very act of calling him forth caused the tsunami that devastated the region. All lesser water Kami are his to command and in some ways are part of him. The Sea Witches of the Jung have bound him to a form of a great water serpent and he has blessed them with his aid. Bushido’s biggest model does not disappoint on the table! With his Tsunami and Incoming Tide abilities, Ryujin affects the game without making an attack but he also has powerful melee and ranged abilities. Finally, he has the Believer ability for Miyakomo models making their Ki Feats considerably more efficient.

Box contains one 98mm tall miniature supplied with integrated base and one full colour card. Product is multi part and assembly is required.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Axiam
description:
Axiam is a Jonin or “High Man” in the Shadow Wind Clan. He has proven greater than the Shadow Crows and now teaches those who would be North Star Ninja. Still some missions must be overseen by more experienced hands and Axiam shows why he is fit to teach the next generation with his prodigious skill. In the game Axiam has high melee skill, rare among ninjas and the only North Star model to have such high base statistic. His range of abilities is unparalleled as he can use any Feat of any North Star Ninja. He adds to this unpredictability with his Equipment rule allowing you to choose an Equipment Card mid game to suit the exact
circumstances you are in.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadow Tactics: Ronin expansion
description:
Ronin is a Kickstarter exclusive expansion to Shadow Tactics - The Board Game that gives solo and cooperative modes to the game.
In this mode the Daimyo player is replaced by an automated rules system, relying on different types of actions with specific dice to roll.

There are several Daimyo actions like moving or defending a target, deployment, or roll call, that could be some potential tactics of a human Daimyo player. There are certain actions when the guards' movement very directly depends on what actions the ninjas actually programmed during that turn, so you have to make your plans very carefully and in close cooperation.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Schism: Immolation of Oethenfur
description:
Take control of the faction of your choosing and go toe-to-toe against your friends. You’ll have to be cunning and quick to win victory. Build your own unique battle terrain with Tiles for a BRAWL battle, CLASH, or KING OF THE HILL. The game ends when one player claims victory by defeating all enemy Champions, or after 10 rounds.

Schism is easy to learn, has endless strategic possibilities, and has high quality miniatures that are ready to paint if you’re a miniature painting enthusiast!

Schism is the fast-paced table top Skirmisher for 2 to 4 players from Arcanist Entertainment, designed to be quick and easy to learn even for complete beginners to the genre.


Choose a champion to ACTIVATE
MOVE a number of Hex equal to their movement stat
ATTACK
END TURN


—description from the publisher

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P0kv7wOJvtw
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: ViceVersi
description:
ViceVersi is an abstract strategy game for 2 players. You can play it immediately if you have Othello/Reversi.

As setup, arrange 64 double faced disks as the checkers pattern (as the diagram above). The object is to connect all your color orthogonally on the board.

GAMEPLAY
At first, white choose a disk facing black color up and flip it over.
Then black takes turn and from then on, players alternate turns taking one of two action below.

(1. Choose a pair of disks with opponent’s color facing up that are orthogonally sandwiching one of your color disk or an unbroken line of your color disks, flip them over to friendly color. You may not divide an opponent’s group to two or more groups by this action, unless it makes your winning condition.

(2. Choose a disk with your color facing up, flip it over to opponent’s color. It is required the target disk is not a part of your largest group, and adjacent the largest group of opponent’s color.

If both players achieve the winning condition simultaneously, the turn player wins.

-description from designer

name: TV Canal 1
description:
From the box:
Have you ever thought how fantastic the life of a television executive is?
Taking care of programs, messing with schedules, finding creative solutions is undoubtedly a fascinating activity!
That's why you'll like TV CHANNEL 1! In this game you will experience all the emotions that govern the life of a TV channel! Play a game! And have real fun!

The players are in charge of one of the TB stations that competed in São Paulo, in 1975 (Cultura, Tupi, Globo, Record, Gazeta and Bandeirantes). Each turn, players buy TV shows and decide if they want to produce and fit them in their grid or keep in their archive. The audience rating of a particular TV show will determine the amount of cash each player will receive. After that, the players will change their grid, archiving some shows or selling them.

The player with more money at the end of the game wins.

name: Fashion 101
description:
Fashion 101 is a lightweight mix-and-match game for ages 8+ that challenges players to create outfits that match fashion themes revealed during each round of the game. You can be literal, creative, or quirky in your interpretation of any given theme—as long as you delight the "Fashion Judge," who awards style points to each winning outfit. Think of it as “Apples to Apples” with a fashion twist!

What if you don’t have the pieces in your wardrobe needed to pull off a great outfit? Play one of your “Fashion Emergency” cards to improve your collection or bamboozle other players. But be careful—timing is everything!

Fashion 101 was invented in 2017 by 10-year-old Elsa Brandt. In 2020, her mom began working with her to bring the game to fruition as a way to combat boredom and create a fun learning experience during the Covid lockdown in Seattle.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Robocity
description:
Program your robots and be the first to get your robots to the finish!

Each player controls four robots which are programmed each round by playing cards face-down on your board. Use energy to buy new cards, upgrade your handsize or remove cards from your deck.

Robocity adds some new twists to the deckbuilding genre: cards you buy are added to your hand and can be used immediately, a dynamic handsize, the use of powerfull - one time used - special cards and the use of resource management outside your deck in the form of energy.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Programmed Movement, Race

name: Nickelodeon Six Pix
description: Players move around a square game board a number of spaces equal to the number of differences he/she can spot from a card with two similar images. On some spaces, players may have to turn the card upside down or keep one eye closed while spotting the differences. The player who reaches the finish first wins the game.

name: Bounce Bunny Bounce
description:
Bounce Bunny Bounce is a two-player, fast-paced strategy game with an element of memory. The object of the game is to collect the most carrots but in order to win, you'll need to avoid some hazards along the way!

Using this unique deck of cards to form the field of play, your Bunny will Bounce across the field in search of carrots while avoiding traps and dead-ends. There is also a chance for mischief as each player is equipped with Shock cards that can be used to Bounce your Bunny into danger.

This easy-to-learn and fun-to-play game is a great choice for folks who are short on time and looking for a game they can Bounce into quickly.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Exploration, Memory, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action/Event, Chaining, Command Cards, Grid Movement, Memory, Take That

name: Spillin' Beans
description:
When you think you know your friends, friend's friends or that big mouth that shows up every once in a while, we guarantee you don't...until they spill the beans!

Spillin' Beans is composed of 120 cards that need to be shuffled before starting the game. Players take turns drawing cards: Action, Wild and Big Bean that keep every player on their toes.

If the player fails to complete the action card, they will place 2 beans in the bean pot. The player to stockpile the most beans wins!

With Spillin' Beans you and your friends will spill stories, place bets, reveal the size of your brain through a dynamic, competitive, and hilarious gameplay.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Action/Event, Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination

name: Kleiner Hut, mach's gut!
description:
Players each place six cone-shaped playing pieces on the outermost ring and try to reach the center of six concentric circles. Play begins by each player moving a piece to the left or to the right inside the outermost ring, as many spaces as the dice roll. The piece can move over other pieces, but can only cover or stack on another piece that it lands on. When a player covers another player's piece, instead of throwing the next throw, he/she progresses into the second ring.
