Another variant exists for 6 players (product code 101/2)

—user summary

name: 3 x Naturspielspass
description:
Three nature-themed games in one :

Which trees can you name?
Where the wild animals live
What lives in the city



Match trees, leaves, flowers, and fruits to collect tree tokens. The player with the most trees wins the game.
The task list determines which African wild animal should be found and photographed. The first to accomplish the task is the safari photo winner and have learnt where his animals live.
A city provides living space for animals. Discovering them and assigning them to the animals is a playful and interesting task.


—user summary

name: Professor Sielmanns Naturquiz
description:
Players answer questions about nature by placing their chips onto a card belonging to one of three categories: air, land, and sea. The questions are about record-breaking and interesting properties of plants and animals.

—user summmary

name: ASL Comp: Jerusalem – Siege: 1948 and 1967 Action
description:
This is the Jerusalem: Siege expansion for owners of Genesis 3, Magach 73 and Ivasion: Palestine!.
Also needed are ASLRB, and Nationalities including British, Germans, Russians - the usual stuff.

This module builds on the Gen/Magach work and includes 6 scenarios, and covers 1948 material from the original Genesis, plus new 1967 actions with an enlarged JERUSALEM Map - in keeping with the MONSTER SERIES, etc. with color rules, and color folio.

Ownership of BOTH Genesis 3 and Magach 73 are a MUST.

-description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Wer würfelt Worte?
description:
Players take turns to roll ten letter-dice. The player who can form a word gets a strike on the notepad. If another player can form a word with more letters, he/she gets that strike, and so on and so forth. The player with the most strikes wins the game.

—user summary

name: Two Toned Tussle
description:
Two Toned Tussle is a medieval offshoot of Rock, Paper, Scissors. While the main goal of beating your opponent with the better of the three options, (Sword, Staff, or Shield in this case)


The over-arching goal of Two Toned Tussle is to be the player with the highest treasure score at the end of the game. To gain treasure, you must win bouts and earn White cards. While these White cards offer powerful effects to help you retain the upper hand, they can serve you much better by being traded 3 at a time for a Treasure card! Beware though, your opponent isn't exactly defenseless! Each time a player loses a bout, they get to draw a Black card with two of the three weapons on it; allowing even larger weaknesses to be exploited in a comeback maneuver!

A typical game of Two Toned Tussle is about 10-15 minutes long and consists of 3 bouts at a time!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Single Loser Game

name: Hunt for the Lonely Queen: Operations with the Tirpitz in the North Atlantic, November 1941
description:
Hunt for the Lonely Queen is the second on Long Face Games's series of operational campaign and scenario packs for Find, Fix and Strike.

This pack covers the planned raid by the Tirpitz and Admiral Scheer into the North Atlantic, pursued by the Royal Navy and with the USN playing an uncertain role.....
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Revolution: The Game of 1776
description:
Revolution is played in two phases. In the first phase each player gets 12 Strategy cards and 2-6 Bomb cards and secretly records their bomb positions on a record sheet. Players then order their Strategy cards as they wish to form a programmed series of movements and take turns revealing one card at a time. If a player lands on an opponent's bomb they suffer the effects of one of their Bomb cards. The object is to cross the board, with points being awarded based on the finishing order.

In the second phase players add and subtract from their point totals by rolling a die for each battle listed on the record sheets and recording the results. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Programmed Movement, Race, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Train Set
description:
Train Set is a family game for two to five players. There will be a solitaire module.

Players select tiles and play them into a tableau to construct a childhood train set. Further plays allow expansion of the layout through birthday and Christmas presents in time honoured fashion.

—description from the designer

name: ASL News #28
description:
ASL News #28

The issue #28 was the second in the ASL News series to be published in magazine format.
Its main focus is the battle of the Bulge, celebrating the 50-year Anniversary at the time of the publication (December 1994).

The two big attractions are:
> a supplemental Campaign Game for Kampfgruppe Peiper I CG IV "Above the prayers" backed by a large file with the designer's notes and pictures of places in the area
> the first ever third party geomorphic mapboard labelled ASLN #1

...plus:
> review of contemporary publications (Backblast, annual '94...)
> the precursory rules for railroads
> an article on Pointe du Hoc, based on scenario ASL News #49
> Scenario analysis "Forward defense"
> Tactics on Armor vs Infantry
> A historical article on the US Armoured Infantry Battalion 1943-45
> 4 scenarios
> readers' mails and 2 tournament AARs
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: ASL News #30
description:
ASL News 30

Fourth and last opus in the magazine format of the ASL News line, this 48-page issue offers:
> 4 scenarios printed on card-stock at the center of the magazine (can be cut out like standard scenario cards)
> a short biography of Jochen Peiper
> a review of existing publications
> a scenario analysis (G18 Goya)
> some LOS rules subtleties explained
> other articles on German units, Tiger 222

+ a plate of railway overlays that complete the set of published overlays (see picture)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: ASL News #29
description:
ASL News 29

Third opus in the magazine format, this 48-page issue offers:
> 4 scenarios
> Add-ons for the modules Kampfgruppe Peiper
> an historical article about the artillery tractor M4 HST Allis Chalmers that also refers to the counters provided with the magazine (see picture)
> a scenario analysis (Paole Zion)
> a review of the Japanese army
> some tips to deal with enemy fortifications
> a study on how to best drop paratroops at ASL

+ a plate of 6 unmounted counters M4 High Speed Tractor.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Patchwork Garden
description:
Playfully build memory and concentration skills with Patchwork Garden—a delightful preschool memory game with a twist! Featuring 36 oversized pieces, players work cooperatively to grow a garden by matching Garden Cards to Sprout Tiles. Pairing the distinct flowerpots with the colorful plants creates a visual retrieval cue that will aid and improve memory during game play. Players win the game when they successfully "grow" their garden.

-description from publisher

name: The Great Debate
description:
The Great Debate is a mischievously social card game that pits two Debaters at a time against each other to explain why their absurd Reason explains the same Topic within 90 seconds. A winner is selected by the other players, the Jury of Peers.

The goal of the game is to win 5 points and become the master debater. The full box consist of 500 cards with 160 Topic cards, 320 Reason cards, and 20 Debater and Peer cards.

Each round the Debater and Peer cards are handed out to randomly identify who is debater 1 and who is debater 2. All other players will become the Jury of Peers and select the argument that feel is best. Both debaters will receive the same Topic such as "Hot Dogs Are A Sandwich". Each debater will then receive a Reason such as "Penguins". The debater will have 90 seconds to explain why the Topic, "Hot Dogs Are A Sandwich" because of, such as, or like the Reason, "Penguins". After each debater goes the Jury of Peers will award a single point to the player's argument they felt was best. After which the next round will begin and new Jury of Peers, Debaters, Topic, and Reasons will be selected.

Example:
Debater 1
Topic - Hot Dogs Are A Sandwich
Reason - Penguins
Is a Penguin a bird? Yes, because it meets the common definition of what is considered a bird. It has feathers, a beak, and lays eggs. Though they can not fly, which is a common trait of a bird, penguins are still birds. The common definition of a sandwich is an item of food consisting of two pieces of bread, in this case a bun, with meat, the hotdog, cheese or other filling between them. Therefore, if a penguin is still a bird, a hotdog is a sandwich if it meets the definition even if it doesn’t appear to.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Turn Order: Random

name: Hercules Abroad: Additional Rules for Men of Bronze
description:
Hercules Abroad is a supplement to Men of Bronze from the Osprey Wargaming Series 24 (OWG 24)

These army lists came from various rules expansions that were created and published by Eric Farrington, the author of Men of Bronze on the Blood and Spectacles Blog.

-description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The Great Outdoors
description:
It’s 1852, the large swath of land from the Great Lakes to the Hudson Bay to the Pacific Ocean remains untamed and untainted by the hustle and bustle of city life. Life in the Yukon is simple, so long as hiking up mountains, canoeing down rivers, fishing from frozen lakes, mining gold, hunting bears, moose and deer is simple; which never seems to be the case for the average frontiersman or frontierswoman. Use your survival skills to do all of these things while maintaining the strength and stamina necessary to keep going. With enough perseverance and instinct, the frontiersman or frontierswoman can eventually build a homestead to live the simple life.

The Great Outdoors is a 2 to 6 player euro/strategy game that places you in the heart of the Yukon as a highly capable Frontiersman/Frontierswoman that specializes in their own trade or profession. You will venture out into the unforgiving wilderness to perform actions such as gold mining, cutting down lumber, hunting, fishing, trapping, trading, building, and above all, resting. Actions that involve collecting resources, such as gold mining, trapping, hunting, fishing, and logging, use dice to determine the size of the gold nugget you panned for, or the animal that got caught in your trap, or the one you shot, or the size of the fish you caught, or the amount of quality timber you cut down. Your dice rolls can be improved by purchasing or building tools, boats, and weapons. Use the fruits of your labor (resources) to build up your homestead with various amenities like sheds, wells, windmills, water wheels, and much, much more. Your victory points are determined by the value of your homestead and the crafts you collected throughout the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Glory: 1861 – Raising and Leading a Regiment to Glory
description:
It's 1861 and the War Between the States has begun, you must do your duty to your state and your new President ~ north or south.

Glory: 1861 gives you the chance to raise an American Civil War infantry regiment and lead your men into battle.
You will need fewer than 50 figures to play.
The rules allow you to create a historical regiment, with named commanders; company officers company names, train them in the arts of war and then lead them into the field to seek glory, fame and immortality.
This revolutionary approach melds character creation from roleplaying, seamless gameplay and robust and well-tested gaming mechanics.

Glory: 1861 gives you dozens of regiment options and takes you through the process of building your force. At each stage you must decide how to train the men and how to use their officers and company commanders to accomplish their objectives. A random encounter and objectives system gives you hundreds of possible scenario options; you can also play the opening moves at Bull Run in 1861 or the whole Western Virginia mini-campaign, You can use your own regiment or one the the pick-up-and-play regiments. Bonus cards to enhance game play are included, along with table set-up maps and ready reference sheets.

– Description from book
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dintojra Łódzka
description:
Dintojra Łódzka is a card game for two players. The plot takes players to the streets of Łódź in the interwar period - the time of the city's great crisis in a multicultural society. Players take on the role of leaders of a faction of criminal groups trying to gain the support of as many city residents as possible. To achieve this, they will bribe, use violence and cling to deception. Law enforcement officers, great mayors of the city and famous criminals from Łódź will be at your disposal.

In their turns, players fight to take over street cards - they play cards of different strength and special cards. Whoever gains more value will take control of this part of the city and gain additional trophy cards. A player may also claim other corruption markers to gain prestige points. The game ends when one of the players takes over the main street (Piotrkowska street) and holds it for 1 turn. The player with the greater number of supporting residents - wins.

name: Bodyslam
description:
Teams of the most entertaining and tenacious wrestlers from across the world throw down in the ring. Many will tussle, but only one challenger will win the coveted belt. This... is... Bodyslam!

Bodyslam is a wrestling-themed dexterity game, where players compete by attempting to knock wrestling figures out of a ring. At the start of the game, each of the four countries—France, Japan, Mexico, and the USA—receives a special scoring card to determine how points are awarded for their wrestlers at the end of the game. Each country's team has four of a uniquely-shaped wrestling mask, representing that country's wrestlers—these are all kept together in a bag. Set up the game by flipping over the box, placing the wrestling mat on top, and placing three random wrestling figures onto the mat.

To play, players choose one wrestler at random out of the bag and throw, drop, toss, fling, or launch it at the other wrestlers already in the ring. Knock off other wrestlers to add them to your pile, but be careful—if the piece you throw falls off as well, everything that fell returns to the bag. Signature Move cards restrict the way players can throw; successfully pull off a signature move to get another turn right away.

Once a player has thrown and collected any wrestlers that fell out of the ring, they make sure there are at least 3 wrestlers in the ring; if not, they draw more from the bag to place however they want into the ring. Then the next player goes, and the round continues until there are no more wrestlers in a bag. Each wrestler a player has in their pile is worth one point, with extra points awarded based on how their wrestlers relate to each country's score card. The winner of a round earns a belt; earn two belts to win!

-description from publisher

name: Ushabti
description:
Ushabti are statues used in ancient Egyptian funerals. They were placed in tombs along with other goods to assist the deceased in the afterlife. They came in a number of figures and sizes and provided different benefits in the afterlife.

Place Ushabti in your burial chamber or place them in your sarcophagus in order to gain influence for the afterlife. Have the highest influence for two rounds.

Each player selects one of the cards in their hand to gain influence. This card is placed directly in front of them. This card may be placed in the player’s burial chamber so all can see (face up) or placed in the player’s sarcophagus (face down). All cards are revealed simultaneously. Each player passes their hand to the neighboring player: alternate passing clockwise and counterclockwise each round. After all the cards have been played, the round ends and the influence is scored.

Each card provides influence in up to three ways. Each Ushabti provides a base level of influence and additional influence based on whether it is prominently displayed in the burial chamber. Each Ushabti also provides influence in a unique way, depending on what other types of Ushabti are in each player’s burial chamber and/or sarcophagus.
Shuffle and deal new hands to each player.
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Łowcy detali
description: The goal of the players is to renovate historic tenement houses from the city of Łódź (Poland) - including the restoration of lost architectural details and their appropriate display on the facade. Detail Hunters is a game about discovering the beauty of the architecture and city of Lodz. Players will take architectural detail cards of 5 colors and combine them into sets to renovate or add details to the tenement house. They will receive tokens with victory points, or special actions to speed up construction. When one of the players completes the building - the game is over and points are counted.

name: Sci-Fi Escape: A Solo Game
description:
An accident on an orbital research station causes the release of lots of dangerous creatures you must gets a group of security guards and scientists to the escape pods.

Sci-Fi Escape is a solo game with plenty of random events to keep the game different every time it is played.

Ideal for 28mm figures but could easily be played with other figure scales.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bezpieczne Miasto: Inna Droga
description:
Safe City - Another Road is an educational card game.
Make your city's road infrastructure more friendly and practical. Discover safe solutions for traffic walking and cycling, as well as car and public transport. Create your own set of road safety solutions. Compete with other players by creating the right connections and dependencies and score as many security points as possible. May the safest city win!

Safe City - Another Road is a tableau building card game for 2 to 4 players aging 10 and up, taking around 15 minutes to play. Players draft cards, then, each player places the chosen card in his set in the corresponding column next to the main color card.
If the card has an instant effect it’s resolver immediately, but most will have effect only during the final scoring.
After all cards are placed in sets the game ends and scoring begins. Each player in turn analyses each card from the set. The player with the most VP wins the game.

name: Tournez manège
description:
Tournez manège is a mutual knowledge game inspired by a French TV game from the 80s. The board is a 3D carrousel.

The game takes place in two parts: making the teams then the determination of the level of affinity. The team with the highest level of affinity wins the game.

To make the teams, each player draws a question card. The carousel is launched and the player facing the side with the highest number becomes the playmaker. He asks the 8 questions on his card. Each question has 4 possible answers. The player to his left places a token of his color face down to indicate his answer in the corresponding box. Each player will do the same. The player of the game then collects all the tokens corresponding to his own choices. When all the players have been playmakers, the player with the most chips can choose his teammate. The second player with the most chips will in turn choose and so on

In the second phase of the game, players test their affinity level. They secretly choose photos of objects while imagining the choice of their teammate. The choice is indicated in the same way as for the teams: a colored token is placed on the corresponding space in the carousel. They will earn points when the choices are the same. The team with the most points wins.

—user summary

name: Battle of Hanekura
description:
Battle of Hanekura is a two-player game of a battle in the Middle Ages Japan. The battle was faught between Yakushiji Kaga Nyudo and Nambata Koro Samuro on 19 December 1351 as a part of Kannō disturbance, a civil war which developed from antagonisms between shōgun Ashikaga Takauji and his brother, Ashikaga Tadayoshi.

FYI:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kannō_disturbance

Issue game of "Bushi Life" #1.

name: Fighting Class! Battle of Aircraft Carriers
description:
Fighting Class! Battle of Aircraft Carriers is a war game that reproduces "Aircraft Carrier Battles" by fleets centered on aircraft carriers that occurred in the Pacific War.

Each unit is one warship or one aircraft squadron (nine aircrafts), however, the damage is in units of one aircraft. Bombs and torpedoes are also handled in units of one shot. 4 hours per turn (aircraft operation unit is 1 hour). In addition to the "Operation Maps" (90 nautical miles per hex) used for fleet movement and search, there is also the "Tactical Map" that is rare in Japanese aircraft carrier battle board wargames.

Operation Maps are prepared for each of the Japanese and Allied forces, and it is divided by "partition" so that the opponent's fleet is not known where it is (this is called "double blind system"). In order to search for this invisible enemy fleet, each aircraft squadron unit is flown from the aircraft carrier or base to search for enemies.

At this time, there was a problem in the conventional aircraft carrier wargames that "if you tell the opponent where you are looking for, your whereabouts will be revealed". Therefore, in order to avoid this problem, the "fan-shaped search" that was carried out in the actual carrier battle could not be done, and the players had to carry out a search pattern different from the actual one. However, in "Fighting Class! Battle of Aircraft Carriers", you can search for enemies without exposing your whereabouts by using cards together. As a result, it has become possible to carry out search enemies based on the same thoughts as in actual aircraft carrier battles, such as "fan-shaped search".

In addition, a system that reproduces the "resources invested (in the case of aircraft carrier battles, the number of aircraft for searching and the time spent on searching) and the amount and accuracy of information that can be detected are proportional" as shown in the "search theory" has also been introduced into the search rules. Players are also required to have the skill to guess "which is the main force including the aircraft carrier" by combining the fragmentary information that can be obtained gradually.

On the Tactical Map, aircraft squadron units move hexes to attack warship units. At this time, the possibility of success depends on the direction in which the warship unit is attacked (whether it is from the front, the rear, the diagonal front, or the diagonal rear). Therefore, the attacking team will charge the tactical map toward the warship unit aiming at the "deadly shooting point (attacking direction)".

On the other hand, the warship unit not only shoots down attacking aircraft with anti-aircraft fire, but also incorporates "turning" (a movement that changes the course of the ship), which has not been taken up in previous aircraft carrier battle games, into the rules. This allows the warship unit to turn around from the "deadly firing point" that the attacking team is aiming for and avoid the attack. In this way, the Allied Forces shoot down the attacking team with "powerful anti-aircraft fire", while the Imperial Japanese Navy dodges the enemy's attacks by turning with "skillful ship maneuvering". It is now possible to reproduce different ways of fighting, similar to the actual aircraft carrier battles.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Multiple Maps, Simulation

name: Organic Wars
description:
In Organic wars, two or four players send out their army of bacteria to conquer the territory of the others (it's played on a square grid).
At the beginning of each turn, bacteria on each "infected field" (a field with a bacteria on it) which neighbors exactly one other infected field, will spread into another neighboring field. Afterwards, bacteria can move to neighboring fields. Where bacteria of two players meet, the one with more units will win, with both players losing as many units as the loser had.
A player who can conquer an enemies home base wins.

name: University of Tokyo Too Far
description:
University of Tokyo Too Far is a board wargame that reproduces the battle between riot police and radicals in the Kanda Liberation Zone Struggle, which is hidden behind the Yasuda Auditorium incident at the University of Tokyo.

In the "Kanda Liberation Zone Struggle", the students of Chuo University, Meiji University, Nihon University and Sophia University advanced from their university campus in the Kanda area to the Hongo campus of the University of Tokyo in order to help the "alumni" (& new left-wing sects) who stood up in the Yasuda Auditorium incident at the University of Tokyo. They clashed with riot police and failed to arrive at the University of Tokyo after all. The process is reminiscent of the "Operation Market Garden", which was the subject of the movie "A Bridge Too Far".

University of Tokyo Too Far is a sequel to Storm over Yasuda Auditorium, University of Tokyo.

name: Operations Research for COVID-19
description:
A solitaire game to play now that the spread of the new coronavirus infection has not ended!!

The player must control the spread of the infection while at the same time minimizing the impact on the economy. How do you control both the deaths caused by the infection and the deaths caused by the economy? As a working secretary (a fictional post) of the Infectious Disease Control Headquarters, the player makes various policy proposals.

This game is also a challenging crisis management simulation.

name: Crimson
description:
Crimson is a semi-cooperative card game for 3-6 people in which you’ll need to complete a bloody ritual to summon the Crimson Overlord to achieve dominance over the Groundhog Kingdom.

Players are members of the Crimson Brotherhood and will give their own blood to complete the summoning, while holding against the forces of the Golden Groundhog.
But beware, because each player must also complete their own mission, and your teammates may not see your well-being in their best interests.

HOW TO PLAY:
Players will take turns to offer their blood in the ritual pool, recover energy and spells, and fight their enemies… or themselves.
In their turn, players play action cards (unique to each character) and spell cards (drawn from a common deck)

To WIN the game, players must complete the ritual circle, achieve their secret objective, and survive.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game

name: Amukti Palapa
description: Redesigned Surakarta with stacking and 7x7 grid instead of 6x6. Players can stack pieces such that only opponent's pieces of the same height or taller can capture them. Each players has 11 one-star soldiers (prajurit), two two-star soldiers (bekel), one three-star soldier (senopati) and one flagbearer (panji perang). Two-star soldiers can capture stacks of two opponent's soldiers while three-star soldiers can capture stacks of three opponent's soldiers on their own.

name: レコードマイスター (Record Meister)
description:
In a mysterious coffee shop, customers are asking for the song they want to hear now. Let's become "Meisters" who work in coffee shops, select the right songs that customers want, and play them!

120 songs from 120 artists can be selected as cards by Record Meister! The selection genres range from pop music that everyone knows to rock, classic, jazz, reggae, Latin, fusion, metal, EDM, techno, game music, movie music, bokaro, and so on. There is no doubt that you will encounter new music through the game that you have never heard before.

Each turn, one player will play as the customer while the others will be the "Meisters".

The customer draw a topic card, chooses one topic on the card and announces it to the meisters.

Then, all the meisters start looking for a song among the vinyl cards on the table.

Each meister plays the song he selected (using a QR code on the card) and explains how the song matches the topic.

Once all the meisters have talked, the customer selects the best song and the selected meister get 1 point (keeping the vinyl card).

Play several rounds. The most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Warden Chronicles
description:
Troubled times plague the lands of Naggoru; the Nul'Te tribes have isolated themselves, the Kuldrak have grown restless and push beyond their limits. And new dark forces rise on the furthest borders of the lands. Take on the role of a Warden leader from one of the three races, set forth from the capital, and uncover the lands facing all obstacles before you.

Warden Chronicles is an open-world exploration adventure, which can be played in a series of one-shot stand-alone chronicles or a chronicle campaign, which will see your character grow, becoming more powerful as skills and abilities carry over from one chronicle to the next. Players will discover new locations, deal with character and world-shaping events, defend trade destroy or rebuild settlements, gain renown, recruit powerful heroes to join the adventure, and engage in combat versus hostile forces.

Rough Game Flow
Players will start in the main citadel location, placing their standee/mini in this space; players will then branch out either individually or group together to explore the world. As players explore the world more tiles will be uncovered, new locations will be unlocked for interaction, and enemies will make themselves known. After a player or party has finished taking their actions, they will be required to draw and resolve an event card, which will impact the player or group and how they develop their characters.

Wardens
The Wardens are the leader characters that players will take charge of through the course of a Chronicle or a Chronicle Campaign. Each Warden starts with their own asymmetric leader card, abilities deck, and board that will provide players with unique play. Through the course of the game, players will decide how they wish to build their Warden out as they gain experience, complete personal quests, and overcome events. You decide will you build out your player board with specialised abilities? Expand your player ability deck and look to increase your hand size? Recruit a larger honour guard of heroes to aid you?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Vierundfertig
description:
Vierundfertig is based on the Connect 4 concept - the winner is the first player who manages to create a line of four cubes, either horizontally, vertically or diagonally.
The board has a row of seven fields. The active player rolls a die, enters one of their pieces on any empty field and moves the number of steps rolled, either horizontically or vertically (climbing onto other pieces). In subsequent turns, players can choose between entering a new piece and moving a piece already on the board (provided no other piece stands on top of it). Towers that are seven pieces high are demolished and the pieces returned to their owners; if a player has no pieces left, the highest tower is taken down. First player to get 4 in a row is the winner.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: キシィ (Kishii)
description:
This is a game where you work together with your friends to escape from a city full of zombies!

In this game, you and your friends have a limited amount of time to escape from a city full of zombies caused by the ancient virus "Kishii".
There are many dangerous zombies in the city, and you have to explore the city to find the items you need to escape. In addition, the virus is spreading in the city, so you have to hurry or you will get infected too.
Even if you don't have strong weapons, work with your friends and you'll get everyone out!

Basic how to play :
Each player chooses a character.
Set all the cards face down in the middle of the table.
On each round :
- every player reveals a card from the center : take the items and leave the zombies in the middle of the table.
- each player may then exchange items, use their character's special skill or use items to defeat the zombies.
- when players are done with their actions, if there is one or more zombie remaining face up on the table, one of the players become a zombie (he now counts as a zombie and will attack other players on future turns)
If the players manage to get four special items (the map, radio, car and fuel) before the end of the 5th round, they escape the city and win the game. Their score then depends on the number of characters (NPC included) they could save.

ハラハラ・ドキドキ間違いなし！
仲間と協力しながら、皆でゾンビだらけの街から脱出するゲームです！
神経衰弱感覚で手軽に始められます。

大古の病原体「Kishii」によりゾンビだらけになった街から、限られた時間で仲間と協力しながら脱出するゲームです。
街にはたくさんの危険なゾンビ達がいますが、みなさんは街を探索して脱出に必要なアイテムを探さなければなりません。
さらに街には病原体が広がりつつあるので、急がないとあなたも感染してしまいます。
心配はいりません。「Kishii」のゾンビ達は、とても愛らしく働き者のゾンビばかりです。
強い武器はなくても、仲間と協力し合って皆で脱出しましょう！

name: Night Raid on Gongchangling
description: Night Raid on Gongchangling is a game that reproduces the night attack operation by the Imperial Japanese Army's 2nd Division on 26 August 1904 during the Battle of Liaoyang. One player commands the Imperial Japanese Army (2nd Division) and the other player commands the Russian Army (mainly the 1st Brigade of the 9th Infantry Division).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control
publishers: Bonsai Games, Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: Sensus
description:
A set of five mind games which tests players' skills of deduction, guesswork, and intuition.

The objective of the first game, Mystery, is to correctly identify the mystery cards. Cards are shuffled and three or four are placed faced down in the center to become the Mystery cards. The rest are dealt between the players. Players then take turns to identify by guesswork, deduction, or telepathy the cards held by the other players. If correct, this card is placed facedown on its corresponding square in the board. The first player who correctly identifies the Mystery cards is the winner.

name: Greenopoly
description:
Board game that uses the design and pattern of Monopoly, but uses businesses in Greene county, Pennsylvania.
There are chance cards, there are hotels and houses.

The board game is square, with moving pieces moving around the board on all its four sides, with the count of spaces moving forward dictated by a roll of the dice.

There is currency (money) and it is used for making real estate business transactions.

Winner of the game is whoever has most money after a predetermined time.

name: Great Apes Survival Game
description:
An educational and fun cooperative adventure to rescue the Great Apes from ruthless Poachers and move them Sanctuaries with the help of the Rangers.

The Great Apes Survival Game, featuring Dr. Jane Goodall, is a one-of-a-kind educational and exciting board game created for children ages 6 and up that 2-4 people can play in about 30 minutes. The premise of the game is to educate children about endangered species, in particular, the great apes; how they are endangered, in a beautifully designed game environment while having fun. Through cooperative game play, children learn animal facts and practice math, reading, geography and science.

name: Tanks β
description: Tanks β is a low-priced edition of Tanks+. Original Tanks+ was designed as an introduction to wargaming. In Tanks β, the rules are more compressed so that you can concentrate on basic shooting between tanks. Although there is a limit to the number of vehicles, Tanks β is a valuable game, so you can enjoy the real thrill of tank battles with only the core system.

name: Rome & Roll: Cupid Promo Card
description:
A promo card originally available as part of The Secret Cabal's 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

Cupid is a God card. Text on the card says "When Constructing: If you build next to exactly two buildings, built by different players (can include you), both players gain a Senator. This is in addition to the regular effects of your Construct action. Reroll the die used to take this action and add it back to your available dice, allowing you to take an additional action this round.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Gates of Mara: Join the Secret Cabal Promo
description:
A promo card originally available as part of The Secret Cabal's 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

A new objective card. Objective: Activate the Wanderer 3 times this round.

name: Jeu du trans europ express
description:
The game is based on a famous rail road : the "Trans European Express". The main goal is to visit 6 capitals in Europe and to be the first to return to the city from where you started. You can travel by train either on the Trans European Express route or on other lines.
Taking turns to move, you are allowed to move as many stations as the number shown on the dice you throw.You have to stop and wait a turn when you come to a capital you wish to visite and also when you change from one railway line or ferry to another.
If you wish to change from one railway line or ferry to another, you have to pick up a CHANCE card and follow the instructions it gives you. Sometimes these instructions will help you on your way. Some other times thay will add time and trouble to your journey.
You can draw a card that allow you to close stations and neither you nor any other playermay go thourgh it except with a special card "remove one train signal" or a 6 on the dice.

name: Guess in 10: Inspiring Professions
description: Ask up to 10 questions to guess the profession on the Game Card! Do people in this profession wear a uniform? Do people in this profession perform on stage? Is the profession a singer? Think hard, ask intelligent questions, use your clue cards wisely, and the be the first player to win 7 Game Cards!

name: Yakatapé
description:
Yakatapé is similar to the Whac-a-Mole arcade game. It is fully mechanical and does not need batteries.

During play, players launch the timer and the five plastic ghosts pop up randomly. Players try to crush as many ghosts as quickly as they can with the plastic hammer.

Each time a ghost is crushed, the counter underneath automatically increases by one point. When time is up, players add up the point counters. The player with the highest number of points wins.

"Yakatapé" in French means "All one has to do is punch!"
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: ASL Comp: Gettysburg – Retro Map 2nd Edition: Devil's Den
description:
Gettysburg – Devil's Den Expansion continues the series and also equips you with a second edition presentation with all known errata input, plus the bonus counter sheet that is needed to add more units for playing the scenarios enclosed.

Scenarios:

Into the Rose Woods – Rose Woods, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Orange Blossoms at the Triangle – “The Triangle,”Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Desperation in the Devil’s Den – Devil’s Den, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Battle of the Devil’s Den – Devil’s Den, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Fix Bayonets – Devil’s Den, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Little Round Top – Little round Top, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Quantum Chess
description:
Quantum Chess is a set which can be used to play four Chess variants. Two are played on a 10x10 board and two on a 12x12 board.

All use additional pieces, most notably the bowman, which cannot capture normally. Instead, it moves like a non-jumping knight, and after moving captures a piece on the square an additional knight's move away in the same direction. The other new pieces are combinations of existing pieces or the bowman plus existing pieces.

name: For Words
description:
For Words is played with a deck of cards, most showing a single letter. There are also some wild cards and blank cards.

The game starts with each player having five cards and two on the table. On their turn a player must add a single card to the table to form a new word. Cards can be played before, after, in between, or on top of the current cards. Blank cards can be played on top of letters to effectively erase them.

If a player can't play they draw until they can.

The object is to either play all your cards or force the other players to have at least ten. The game is normally played in multiple rounds with scoring.

name: Mons, 1914: The Mad Minute
description:
On August 3rd, 1914, Germany declared war on France. German armies poured into France and Belgium. Britain protested, then declared war on Germany on August 4th. The famous British Expeditionary Force (BEF) was sent to France and marched into Belgium on August 21st. They halted on the Condé Canal at Mons to defend against what they thought was a small German force to their north. Once that was brushed aside, they planned to turn east and roll up the German flank. However, they actually faced the entire German 1. Armee. The next morning, in a thick mist, German cavalry patrols stumbled into outlying British pickets. So began the long fight between the British and Germans in The Great War.

The Battle of Mons (August 23rd-24th, 1914) looms large in the legends of the British Army. Here the plucky BEF with their “rifle fire like machine guns” gave the dastardly Germans a bloody nose, or so the story goes. The Germans for their part were well satisfied. In their view, they met the “English,” pushed them back, then chased them all the way to the Marne. Which view is correct?

Mons had surprises for both armies. They expected a battle like in The Boer War or the Franco-Prussian War. Mons did have maneuver and even cavalry charges, but hard lessons were learned.

Mons, 1914: The Mad Minute is the second game in the Rifle and Spade Series, first used in Gallipoli, 1915: Churchill’s Greatest Gamble. The series rules have been completely overhauled to speed play and ease learning. Key charts have been simplified and rules that were rarely used have been dropped, resulting in faster and smoother games. Gallipoli can be played with the 2.0 rules with some short upgrade instructions and a few replacement charts.

Mons is a big game. Two maps show the length of the Condé Canal. The 1,500 counters have every unit from the BEF and the German 1. Armee. Units are half-battalions and batteries with some platoon pickets. Mons has many scenarios: three training scenarios, the full two-map historical scenario, several smaller one-map scenarios, and a set of very interesting hypothetical meeting engagements. In the meeting engagement scenarios, the armies enter gradually, led by their cavalry divisions. A wild period of maneuver follows as the cavalry and jägers attempt to sneak past the enemy until the infantry show up, and the battle is joined in earnest. There are rules for cavalry charges, including debacles and impetuous charges. The command problems of the BEF and German 1. Armee are shown, although scenario variants give players all the freedom they could want.

Components:
Two 22x34 maps
5 1/2 standard counter sheets (280 each), total 1,540 counters.
35+ Small wooden colored cubes
One version 2.0 series Rule Book
One Game Book
One Setup Book
Numerous Charts and Tables, Player Aids, Army Organization Trees, and Status Displays
Planning Maps
Dice

-description from publisher's website

name: Potions & Puppies
description:
Potions & Puppies is a light weight game that has a unique twist on resource management and press your luck. It's a 1 to 5 player cooperative game where all players must work together to share resources to discover recipes to a variety of potions to help you get past tasks inside the tower. Each puppy has a unique magic ability to help their friends but must balance using their own abilities with using those same crystals for potions.

Puppies have a variety of actions to take on their turn ranging from gathering crystals from a shared stash to discovering or brewing potion recipes. Each puppy also has two unique abilities - a lesser ability can be used an unlimited number of times per game as well as a once per game ultimate ability that will make the puppy's player mat flip and their remaining ability will cost more gems to use for the rest of the game. Discovering potions is vital to puppies' success, and each time a player wants to discover a potion they must use three colors of crystal from in front of them that do not match any other current recipe before flipping over the top potion card. Potions can be be brewed by using the same crystals as are on the recipe card by placing them onto the puppies' current tile. When all potions have been brewed, the puppies can move forward.

Brewing a potion that is labelled on the modular tile they are currently standing on allows the group to move forward and one step closer to escape. They also have unique abilities such as rearranging recipes, looking at the potion deck to see what is coming up next, and digging up many crystals at once. At the end of each turn the active player can draw up to two crystals from the blind bag to replenish their resources - but each time a black crystal is drawn the guardian moves one space closer to the puppies and the crystal goes back into the bag. If the puppies brew all the potions on the final tile before the guardian lands on their current space - they win! Otherwise, it's game over.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Ruse it!
description:
Ruse it! is similar to Perudo: players roll concealed dice and then make ascending bids until someone calls. Its main differentiator is that players can stop the bidding and guess exactly how many of a particular number have been rolled, in order to get lost dice back.

While the game can play up to twelve, each set only supports four.

The game was published under the name BellRose Inc.

name: Power Play
description:
Power Play is an abstract hockey-themed game. Each person controls three hockey players, numbered 1-3.

On a turn the owner's players must each be moved to an empty adjacent space if possible, and they must be moved in numerical order. After that, the puck is checked to see how many of the current players are adjacent to it, and it is moved that many spaces in any combination of directions.

Moving the puck into the opposing goal scores a point. The first player to score three points wins.

name: Sewers & Slimebeasts
description:
Sewers & Slimebeasts is written by Abe Crow and published in NorthCoast Roleplaying (Issue 1 - 1987). A two-page comic introduces the game, which is then presented in six pages of rules including the maze-like playing board and a tracking sheet.

The game is played by two opponents, one controlling the "human" team and one controlling the "slimebeast" team. A third player acts as a "referee" to enforce the rules, make decisions in uncertain cases, and track locations and events that are unknown to one team. Additionally, the "referee" controls a team of "bums" - hapless humans that should be rescued by the human team or used as egg incubators by the slimebeast team (bums are, effectively, an in-game resource).

Prior to play, each player receives 100 points to use to build their team. Humans and slimebeasts have variable powers with varying costs; every human and every slimebeast can some varying powers, depending on player desires.

During play, each player maintains their own map that shows locations and events known to them (generally, all their own team and those of the opposing team they have discovered). The play pieces are straight pins with colored tape to indicate status/condition/etc. The referee simultaneously maintains a "master" map that is considered authoritative in the event of a discrepancy with a player map.

Play proceeds in turns following an established sequence. In each turn, humans move first and slimebeasts move second; combat then occurs wherever humans and slimebeasts have encountered each other. Combat uses a fairly complex series of processes that obviously are heavily derived from Dungeons & Dragons mechanics.

The game ends when the humans eliminate the slimebeasts or the slimebeasts eliminate the humans.

—user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Grid Movement, Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Variable Player Powers

name: The Brigade: Lady Artesia Scyllos
description:
A new warden available as a promo in 2020 through The Campaigner magazine.

Text from the card:
When you hire Lady Artesia Scyllos gain a free upgrade.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: OXx
description:
OXx is a game system with cards. The rules contain four ways of playing, the publisher has announced that further rule sets would be published on their website.
The cards have three properties: A background color, a word (blue, yellow, etc.) and a color in which this word is written. Most rule sets are based on finding cards with two matching characteristics, you will then try to get rid of them by stacking them up, either player by player or in a speed mode.

name: ASL Comp: Gettysburg – Turning Point 1863
description:
Gettysburg – Turning Point 1863 the Battle of Gettysburg in tactical-level format for ASLers.

This set gives the player everything needed to play, only ASL-RB and standard system markers are needed.

It offers a set of scenarios that all play on the McPherson's Ridge and Bliss Farm maps.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Felldom Core Book
description:
Felldom, short for Fell Kingdoms, is a game of strategy and competition.

You will pit two or more fantasy armies in brutal mass combat.
If you enjoy rolling buckets of dice and using wit and tactics to best your opponent, this is the game for you.
Fell Kingdom plays off the best parts of older fantasy wargames to make a feeling of nostalgia with every battle.

Don your armor and draw your sword, for the cry of war is sounded once more!

This book includes the core rules to play a game of Felldom, but does not include any army lists.

-description from the publisher

name: ASL Comp: Gettysburg – The Battle of Culp's Hill
description:
Gettysburg – The Battle of Culp's Hill continues the series and also equips the player with a second edition presentation with all known errata input, plus the bonus counters needed to add more units for playing the scenarios enclosed.

Ownership of ASL Comp: Gettysburg – Turning Point 1863 is required to play.

During the Battle of Gettysburg, July 1–3, 1863, Culp's Hill was a critical part of the Union Army defensive line, the principal feature of the right flank, or "barbed" portion of what is described as the "fish-hook" line. Holding the hill was by itself unimportant because its heavily wooded sides made it unsuitable for artillery placement, but its loss would have been catastrophic to the Union army. It dominated Cemetery Hill and the Baltimore Pike, the latter being critical for keeping the Union army supplied and for blocking any Confederate advance on Baltimore or Washington, D.C.

Scenarios:

Johnson’s Hesitation – Culp’s Hill, Gettysburg, July 1st 1863
Artillery Duel - Culp’s Hill, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Meade’s Blunder - Culp’s Hill, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Before Nightfall - Culp’s Hill, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Pardee’s Field - Culp’s Hill, Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
Blood “Red Hill” - Culp’s Hill, Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: ASL Comp: Gettysburg – Into the Wheatfield
description:
Gettysburg, Into the Wheatfield continues the series and also equips the player with a second edition presentation with all known errata input, plus the bonus counter sheet that is needed to add more units for playing the scenarios enclosed.

Scenarios:

Into the Wheatfield – The Wheatfield, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Kershaw’s Attack - The Wheatfield, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Stony Hill - The Wheatfield, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
The Stone Wall - The Wheatfield, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Caldwell’s Counter-Attack - The Wheatfield, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
The Last Attack - The Wheatfield, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: ASL Comp: Gettysburg – Pickett's Charge
description:
Gettysburg - Pickett's Charge continues the series and also equips you with a second edition rules presentation with all known errata input, plus the bonus counters needed to add more units for playing the scenarios enclosed.

Ownership of Gettysburg: Turning Point 1863 + Culp's Hill + Devil's Den OR Into the Wheatfield is required to play.

Pickett's Charge was an infantry assault ordered by Confederate Gen. Robert E. Lee against Maj. Gen. George G. Meade's Union positions on Cemetery Ridge on July 3, 1863, the last day of the Battle of Gettysburg during the American Civil War.

Scenarios:

Ohio Musketry – Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
On the Right Flank - Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
Cushing’s Courage - Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
Failure to Obey - Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
Fredricksburg! – “The Angle,” Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
Pickett’s Charge! - Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Kapow: A Shibumi Game
description:
A drop of Acid is a stacking game about trying to get the most highest balls of your type. But watch out! At any point one of the players can drop a bomb to destroy all it touches.

—description from the designer

name: A Lenda do Herói
description:
A Lenda do Herói is based on a videogame known internationally as "Songs for a Hero", developed by Dumativa and Castro Brothers. It can be played cooperatively or in "hero team vs. villain" mode.
Players take turns singing verses which must contain a rhyme determined by the villain. They should try to include as many of the items depicted on open cards on the table, because they can take any of these item cards as coins. At the end of a round, the group can buy extra skills and lives for the coins they collected.
The villain's role is to make the hero team's task more difficult, because when a player fails to create and sing a musical verse within time and conditions, the hero loses a life, and if the team loses all their lives, the villain wins. There are 3 levels of difficulty of the rhyme cards, so the Villain needs to manage the difficulty of the rhymes in their hand and analyze which ones are more difficult with the elements that are currently on the table. If after three rounds the hero team still has lives, there is one last round. In this final round each player must use all the elements on the table, and the sung stanza needs to be a provocation to the Villain. If a player succeeds, the villain is hit. If the Villain receives a number of blows equal to their life, the hero team wins.

name: Space Angle
description:
Space Angle is a print and play space battle game that is played on an empty piece of paper. The rules provide a setup for the game, with each player drawing a home base and three spaceships, and a star and some asteroids in the middle.
The goal is to shoot down all of your enemies ships or destroy their homebase. On a turn, a ship can either move or shoot. For movement, draw a line from your ship's current position to the new one. For shooting, put a ruler to your ship and see whether it hits anything. Asteroids are destroyed by hitting them once, while spaceships or home bases will be destroyed on the third hit.
For solo play, some alien ship sheets are provided; these are placed on the far end of the battlefield.
categories: Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Line Drawing, Line of Sight, Paper-and-Pencil

name: D20 Football
description:
Replay your favorite team's entire 2020 schedule in about an hour!

A simulation of the pro game, D20 Football reduces the NFL to its most basic level. Each team is rated for offense and defense based on points scored and yielded – including all defensive and special team scoring. Ultimately, the only statistic that matters is point differential – and that's what counts in D20 Football.

Game play is simple: for each quarter, the players use a virtual 20-sided die chit-pull system and consult the results chart. If no overtime, that's just four "die rolls" per scheduled game per player. Luck isn't everything, though. Players choose an offensive and defensive focus for each quarter. The player who does the better job of outwitting his opponent can affect the results in his favor to a considerable degree.

So, can 2020’s Tampa Bay Bucs go all the way in your replay? Maybe not – there are four slightly better teams in their way.

Every 2020 NFL team is rated, and a specially designed scoresheet makes the game flow smoothly. The game can be played solo or two-player. It’s highly portable, easy to play, and is sure to “fire up” football fans of all ages.

name: Swappies
description:
Swappies is a game based on permutation and domination which can be played by 2, 3 or 4 players. This strategy game is played on a checkered big board with 81 squares arranged in a 9x9 grid. There are 2 ways to win; being the only player remaining on the board or to place all 49 swappies on the big board.

Try to form patterns to create clones of your swappies. By doing so, you may replace opponent's swappies. You can also encircle opponent's swappies to get more clones and get rid of more enemies.

Basically, the idea behind Swappies was to create a game where good players in Candy Crush Saga (or any similar games) could play against each other. Also, there is no kind of luck, this game is just all about skills.

—description from the designer

Swappies est un jeu de permutation et de domination pouvant être joué par 2, 3 ou 4 joueurs. Ce jeu de stratégie est joué sur une grande planche de jeu contenant 81 cases dans une grille de 9X9. Il y a 2 façons de gagner; être le dernier joueur à avoir perdu tous ses swappies ou mettre ses 49 swappies sur la grande planche de jeu.

Essayez de faire des combinaisons afin de créer des clones avec vos swappies. En faisant cela, vos clones prendront la place de certains swappies ennemis. Vous pouvez encercler les swappies de vos adversaires pour avoir plus de clones tout en se débarrassant de plus de swappies ennemis.

En fait, l'idée derrière Swappies était de créer un jeu auquel les joueurs de Candy Cush Saga (ou tout autres jeux similaires) puissent s'affronter l'un l'autre. Aussi, il n'y a pas de coup chanceux, ce jeu n'est basé que sur les aptitudes.

—description from the designer (French)

name: Memory Bank
description:
Players move their pawns along a monopoly-style board building up number lists, word lists, visual lists, data lists, and face/name lists. Each player collects memory chips to remember these lists and as the game progresses the number of items that players have to remember increases.

The winner of the game is the player who enters the memory bank, has 30 or more memory chips, is successfully able to repeat all lists, and has at least one item in each list.

name: PowerMan
description:
The objective of the game is to attach as many weights as possible to Power Man's weight bar without causing him to topple over.

—user summary

name: Le jeu du nombre exact
description:
The name means "The game of the exact number".
The object of the game is to make mathematical equalities with cards. These ties can be independent of each other (rule A) or dependent on each other (rule B).

Rule A:
The player chooses from his 9 cards those which allow him to establish a tie. For example 4 = 4 or 4 + 2 = 6. There can only be one sign on each side of the = sign. Each tied tie will be worth points according to the value of the cards. If he cannot lay a tie, he must draw a card and get rid of a card in hand. The round ends when a player empties his hand. He then obtains a bonus of 50 points. The first player with 1000 points wins the game.

Rule B :
The game begins the same way as rule A with 8 cards instead of 9 for each player. The player must re-use one card already on the table to build their equality, using the same building spirit as the scrabble game.

name: Knights of the Cupboard
description:
You and your knightly companion have finally done it- at King Arthur’s request, you have found the holy grail! But only one of you can claim the fame and glory upon your return home. Make sure your former friend only presents common drinkware to the king, lest they steal the honor that is rightfully yours!

Knights of the Cupboard is a 1v1 card game, where both players are trying to be the first player to present the Holy Grail to King Arthur. Players take turns presenting drinkware to the king by playing a card from their hands. Carefully decide how to use each ability available to you, whether to further your plans or to deceive your opponent!

—description from the designer

name: Astro Soleil
description:
This game, described as "astrological", has its theme about divination through the stars and tarot cards.
It includes a solo mode which is more a self divination than a game and a duo mode which is a game.

Each player has 12 cards in their hand. The first player thinks of a question and mentions its theme to the other player. The theme can be health, feelings, money, work ... He then turns the plate on the board in order to bring his number (determined from the transcription of the letters of his first name into numbers) in the area of ​​his astrological sign. He then moves the "sun" disc on the board so that the green solar ray is on the sign of the other player. This indicates 3 numbers which correspond to constellation maps. If the player has a matching card in his deck, he places it in front of him. If he doesn't have one, he passes and the other player moves the discs on the board to identify 6 more digits. When all the cards have been identified, the players compose their answers using the booklet supplied with the game. The players then assemble the cards according to their symbols and sort them in numerical order. The player with the highest row of cards wins

—user summary

name: Old games using dice
description:
Set of XIX century board games reprinted:
Post- und Reisespiel (Gustav Kühn)
Ringwürfel-Spiel (Johann Trautner)
Tiergarten Spiel (F C Wentzel) BGG Item ID: 177491
Neues Matrosen-Spiel (Gustav Kühn) BGG Item ID: 58035
Turnierspiel (Robrahn & co)
Gänsespiel (Pellerin & Cie.)

name: Bazaar Exchange
description:
Bazaar Exchange is a market-based board game where players trade objects, create products, and attempt to win total market dominance.

Players each start with an inventory of object cards with specific products able to be made for the game. Each product is comprised of specific objects, so players decide which products they want to try to create, then trade with other players to get the products that they need.

After trading is complete, the final round, the Bazaar Exchange, commences.

Every round, players secretly place a bid. The tribe with the highest bid wins 1 ingot and loses their bid to the
second highest bidder. The tribe with the second highest bid loses their own bid (goes into the game bank) but takes the highest bid instead. All other tribes get to keep their bids.
The tribe(s) with the lowest bid (50 dribs or more) get 50 dribs from the bank.

A winner is declared when a tribe is able to collect 3 ingots.

—description from publisher

name: Project HUNTER
description:
They came from space. From within meteors they broke out and caused devastation. With corporations and security companies concerned only with the elites, the people pleads for world government action. The president of the world is then forced to finance mercenary giant robot pilots, paying for each head of the giant monsters.

Project HUNTER is a minimalist solo print-n-play roll-n-write game in which you drive a giant robot in order to defeat the giant monsters that have invaded the earth. You will need to print these sheets and get some dice, pencils and eraser.

Objective
The main objective of this game is to defeat at least one monster of each of the six species. However, you must survive until then! Your giant robot is destroyed if its chassis is completely damaged or if it overheats, which will cause an explosion. You also lose if you run out of money after a hunt.

Hunting Kaijus
To face a monster you first roll three dice. Each die will indicate a monster avaliable. Of these three you will have to choose one to face. If you don't want to face any, you will have to spend $ 50 on the maintenance of your robot to be able to wait another day. So you can roll the three dice again. You start the game with $ 300 in cash (write it down).

Combat
As soon as you choose a monster to face the combat starts. The combat is separeted between the turn of the monster and the turn of the robot. The monster always starts first.

Monster Turn
On the Monster turn you must roll a number of dice equal to the Monster Attack value. Each die is treated individually and allocated somewhere in the robot sheet. Each die that landed at number 6 causes 1 Overheat. Each result less than 6 can be absorbed in some armor of the robot. See in the diagram of the robot that there are squares for you to write down the result of the die you want to allocate there. You can place it wherever you want as long as there are already any other results linked to it, it must obey the rule (see below). If you cannot allocate any die in the sheet this die becomes 1 damage in the Chassis.

Armor’s Rules
In the diagram of the robot you will find several blank boxes to record the result of a die. Each of these boxes has an arrow. If the arrow is facing the box, it means that it has some rule. Each symbol on the black circle will indicate he rule.

Robot Turn
On the Robot's turn you will be able to choose if you want to attack normal with your weapons or if you want to overload the shots. If you choose to attack normal, roll the dice equal to the number of weapons you have (initially you only have one weapon). Add up all the results of all the dice and write down the amount of damage the monster has taken. If the monster loses all hit points, it is defeated (see below).
If you choose to do an overloaded attack, you will roll twice the attack dice but will cause 1 point of Overheating.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: ASL Comp: St Lo – The Battles for Hill 192
description:
Near Hill 192 and St Georges d'Elle, France, 11 July 1944: Pfc. Ralson A. Shepherd was not the only hero among the ranks of the America dogfaces fighting near Hill 192. The battle minted heroes, including Private Joseph Marez, an aid man with the 9th Regiment. Disregarding a "hail of machine-gun and rifle fire" according to the unit history, Marez ran forward to attend to two wounded riflemen.
While he was holding a tourniquet to the first soldier's leg, Marez was hit in the head by a German bullet. Undaunted, he headed for the second man to render aid... but collapsed before reaching him.
Marez received the division's first Distinguished Service Cross for her bravery.

ASL Comp: St Lo 44 – Hill 192 is a detailed ASL Comp variant module that follows the American 2nd Infantry Division as it attacks Hill 192 on the road to St. Lo. Located about five miles north-east of St. Lo., Hill 192 would hardly be classed as hill on most military maps, but in a countryside where a significant high point is twenty or thirty meters above the surrounding countryside, Hill 192, named for its height in meters, was a strategic point that would cost a lot in American lives.

This is not a complete game. Ownership of the ASL RB and modules providing Germans and American is a requirement to use this product.

Scenarios:

The Good Sheperd – St-George-D’elle, June 9th 1944
Stopped Dead – Near Hill 192 and St-Georges-D’elle, June 13th 1944
Three Abreast – Hill 192, near St. Lo, June 16th 1944
Raiding Party – Near Hill 192 and St-Georges-D’elle, July 5th 1944
Death’s Draw - Near Hill 192 and St-Georges-D’elle, July 11th 1944
Heroes’ Garden - Near Hill 192 and St-Georges-D’elle, July 11th 1944
Hill 192 - Near Hill 192 and St. Lo, June 11th 1944
Bocage Party - Near Hill 192 and La Croix Rouge, July 6th 1944
The Big Hurt - Near Hill 192 and St. Lo, July 11th 1944
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Latabæjarspilið
description:
The players, as residents of Lazy Town, take turns rolling dice, moving along the board and completing various assignments.

Assignments can include doing light workout, eating healthy snacks, or complimenting an opponent.

For each completed assignment, the players receive one fruit or vegetable token.

When a player has collected enough tokens, they need to face Robbie Rotten and successfully complete one final assignment to win the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: ASL Comp: GWASL II – Blasted Woods: French Great War
description:
BOIS DES CAURES, VERDUN, FRANCE, 21 February 1916: Lieutenant Colonel Émile Driant foresaw a German assault on Verdun, and made himself unpopular in military circles with his gloomy forecasts.
He was a prophet of his own doom.
Driant’s two battalions of Chasseurs-a-pied, the elite of 72nd Division, held two miles of wooded hills directly in the path of the main German onslaught.
On 21 February, Driant’s infantry were awoken by the greatest barrage ever heard. Every caliber from field gun to the terrible 210mm crashed down, lifted long enough for the stunned Frenchmen to rise to the surface, then began all over again. By midday, 80,000 heavy shells had fallen in an area of barely half a square mile. Trees were blasted to matchwood; platoon-sized bunkers had simply vanished; many Frenchmen were buried alive not once but repeatedly. Nevertheless, as the German assault teams advanced to infiltrate the French lines, almost half of Driant’s men had survived. Isolated, unsupported, blown out of their own fortifications, the Chasseurs fought on.

This expansion contains special rules (Attack à Outrance...), geo boards and counters for the French (inc. AFVs).

Scenarios:

The French Spirit – The Alsace border town of Altkirch, France, August 7th 1914
Pilckem Ridge – Pilckem, Belgium, April 22nd 1915
Window of Opportunity – Bois Des Caures, France, February 22nd 1916
Blasted Woods – Bois Des Caures, Verdun, France, February 21st 1916
Dead Man Hill - Bois Des Caures, Verdun, France, March 8th 1916
Baptism – The hamlet of La Ville Aux Bois, France, April 16th 1917
Flag Signal: Advance! – St-Pierre-Aigle, France, May 31st 1918
Schneiders at Soissons – Soissons, France, July 18th 1918
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: ASL Comp: GWASL III – Over There! American Great War
description:
GWASL III – Over There!

In this expansion the Americans enter the fray with all the fanfare that was mustered as they boarded ships to save Europe.
The proud, but untested ‘doughboys’ could not have known what was waiting for them ‘over there’ specifically, battle-hardened German soldiers, led by officers that knew victory first-hand. And were fighting for the Vaterland....

This expansion contains rules, geo boards and counters for the Americans.

Ownership of GWASL I and GWASL II is required...
as you know the Battle of Belleau Wood pitted Americans, alongside French and British troops as they faced down the Kaiser’s 1918 Spring Offensive!

Scenarios:

Honored Ground – Brancourt, France, October 8th 1918
Young Blood and Guts – Pannes, France, September 5th 1918
Hollenhunde – Belleau Wood, France, June 6th 1918
Hold Where You Stand – Marigny, France, June 3rd 1918
Riposte at Chinese Trench – Vierstraat, Belgium, September 1st 1918
Outworks Objectives – East of Ronssoy, France, September 27th 1918
Cher Ami – Argonne Forest, France, October 4th 1918
Cantigny Stand – Cantigny, France, May 28th 1918
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Obliquity: The Trenches
description:
War is imminent. You and your opponent will battle head-to-head, trying to fashion the strongest trench, using secrecy and special cards to bolster your line. Will you try to strike first and declare war? Or will tensions reach the point of no return...

Obliquity: The Trenches is a quick print and play card game that sees players building up their trench, using merely two decks. The variety and possibilities in this game means that no two trenches will ever be the same. Cards will provide Power Points, which is the ultimate decider of who wins in the game, and is provided by infantry cards and bolstered by support cards. Special cards can provide great advantages, if the trench can support their particular placement rules.

Part face-off and part-puzzle, all the cards have their own placement peculiarities, which will need to be thought about. Players will need to decide which place, out of the available places, would the card be best, to facilitate future potential card draws. This is ultimately the crux of the game, the construction of the trench through quick and simple puzzle-solving.

And if that isn't enough, then the Buildings and Bombs expansion allows players to construct buildings in their trenches and utilise No Man's Land, adorning it with dangerous defences.

Good Luck, General.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Pays Charolais Brionnais: le jeu
description:
The game of the Pays Charolais-Brionnais is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the centers of the Pays Charolais-Brionnais, Briant, Lugny-les-Charolles, Cronat...
and then go discover all the sites with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities, traditions, heritage....
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: ASL Comp: GWASL IV – Samsonov's Army: Russian Great War
description:
GWASL IV Samsonov’s Army takes the action to the Great War’ Eastern Front and pits the soldiers of General Ludendorff against invading Russians under General Samsonov. The dark forests, forced-marches, and human waves of a low-morale, poorly led force ... face the crack troops of a still ascendant Germany. The horror of a two-front war is upon the Kaiser’s best leaders and there is only one way out: total victory.

Historians know the battle took place near Allenstein. However, General Erich Ludendorff named it after Tannenberg, some 30 klicks to the west, to avenge the defeat of the Teutonic Knights at the earlier battle of the same name that occurred in 1410.

The world was a far different place during the summer of 1914. Germany was on the offensive on the Western Front. Trench warfare had yet to set in. Crowds, out in the streets welcomed war with open arms, and cheers. A massive Russian Army headed for East Prussia, and eventually, the heart of Germany ... in an unprecedented invasion—ten Russian Armies in all could be mobilized. Hindenburg was called out of retirement to manage the German side along with Ludendorff. Despite overwhelming numerical advantages by the enemy, the battle resulted in the almost complete destruction of the Russian Second Army, and the suicide of its commanding general, Alexander Samsonov.

A series of follow-up battles (1st Masurian Lakes) destroyed most of the First Army as well, and kept the Russians off-balance until the spring of 1915. The Battle of Tannenberg set the stage for the First Battle of the Masurian Lakes a week later, where the reinforced German Eighth Army now faced only the Russian First Army and forced it back over the prewar border.
Russian forces would not again march on German soil until the end of World War II.
Ownership of GWASL I is required.
Includes eight scenarios, two sheets of counters, all the geo boards needed to play the scenarios, folio, and special rules.

Scenarios:

Opening Blow – Stalluponen, East Prussia, August 17th 1914
Disaster at Gumbinnen - Gumbinnen, East Prussia 1914
Fresh Blood – Usdau, East Prussia, August 27th 1914
Samsonov’s End – Frogenau, East Prussia, August 29th 1914
The Kerensky Offensive – Lvov, Ukraine, July 1st 1917
Sacrifice for Joffre – Vilna, Russia, March 20th 1916
Action Along the Wilja – Vileyka, Russia, September 22nd 1915
East of Sosenka – East of Sosenka, Russia, September 24th 1915
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: ATTLO: Avoid Taking The Last One
description:
Nim variants with six different boards and fifteen counters. Players take turns to remove one or two adjacent counters that must be joined by a black line. The player who is forced to take the last counter loses the game.

Variant 1: players take turns to remove at least one counter or at most a row of counters provided there is no missing counters in between.

Variant 2: players take turns to remove from one to three adjacent counters with no missing counters in between, but a players must not take the same number of counters as the previous player.

name: Escape From Mars
description:
You are not alone...

Escape from Mars is a single player hidden traitor game.

An alien virus has infected the crew of Mars Base Epsilon, the first off world colony, and strange insect like creatures swarm the outpost. Players must discover and quarantine the alien host, living among them, inside one of the crew, they must also gather alien gene samples, then via the communication room, request rescue. It’s a race against time as crew become infected, drone aliens will be drawn to the colony until eventually an alpha alien will arrive and wreak havoc on the colony and its crew.

Scour the colony for useful items and weapon, locate the clues to discover the alien host and send them to quarantine, keep crew infection down, research the alien gene sample codes, deal with crisis events and distrustful crew members, seal off parts of the base and set defenses, send the robot to rescue fallen crew, prepare medicines and vaccines, stock up on ammo, jump in a space suit and search the plant surface, destroy the alien drones then hold out until the rescue ship arrives, just make sure you get home...alone.

The game is played over a set number of rounds (which also determined the difficulty), a crew marker counts down the rounds and at the other end of the round tracker an Alien marker moves in the opposite direction, if the markers ever meet, the Alpha Alien will arrive and the ‘Host’ crew member will die.... or evolve?
