Players start off with a limited number of active crew, some must be rescued, other will be distrustful and need convincing to join. Player must scour the ship looking for clues as to the identity of the Alien Host, looking for blood samples and crew logs, players also need to gather alien samples for HQ. The colony is also full of weapons, tools, events, and more. Players risk crew when venturing out in colony as the longer they search, the more exposure to the alien virus they risk. The game is about managing and taking risks, use your crew wisely as they have different strengths and weaknesses.

The game ends and the players win, when they have discovered and quarantined the Alien Host, found and reported the Alien samples to HQ, all get into the airlock and the rescue ship arrives.

The player loose if no one makes it out alive, and this can happen in many ways...
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: The Sound of Metal
description:
The Sound of Metal is a fully cooperative (or solo) tabletop miniatures skirmish game. With a rogue-lite campaign system, players take on the roles of survivors of humans, trying to get by after the downfall of civilization, a result of the Great Robot Uprising.

After a large meteor crashes into the planet, the Robot overlords start to experience communication issues and many start to malfunction. Humans dubbed this event as "The Glitch" and see it as their opportunity to take back their planet. This is no easy task, as the human population is just a fraction of what it once was, and communication is a challenge. Although the Robots have been greatly disrupted, they are still, in every sense of the word, a great threat.

Players create survivors, find a vehicle, and traverse the countryside, gathering resources, finding food and weapons, and learning skills to complete mission objectives. In doing so, players characters will level up, gain notoriety, and try to find and destroy the machines central core.

The game features an action-point based system - These points double as action points and your characters health. As your character takes wounds, they lose action points. Run out of action points, and you collapse.

Combat/skill checks are performed by rolling dice, bolstered by stats and gained skills.

Similar to the great tactical, turn-based video games of the 90s, such as X-Com and Jagged Alliance, players can spend extra action points to perform actions at higher levels of competency, being able to aim, change their stances, or focus on specific tasks.

Enemies are controlled by the game's AI - each enemy has its own order of operations reactionary programming. Players face these enemies in campaign missions, as well as random encounters.

The world unfolds in front of the players - as they track their progress on the overworld map. Moving costs food and fuel, and dangers lurk around every corner. The map is be randomly generated each game, and players will find settlements, points of interest and missions in different areas every game.

Players never control more than 6 survivors at a time, and can be played with 1-6 players cooperatively, splitting up the survivors among players.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: The New Game Of War
description:
Each player has nine pawns. Two players may play as allies. The goal of the game is to score points by entering the citadel in the center of the game board an by capturing enemy pieces.

Movement is one space per turn in any direction, but not diagonal. The pawns may capture enemies by jumping over them. Capture in mandatory if possible. Allied pawns may be jumped over but are not captured. Jumping over pawns of the same color is not permitted.

Pawns that reach the citadel are put out of the game, if they are not compelled to leave right away to capture an enemy pawn. Captured pawns are exchanged and reenter the game on the spaces of the same color.

The game ends, when one allied party has no pawn left on the board or, if there are no allies, when only pawns of one color remain on the board.

—user summary

name: Tri-Dice
description:
Tri-Dice is a unique, quirky fun two person game. Both players move around a two track board, obtaining playing cards and optionally switching tracks, trying to score points. First player to 30 points wins. Sounds simplistic but there are many twists which require a good deal of strategy. For example, players may "capture" each other leading to cat and mouse chases.

—description from the designer

name: Entre os Feixes
description:
To play Entre os Feixes, you just have to grab some bottle caps, print two sheets to cut out, and the rules.

The story of this game takes place thousands of years ago, in the city of Bethlehem of Judea, when poor people collected, among the plantations, ears of wheat and barley that fell to the ground, to satisfy their own hunger. Ruth, the protagonist of the story, is one of these people, a young and foreign widow looking for ways to support her mother-in-law, picking ears in a plantation in the region, because according to Jewish law on behalf the hungry, it was justice for the owners of land to leave the ears that fell to the ground for people in need to collect for themselves. The game is based on chapter 2 from the book of Ruth of the Bible, telling the story of this notorious young foreigner who, because of her faithfulness and dedication, marries the owner of the plantation and joins the genealogical line of Jesus Christ.

A game that, through its mechanics, can be used to address issues such as: social equality, self-preservation, respect for women, the value of loyalty, work, and the correct authority that cares and leads people in a loving way.

In summary, each player plays with 3 pieces that move like queens, but instead of capturing the opponent's pieces, they capture the squares of the board, collecting them to sum points at the end of the game.

(Description by the designer)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Print & Play, Religious
mechanics: Modular Board, Set Collection, Square Grid, Take That

name: Norsun muisti
description:
An educational memory game about nature preservation. Find pairs of animals, connect animal families and plant protective forest for them. Can also be played as a classic memory game.

The game includes 16 animal species (2 adults and one baby each), and baobab trees as home trees for species. You try to find the pairs and deliver them to safety. Winner is the one with most animals saved.

name: Clown Ring Toss
description: A clown figure is attached to a game board by means of a brass tube. Players take turns throwing rope rings from ten feet away. For every successful throw or "Ringer", 25 points is scored. The player with the highest score after ten turns wins. Alternatively, players can play to an agreed-upon score to win the game.

name: High Noon: Bloodcreek Bushwhackers
description:
Remnants of a lost cause. Survivors of a massacre. For a country that abandoned them, the war is over. For this band of men, it has just begun. Left for dead and deserted by their homeland, these survivors of the Blood Creek Massacre have only vengeance as their refuge, stalking their oppressors in the dead of night, becoming themselves the haunting specters of Saratoga and they will not rest until the men who murdered their brothers join them in Hell!

The Blood Creek Bushwhackers posse is one of sabotage and ambush. What they lack in range, they make up for in surprise. When the Bushwhackers are on the table, no space is safe and no loot crate is secure as these gray ghosts can pop up anywhere to attack an unsuspecting target or detonate crates, destroying them entirely and dealing damage to all around them!
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
publishers: High Noon Game Inc., White Label Games

name: High Noon: The Jenkins Brothers
description:
Deep in the swamps of Pascagoula County sits a small barrel town of moonshiners founded by the Jenkins family. After the Governor’s violent crackdown of the industry left most of the family dead, the last surviving patriarch has gathered his kin and – with nothing left to lose - takes the fight straight city hall. But this will be no peaceful protest.

The Jenkins Brothers are a trio of close range punishment. Two of the brothers, Jethro and Jonah, brandish powerful shotguns that execute carnage through cover and doors, while the giant Clifton’s brutish strength and combo attacks sends his opponents flying in every direction.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Player Elimination
publishers: High Noon Game Inc., White Label Games

name: High Noon: Monco and McAtte
description:
A retired colonel, hunting the man who murdered his lover, teams up with a gunslinging stranger with no name to form one of the deadliest bounty-hunting posses Saratoga has ever seen. One is quick on the draw, the other has the range of a marksman. Together, they hunt the notorious outlaws of the West, cleaning the streets and filling their pockets.

Monco & McAtte are a dynamic duo that work better together than apart, but can stand on their own if they have to.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Player Elimination
publishers: High Noon Game Inc., White Label Games

name: Hit Parade
description:
Hit parade is a game based on the same spirit as the monopoly one.

The player must collect 4 "Gold disc" from different artist to win the game. To do that they will throw the dice and move their pawn on the board to buy artist cards.

Once a player as an artist card, he should develop them to get higher in the artist ranking until winning a Gold disc.

When an artist card is already taken by a player, an other player can challenge him: the players write on a piece of paper an amount of money. If the one who challenged the card wins, he should take the card and pay the difference between the two amounts to the bank. If the one who was challenged wins, he keeps his card and the other player must pay him the difference between the two amounts. If the amount are equal, nothing happens.

The player can lose or win money all along the play depending of the boxes they go in (taxes, royalties, bank) and they can sell artists of disc gold to get money back.

name: High Noon: The Abernathy Gang
description:
When those deputized to enforce justice only sought to twist and corrupt it to their own ends, this Man of Metal and his bushranging renegades took the law into their own hands. But when everyone has their own ideas of order, the compass tends to tailspin into chaos, and that’s precisely what transpired at the Bloodbath of Brunswany, where the unstoppable, armored Nelson Abernathy and his Abernathy Gang went down in infamy as ruthless outlaws with a thirst for violence.

The Abernathy Gang are heavy hitting gunfighters, that can take just as much punishment as they can give. Using torches, the gang can light entire buildings ablaze while Nelson’s impenetrable metal plating absorbs his enemies’ attacks for days and the sight of a brass star brings out a monster in Nelson that has become the nursery rhyme for misbehaving children across the country.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
publishers: High Noon Game Inc., White Label Games

name: Jeu des étoiles
description:
The principle of the game is simple: the players must move from one star to another by the simplest and shortest possible way. Players advance along the constellations, depending on the result of a 12-sided die. If players need to move from one constellation to another, they use a ruler to gauge the distances.
For each journey completed, the players earn points. Whoever has the most wins.

name: ASL Comp: GWASL VI – Blood on the Isonzo: Italian WW1
description:
Italy upended their Central Powers allies by entering the war on the side of the Allies in May of 1915, following secret negotiations. Italy fought mostly against Austria-Hungary along the northern border, including high up in the now-Italian Alps and along the Isonzo river. The war was initially a failure for Italy despite being numerically superior to Austria-Hungary. The Italian army repeatedly attacked Austria, making little progress and suffering heavy losses, and then being routed in 1917 by a German-Austrian counteroffensive after Russia left the war allowing the Central Powers to move reinforcements to the Italian Front from the Eastern Front. In October 1918, as civil unrest increased in Austria-Hungary, the Italians attacked again. The Austrian army broke, and the Italians drove deep into Austrian territory. Fighting ended on 3 November 1918.

Ownership ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

Hill 383 - Plava, Italy, June 20th 1915
City of Violets - Gorizia, Italy, May 5h 1915
First Rush - Podgorica, Italy, July 2nd 1915
Isonzo Marsch - Tolmino, Italy, September 10th 1917
Tolmino Bridgehead - Tolmino, Italy, September 12th 1917
Cappuccio Wood - Mount San Michele, Italy, July 25th 1915
Vrtojba - Vrtojba, Italy, November 4th 1916
On To Monte Majur - Monte Majur, Italy, October 25th 1917
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: ASL Comp: GWASL VII – Soldiers of the Sultan: Turkish WW1
description:
The soldiers of the Ottoman Empire fought a variety of combatants during World War I.
There were five main campaigns in the theatre: the Sinai and Palestine Campaign, the Mesopotamian Campaign, the Caucasus Campaign, the Persian Campaign, and most famously, the Gallipoli Campaign.
The Ottomans joined the Central Powers, goaded by Germany, in its hope that Russian troops would be drained away from the fronts in Galicia and Poland. Scenarios in this module cover the Battle of Sarikamish, as well as the campaigns in Mesopotamia, Palestine, and OF COURSE … Gallippoli, one of the most disastrous campaigns of the Conflict.
The Dardanelles campaign was fought on Turkish soil, as the ANZAC tried to create a passage through to the Black Sea. Gallipoli was the brainchild of Winston Churchill, and was a bitter failure. After massive hardship, ANZAC soldiers were withdrawn, having failed in most cases to even get off the beaches. Russia also invaded Turkish territory, in the north. Following the collapse of the Tsar’s government, the Turks swept north and entered Russian territory proper. By the Russian surrender in the Spring of 1918, the Turkish forces had taken Baku on the Caspian Sea.

Ownership ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

The Bergmann Offensive - Caucasus Front, November 7th 1914
Stand At Pine Ridge - Pine Ridge, Gallipoli Peninsula, April 25th 1915
Plugge's Point - Z Beach, Geba Tabe, Gallipoli Peninsula, April 25th 1915
Valley Of Death - Kereves Dere, Gallipoli Peninsula, June 21st 1915
Forgotten Arabs - Gallipoli Peninsula, August 6th 1915
Achi Baba Nulla - Cape Helles, Gallipoli Peninsula, June 4th 1915
Fir Tree Spur - Cape Helles, Gallipoli Peninsula, May 8th 1915
Australian Achilles - Gallipoli Peninsula, May 19th 1915
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Papertrail
description: Players take turns rolling a dice and placing paper trails in the form of white counters on the spaces allocated on the game board. After all 48 tiles have been laid, players then take turns moving their pawns and collecting the counters either using forward movement or a combination of forward and backward movement, the sum of which must equal to the dice roll. When all players have completed the circuit, the game ends and the winner is the player with the most counters collected.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Pirates Gold
description: Players race through a track peppered with skull and crossbones spaces and treasure chest spaces. If a player lands on a skull and crossbones space, he/she takes a skull and crossbones card and go back X - Y spaces. If a player lands on a treasure chest space, he/she takes a treasure chest card and move forward X + Y spaces. The values of X and Y are given on each card.

name: Land Rush: A Game of Of-Fence and De-Fence
description:
Land Rush is played with Chess pieces on a Chess board, and for the most part the pieces have their normal Chess moves. (Pawn movement is slightly different.) However, other than kings pieces cannot capture, and the goal of the game is to build a connected chain of your pieces between the left and right edges of the board which fences off more than 32 squares.

The board starts empty. On a turn a player may create a piece or move an existing piece. Pieces are created on the owner's first rank and have point values: in order to create a piece there must be at least as many pieces in its file as its point value. (Pawns have a value of 0 so can be created at the start of the game.)
mechanics: Connections, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Wizwords!: The Ultimate Crossword Game
description:
In Wizwords! one or more players gradually build up a crossword grid as the game progresses. (The box says "1+" but six seems like a reasonable maximum number of players.)

On a turn a player draws a letter card and adds a word containing that letter to the grid, connected it to existing words as in Scrabble.

The grid starts with no black squares; after the first turn a player's turn starts by covering letters in previous words with black tiles to leave shorter words, or incomplete words which they complete on their turn.

name: Zypher: The Scrambled Word Game
description:
In Zypher players race to the end of a track by unscrambling anagrams in 30 seconds.

A player may choose to unscramble a five-letter anagram for a small benefit (e.g. advancing one's own piece or moving an opponent's back), or a six-letter anagram for a larger benefit (e.g. both moving your own piece forwards and another back).

name: Suit Up!: Strings
description:
Strings (one of two games in a article titled Suit Up!) is a no-luck card game.

Each player gets the 13 cards of a suit from a standard deck of cards, and takes turn playing one card at a time to a set of "strings" on the table. A "string" is a row of cards in ascending sequence with no gaps, e.g. a 4 must be followed by a 5, then a 6, etc.

A string can be started with any card except an ace, 10, or a court card; the latter are wild.

There is a limit of seven strings with three players and nine with four, which may make it impossible for a player to play later in the game, in which case they discard a card.

When all cards are gone players assess each string to see who wins it: 2-10 count their face values, aces count 11, and court cards count 5. The winner takes the string; if there is a tie the cards are split evenly. The player winning the most cards wins the game.

Several variants are provided.

name: Check4
description: Variant of Checkers with four players

name: Suit Up!: Bidwise
description:
Bidwise (one of two games in a article titled Suit Up!) is an auction game played using standard playing cards.

Each player gets the 13 cards in one suit. The property cards to be bid on are the ace-10 of the remaining suit/another deck, and are placed face-up on the table.

Each player shuffles their cards and each turn draws one and plays it. Cards are generally placed under property cards as bids of their face value; court cards can be bids worth five or can be used to remove an opposing bid card.

When all cards have been played the player bidding the most for each property wins it. The player with the greatest total value of properties wins the game.

A variant is given in which the bid cards can only be used on properties of matching value or one different.

name: Divide & Conquer: A Game of Galactic Isolation
description:
Divide & Conquer is played on a small hexagonal grid with seven pieces for each player.

On a turn a player can move one of their ships to an adjacent empty space, as long as the ship is adjacent to at least one friendly ship.

Instead, a player can move an opposing ship which is adjacent to one of their ships (which is in turn adjacent to another friendly ship). They must move the opposing ship to a space where it isn't adjacent to any of its own ships, or to one of the black holes at the edges of the board, where it is lost forever.

The object of the game is to isolate or remove all the opposing ships.

If the players agree the game is stalemated a set of cards numbered 1-10 is used to remove a ship from each player.

name: Hex-A-Gone
description:
Hex-A-Gone is a solitaire puzzle game played on a hexagonal grid in a rhombus shape, five on a side.

There are 16 pieces: four each numbered 1-4. A move consists of jumping a piece over exactly the matching number of adjacent pieces. One of the jumped pieces is removed. The goal is to leave as few pieces as possible.

A starting position is given but others can be used.

name: Robot Tricks
description:
In Robot Tricks two-player teams each control a robot moving on a checkerboard, attempting to retrieve treasure chests.

The robots are controlled via card play, specifically by playing Spades. However, no bidding takes place and the number of tricks won is irrelevant. Instead, the winner of a trick chooses one of the four cards in it and moves their team's robot accordingly: the suit determines the direction and the rank determines how many spaces it moves, according to a table. Court cards allow the robot to be rotated.

However, if a trick contains an ace the winner chooses one of the other cards and moves the opposing team's robot instead.

When a robot moves to one of its treasures exactly it retrieves it. Opposing treasures and robots may be pushed.

The game can be set up with two treasures per team for a short game or four each for a long game.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Mercato: Dominate the World's Market
description:
Mercato: Dominate the World's Market is a dynamic game in which players acquire properties to gain control over key industries while navigating external events like wars, global warming, disruptive innovation, and pandemics.

Enjoy trading and attempting hostile takeovers on your quest for market dominance.

In Mercato: Dominate the World's Market, players engage in intense competition, strategically buying properties to concentrate ownership on global industries. The game's dynamic nature allows any player to build on their strategy, aiming to become the dominant player in the market and potentially bankrupt the rest of the players.

name: Chemline: Jouez avec les éléments !
description:
Chemline is a card game consisting of 104 cards, corresponding to the first chemical elements.

Goal: create lines by placing cards in the order of, either the element's atomic number or, its year of discovery.
In doing so, players become familiar with atomic elements and can discover different information about each element.
The etymology of each name, the main uses of the elements, their molar masses and their electronegativity can all be found.

This is a free game (in French) available from their creators, the ENSCMu – Ecole Nationale Supérieure de Chimie de Mulhouse

name: Great Tank Battle of Kursk
description: Great Tank Battle of Kursk is a game of tactical combat between German tanks and Soviet tanks during the Battle of Kursk, published as a special supplement of MC Axis #37.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Battle of Leyte Gulf
description:
Solitaire game of the Battle of Leyte Gulf, published as a special supplement of MC Axis #46.
The player plays the role of Imperial Japanese Navy commander, organizes four fleets (Ozawa, Shima, Kurita and Nishimura) and intercepts U.S. Navy.

name: Battle of Midway
description:
Solitaire game of the Battle of Midway, published as a special supplement of MC Axis #49.
The player plays the role of Imperial Japanese Navy commander and runs after two hares — aims at bombing both Midway Island and U.S. aircraft carriers.

name: Battle of Britain 1940
description:
Solitaire game of the Battle of Britain in 1940, published as a special supplement of MC Axis #54.
The player plays the role of Luftwaffe commander and aims at bombing London and other strategic targets.

name: ASL Comp: GWASL VIII – Gallipoli and Beyond: ANZAC WW1
description:
When war broke out in August of 1914, the news was met by wildly cheering crowds in Australia.
Following some months of mobilization, the AIF exited the country in November 1914 and, after several delays due to the presence of German naval vessels in the Indian Ocean, arrived in Egypt. Their first task was to defend the Suez Canal. In early 1915, however, it was decided to carry out an amphibious landing on the Gallipoli Peninsula with the goal of opening up a second front and securing the passage of the Dardanelles. The Australians and New Zealanders, grouped together as the Australian and New Zealand Army Corps (ANZAC), went ashore on 25 April 1915 and for the next eight months the Anzacs, alongside their British, French and other allies, fought a costly and ultimately unsuccessful campaign against the Turks. The force was evacuated from the peninsula in December 1915 and returned to Egypt, where the AIF was expanded. In early 1916 it was decided that the infantry divisions would be sent to France, where they took part in many of the major battles fought on the Western Front. Most of the light horse units remained in the Middle East until the end of the war, carrying out further operations against the Turks in Egypt and Palestine.

Ownership ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

Driven Out - Mont St. Quentin, France, July 23rd 1916
The O.G. Lines - Pozieres, France, July 29th 1916
First Dash - Pozieres, France, July 23rd 1916
Pozieres Heights - Pozieres, France, July 29th 1916
First Puncture - Bapaume, France, May 2nd 1917
Determination and Valour - Amiens, France, April 4th 1918
The Sugarloaf - Fromelles, France, July 20th 1916
Bayonet To Bayonet - Broodseinde, Belgium, October 3rd 1917
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Third Battle of the Solomon Sea
description:
Solitaire game of the Third Battle of the Solomon Sea, published as a special supplement of MC Axis #57.
The player plays the role of Imperial Japanese Navy commander, organizes fleets and aims at transporting Imperial Japanese Army reinforcement to Guadalcanal Island.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Ancient War Game
description: An abstract chess-like game based on the Punic Wars. The playing pieces are casted in resin (deluxe edition) or wooden blocks (normal edition), colored red (Rome) or blue (Carthage). Both red pieces and blue pieces are subdivided into one commander, ten infantry and four cavalry. Each player aims to making a friendly piece move to the opponent's deepest square or removing the opponent's commander.

name: Hellseher
description:
The objective of the game is to guess the exact combination of triangles, squares, and circles and their exact positions. The first player creates a combination of four shapes using triangles, squares, or circles without the second player looking and covers it. The second player then tries to guess the correct combination. After every guessing attempt, the first player marks each square grid that has the correct shape with a circle, and each square grid that has the correct shape and position with a square. If the second player is unable to guess correctly after eight attempts, the first player wins.

Equipment: 1 game board, 1 privacy screen, 34 discs, 34 squares, 19 triangles.

name: On the Rivet: Team Tactics
description:
The first expansion for On the Rivet: The Race for the Champion's Stripes, which adds cards and tokens to include a 6th and 7th player as well as Tactic cards which gives players unique abilities to play throughout the game.

Also included are more map tiles for greater course variability and two new event cards.

Components:
- Additional Orange and Purple team, thus playing between 3-7 people.
- 14 Tactics cards that help players avoid events or make super moves.
- 2 additional Event cards.
- 2 additional double-sided map tiles for further distance and terrain variability.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Catch the Leader, Follow, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Negotiation, Pattern Movement, Race, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: ASL Comp: GWASL IX – Bulgarian Summer: Bulgarian WW1
description:
Following Bulgaria’s entry into the war on the side of the Central Powers on October 14th, 1915, the death knell for Serbia and Romania began to sound.
The Bulgarian Summer of 1915 saw the Entente attempt to win the hearts and support of Bulgaria. It was all for naught, as the country entered the war aligned with Germany and her allies. And mobilization soon began, followed by a declaration of war against Serbia. Around this time the Germans and Austro-Hungarians had penetrated into Serbia on a front that was 140 kilometers in length and 15 kilometers in depth. In order to close the 90-kilometer gap between the flanks of the German 11th Army and the Bulgarian 1st Army Mackensen ordered the latter to invade the valley of the river Morava and take Niš and Aleksinac. In accordance with this order the Bulgarians attacked along the entire front of their 1st Army, quickly driving out the Serbian units and taking control of the border area. Following this easy success however the speed of the advance was much reduced due to the bad weather, which turned roads into mud, and a dense fog that sometimes limited visibility to 50 meters. In addition the stiffening Serbian resistance and the mountainous character of the area caused the flanks of the 1st Army to halt before the fortresses of Pirot and Zajecar. The exploits of the Bulgarian 2nd Army in Macedonia convinced the Serbians that the danger of complete encirclement is high and forced them to begin withdrawing their forces to Kosovo while offering stiff but not desperate resistance to Army Group Mackensen. In November, while the decisive Serbian defeat unfolded, the French attempted to exert pressure on the Bulgarian 2nd Army but were soon forced to halt their attempts to drive north.

Ownership of ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

Pristina Halt - Pristina, Serbia, November 24th 1915
Fall Back To Lerin - Gornichevo, Salonika Front, September 14th 1916
The Dobrich Epopee (Epic) - Southern Dobruja, Romania, September 5th 1916
A Good Field - Dobro Pole, Serbia, September 15th 1918
Chegan Operation - Banitsa, Serbia, August 17 1916
Contested Prophet - Sabac, Serbia, September 30th 1916
Rakija Courage - Gnjilane, Serbia, December 2nd 1915
Show Of Force - Serbia, August 18 1916
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Onkel Pinkepank auf der Weltreise
description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 80 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: A. Anton & Co., Leipzig, Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Beyond Tic Tac Ten
description:
Beyond Tic Tac Ten is played on a 9x9 grid divided into nine 3x3 grids, as is the fake "Tic Tac Ten" game that inspired it. (This appeared in one of the fake ads in an earlier issue of GAMES.)

Players take turns marking an empty space. After the first move, each move must be made in the 3x3 corresponding to the position of the previous move in its 3x3 grid. E.g. if the first move is made in the upper right corner of its 3x3 grid, the second move must be made in the 3x3 grid in the upper right corner of the "board."

The first player to get three spaces in a line (a tic-tac-toe) in a single 3x3 grid wins. However, several variants are suggested, including one in which players try to get tic-tac-toes in three grids in a line, and both players can get a tic-tac-toe in the same grid

name: Quoz
description:
Quoz is played with a deck of eight suits each numbered 0-4, plus 12 numbered "Draw" cards and 12 "Quoz" cards.

On a turn a player plays two cards with matching number or suit, optionally accompanied by a Draw card. The next player to play is determined by the rank of the cards played (higher if different) - count that many players around the table. If it ends on the current player they choose who plays next.

Instead of playing a pair, a player may draw a card or play a Quoz card, which forces the previous player to also play a Quoz card. If they can't they collect all played cards and also draw cards as indicated by any Draw cards played. (Players may also have to collect cards if they can't play a pair under some circumstances.)

When a player is out of cards everyone else scores the value of their remaining cards. Low score when someone reaches 200 points wins.

name: Die lustige Zwölf
description: At the beginning of the game, each player places 10 coins on space 6. The players roll two dice and places 5 coins on the space with the rolled number if the space is empty. If not, he wins the 5 coins from this space. On the roll of a 6, five coins are payed every time. If a 12 is rolled, the player wins the game and all coins on the board.
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Escapade
description:
Escapade is played on a oblong hexagonal grid board using 13 pieces for each player, one of which is marked as a General. The other pieces are Guards.

The General and six Guards for each player start on the board, with the other six Guards as off-board reserves. On a turn a player may place a Guard from their reserve on any empty space, or they may move a piece on the board any number of empty spaces in a straight line.

A Guard is captured if an enemy piece is moved so that is directly between two enemy pieces. A General is captured if enemy pieces occupy all its adjacent spaces.

The object of the game is to move one's General to the goal area on the opposite edge of the board. One can also win by capturing the opposing General or lose if all the spaces in your target goal area become occupied.

name: ASL Comp: GWASL X – Slavic Warriors: Serbian WW1
description:
Serbia was blamed for the start of World War I following the assassination of Archduke Franz-Ferdinand in Sarajevo. Yet the Serbs would enjoy the first Allied victory of the war, after they drove the Austro-Hungarians out of the town of Sabac on 19 August 1914. Before they could, however, civilians were rounded up in the town and massacred. On the 5 October 1914, Austria launched their offensive against Serbia. The Serbian Army, weakened by Typhus, couldn’t hold out and the capital, Belgrade, was evacuated on the 9th. Two days later, Bulgaria declared war on Serbia, hoping to annex the Serb possession of Macedonia. By the 24th, the Bulgarians had driven a wedge between the Serb army and the Allied armies in Greece attempting to come to their aid. The Serbs fought with courage, but found their army critically low on ammunition stocks. With defeat staring them in the face, over 200,000 soldiers and civilians fled over the rugged mountains and into Albania. Many were evacuated by sea to the island of Corfu, in what would stand as the world’s largest evacuation by sea until the ‘miracle at Dunkirk’ in 1940. Surviving Serbian soldiers made their way to Greece, and remained in uniform to serve in the Yugoslav Division of Serbs, Croats, Macedonians, Montenegrins and Slovenes. When Bulgaria surrendered on 30 September 1918, Serb, Yugoslav, French and British forces united to drive the Austrians and Germans out of Serbia.

Ownership of ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

Delay Before The Drina - Podrinje, Serbia, August 12th 1914
Kosaningrad - Tekeris, Serbia, August 15th 1914
Mounted Clash - Tekeris, Serbia, August 16th 1914
In The Valley Of Jadar - Sabac, Serbia, August 16th 1914
Back Across The Drina - Cer, Serbia, August 17th 1914
The Liberation Of Sabac - Sabac, Serbia, August 24th 1914
The Youngest Corporal - Cer, Serbia, August 14th 1914
The Battle of Kolubara - Serbia, November 18th 1914
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Spy: An Original Strategy Game
description:
Spy is played on a 11x11 grid with 20 spaces designated as cities. There are five tiles in each of four colors, numbered 1-5, which are randomly placed on the cities at the start of the game.

Each player has four spies: one large, one medium, and two small. On a turn a player either places a spy on an empty edge space or move a spy any number of empty spaces orthogonally. A spy can end its move on a space with a smaller enemy spy, which is placed one space away in the direction the moving spy came from.

When four of the black tiles spaces are occupied those tiles are taken. The blue tiles are next, etc. The fifth tile in a color can be taken by any spy landing on its space.

When there is just one tile left the game ends. Players score the values of their tiles, plus a ten-point bonus for collecting three or four of the same number.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Set Collection, Square Grid

name: Mating Season
description:
Mating Season is played with a set of 36 insect cards/tiles. Each card is a unique combination of one of six colors, one of three wing patterns, and having or not having antennae. The cards are double-sided, with a male on one side and a female on the other.

In the two-player game players start with five-card "hands" (the cards are actually face-up on the table) and a single card to start a common insect family tree. Players take turns playing one or more cards to the tree; before playing a player may draw up to five more cards from the deck, choosing their genders.

Two insects will only mate if they are of different genders, of complementary colors, have different wing patterns, and have opposite antenna status. Their offspring (up to two) will have the wing pattern different from either parent's and any of the other four colors.

There can only be five generations in play; if a sixth is started the top one is shuffled and placed at the bottom of the deck.

The first player to empty their hand wins.

In the solitaire game an insect is set aside at the start and the goal is to evolve a mate for it within five generations.

name: Treasure Hunters
description:
Treasure Hunters is played on a board of seven spaces arranged in a ring. The players move around this - one clockwise and one counterclockwise - picking up four different values of treasure.

Movement is done by playing cards - one player has all the black cards from a standard deck and the other has the red, with random hands drawn from each. Most cards move the player around the board, but court cards have special effects.

When a player lands on a space they take the least-valuable treasure there, generally speaking. At the end of a turn a player may turn over one treasure on the board; treasures that have been turned over are worth more.

When all the treasures have been taken or all cards have been played the player with the most points in treasures wins.

name: ASL Comp: GWASL XI – Balkan Aspirations: Romanian WW1
description:
Romania entered the war in August of 1916, on the Allied side, in an attempt to seize the prize: Transylvania.
This region in Austria-Hungary had a Romanian ethnic majority but was under Hungarian control at the time.
Despite initial successes, the combined forces of Russia and Romania suffered several defeats, and by the end of 1916 only Moldavia remained under Allied control. After several defensive victories in 1917, with different groups competing for authority over the Russian troops in Romania in the aftermath of the October Revolution, Romania signed an armistice at Focani. On November 10, 1918, just one day before the German armistice and when all the other Central Powers had already capitulated, Romania re-entered the war. By then, about 220,000 Romanian soldiers had been killed. Despite their small size, the Germans worried about the prospect of Romania entering the war, Hindenburg writing: “It is certain that so relatively small a state as Romania had never before been given a role so important, and, indeed, so decisive for the history of the world at so favorable a moment.” Romanian soldiers would fight in battles that would be compared with some of the most brutal campaigns on the Western Front at little-known places like the Bran-Câmpulung area, the Carpathains, and the Prahova Valley.

Ownership of ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

Across The Argesch - Argeș River, Romania, December 3rd 1916
Stand At Brasso - Brassó, Transylvania, October 8th 1916
Sweep Of Cinghinarele Island - Cinghinarele Island, Bulgaria, October 8th 1916
Erich and August - Silistra, Bulgaria, September 4th 1916
Turkey Shooters - Amuzaca, Romania, September 24th 1916
Der Alte Mann - Kohalom, Romania, October 2nd 1916
Saving Moldavia - Oituz, Romania, August 12th 1917
Predeal Ordeal - Predeal,Romania, October 23rd 1916
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Worlds of Universe: Dawn of Terra
description:
Worlds of Universe - Survival Board Game / Tabletop is a board game, as well as a miniature game.

What genre is it?
The game is a mix of … Survival, Tabletop Elements, RPG, Crafting, Strategy, Building and Economy. The game is both a co-op and a lone fighter game. For up to 6 players. Despite the complex scope of WoU, the game is also designed to be beginner-friendly. Of course, you will also encounter zombies in the post-apocalypse.

What is WORLDS of UNIVERSE all about?
The story begins in WORLDS of UNIVERSE Teil 1: Dawn of Terra [Part I] on our earth in the year [now]. The only difference is that the fate of the earth was already determined in the 50s. That is with a fallout, justified by a desperate attempt to stop a pandemic. A foreign virus-transformed 60 percent of the population into zombie-like mutant beings.

The humans, as they are, destroyed themselves afterward. The chaos in the new world brings WoU to a post-apocalyptic journey in which players can play their own hero. Due to the disintegration from 1950 onwards, the world in WoU contains both old-fashioned things that have stood still in their time, as well as technical achievements over the years of development.

While some live in the Outland, empires, and elites in their futuristic districts are forging new plans for power over a new unified world. On the other hand, two camps are striving for only one thing; to survive. This is exactly where the players come into play. You are allowed to join one of the camps, do jobs, and advance the main story. And as expected in a zombie survival board game, actually also zombie, mutants, something ugly ?
Note: This game has no connection through the Covid19 events, the content was written by me three years ago. This is pure coincidence.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Events, Map Addition, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Variable Set-up

name: Tate and State
description:
Players take turns throwing dice with the values of a smiley face, T, A, t, E, S (in order of decreasing value) and try to score the best combination. The first player can stop at one throw or re-throw all or some of the dice. Other player can only have as many throws as the first player.

Some combinations are:

'Enterprise': Smiley face and TAtE (Best combination)
'Five of a kind'
'Four of a kind' and so on
'Stagnation': STAtE (losing throw, player pays penalty)

This game seemed to have been produced by Tate and Lyle sugar refineries to protest against nationalization of the sugar refining industry.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: Berlin I: Final Victory
description:
Berlin Final Victory HUGE MONSTER Edition: Crazy, big, massive, enlarged, and unprecedented. Those would be terms one could use to describe the Battle of Berlin. You might also want to trot them out for a description of this new edition of Berlin I, an unusual and unique gaming experience-the first truly large hex city fight. What you get is an enlarged (check our site for actual dimensions, it aims at as Deluxe as can be considering the huge scale of this battlefield) game map using the new lay-flat, hard boards. It's just mind-blowing to look at, the expanse. You also receive the scenario collection in latest editions in color + new color rules pages in 3-hole, the new presentation. Bring your own counters from any edition or purchase the BERLIN COUNTER SET now available. You also get the collection of color play aids in NEW cardstock format for durability and ease of use.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Wild Robot's Checker Set
description:
Standard Checkers rules with a robot for each player. The Robot is placed next to the board on each player's end. On any turn a player may move the robot in one of the following ways:

To enter the board, the robot must jump in and capture an enemy piece. The robot may choose to not jump in if the opportunity arises. A robot that jumped in must complete the full series of jumps capturing enemy pieces to the extent that it is able to do so. A robot may jump in and jump out again in one turn.
A robot moves like a standard king on the board.
A robot may jump off the board by capturing an enemy piece and landing off the board, or by moving from a square on the perimeter of the board. A robot may not jump out of the board even if there is the opportunity to do so.
To re-enter the board a robot jumps in again according to rule no. 1 above
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: ASL Comp: GWASL XII – With the British in Palestine: British and Irregular
description:
One of the most compelling theaters in the history of warfare was the Middle East during the Great War. From late 1914 until mid-1915, the British defend the Suez Canal, taking on various Turkish and Senussi irregulars in their attempts to capture or damage the canal, to block it. A major victory was earned in August 1916, at Rumani, near the coast. This success relieved pressure on the Suez Canal. The British then began to construct a railway and supply roads along the coast. Operations continued against the Senussi in the Western Desert. This part of the campaign saw Sollum shelled by German U-Boats, and an Emergency Squadron of the Royal Naval Armoured Car Division sent to strengthen the British post there. Both Sollum and Sidi Barrani were subjected to Arab raids. The 2nd New Zealand Rifle Brigade, one company of 15th Sikhs, a detachment of the Bikanir Camel Corps, an Egyptian Army Machine Gun Section and an armoured train garrisoned by 1/10th Ghurka Rifles, moved on 21 December 1915 to hold the Alexandria - Debaa railway, and to patrol to the Moghara oasis against more Senussi incursions. Battles would rage back and forth at places like Matruh, Sidi Barrani, made famous later, when the Desert Fox Erwin Rommel enter the annals of military history. The Senussi were finally defeated with the use of modern weaponry including armored cars, aircraft and artillery.

Ownership ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Scrabble: Disney Vacation Club
description:
"Welcome Home" to a special Disney Vacation Club Edition of SCRABBLE, America's favorite word game. Your magical community has inspired a variety of neighborhood twists on the classic game, creating a unique SCRABBLE experience that spells pure.... MEMBERSHIP MAGIC.

—description from the back of the box

name: Fan Erweiterung Auftragskarten 2.0
description:
This is a set of animal tiles and a job card board for 1-6 players. It enables you to use the job cards, if you use the other animals, Aquaretto or even Zooloretto with Aquaretto.
At the end of the game you get extra points for a enclosure with an specific animal and zero minus points for one kind of animal in the barn / depot.

Es ist ein Set aus Tier-Plättchen und einem blanko Auftragskarte für 1-6 Spieler. Es ermöglicht die Nutzung der Auftragskarten, wenn ihr mit anderen Tierarten, Aquaretto oder gar mit Aquaretto spielt. Zum Spiel-Ende erhaltet ihr dann Extrapunkte für Gehege mit übereinstimmenden Tieren und keine Minuspunkte für eine Tierart im Stall / Depot.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Labyro
description:
A handifracted game made of sustainable wood in which 2-7 players try to escape a labyrinth by themselves or in a cooperative way.

The labyrinth changes itself by the throw of a die, each player can choose to throw the die.

name: Hedgerows & Heroes
description:
Hedgerows and Heroes is a fast paced, easy to learn fantasy strategy game based on the Mighty Armies game engine. Featuring 28mm scale fantasy animals, designed by Bob Olley, players wage the ultimate battle for good and evil.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: ASL Comp: GWASL XIII – German East Africa: German and Irregular
description:
Another fascinating era in Great War military history is represented by the German East African Campaign.
It was the setting of the famous movie, "The African Queen", and devolved into a series of battles and guerrilla warfare clashes, which started in German East Africa and spread to Mozambique, Northern Rhodesia, British East Africa, Uganda and the Belgian Congo.
Before the campaign ended in November 1917, Germans and their Askari clients kept the drumbeats of war going on the dark continent with the aim of tying down Allied soldiers, keeping the latter away from the battlefields of Europe.
After the sinking of the Pegasus, the British salvaged and used six 4 inch (100mm) guns from the ship, which became known as the ‘Peggy guns’. Meanwhile, the crew of sunken Königsberg, and its 4.1 inch (100mm) guns, were folded into the Schutztruppe. The British reinforced. The Belgians reinforced. The German commander Lettow-Vorbeck fought a costly battle at Mahiwa, with 519 German casualties and 2,700 British casualties in the Nigerian brigade.
This faraway theater saw some of the most dramatic fighting, amidst some of the world’s most stirring terrain, during World War I.

Ownership of ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

Under Kilimanjaro - Kahe, German East Africa, March 21st 1916
The End of Neutrality - Taveta, German East Africa, August 15th 1914
Adui Tayari (the Enemy is Ready) - Tanga, German East Africa, November 4th 1914
Ras-Kasone Bug Out - Ras-Kasone, German East Africa, November 5th 1914
Empty Hills - Burungi Mountians, German East Africa, May 9th 1916
Effective Effendi - Kondoa-Irangi, German East Africa, June 13th 1916
Along The Tanganjikabahn - Usoke, German East Africa, September 3rd 1916
Along The Wami - Derkawa, German East Africa, August 13th 1916
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Air Master: Duo
description:
You are one of two pilots flying head to head against the elements and each other in order to claim the Savvy crown.

Features a unique scoring system using numbered cards and a corresponding number chart.

Your first battle is with the wind. Follow the favourable ones to help you on your way. Catch the bad ones and be blown off course or even backwards.

You both fly the plane in opposite directions on your turn. As an attacker you fly towards the crown. As a defender you fly away from it.

But the clock is ticking. Whoever owns the crown after two plays through the deck and one turn into the third is declared the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Trederran Monarchy Mission Pack
description:
Once the greatest kingdom in the Northern Reach of Trederra, the Kharkodan Monarchy was overthrown in a revolution by its legions of workers and peasants. The King was killed and his armies scattered. His fortress reduced to rubble under the heavy bombardment of the people's arsenal. Escaping into the mountain cities of Tredesh, the Queen and her Royal Guard now reside in exile. Biding their time and growing their numbers, the Monarchy has begun their campaign to crush the rebellious Kharkarus Konfederacy that drove them out and reclaim their rightful place on the throne. Trained in deadly close quarters fighting, the Monarchy Royal Guard go to war wielding twin ceremonial blades that can slice a man in two with one swift stroke. Decked out in the heavy furs and ornate armor of the Queen's Regiment, the Royal Guard are second to none in discipline, battle prowess, and sheer ruthlessness. They will stop at nothing to crush their enemies. For the Crown!

This Mission Pack introduces the Trederran Monarchy Royal Guard. Though few in numbers, they are perhaps the most highly trained and deadly warriors in all of Trederra. With 4 new Missions that form a short story campaign, a new Objective Room Map Tile, a host of new cards including Threats, Artifacts, Enemy Traits, Darkness, and more, as well as the Enemy Record Sheet, Rules, and 6 Monarchy Royal Guard models, this Mission Pack is an exciting addition to the lore of Trederra and your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

PAINTER'S NOTE: the Trederran Monarchy are their own faction of Trederra. For players that paint their figures, the Trederran Monarchy have their own paint scheme and are independent of existing Trederran Legionnaire color schemes from the previously released Trederra Deluxe OtherWorld Expansion.

- Description from the Publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: #DidTheMission
description:
#DIDTHEMISSION: Meant to be played by a group of people, each round presents a mission and you must complete the round! ​ This social card game is simple to play. It's recommended to play with a group of people, preferably 3 or more players. Each round, one player picks a phrase card and a mission card. The player will use that phrase to earn points by way of one of the various mission cards. Some mission cards will prompt other players to win the round.

CONCEPT: The game revolves around one phrase created by two words picked at random. Once the phrase is chosen the player uses that phrase with a mission card for the round. Each mission has it's own point system and you play to 18 points. In a nutshell, it's a modern rendition of play on words for adults.

RISKY: Be prepared to earn points by way of prank calls, social media, being creative with play on words, or drinking something. Before you know it this will be the best card game for you and your friends that is played at every party or game night!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Voting

name: Berlin II: Führer's End
description:
Berlin Führer's End HUGE MONSTER Edition: There is a certain dictator and his mistress, er, bride-of-a-day that is hoping you refrain from arranging a most original Battle of Berlin experience … but we know in your best Georgi Zhukov (or General Konev to cover all the bases) you'll be pulling into town in your Js-2 … and nailing the second set of MONSTER boards, color scenarios and color 3-hole rules … without delay. That's because we're making BERLIN II also available in a HUGE MONSTER edition. Same approach as Berlin Final Victory, bring your Berlin counters from any edition or buy them separately.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Escape Adventures: Sherlock Holmes – Das geheime Tagebuch
description:
An escape-room-style game that's formatted like a comic book.

One of a series of Escape Adventure games from TOPP.

Sherlock Holmes and John Watson have disappeared. Solve the mystery to rescue them and foil the evil mastermind's plan.

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Valley of the Serpent Kings – Blood Priestess Hero Class
description:
The ancient Aztec gods demand blood and death to honor them, through sacrifice and warfare. Wielding powerful Blood Magik bestowed by these deities, the Blood Priests and Priestesses of the temples grow in power and potency as they strike down their foes, calling on the spirits of the dead to tear enemies apart, and spilling blood to gain the favor of the gods!

This new Aztec-themed Hero Pack contains all of the cards, Hero Character Sheet, Upgrade Chart, and rules needed to play a Blood Priestess Hero in your games of Shadows of Brimstone, including 2 high detail plastic models to represent the Male and Female versions of the Hero Class. Combined with the Jaguar Warrior Hero Class, this gives players the option of running an Aztec-themed Hero Party, or joining the Conquistadors in the war against the Serpentmen.

-description from Kickstarter campaign
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Forbidden Sigil
description:
Forbidden Sigil is a 1 vs many hybrid dungeon crawler/skirmish game for 2 - 6 players.

The heroes are long dead and only the vicious endure in a world overrun with demonic influence and cruelty. As a powerful monster or villain, you must enter the Dungeon of the Wound. A labyrinthine hellscape where a forbidden power has torn a wound on the very fabric on which reality is writ. You must explore the procedurally generated game board to find The Wound, defeat the powerful Dimensional Wound Guardian, and escape with your lives.

PROCEDURIALL GENERATED BOARD:

The dungeon board is comprised of 16 room tiles which are shuffled before each game ensuring the dungeon is never the same twice. Explore the dungeon rooms by flipping room tiles as you enter them. But beware, powerful roaming monsters lurk in the depths that will take cunning and cooperation to defeat.

CHESS LIKE COMBAT:

Combat is played on separate combat board where strategic movement is as important as your party configuration and character abilities. An easy to learn but challenging to master combat system the requires you to position and respond your enemies every move.

BUILD YOUR PARTY:

Play as one of the 7 initially playable characters or one of dozens of unlockable and secret characters who will join your ranks as the emergent story mechanics unfolds an epic tale.
Select your party members to take advantage of synergist team work and fill your party roles to fit your playstyle. Level up your characters to unlock new powers and gain access to elite gear and armor sets.

1 VS MANY OR TEAM BASED:

Play as The summoner, a powerful character who controls the monster and elite demons in the dungeon, as well as the Summoner Demon: A customizable character who levels up like party members and who has access to the Sigil Board. The Summoner draws from the energies party members spend in the dungeon. Each time a powerful ability is used, or a wrong choice is made, The Summoner places tiles on The Sigil Board to unlock abilities, treasure, and powerful demons.

THE FORBIDDEN SIGIL APP:

Use the optional, but highly recommended app, to play ‘Dungeon Scenarios.’ Dramatic video of Octavia, an ancient and morally ambiguous demon queen who will present you with multiple choice scenarios which connect to each other and result in a cascading story tree that makes each one of your decision significant and consequential. Each Dungeon Scenario has at least three possible courses of action with many more possibly results. Literally tens of thousands of combinations can unfold which guarantees every game is different than the last.

PLAY A ONE OFF OR A SERIES:

Play a quick One Off game with friends or commit to a series, where more powerful gear can be unlocked and the sprawling story unfolds across several chapters.
SEMI LEGACY GAMEPLAY:

Unlock town upgrades which will allow you to use new characters, over 200 pieces of unique gear or even learn how to tame the monsters of the dungeon to use in combat.
Explore cascading story trees which plays out vastly differently each game based on your decisions.
All legacy mechanics are non-destructive and reset whenever you want them to.

Yes, the heroes are long dead, but perhaps it is monsters that are needed now. Perhaps it is only the damaged and deranged who dare to close the wound once more, by wielding the power of The Forbidding Sigil

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Legacy Game, Movement Points, Storytelling

name: Kiwis Versus Morality: Expansion
description:
We finally got off our asses and did it; introducing the Kiwis Versus Morality - Black Box Expansion.

This expansion includes 250 new cards featuring awful, wonderful and downright weird kiwi references, so good you’ll want to put down your blow torch and play it over smoko.

This expansion is verified as better than a surprise from the Invercargill pool pooper, but not quite as fun as Timaru mobility scooter police chase.

It’s a lot more fun than sleeping in when the creator is handing out stuff, but far less ethical than reusing condoms to be sustainable.

Containing all your favourites, like: sheep placenta cream, spaceman candy sticks, designer balls by Dan Carter, and the devious behaviour of the very Hungry Caterpillar.

It’s better than a sailing trip with Sir Peter Blake, or your unexplainable attraction to the orange election guy, and just as confronting as the naked couple on your porch wanting to chat about your son's porn addiction.

So make like you did when you redeemed your ‘50 Shades of Grey’ from the Scholastic Lucky Book Club, and grab your pack today.

Recommended for ages 18+:

Contains:
175 White Cards
75 Green Question Cards
Compatible with Kiwis Versus Morality Game

-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Commit the Garde: Jena
description:
A Scenario for the Napoleonic rules Commit the Garde!

October 14th, 1806 - Napoleon attacks what turns out to be Prussia's rear-guard force on the same day that Davout engages the retreating main force nearby at Auerstadt.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: ASL Comp: GWASL XIV – Yser Stand: Belgian WW1
description:
Tiny Belgium was not well prepared for what would come to be known as The Great War.
Adherence to strict neutrality meant an absence of treaties, and the protection (or escalation, as it would turn out) they afforded.
Yet, the tiny nation did not lack for valor!
The Belgian strategy was to concentrate near Brussels and hold off the Germans as long as possible.
This approach proved highly effective and disrupted the German timetable: the capture of Liège was expected to take 2 days; it took 11. Belgian soldiers fought a number of significant delaying actions in 1914 during the initial invasion. At the Battle of Liège, the town's fortifications held off the invaders for over a week, buying valuable time for Allied troops to arrive in the area. Additionally, the German “Race to the Sea” was stopped dead by exhausted Belgian forces at the Battle of the Yser.
Belgians saw action in East Africa. Congolese forces, under Belgian officers, fought German colonial forces in the Cameroons and seized control of the western third of German East Africa, advancing as far as the town at Tabora.

Ownership of ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

The Bridge At Vise - Vise, Belgium, August 4th 1914
Between The Meuse And The Vesdre - Fort Barchon, Belgium, August 5th 1914
Elan And Bayonets - Belgium, August 5th 1914
The Retreat Of The 800 - Haneffe, Belgium, August 14th 1914
Black Devils And Car No. 7 - Werchter, Belgium, September 8th 1914
The Death Trench - Yser Dyke, Belgium, June 2nd 1915
Lancers and Uhlans - Ciney, Belgium, September 14th 1914
A Baron In The Bag - Chaudfontaine, Belgium, August 4th 1914
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – XL Fire Giant Alternative Enemy Pack
description:
The raging Fire Giants of Muspelheim have broken the barriers between worlds and now sweep through the Norse Lands, setting fire to the forests and cracking the very ground asunder with their mighty Charred Clubs!

This alternate Enemy set features 5 new Threat cards to add Fire Giants to your games, 1 new Enemy Record Sheet with new stats and abilities, and 1 additional XL Frost Giant model that can be painted to represent this new Enemy variant. The Threat Cards include a new HIGH Threat to face a Lesser Fire Giant, a Caverns of Cynder OtherWorld Threat, as well as new EPIC Threats for the Fire Giant.

1 XL Enemy, Cards, and Rules

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Valley of the Serpent Kings – Carnivorous Plants Multi-Pack
description:
With writhing vines and snapping jaws, the Carnivorous Plants of Jargono are legendary for any lucky enough to escape their clutches alive! The dark swamps and lush jungle valleys of Jargono are teeming with countless forms of these deadly flora, lying in wait for those foolish enough to wander too close.

This miniature set features 4 new Jargono OtherWorld Threat cards representing Blood Snappers and Den'oola Man Eaters, as well as 12 additional Carnivorous Plant models that can be painted to represent these two new Enemy variants. Exploring the inhospitable Swamps of Jargono just got a little more deadly.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Saboteur: 15 Jahre Jubiläums-Sticker
description:
Postcard with 11 reusable stickers that can be stuck on the original saboteuer cards.
How to use the stickers with Saboteur.

After each round, the winners choose a sticker and stick it on a suitable card. In the following rounds of this or other games, the function of the card is changed to the new rules.
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Network and Route Building, Team-Based Game

name: Sparsi! A Guerra dos Grãos
description: Sparsi! is a nanogame played on a business card size map. Different grains can be used as playing pieces (not included). Players take turns placing one of their pieces on the map, trying to get majorities in the four landscape types. Volcanoes yield negative points, but can secure majorities, gold mines yield bonus points, and if you place a grain on the raft, you win all ties. The player with the highest score when all grain has been placed is the winner.

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Cobarri Headhunters Mission Pack
description:
Striking from the shadows, the Cobarri Headhunters surround their prey, cutting them down with brutal efficiency. With flared hoods and forked tongue, the Cobarri can spit venom in the face of their foes, deflecting blows with their ornate shields and slicing through the toughest armor using swords lined with volcanic Dark Stone, chipped to a razor's edge. Mercenary warriors, the Cobarri Headhunters do not belong to any one Tribe, but sell their swords for gold and glory in the name of Ke'Ke Na, the Serpent God of Death!

This Mission Pack introduces the Cobarri Headhunters of Jargono. With 4 new Missions that form a short story campaign, a new Objective Room Map Tile, a host of new cards including Threats, Artifacts, Enemy Traits, Darkness, and more, as well as the Enemy Record Sheet, Rules, and 6 Cobarri Headhunter models, this Mission Pack is an exciting addition to the Swamps of Jargono and your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Prometheon Defenders Mission Pack
description:
The frozen halls and ancient archives of the Targa Plateau are watched over by more than just lumbering Guardians and robotic Custodians. As the Library awakens, and the systems blink back to life, the Prometheon Defenders emerge from their ancient slumber to stalk the halls once more, eradicating intruders and setting out on sinister missions by order of the Archive Intelligence. Armed with the arcane Prometheus Staff, these four-armed robotic predators tower over their foes, sweeping aside all opposition up close while firing deadly energy blasts to disintegrate those that try to flee. Protectors of the Library, the Prometheon Defenders are a robotic nightmare of cold calculation and ruthless perfection.

This Mission Pack introduces the Prometheon Defenders of the Targa Plateau. With 4 new Missions that form a short story campaign, a new Objective Room Map Tile, a host of new cards including Threats, Artifacts, Enemy Traits, Darkness, and more, as well as the Enemy Record Sheet, Rules, and 6 Large Prometheon Defender models, this Mission Pack is an exciting addition to the Targa Plateau and your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Sci-Die
description:
Sci-Die is a nanogame consisting of one business. In addition, each player needs three dice in their personal color.
At the beginning of the game, each player rolls their dice and places one die onto the card as their Sci-Die. The other two dice are called Dice Bots and are placed adjacent to the card. On their turn, a player can either move a Dice Bot along one of the paths on the card, or turn it over an edge to reach an adjacent position. A point is achieved when both Dice Bots show the same number as the Sci Die of that player. First player to five points is the winner.
Two variants with more interaction are provided.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Fing-o-saur
description: Fing-o-saur is a nanogame consisting of one business card which shows a map with areas containing a letter each. The active player chooses an area and says a word and a number, with the number telling how many times the letter in that area appears in the word. The other players then hit the area with their fingers ("destroy it with their meteor") while shouting the answer. A correct answer yields a point, then it's the next player's turn. First player to reach 5 points is the winner.

name: La Petite Mort: Goodie Autograph
description:
A goodie tile for La Petite Mort, Distributed at the Cannes International Game Festival (FIJ) in 2019.

It's a place reserved for an autograph or a drawing by Davy Mourier, the illustrator of the game La Petite Mort.

This tile is like a character card played as a basic game tile, with the Darwin Arward weakness, and three soul points.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Spanish Fort Artifacts #2 Game Supplement
description:
Description from the publisher:

The lush jungles and tropical islands of the New World are rich with treasures and gold. Trading with local villages and tribes, the Spanish soldiers have found many new allies and mystical relics to aid in the war with the Serpentmen.

This 15 card supplement adds a collection of all new Spanish Fort Artifacts for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around sacred relics and mystical weapons offered by the local cultures to fight back the brutal Serpentmen from Jargono.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Norse Lands Artifacts #2 Game Supplement
description:
The icy Norse Lands are home to many savage beasts, corrupted men, and creatures of shadow, but the Norse Gods of old bless mankind with Aesir weapons forged in the furnaces of Asgard to hold the Darkness at bay.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Norse Lands Artifacts for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around relics and weapons forged and blessed by the Norse Gods.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Valley of the Serpent Kings – Primal Terrors Game Supplement
description:
Slithering through the deepest jungles, the Serpentmen and their savage beasts of war have come to this 'new world' of man to conquer in the name of the Serpent Gods. The tribal drums and vicious roars send a chill of primal terror down the spine of any that would stand in their way.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Spanish Fort Encounters for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around the Serpentmen of Jargono crossing over from their swampy realm to unleash terror on the world of Man.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Loki's Vengeance Game Supplement
description:
A legendary trickster and mischievous manipulator, the god Loki has returned from his banishment, seeking revenge on Odin and all the realms! Pulling strings, he incites the Frost Giants of Jotunheim to attack, while the Aesir Gods are distracted battling the Thunderforged warriors of the Underworld in their bid to hold off Ragnarok.

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of all new Norse Lands Encounters for Shadows of Brimstone, themed around the Norse God Loki with his tricks and manipulation, sewing seeds of chaos across the Nine Realms.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Frost Giant Multipack
description:
The Frost Giants of Jotunheim have been unleashed from their icy realm! Rampaging across the land, these massive terrors wreak havok as they feed on livestock and carve a path of destruction in their wake.

This miniature set features 2 new EPIC Threat cards representing a pair of Frost Giants and a group of D3 Frost Giant Raiders for an extreme challenge, as well as 2 additional XL Frost Giant models. Can you stop the Frost Giant's rampage before they plunge the world into a frozen wasteland under the dominion of their icy king?

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Valley of the Serpent Kings – Croxin Beast Multipack
description:
Captured by the Serpentmen of Jargono to use as living weapons of war, the mighty Croxin Beasts thrash and chomp their way through the toughest of foes, ruthlessly crushing those who find themselves in the path of their sweeping tails!

This miniature set features 2 new EPIC Threat cards representing a pair of deadly Croxin Beasts and a group of D3 Croxin Pit Thrashers for an extreme challenge, as well as 2 additional XL Croxin Beast models. The Serpentmen do not take kindly to intruders, though their terrifying Croxin Beasts are always hungry.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Zweimal Spiel und Spaß mit Goldi
description:
Goldis buntes Würfelspiel + Goldis abebteuerliche Reise um die Welt

The players start at "Start". The first to reach "Ziel" wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Eine lehrreiche Vergnügungsfahrt mit der kleinen Eisenbahn
description:
The players start at space 1 in Bad Ischl.
The first to reach space 100 back in Bad Ischl wins the game.
Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. In Salzburg the players leave the train and go on a sightseeing tour before taking the train back to Bad Ischl. That is, if they're not overrun by a motorcycle, in which case they are out of the game for good.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battle Dress: Science Fiction Wargaming Rules
description:
Battle Dress is a set of science fiction wargaming rules intended for use with 6mm (1/300) or 15mm (1/100) scale figures.

Battle Dress is:

to fight actions of about a reinforced company on each side
intended for multi-based figures and single vehicles/guns
a ruleset that places stress on troop quality and uses an innovative command system to reflect better quality troops being able to do more "stuff" on average than poor quality troops
a ruleset that includes all the weapon and vehicle stats you need to play right away, drawn from the Traveller science fiction universe
blessed by Traveller designer Marc W Miller
full of science fiction elements like grav vehicles, warbots and fusion guns
fully capable of handling actions between forces of very different technology levels
intended to fill the gap in between RPG/single-figure skirmish combat systems and large-scale abstract mass battle systems.


—description from the publisher

name: ASL Comp: GWASL XV – Vimy Ridge and Beyond: Canadian WW1
description:
