Some 619,636 Canadians enlisted with the Canadian Expeditionary Force during the war, and approximately 424,000 served overseas. Of these men and women, 59,544 members of the CEF died during the war, 51,748 of them as a result of enemy action. The CEF served with distinction at Neuve-Chappelle, and at 2nd Ypres in 1915 they made a legendary stand to hold the line during the first gas attack on the Western Front. Posted to the Somme in September 1916, the CEF fought the sanguinary battles for Mouquet Farm and Courcelette, taking the 2nd German line that was an objective of the failed 1 July attack. Posted back to Arras in 1917 the CEF finally cracked the defenses of Vimy Ridge in a brilliant attack, which had defied both the French and British for the past 2 years. Posted back to the Ypres area in the fall of 1917, the CEF was tasked with taking Passchendaele in October and November, in appalling weather. This was the final push to that town that had been an objective since August. In abysmal weather the CEF finally captured it in November 1917. In 1918 the CEF was in the forefront of the great offensive that ground down the German army in the west, in fact, the 2nd Canadian division advanced past Mons on 11 November 1918 to finish the war where it had begun for the BEF 4 long years ago.

All of these battles were hard fought affairs, where no quarter was asked or given. Now, with this latest GWASL module you get to see if you can match the exploits of this fearsome fighting force on some of the most pitiless battlefields of World War I.

Ownership of ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

Cheers For The Living - Bellewaerde Ridge, Belgium, May 8th 1915
High And Dry - Ypres, Belgium WW1, June 2nd 1916
Kitchener's Wood - Langemark, Belgium WW1, April 22nd 1915
A Cane And A Lionheart - St. Julien, Belgium, April 23rd 1915
Gravenstafel - Gravenstafel, Belgium WW1, April 25th 1915
Courcelette - Courcelette, France, September 15th 1916
Sanctuary Wood - Hooge, Belgium, June 2nd 1916
The Pimple - Vimy Ridge, France, April 10th 1917


Contents:

4 Geo Boards
8 scenarios in color format
368 die-cut counters - The Canadians
Color 3-hole rules sheet
Color cardstock folder style wrap.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Masters of Math: Minus Edition
description:
Masters of Math – Minus Edition is a card educational game played by two to four players. This game helps children to learn subtraction basics up to 10 and quickly calculate tasks in their head. It also practices the comparison of numbers: bigger, smaller, equal.

The object of the game is to be the fastest to solve math equations in your head correctly and to get rid of all your cards. The person who calculates the quickest and has the card with the correct solution puts the corresponding solution card on top of the equation card. The player obtains this pair of cards and places it in front of themselves. The player who collected the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: Feuerwehrmann Sam: Allzeit bereit!
description:
Fireman Sam and his friends are always ready to help the residents of Pontypandy.

On your turn, you roll the color die. Then you may take a puzzle tile from the center of the table that has the same colored dot as the rolled color. Each player may only take one puzzle tile per round. If you roll the color of which you already have the puzzle tile in front of you, you will not be able to take a tile in this round. Then it's the next player's turn. The first player to complete a puzzle wins the game.

name: Rack-Stack
description:
Rack-Stack is played on a diamond-shaped grid of 16 spaces. Each player has eight pieces in their color.

One unusual feature of the game is that the players must pretend that the board is vertical; a piece can only be placed if it is supported on both "lower" sides by other pieces or the board edges.

The other unusual feature is that players may play pieces of either color. However, at the end of the game players only score for their own pieces.

Scoring is for sets of three pieces at the points of an equilateral triangle. These can be made in three sizes which are worth from one to three points.

name: ASL Comp: Hindenburg Line – Battle of Vierstraat Ridge 1918
description:
VIERSTRAAT RIDGE, BELGIUM, 2 SEPTEMBER 1918: The Hindenburg Line was originally organized for defense toward the end of the year 1916, and work was continuous in its preparation for a long time thereafter.
The Siegfried Line makes full use, along extended stretches, of the front line of defense accorded by the Bellicourt-St. Quentin Canal.
The strength of these defenses, increased as it is by inundated areas, provided extensive mutual flanking fire support. Good artillery observation rendered the line very strong. The Siegfried Line is considered to create the most favorable conditions for a stubborn defense by a minimum garrison. It is therefore adapated to the requirements of obstinate close combat.

Ownership of GWASL 1 and GWASL 3 are required, as is your ASL-RB.
All the other combat counters needed to play are provided in the form of 648 color die-cut counters.

Scenarios:
Vierstraat, Belgium

Captains and Majors, August 31st 1918
The Vierstraat Switch, August 31st 1918
Blind Courage, August 31st 1918
Redoubt Farm, September 1st 1918
Riposte In Lead, September 1st 1918
Back To Chinese Trench, September 1st 1918
Handiwork Of The Devil, September 1st 1918
Vierstraat Ridge, September 1st 1918
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Hawker Life
description:
Hawker Life is a game for everyone who enjoys the hawker experience, just as we do. From the variety of food to the hustle and bustle, we aim to keep this unique culture alive in all our hearts!

From collaboration to competition, fresh-faced newbies to roughed-up veterans, our game mirrors what hawkers face as they go about their business. In this game, it’ll be a battle of wits to see who comes out as the Head Hawker by opening all the stalls in front of you!

The objective of the game is to be the first to complete all the stalls in front of you.

Collect ingredients to open up the stalls, collaborate with your neighbours to open the food stalls together, and use a variety of action cards to take advantage of your competitors' weaknesses.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Negotiation, Pattern Building, Take That

name: Blitz-Spiel
description:
The players start with one pawn at space 1 and go to space 50 and change to the round course from space I to XII. Movement is determined by one or two dice. One or more pawns may occupy each space with the exception of spaces II, V, VIII and XI.

If a pawn stands on one of these 4 spaces, lightning stikes all other pawns standing on the same lightning bolt, eliminating them from the game. Then the pawn, that initiated the lightning strike starts anew from space 1.

If a meeple reaches space 50 exactly, it starts anew at space 1.

The player with the last pawn in play wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Fußball-Wettspiel
description:
Each player has 11 tokens which are placed on the black spots on the game board. Movement is determined by a die according to following special rules:

1 - The goal keeper (T) moves forward one space diagonaly. If the keeper leaves the penalyty box, the opponent rolls two times, on a result of 8 or more, he sets the nearest forward- or midfield player on a red spot and scores a goal and the keeper is reset to his starting point.

3 - One of the three midfield players (L) moves 3 spaces in a straight line from his starting point.

4 - One of the five forward players (S) moves 4 spaces in a straight line from his starting point.

2 and 5 - A forward or midfield player not standing on his starting point moves 2 or 5 spaces.

6 - A defense player (V) moves 2 spaces diagonaly forward. If a defense player passes line A, the opponent gets a free turn.

Every time a forward- or midfield player reaches a red spot near the goal of the opponent, a goal is scored and the token remains there for the rest of the game. The first player to score all 8 goals wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: A. Anton & Co., Leipzig, Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Outer Planet Panic
description:
Welcome to Outer Planet Panic, the game of archeology in space, where you play an institution that is racing with your opponents to become the first to reverse engineer and activate alien technology. In the distant future man has expanded beyond the stars and has found a galaxy where several advanced civilizations lived. Through initial research, it has been discovered that they created several great advancements, some of which you have found.

You think you know what you need to create the device but now you must search through planets, debris fields, and radioactive areas of space in order to find the components needed to put the devices together. The galactic museum is willing to help, for a price. You can also hire workers to help you or hinder your opponents, buy equipment to make digging and research easier, and be careful because bad luck or good luck can strike at any time in the vast emptiness of space.

You start out by given fund from your sponsors to explore and dig up ancient alien artifacts Depending on your D-12 Dice role. The goal is to collect seven specific items, Research them, activate them and once you have collected 7 of said items you can try to activate the ultimate Device using the cards and take over the galaxy.

Beware, the other players may use spies to Saratoga your items, They or you can dig up gadgets from the space ship salvage yard. Sell items to do more deal making and there are events that can inhibit or help you each cycle. To help you with your mission you can hire freelancers sell items to the research academy. But be careful you might be selling somethings the other players needs.

Work together to stab each other in the back. Make deals, Saratoga your friends. Be the first to develop the ultimate device to win the game! Included are 6 planets, a space port, black hole, item cards, Event cards, personal cards, equipment cards, the ultimate device cards, player pieces and sponsors cards. The game also included 6 D-12. Starsmanught base worlds and more!

—description from the designer

name: DiceDek
description: The objective of the game is to be the first player to play off all of his/her cards and go out. The game makes use of a custom set of 36 numbered cards, six jokers, and two dice. The cards are first dealt evenly to all of the players. On their turn, a player rolls a dice and tries to match the dice with the cards he/she has that are of the same denomination, which is then placed in the discard pile. If he is able to discard, he throws again until he can no longer discard any cards, at which point the dice (and play) passes to the next player. Numbers are divided into blocked and free numbers. Free numbers can be used by other players to discard their cards if the player whose turn it was could not discard his/her cards. Blocked numbers can only be used by the player throwing the dice. Jokers serve as wild cards.

name: ASL Comp: Major Upham – Battle Pack
description:
A collection of scenarios from various fronts and time.
It requires ownership of the ASL-RB and many other supplements from MMP as well as CH (for more details consult Desperation Morale site).

Scenarios:

The Blowtorch Battalion - Near the River Udy, Ukraine, February 12th 1943
Battle's Red Glare - Montreval, France, September 2nd 1944
A Grim Brick Sentinal - Stalingrad, Russia, November 13th 1942
Of Volunteers, Boy Scouts and Police - Grodno, Poland, September 21st 1939
Heaven Sent - Chaumont, Belgium, December 23rd 1944
Hitler's Right Hand Man - Malmedy, Belgium, December 21st 1944
The Liberation March - Szack, Poland, September 28th 1939
The Blowtorch Battalion II - Near the River Udy, Ukraine, February 12th 1943
Elan of the 11th Dragoons - Marilles, Belgium, May 13th 1940
Big Trouble in Little Stalingrad - Ponyri Station, Russia, July 10th 1943
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Jellybeans
description:
Jellybeans is played with a standard deck of cards, minus the court cards. Each player is assigned a color (with two players) or a suit (with more; with three one suit is removed).

Players receive hands of five cards and take turns drawing and then playing one card (or discarding and drawing three cards). Cards are placed in five "baskets" (rows of cards) - the cards represent packages of jellybeans.

When each basket has four cards the game is over. Each basket scores for the owner of the suit with the most jellybeans (pips); the score is the total number of jellybeans plus the number of different flavors (suits).

name: ASL Comp: Cambrai 1 – Armoured Fist 1917
description:
ASL Comp: Cambrai 1 – Armoured Fist 1917
This is Part 1 of the largest Great War historical module produced.
Maps for Cambrai parts 2 and 3, Fontaine and Bourlon, join together, the top right of the Fontaine map overlaps with the bottom left of the Bourlon map.

Printed trench networks, rattling tanks of the earliest vintage ... Highlanders ... Stosstruppen ... this is a limited collection and print run.

This is a monster game and includes 4 sheets of color die-cut counters, special rules and 90+ hours of scenarios set on the historical map provided. Large historical map.

Ownership of the ASLRB, plus GWASL 1 required.

Scenarios:
Flesquieres (south-west of Cambrai), Nord, France
November 20th 1917, British vs German

Armored Fist,
Sledgehammer,
Kamerad!
Corporal McBeath,
Deborah,
Crack A Nut,
Day's End,
Tankschlacht
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Choosy
description:
Choosy is played on a small (16-space) board using six pieces each of three different types (e.g. three denominations of coins).

On a turn a player either places any piece in an empty space or takes a piece to indicate they will score that type at the end of the game; the latter move can only be made once and can't be the last move.

At the end of the game players score for opposing and neutral pieces that are between two of "their" pieces.

name: Mutant Mudds Super Challenge
description:
Defeat the Mudd Bosses and collect the Water Sprites... with your friends!

Players can have a blast playing this brand-new official Mutant Mudds table-top game, with 5 super challenging Mudd Bosses and 3 unique maps exclusively featured in Mutant Mudds Super Challenge Game Decks!

Combine Mutant Mudds Super Challenge Game Decks with Mutant Mudds Deluxe Game Decks for an official crossover board. Players can also create their own Board Design to play with your friends! Boost your Board Card options with both Mutant Mudds Deluxe and Super Challenge Game Decks!

Features:

Gorgeous hand-painted artwork
An adaptable Dynamic Board Game System
2-4 player gameplay
Combine with every other Game Decks Party Styled game (like Mutant Mudds Deluxe) for fun expandable gameplay
2 exclusive Mutant Mudds Super Challenge Mini-Games
5 unique Mudd Bosses to conquer
3 official Board Designs (including one from the creator of Mutant Mudds)


Players must collect Water Sprite Token Cards by purchasing them with points they've earned during gameplay. The player with the most Water Sprites at the end wins!
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Atooi, Game Decks, Limited Run Games, You Lose I Win, LLC

name: Pea Ridge/Elkhorn Tavern Campaign: Umpire's Guide
description:
This booklet is designed to help an umpire put together a historical and realistic campaign for any number of players for the Pea Ridge/Elkhorn Tavern Campaign.

Adaptable to multiple rule systems.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Mountain
description:
Mountain is played with two decks of standard playing cards plus optional jokers.

In the solitaire game the decks are shuffled together and 12 cards are dealt in a row to form the base of the mountain. The player takes one card from the deck at a time and places it in the discard pile; the top card of the discard stack is available to play on the mountain.

A card on one level is placed above two cards on the next lower level. If the cards are different ranks and suits the new card must match the rank of one and the suit of the other; otherwise it must match what they have in common. (If the cards are identical any card can be played on them.)

When the deck runs out and all plays have been made, cards score based on what level they are on.

In the two-player game one player has a deck of red cards and the other black. The base is made up of alternating red and black cards and players draw cards into their hands, from which they may play any number of cards. The winner is the player with the most cards on the top level, but if a player can complete an entire level by themselves they win immediately.

name: Maze Match
description:
Players competitively race to the centre of a maze, in order to instantly win the game.

Maze Match is player in rounds, in which players first indicate how many spaces they wish to move, then a card is revealed that shows possible movement restrictions, and then in turn each player token is moved on the board. If a player moved as many spaces as indicated at the start of the round, that player receives points. A player must be in possession of 10 points to be allowed entry to the centre of the maze.

Maze Match offers additional rules for experienced players in the form of blocking/unblocking restriction cards by spending points, and in adding guards patrolling the maze.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Events, Movement Points, Predictive Bid, Push Your Luck, Race

name: The Endless Bugle Call
description: An elementary wargame on Chinese intervenes during the Korean War. Basic system is based on Bonsai Games' Blitzkrieg to Moscow 2 and Russo-Japanese War 1904-1905, using 40 event cards.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: C⁴KISR System: Information Warfare Under High-Tech Conditions
description: A game of modern military exercise based on information processing system integrating C4KISR (command/control/communications/computer/kill/intelligence/reconnaissance/surveillance).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Cirquarles
description:
In Cirquarles players try to place 4 pieces with matching properties in a line.

Components

24 pieces (2 identical sets of 12 unique pieces in white and black colors)
1 game board


Setup
Each player receives 12 unique pieces of one color and arranges them in 4 stacks on own side, close to the game board.

How to play
Players alternate turns starting with the player who controls the white pieces.

Type of pieces
Each unique piece is cut out in the middle and defined by three different properties affecting the gameplay:

piece size: small, medium or large
interior shape of a piece: square or circle
exterior shape of a piece: square or circle


Players actions
During player’s turn player may perform one of 2 actions:

place a new piece on the board, or
move a piece on the board to a new field (Players cannot remove pieces from the board once they have been deployed)


Pieces movement
A player may only move pieces of own color. Player is allowed to only take and move the exterior piece of the stack. Even if other pieces are placed inside. Pieces surrounded by the opponent's one cannot be moved. They are blocked at the moment.

Players can place their pieces:

to any empty field on the gameboard
inside/outside of the other pieces (own or opponent’s), if it can be placed without collision.


If a piece cannot be placed without collision on a field, then player cannot place it there.

Game End
A player wins the game immediately after placing 4 pieces with matching properties in a line (horizontal, vertical, oblique)

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: Battle of Talas
description:
An wargame on the Battle of Talas, a military engagement between the Abbasid Caliphate along with its ally, the Tibetan Empire, against the Chinese Tang dynasty in 751 AD.

The third game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Schneller mit Glitzi, schneller zum Ziel!
description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pot o' Gold II
description:
In Pot o' Gold II players compete to win four pots of unknown value.

Each of the pots is initially seeded with three face cards from one of two standard decks of cards. The remainder of these cards are used to play the game - each player receives a hand of ten.

On a turn a player plays any non-face card to a central pile; when the total value of the cards reaches 20 the player causing this gets an action (or two if they hit 20 exactly). Actions include placing a marker on a pot, moving a marker, looking at the cards in a pot, adding a face card to a pot, or re-rolling the die placed next to each pot, which will later subtract from its value.

Play continues until two players have each used all five of their markers, at which point the pots are scored. The player with the most markers on a pot gets the full value, the player with the second most gets half value. The value of a pot is based on the die, the number of markers, and the cards in it.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing

name: The Game of Flying Obelisks
description:
The Game of Flying Obelisks is played on a 9x9 board with two raised 3x3 "hills." Each player has a set of 17 pieces of 8 different types, and there are also 5 neutral obelisks.

On a turn a player moves a piece according to its specific movement rules. Moving to a space occupied by an enemy piece captures it. Moving to a space occupied by a friendly piece creates a stack; a stack can have up to three pieces (with some restrictions) and can move as any of the pieces in it.

By moving pieces to the opposite rank a player may recover lost pieces or acquire obelisks. Obelisks allow stacks they are with to teleport from one hill to the other. (Movement onto and on hills is fairly restricted.)

The object of the game is to capture the opposing globe (which moves like a Chess king) or to occupy both hilltops (the center squares of the hills) and have no enemy pieces on the hills.

Note: this was claimed to be a reconstruction of an ancient board game, but that was an April Fool's joke.

name: Dollar
description:
Dollar is played with two decks of standard playing cards minus the court cards (one for each player) plus a supply of 199 points in tokens worth specific amounts (e.g. US coins).

Players have four-card hands and play "tricks" to win points; players each play one card with no restrictions and the higher card wins a token (which one depends on specific conditions). If there is a tie a token is added to the next trick, unless the cards are identical in which case the second player wins 25 points.

The object is to reach 100 points.

name: The Ring
description:
The Ring is a card game loosely based on the US election process. It is played using a standard deck of cards, a small board, and some markers.

The game is driven by four columns of cards on the table, which each start with a single card. On a turn a player can draw a card from the deck, add a card to a column, or discard a card allowing them to take one or more columns: columns with a total exactly matching the discarded card and/or any combination of columns matching this may be taken.

For each column taken the player places a marker in the top box of an area on the events board (or five markers if they manage to take all four columns at once). There is a marker moving from area to area with each placement, so a player placing multiple markers places them in different areas.

Once all the spaces on the board are full the game ends. Players each one point per marker, except that markers on blue spaces are worth two. A player having the majority of the spaces in an area doubles their points for it. Players lose points for cards in hand. If there is a tie for overall points the lowest player is dropped and the board is re-assessed.

name: ASL Comp: Cambrai II – Black Friday: Fontaine
description:
Printed trench networks, rattling tanks of the earliest vintage ... Highlanders ... this is a limited collection and print run.

Cambrai II – Black Friday: Fontaine is a GWASL Module and includes BONUS publishers choice counters, special rules and 8 scenarios set on the historical map provided.

Ownership of the ASL-RB, plus GWASL 1 + CAMBRAI 1 required.

Scenarios:
Fontaine-Notre-Dame, Nord, France

As Darkness Falls, November 21st 1917
Forlorn Hope, November 21st 1917
Securing The Flank, November 23rd 1917
Black Friday, November 23rd 1917
Harper’s Duds, November 23rd 1917
Winter Quarters, November 27th 1917
Nulli Secundus, November 27th 1917
Kilted Canucks, September 28th 1917
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Malleus 1666
description:
Malleus 1666 is a cooperative dungeon crawler board game for 1 to 3 players. In this game players control heroes intended to prevent the evil awakens from his ancient sleep.

This game uses dice for player attacks and cards for monster actions. You must explore room by room, complete missions, collect equipment (by destroying barrels) and defeat the final boss.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Trivial Pursuit: Alsace
description:
The famous trivia game.

The questions are about the region of Alsace in North-est France.

3000 questions in 6 different themes; History, Geography, Science and Nature, Art and Literature, Entertainment and Sports and Leisure.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Theatre in a Box: Return Season
description:
The Return Season expansion is another 220+ cards to immerse yourself. This pack contains more singing, more dancing, more acting, more trivia and even more tears and cheers.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Music, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing
publishers: Theatre in a Box Pty Ltd

name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition Alsace
description:
Discover or rediscover the region of Alsace in 1800 questions by playing with the new Trivial Pursuit rules which will allow you to win a marker triangle on all the squares of the board.

Questions in 6 different themes:

History,
entertainment ,
Geography,
Art and Literature,
Science and Nature,
Sports and Leisure.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: ASL Comp: Cambrai III – A Panorama of Hell Bourlon
description:
Cambrai III – A Panorama of Hell Bourlon is a GWASL Module and includes BONUS publishers choice counters, special rules and 8 scenarios set on the historical map provided.

Ownership of the ASL-RB, plus GWASL 1 + CAMBRAI 1 and 2 required.

Scenarios:
Bourlon, Pas-de-Calais, France

A Day Out – November 23rd 1917
Stick Close, But Not Too Close – November 23rd 1917
Remember Spion Kop – November 23rd 1918
Hold Or Die – November 23rd 1918
Mighty Little Men – November 24th 1917
Arwyr Bach – November 24th 1917
Hell’s Last Issue – November 24th 1917
Hunting Party – November 25th 1917
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Halloween Hustle
description:
Halloween Hustle is played with a standard deck of cards and a supply of candy (or other small items).

At the start of each hand each player receives four cards and a supply of candy is placed in the center of the table: one less than the number of players.

The dealer draws a card from the deck and then passes any of their cards to the player on their left, who then passes any card to the next player, and so on; the player to the right of the dealer ends up discarding a card. In the meantime the dealer draws and passes another card, so players end up all passing cards at the same time. Discards are shuffled when the deck runs out.

When a player has four cards of the same rank they take a piece of candy. All other players may then also take a piece. Starting on the second round the player left without a piece is eliminated from the game. After a player is eliminated, of one player has more candy than anyone else they win. Otherwise another hand is played.

A player may pretend to be about to take a piece of candy to fake out other players. If another player takes a piece in this case, they must give it back along with a piece they already have.

Variant rules are provided for younger children.

(The game says up to 13 players can play, but there's no way to get the game started in that case.)

name: ASL Comp: Operation Lens Nord – Eastern Front Partisan Warfare
description:
Operation Lenz Nord was conducted April 4th through April 13th 1943, in the area around Borisov, in the Gavja river valley, some of the actions involved the villages of Korkeyka, Zarinek, Starniki, Dworzez, and Zabashevichi.
The area was thick forest, swamps, peat bogs, and many of the little villages were on low hills, like islands among the bogs and water logged forests.
Home the Partisan Regiment “Bolshevik” the Germans found a challenging adversary in the vast formidable terrain of central Russia.

Operation Lenz Nord – Eastern Front Partisan Warfare updates the map and situations from the former "Bandenkreig"

Ownership of ASL-RB, CH's NATIONALITY Sets providing Waffen SS and Partisans - AND ownnership of any editions of modules that provide 5-2-7/3-3-7 Russians and 5-4-8/4-4-7 SS MM

Scenarios:

When the Odds were Even - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 12th 1943
Death’s Magnet - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 8th 1943
Ivan’s Farm - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 11th 1943
Chaos in Haste - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, July 1st 1944
Swamped with Partisans - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 9th 1943
The Road to Orsha – Outside Orsha, Soviet Union, June 24th 1944
Defeat in the Peat - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 8th 1943
Derbun’s Command Post - North of Borisov, Soviet Union, April 13th 1943
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

description:
1514 the board game, was designed to mark the 500th anniversary of the Battle of Orsha.

1514 is an epic board game for two, four or six players.

Become the head of the Muscovite army or forces of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania.
Roll the dice, move your troops, take part in battles and follow orders from the cards.
Tactics and luck, combine infantry, cavalry and artillery regiments and win the victory!

The game must involve an even number of people - 2, 4, 6:

2 : players go in turns, one kind of troops per turn (for example, the first move of player №1 - infantry, the second move - cavalry, the third move - artillery, then again infantry, etc.).
4 : the players are divided into two camps - the Moscow army and the Lithuanian army. Artillery figures are not involved in this version of the game, so one player controls one type of troops. The game takes turns (for example, the first move of player №1 for the Moscow infantry, the second move of player №2 for the Lithuanian infantry, the third move of player №3 for the Moscow cavalry, the fourth move of player №4 for the Lithuanian cavalry).
6 : the players are divided into two camps - the Moscovite army and the Lithuanian army. Each player controls one kind of troops. The game takes place alternately (for example, the first move of player №1 for the Moscow infantry, the second move of player №2 for the Lithuanian infantry, the third move of player №3 for the Moscow cavalry, the fourth move of player №4 for the Lithuanian cavalry, the fifth move of player № 5 for the Moscow artillery, the sixth move - player №6 for the Lithuanian artillery).


Gameplay:
In your turn, roll the dice and move your figure to the number of points received. Subsequent game actions depend on where you are on the field.
Troops of one army can stand on one space.
If, after throwing the dice, your figure ends in a space with an enemy troops, a "Battle" begins.
When on the red or black box, take a card of the appropriate color and follow the steps described in it. If, as a result of the orders executed on the card, you are again on the red or black field, you do not need to take the card a second time.

Combat:
If you receive a "Fight!" Card, then your moving figure and the nearest (on either side) opponent's figure start the fight. You and your opponent roll the dice at once - who gets more points wins. The defeated army that took part in the battle goes as many steps back as the points thrown by the winner during the battle. In case of a tie the combat is held again, until victory.

Victory:
The winner is the one who first brings to the enemy's camp his entire army, of figures of infantry, cavalry and artillery.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Colorbs
description:
In Colorbs, you’ll try to build the most efficient grid of colorful energy-orbs (colorbs) possible.
Players take turns building and harvesting colorbs.
Some colorbs have special abilities that makes them worth more points when combined with others in a pattern.
The player with the most points when a grid of 4x3 orbs is full or there is no cards left in the colorb-deck wins the game.
mechanics: Connections, Grid Coverage, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sight Words Challenge Grade 1: Sled Spin Out! Board Game
description:
A fun way to learn sight-words, build vocabulary, and increase reading fluency!

Includes:
Game board with 40 sight words
10 write and wipe cards
4 write and wipe markers
4 pawns and one die

conforms to ASTM D-4236

OBJECT: Be the first player to complete all of the sentences on your game card.

SETUP: Have each player choose a game card, a pawn, and a write & Wipe marker.

HOW TO PLAY: Place your pawn on the "start" space and roll the die to decide who will go first. Whoever rolls the highest number starts, and play proceeds to the left.
To play, roll the die and move your pawn that many spaces along the board.
When you land on a space, say the word aloud then look over your game card to see if you can use the word in one of the sentences on your game card.
If you can use the word, write it on your card with the marker, then read the sentence aloud. Players should decide whether the word makes sense in the sentence. If you cannot use the word, play passes to the next player.

HOW TO WIN: The first player to complete all of his or her sentences is the winner! Continue moving around the board until someone wins, even if you pass the start space.

name: Dial the Dice: Fantasy Edition
description:
Dial dice, not roll, to activate moves and skills for your hero pawns on the game board. First player to complete 12 hero tasks wins the game.

This game is a stand alone board game AND also has a modular element allowing players to play their DtD heroes through their favorite RPG module.

—description from the designer

name: Rätselraum Stories: Teil 1 – Rätselhafte Spuren
description: After a mysterious message, Tanja is very worried about her brother. The normally very reliable Philipp hasn't answered for hours, which is why Tanja goes looking for him. When Tanja follows Philip's lead, she comes across unsettling information. Will you be able to support her on her journey and find her brother?

name: Flames of War: German Starter Force – Tank-Hunter Kampfgruppe
description:
Reinforce your German troops on the eastern front.
Nothing beats a Tank-Hunter Kampfgruppe to stop the Soviet advance, or at least try.

name: NetWords
description:
NetWords is a word game played using only paper and pencil. No maximum number of players is given.

The game starts with an agreed-upon number of letters, each written in a circle, with the circles connected by lines. The players also agree on the number of letters that will end the game and the minimum word length.

On a turn a player may add as many connections as they want between existing letters that aren't already connected, as long as none of the lines cross existing lines. Also, each connection must result in at least one new word, which the player claims (they may claim more than one). Words are spelled by following the connections - a connection can be traversed more than once, and each letter has an implicit connection to itself.

After adding as many connections as desired a player ends a turn by adding a new letter with a single connection to an existing letter. This need not result in any new words.

Claimed words score their length minus the minimum word length. However, there are some additional rules on claiming longer forms of earlier words and so forth, which affect the scoring.

After the last letter has been added players may examine the network to find additional words to claim.
publishers: A. K. Peters, Ltd., GAMES Magazine

name: Gesund und munter durchs ganze Jahr!
description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 52 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ASL Comp: Cambrai IV – Highlanders Ground
description:
Printed trench networks, rattling tanks of the earliest vintage ... Highlanders ... this is a limited collection and print run.

Ownership of the ASL-RB, plus GWASL 1 + CAMBRAI 1 required.

Scenarios:
Cantaing, France (5 km south-west of Cambrai)

Combined Arms, November 21st 1917
Harlequin, November 21st 1917
Cantaing Mill, November 21st 1917
The Kaiser's Navy, September 28th 1918
Weary Warriors, November 21st 1917
Distant Objective, November 21st 1917
Need A Tank, November 21st 1917
Red, Green and Blue, September 28th 1918
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Warrior Zone
description:
Warrior Zone, a game of attrition, where players use the “strategy-of-chance” to gain victory. With each game a different battlefield where players ruthlessly eliminate their opponents. Take your five best warriors into battle, attacking and defending with a unique dice system in both hand-to-hand, short-range, and long-range combat. Gain experience, heal, or feel the wicked wrath of the unexpected.

Be the One To Stand Where All Have Fallen!

—description from publisher
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Dawn of Kingdoms
description:
Dawn of Kingdoms is a worker placement (with a new twist), resource management, tableau building, area control game!

Dawn of Kingdoms is a game that is riveted with intense decisions that are made difficult due to their importance and lasting effects!

Raise your Kingdom to its fullest potential by choosing wisely where to place your two workers each round (1 king and 1 queen).
After placing their workers everyone collects their respective resources, tokens, points, and building blueprints. They then have an opportunity to build a building from their blueprint collections.

Points can be acquired in a variety of ways. Through area control on the map, hidden victory points from political buildings, from the worker placement board, and from special circumstances due to a constructed building.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Multiple Maps, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types, Zone of Control

name: Latino Card Revoked: First Edition
description:
A hilarious, laugh-out-loud trivia game about Latino culture written by comedians, Glorelys Mora and Tori Pool.
Whether you identify as Latino, Latina or Latinx - if you can't answer these questions, you might just need your card revoked.

One player reads a question with multiple choice questions, A-D. The others put down a card indicating the choice they believe is correct. Players start with 10 points and lose a point for every incorrect answer.


Plays up to 6 people
Includes 81 question cards
24 response cards
Safe for family play
Comes in a white box
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Surround!
description:
Surround! is played on any kind of grid; six example grids are provided including standard square, hexagonal, and triangular grids.

On a turn a player colors in one grid space. The object is to completely surround any connected group of spaces of the opposing color (including just a single space) with your own spaces and/or the edge of the grid. Spaces do not connect at the corners.

The game is stated to be intended as an introduction to Go.
mechanics: Enclosure, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Square Grid

name: The War of Cognac
description:
Between 1526 and 1530 a war broke out in Italy which involved the Peninsula from Calabria to Lombardy; often inserted as an “episode” of long Italian Wars of XVI century, the conflict comes also referred to as War of Cognac, from the name of the locality where the treaty of alliance and formed the League between Rome, Florence, Venice, Milan and France against the Emperor Charles V.

The conflict was the first real attempt at Italian independence, fought between Italians against Italians, due to the division in which it is he found the country and the mercenary it was rampant practice in those years.

The game is based on the Thirty Years War system published by GMT Games.

During every turn, players alternate in playing cards for action points or for event. Actions points are used to move armies, fight with enemy, siege a fortress, take control of areas.
Some areas are key area that gives the control player Victory Points. At the end of a scenario (smaller or campaign) the player who has the most VPs is the winner.
categories: Pike and Shot, Political, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Pulp Alley: Scenarios – Second Edition
description:
Pulp Alley 2nd Ed: Scenarios

This book includes the first twelve Scenarios of the Month - previously only available as separate downloadable files.

This book includes basic scenario set-up and wrap-up rules.

In addition, you will find the rules for Solo, Horror, NPCs, and so on, for quick and easy reference.
The scenario pages focus mainly on the rules and special cards.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Freight Frenzy
description:
Fun medium-light weight pickup-and-deliver game, where the board is always different, and your available routes change during the game.

In the future, after the fiasco of Monorail public transportation, logistics companies acquire the infrastructure cheaply, and use it to deliver cargo, instead of passengers.
Players are route planners for one of those logistics companies, competing to gain manifests (contracts), picking up the corresponding package/s first to then deliver them to their requested destination.
Each turn you use your monorail's speed for available actions to load, unload, and move, with the goal of acquiring contracts and delivering the most packages.
Old passenger routes are not optimal for cargo, however, so over the course of the game you can change the tracks, improving your routes or hindering other players'. You can also improve your monorail, increasing your package capacity per trip, or making it faster, which gives you more actions per turn.

Gameplay:
- The board game is setup randomly out of different track tiles. Cargo packages are set on 9 stations around the board.
- Each player has an action allowance, based on their monorail's speed. This can increase or decrease in later turns, as players buy more engines or more cargo space for their monorails.
- Routes can be improved (or hindered) by using track improvements, which allow players replace the track tiles on the board.
- New contracts are created randomly from cargo + destination decks.
- The game ends when all “golden” packages are delivered. The player that successfully delivered the most valuable packages is the winner.

The game can be played from 2 to 5 players.

-description from designer
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Coach Kim Stewart's Checker Football
description:
Coach Kim Stewart's Checker Football is designed to simulate the game of football as closely as possible. It allows for football actions such as blocking, running, moving the ball, passing, or punting. The board itself is designed to resemble a football field with two end zones. The checkers represent the players with the offense having eleven players and the defense having twelve players. There is also a quarterback, which is supposedly the most powerful game piece of any board game that the designer has ever seen.

—user summary

name: Wer macht einen Fünfer?
description: The players have 5 pawns each and start at space A. The first to reach space 90 with all 5 pawns wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Xodul
description:
This game is a variant of chess inspired by international chess, shogi, and xiangqi. The differences from chess are:
1. the board is 8x9, where the startup position contains the traditional pieces at left hand-side and the additional pieces at right hand-side;
2. various additional pieces were introduced:
- a wizard piece which can teleport or move two squares diagonally
- a guard piece which moves one square orthogonally or various squares along its row/column in the direction of the king up to the maximum of intercepting the coordinates of the king
- a lance piece which can move any number of squares forward or diagonally one space
- a cannon piece which is the same as its counterpart in xiangqi
(note: the chess rook was replaced by a xiangqi car, which has the same movement)
3. pawns can be promoted by replacing it with a captured piece;
4. pawns are promoted to generals upon reaching the last line, which moves one square to the front or diagonally.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Crusades: A Solo Game
description:
After a disastrous battle you command a small group of Crusaders fleeing the Saracen forces.

Ideal for individually based 28mm figures but other sized figures would also work.

A simple and easy to play solo game with enough variables to allow it to be replayed many times.

—description from the publisher

Turn Sequence:
1- Crusaders move, fight etc..
2- Saracen forces move fight etc..
3- Roll for Saracen reinforcements starting on turn 2
4- Roll for random events
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Золотая лихорадка
description:
Золотая лихорадка, Gold fever

Attracted by the secrets of ancient civilizations, by treasures hidden by the thick walls of temples?
Feel like a seeker of the mysterious treasures of the past.
Find the right path to the treasure, bypass all the obstacles and dead ends, and most importantly, remember the basic rule: "You can not trust anyone!"

How to play?
Players act as treasure hunters of the ancient temple, but among them, skillfully disguising themselves, the Guardians of the temple can hide.
The task of the treasure hunters is to study the intricacies of the tunnels in the temple, to build a route to the treasures, avoiding the traps and intrigues of the Guardians.
The goal of the Temple Guardians is not to betray themselves. Make sure that treasure hunters do not get to the Treasury.

The player who receives the most gold after three rounds of the game wins.

– translated description

name: O Cortiço
description:
Based on the classic novel.

In this game, each player becomes João Romão, owning his own tenement and striving to build houses, rent, negotiate, set fire and avoid fires, traps and confrontations with rival groups.

Play and have fun to better understand the occupation of geographical spaces, the social and cultural formation of Brazil, and, above all, to immerse yourself in the literary universe of Aluísio Azevedo.

Every turn you can use 3 types of cards: properties, tenants and action to earn money. The game ends when a player accumulates (the same sum of money the character in the book is seeking to accumulate). The player with most money at the end wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Ownership, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Flea Collared
description:
Flea Collared is a Checkers-like game played on a 10x8 board with two different types of pieces: dogs and fleas. Each player controls eight dogs and four fleas.

Dogs and fleas both move in standard Checkers fashion, moving and jumping forwards. Dogs can be promoted to "top dogs" which can move backwards as well. Jumping is mandatory.

The game can be won by capturing all your opponent's dogs, but also by forcing your opponent to capture all your fleas or move one of their fleas to your end of the board.

name: Witches' Quarrel: Gifted Children
description:
Witches' Quarrel is a 2 player, 10-minute deckbuilder with legacy mechanics, where you play the role of a witch in a quarrel with another witch.

Play spells to gain power, learn new spells, and deal or block damage. The first witch to take 10 damage loses.

Play each game with a selection of 5 changing spells, but all the spells start in sealed envelopes: complete achievements to unlock each spell. Also unlock new witch characters and new starting spell options for each witch.

Find a new snippet of lore about the child prodigies Yi-Feng and Nitya and the magical world they live in with each envelope.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Legacy Game, Take That

name: Kings of War: The Battle for Ironhold – Two Player Battle Set
description:
Since ancient times, the world has been ravaged by war. The wise foresee an age of horror approaching, for the spirit of the earth is sick, tainted by deadly sorcery in a great conflict ages past. Not that the warlords of this bloody era care, not while there is glory to be won, territory to be wrested from the enemy, foes to be slaughtered. The so-called Noble Peoples – Men, Elves and Dwarfs – now struggle for power and influence, battling across the ruins of long-dead realms, or staking claim to new lands. Their ancient pacts are no more. The kingdoms that pledged their armies in service of those sacred treaties are gone into legend, the descendants of the noble princes who swore eternal oaths of friendship warring openly with one another. The glorious empires of those days are lost to the ocean, or buried beneath shifting sands, the palaces of the wise now home to kraken or shambling revenants, while the scions of their great houses are exiled or long-dead...

This set contains a Kings of War 2nd Edition Gamer’s Rulebook, and 93 multi-part plastic Undead and Dwarf miniatures, including:

1 Skeleton Regiment
20 Skeleton Warriors
Hand Weapons and Shields or Spears and Shields
Command components including Standard Bearer and Musician.
Undead Dog
20 Zombies
10 Ghouls
20 Ironclad
10 Ironwatch
10 Shieldbreakers
1 Ironbelcher Cannon/Organ Gun with Crew
Square Bases

Miniatures are supplied unpainted and assembly may be required.
mechanics: Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Das lustige 7-Hühnchen-Spiel
description: The players start at the red space near space 1. The first to reach the red space at the henhouse wins the game. Movement is determined by a spinner or die. On the numbered spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ascidiae
description:
In Ascidiae you control a thriving colony of ascidians, tiny marine immobile animals, and race to establish new colonies on neighbouring rocks.

In this assembly-line puzzle, players use their ascidiae to spawn tadpoles, and their tadpoles to create new tadpoles and ascidiae through metamorphosis. Get the right group of tadpoles to establish a new colony, and claim to colonies to win the game!

Card ascidiae are placed on a grid in each player's board,
mostly immobile, and activate following the zig-zagging aquatic currents. Wooden tadpoles are placed on the cards and change and travel according to each ascidian habilities.

Each ascidia has its own different habilities, and can be initial (each player starts with two), common (all games have these) or special (six chosen from more than 25); with colonies that come in three difficulty levels and different player boards, game possibilities are endless.
categories: Animals, Print & Play, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Queue, Automatic Resource Growth, Chaining, Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: Эвакуация
description:
Эвакуация, Evacuation

A terrible explosion took place in the city.
The metropolis turned into hell.
Millions of people have gone missing...
and only the most persistent will be able to get out of this hell...
Can you become one of them ?

Gameplay:
each player leads a group of 6 refugees, whom he must lead along a narrow and dangerous road among the ruins from the explosion to the rescue point: the bus.
In order for a group of people to survive, to be able to leave for another country without loss, the player must, on its way out, collect a gas mask, a first aid kit and a backpack with food, but only those that are on special cards.
Each player during the game will receive cards with tips on how to run to the bus.

Victory:
Everyone wants to survive, but there is only enough room on the bus for one group.
As soon as someone's group is completely gathered near the bus, he/she wins, everyone else loses!
mechanics: Modular Board, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection

name: Monopol: Malmö
description:
The popular real estate game has arrived in Malmö, Sweden.

Walk around the town and find beautiful streets, interesting cultural institutions, companies and outdoor areas all for sale.
Who doesn't want to own the magnificent Malmö Opera House, Turning Torso Skyscraper, Möllevångstorgið, Cosmopol Casino or Eyrarsundsbrún?
The way to victory is to show foresight, invest well and make good deals.
The one who accumulates the most wealth and acquires the whole town stands out as the winner.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Give Me Money or I'll Kick Your Cat
description:
Give Me Money is the ultimate game of threats and payoffs.

The adult party game with no judges - no votes, just horrible threats for cold, hard cash.

This game is for adults only and contains material offensive to most people. If you find nothing in this game that offends you, you should probably consider therapy (and if you are already in therapy, you may want to up your dosage.

—description from the box

name: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Log #32
description:
“Don’t forget the popcorn.” – Doctor Joan Raddock, GIA analyst

Released in June 2006, this Captain’s Log issue supports Star Fleet Battles, Federation Commander, and Federation & Empire. “Circle of Vengeance” by Randy O. Green has Klingon, Hydran, and Vudar ships fighting a battle in an asteroid field. Will their fear, hate, and distrust find an end? “The Last Command,” also by Green, follows a Carnivon in command of a Bear-Dog dreadnought.

In addition to the story, History includes information on nobility titles and an article on Tholian military ranks.

As is usual, Communications informs readers about the company’s activities. Captain’s Log #31 and SFB Module F2 have after-action reports. The company laid out its plans for new print releases and metal miniatures for the coming year, including the new Federation Commander. There are questions and answers about that new, faster-playing game. The Input Guide has guidelines for submissions to Federation Commander. Proposals for Star Fleet Battles are presented. Admiral Growler answers SFB questions. More “Why” questions get answered. There is a page of filk songs. Finally, there are the Star Fleet Awards.

Federation Commander has prototype rules from Romulan Border. The first tactics papers appear. Finally, there is an example of play for the game. Later in the issue, the scenario “Sabotage!” provides a battle opportunity between the Klingons and the Federation.

This issue includes five scenarios for Star Fleet Battles.

SL241, Circle of Vengeance, and SL242, Last Command, are based on the two stories in the issue.
Set during the Early Years, SL236, Web of Curiosity, involves an encounter between the Tholians and Klingons.


SL243, Network Disruption, is tied to the Battle Group scenario that features the fleet of one of the Galactic Powers facing the Andromedans.
SL244, Hearth and Home, has the Hydrans facing a Coalition fleet of Klingons and Lyrans.
Based in the Omega Octant, Dragonslayer SL245 has an Iridani clipper facing a Branthodon young dragonship.

Database articles include battlegroups designed with 800 points and the optional use of partial X-refits. There is an article on the cosmic cloud. Kosnett’s war is updated from its appearance in Advanced Missions. There is a guide for converting captured Klingon ships to fit into Lyran fleets and vice versa.

The Tactics section has “Victory at Origins 2005,” by Ken Lin. The primer focuses on the Drex, located in the Omega Octant. There are three pages of term papers, including some encore term papers.

The Venues section covers Star Fleet Command, SFB On-Line, playing by email, Galactic Conquest, Star Fleet Warlord, Prime Directive, and Star Fleet Battle Force.

Federation & Empire has a status update along with rules and rulings. There are four pages of tactical notes. Finally, there is the Q&A section.

New ships are added for Star Fleet Battles. The Klingons get “collared” ships: DC7 collared battlecruiser and the DC5 collared war cruiser. The Vudar gain more ships with their command cruiser, advanced technology command cruiser, fast carrier resupply frigate, X-scout, and supply cruiser. The Vudar also get a medium bomber squadron, heavy bomber squadron, and bases for both types of bombers. The Federation receives its (old) light scout cruiser and its (old) heavy fighter carrier. The Klingons get a refitted captured Lyran war cruiser and Lyran destroyer. Conversely, the Lyrans get a refitted captured Klingon D5 war cruiser and Klingon F5 frigate. Federation Commander gets new ship cards for the Romulan King Eagle cruiser and K7R battlecruiser and the Gorn battle destroyer and battlecruiser. These four ships are in fleet scale.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Crash Master
description:
It's 1938 and your plane has crashed in the remote Alaskan wilderness on its way to Anchorage.

Using only the items from the plane, will you survive and find your way out of the wilderness?

This at-home escape room in a box takes between 90 minutes and 3 hours.

Solve your way out of the forest by finding hidden clues and solving intriguing puzzles.

The game works best for 1 to 8 players ages 12 and older.

—description from the publisher

name: Be Witching
description:
Every thousand years, the stars align in a way that heralds the arrival of a new Witchqueen. Someone who can guide the magical community into the next age of sorcery, enchantment, and magical drama. How to decide who could possibly carry such a burden? The way witches have for millennia: throw a ridiculous party and show off your very best outfit.

3-6 players draw on provided body templates their outfits for a witch ball using themes on cards drawn from a deck. Then, during a five minute timer, all players debate and finally vote on the best fit between outfit and drawn cards. In the final round, two finalists answer interview questions, and the other player(s) award them points based on their answers. The player with the most points wins.

It's a role-playing game for kids, adults, or both at the same time that celebrates the magic of femme expression and the power in being your most authentic self.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Player Judge, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: 1 Stat Skirmish
description:
1 stat skirmish is a tactical skirmish system with simple rules, where all stats of a miniature are boiled down to 1 single stat.
Included are rules for solitaire gaming, too!

The system is miniatures agnostic and due to its abstaction of everything suitable for all kinds of ranges and genres.
A fantasy brawl? Go for it. A western shootout? Will do. A cyberpunkt heist? Hell yeah! Cthulhu (god, I just copy and pasted this word just to get it right..) investigation? Anytime!

The rules actually fit on 1 page, the cheatsheet on another.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, King of the Hill, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Inqvisitor: The Ten Player Expansion
description:
This expansion adds 12 more coins and innocence markers for a game with up to 10 players.

It also adds 10 character cards with different amounts of money and innocence. Some characters have special abilities.

This expansion was available with the Kickstarter in 2017.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medieval, Party Game

name: Inuk
description:
88 Round Cards plus 10 Cut-Out Cards “Who am I?”

The INUK cards present a companion in play to the existential question, “Who am I, what makes me how I am?” Each 88 mm circular picture card depicts metaphorically a situation in which any of us might find ourselves. Players interpret the pictures through attributing feelings, moods and actions and so themselves become participants in the scenes. At the same time they might catch a glimpse of their own current inner state.
Artist Yilin Bai has enriched the OH-Card genre with her 88 paintings on the theme of self-discovery and self-determination. 10 cut-out cards operate as windows, keyholes or magnifying glasses to enhance and affect our perspectives.
For further surprises try combining the INUK images with the OH words!

name: Armiño
description:
Armiño (Ermine in Spanish language), was the fur clothes sported by Catholic Monarchs in Medieval Europe.

The cloth board and cards of this game emulate those luxury garments. Beside the board, the game consists in 44 field cards, 10 special cards, 2 player aid cards and the instructions. All components are made in Spain from small manufacturers. No plastic components.

The aim of designers was to take some mechanics of different games trying to make their own version of Gwent. Tough, the idea evolved and mixed some concepts from Age of Empires, Stratego, or even Carcasonne.

In Armiño the board and scenario is always changing, allowing a great replayability.

Plays can last from 1 to 30 minutes, depending on strategy and luck. At the beginning of the game, the red carpet will be displayed between contestants, each of them having a King card from the maze. Then, the rest of the 42 field cards (white back) must be mixed and both players shall receive 17 face down cards. Then, the special cards (black back) will be mixed too and just one will be given to each player.

The player will choose how to place cards on the cloth board. Decisions on how to place them will be based just in strategy.

Each card has an effect written on it, so each turn a player must do an action with the cards. Move them or use them according to its effects.

The special cards (epic, meteorite, transmute or breeze among them) can be used all along the game as many times as needed.

Easy to learn but hard to master, Armiño is a strategic card game of medieval combat for two players, whose goal is to kill the opponent's king. Fast and destructive, in the eventuality you could not achieve the regicide, the winner will be the player obtaining most victory points.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Tile Placement, Victory Points as a Resource, Zone of Control

name: Sovereign Slayer Solitaire
description:
Sovereign Slayer Solitaire is a one player one page card game, based on the Carta SRD.

You will need a standard 54 cards deck, a 20-sided die, a red pawn and a black pawn to play.

Move your pawn around a random, initially face-down, 5 by 6 grid. Build up your Luck and Equipment to help you battle the cards defending the Kings. Roll equal to or higher than their value, or lose Health.

Kill all four Kings before your Health reaches zero to win.

name: It's In The Vents!
description:
"A distress signal. A foreign planet. An unexpected attack.
Your captain’s suit was breached.
You tried to impose a quarantine, but the team wouldn’t listen.
Now they’re all dead.
You’re not sure what they brought onto the ship, but whatever it is . . .
It’s In The Vents!"

To play, you’ll need:
1 standard deck of 54 cards, red & black jokers included
1 token, coin, or other character marker
1 counter or scrap of paper
A flat surface for laying out your card grid

On a 4 by 6 grid, search the ship for the cat and fuel for your plasma torch, as the thing in the vents comes ever closer. If you can make it back to the escape pod with the cat before the thing in the vents reaches you, you win!

name: The Last Shall Be First
description:
A fun "take that" game of Catholic items and actions from the designer of "The Catholic Card Game" and the artist behind Tomics Comics.

Players take turns playing item cards in front of them or playing actions that affect other players' cards. The goal is to force other players to discard their cards and be the last player with cards in their possession.

name: Headless Guide
description:
"It is said in Nova Scotia that, when pirates decided to bury treasure, they came ashore with only a handful of men. The Captain, of course, and two or three men he trusted.

And one stranger.

It is said that, once the treasure was safely buried, the Captain would ask who wanted to stay behind and guard it. In the stories, the stranger volunteers, hoping to take the treasure and run.

So, the stranger is beheaded on the spot, their ghost left to haunt the place and guard the treasure for centuries. According to the stories, the stranger is bound to the place now, unable to leave, rest, or move on.

Unless, of course, someone were to discover the gold they have been guarding. Unless they could find some way to convince someone, anyone, to face their fears, head out into the night, and claim the blood gold for themselves."

Headless Guide is a game for a single person. It can be a simple solitaire card game or, if you prefer, a map-making game.

Gather two six-sided dice, something to write on, and something to write with. If you want, get a blank piece of paper to draw the map on.

A player lays out 11 cards with the Ace of Diamonds (representing the Treasure) on the end.

After choosing one of four characters, each with a different combination of Courage and Silence and a special ability, the player flips a card and reads the description tied to that card.

After resolving the rules on a card - often including an attempt to roll under their current Courage or Silence - and adjusting their values accordingly, the player flips again until their Courage runs out, or they claim the Treasure.

name: Into The Glacier
description:
"You have come to the Glacier because you have heard a story. You have every reason to believe it is true, and you have come to the Glacier to find something. Which story are you following, exactly?"

You Will Need:

One standard deck of playing cards
Two six-sided dice
A character marker like a figurine or small toy
A piece of paper and a pencil

A player will explore a grid of from 9 to 21 cards (depending on how long a game is desired) searching for the truth behind one of four stories.

Start with 8 Warmth. Every round, before moving, lose 1 Warmth. Every round, choose a card next to your
marker, turn it face-up if it is face-down. Look up that
card and follow the instructions on it. (You might want to
write in your journal about what you find there.)
If you ever reach 0 Warmth, then you lose consciousness and need to be rescued. Move your character marker directly to the King of Hearts.

Your goal is to find the thing you came to the Glacier for, and then return to the Ace of Clubs. Your goal is also to see what you can see, find what you can find, and explore this untouched and mysterious place.

name: Apex Predator
description:
Apex Predator is a single-player game in which you explore an ancient forest, tracking down and fighting titanic monsters. Along the way, you'll face peril and find that the natural world may just be on your side.

You will need:

1 standard 52-card deck of playing cards
A 10-sided die
A pen or pencil
Paper or a journal
A marker, like a coin or small toy

Choose your quarry, and the size of your map (4x4, 4x5, or 5x5) then explore the Forest. Cards may provide tools to help you defeat the Monster, or tracks to help you find its lair. Once you find the Monster in its lair, your Advantage provided by the tools you have discovered give you a bonus to the die roll as you fight.

name: Foco Total
description:
Pay attention to every new challenge. Combine your memory and attention to became the fastest player.

In this game of pattern recognition and speed, the players can choose 5 different difficulty levels, but the game play is the same for all levels.

There are several cards showing forms with different Colors and patterns that are opened in the center of the table.

Each round the dice for the chosen difficulty are rolled and the combination of the dice show to players one and only one combination between the cards on the center of the table. The objective is to be the fastest player to recognize the correct card.

name: Sílabas de Ouro
description:
The path is full of danger, but in order to reach the treasure room you must fond words with the same syllable in different positions.

This is another educational game from Idea Jogos, aimed for young children in the alphabetisation age.

On your turn you must roll a dice to move inside a dungeon map, full of fields with traps. If you land on a trap, several things can happen (like not being able to play your next turn).

On the other hand, if you land on treasure places, you can gather cards containing syllable, that you need on order to form words and as a requisite to be able to reach the treasure room and win the game.

It's a very interesting way to make little children starting to read.

name: Food Coma
description:
Food Coma is a strategic elimination card game. Choose a playable chef and feed other players high calorie meals until they pass out - in a Food Coma. The last chef standing wins!

Players take turns drawing ingredient cards from the three stores to stack their hands. Ingredients are combined to make meals, which players feed to other players to increase their calorie counts. Each chef has their own unique abilities and there are special cards in each deck, making each draw a tactical decision! And a rubber band mechanism makes players more powerful the closer they get to being knocked out.

Food Coma is designed to be both a fast, fun party game that can be played in easy quick sessions and also a highly strategic and thoughtful game for more competitive players.

All of Food Coma's images are hand drawn and each of the 35 ingredients each have a clever name and witty tagline. It was important to us that Food Coma's cards and imagery were fun to view and enjoy on their own, in addition to great care being taken to polish the balance and gameplay.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Les Coureurs du Vel d'Hiv
description: The game is a cycling race for four people. Each player receives a cyclist of his color. They are placed on the starting field of the game board and have to drive one and a half laps. The cyclists are moved forward using cubes. Events such as "Accident" or "Disqualification" occur on some fields of the game board.

name: Marlowe to Maidenhythe: A Fictional Campaign and Scenario Pack For TsS ! King and Parliament
description:
Marlowe to Maidenhythe is designed for the TtS! For King and Parliament English Civil War rules but useful with other rule systems too.

The PDF contains twelve free-standing fictional scenarios set in the counties of Buckinghamshire and Berkshire during the English Civil War.
They tell the story of a series of clashes between Sir John Boulters (for the King) and Sir Christopher Grey (for Parliament).
Each scenario contains a background briefing, separate briefings for each of the players, a deployment plan and orders of battle.
The scenarios can be played individually or in sequence, as a campaign.
Many of the characters and units recur throughout the campaign.

—description from the publisher

name: Roll it up: roll your joints!
description:
Roll it Up is set in the cannabis world: in fact, the goal is basically to roll your joints before the other players.
it is a card-game: every player will have a number of green flower cards in front of himself, and three tool-adversity card in hand.
after drawing the first card, placing it in front of himself (near the green card) or in the discard deck (face-up, near the main deck) the player will draw a card from the main deck, giving the turn to the player next to him.

The goal shall be agreed among the players before starting the game and, when achieved, can be set again to let the game continue.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Worm & Cozy
description:
Worm & Cozy is a medium-weight strategic spatial roll-and-write game offering meatier puzzles than most roll-and-writes, but sharing their simple materials, solo playability, and streamlined rules.

Use the roll of the dice cleverly to fit worms onto your board, give them body parts, and have those body parts act. You can use any one of thirteen different game sheets for each game; each tells a different chapter from the history of the worms, and has a few unique ways to score. There’s one way to lose points on any sheet: leaving worms touching blank space. So fit your worms together cozily!

At first you need only read 3 pages of rules, and then play Chapter 1, in which the eye is the only organ that has an action: to find food.

Play at your own pace through the chapters. Each of the first 6 chapters introduces the power of one more of the six organ types: With a mouth, a worm can eat food to grow more organs. With a brain it can get some control of the colony’s fate by changing die rolls. With a heart, a worm can grow longer. With a pointy tail it can team up into a “Conga Line”. And with “collars”, two worms – who love each other very much! – can make short baby worms.

—description from the designer

The game's playtesting and development is documented in:
[WIP] Worm & Cozy - 4th Roll & Write Game Design Contest - Contest Ready.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Checker Football
description: Board resembles a 20x13 square grid football field with endzones. Each player has 11 helmet-shaped playing pieces consisting of 7 linemen, 2 halfbacks, 1 fullback, and 1 quarterback.

name: Flames of War: Firestorm Mini Campaign – Norway
description:
Norway was the first battlefield where British, French and German soldiers would battle on land in World War II. It would last longer than the Battle of France. It was the first modern combined arms operation with navy, air and land forces. One which the Wehrmacht performed to their German perfection.
It was a gross violation of neutral states and Operation Weserübung would conclude in the occupation of Norway and Denmark for the reminder of the war in Europe.

Firestorm: Norway uses three maps to plot the strategic situation and show the effects of your table top games on the battles for Norway. All of the important units, territory, and objectives of the operation are represented on the map. Your units will clash at important locations with the best forces from both sides, such as the Gebirgsjäger, Fallschirmjäger, Alpine Troops and Legionaries as well as the Norwegian army.

Victory conditions: It will be very hard for the Allies to achieve any kind of a real victory in Firestorm Norway and the victory conditions reflect this. Events in France will overtake the Campaign in Norway and affect the support of the British and French so the Allies will score points for holding out and slowing the German advance.

All the rules you will need are included to play.
Downloadable tokens are provided although you can easily substitute them with other models.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Flames of War: Firestorm Mini Campaign – Lorraine
description:
Battles in Lorraine saw some of the heaviest tank engagements on the Western Front in World War Two, of which the Tank battles of Arracourt are the most famous.
The Lorraine Campaign saw two poorly supported armies face each other.
The US Third Army was at the end of a successful campaign to liberate France but was now reduced to a secondary role while the Allies prepared for Operation Market Garden.

Players use their normal Flames Of War forces to fight battles to capture areas, reinforced by the main combat units shown on the campaign map.
Each game the player makes a new force to respond to the situation they face.

All of the rules needed to play are included.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: No Fish!: A Game of Environmental Catastrophe for the Whole Family
description:
No Fish! is a darkly humorous, weirdly educational twist on the classic card game Go Fish!

It's good, clean, apocalyptic fun for adults and a great way to teach kids age-five-and-up about where our environment is at now and where the logic of zero-sum consumerism will take us.

No Fish! is like Go Fish! played backwards. Instead of collecting sea creatures, they all go into an extinction pile.

The goal of the game is to make your opponents’ creatures go extinct while sticking them with all the ocean plastic. The last player holding a living organism “wins.”

—description from the designer
