name: Counter-Attacks! 1
description:
Counter—Attacks! — The SS Legions 1
brings 8 mid-war, Waffen SS battles scenarios.
Pitched firefights from the Upper Aisne River in 1940 to Krasny Bor in 1943.

Other than the usual ASL-RB and counters, the CH geo-boards: CH1, CH2, W1, W2, W3, and W4 are needed.

Counter—Attacks! 1 contains 8 scenarios, as well as 2 sheets of color die-cut counters, including new soldier art for 1940 Waffen SS MMC/SMC, British and Italian SW in Russian brown, T-28 m34 and T-26 m37 tanks in Winter whitewash and more.

Scenarios:

A Deadlier Beat - Voncq, France, June 9th 1940
Jungle Fortress of Salla - Salla, Finland, July 1st 1941
Blood Red Snow - Gorodische, Russia, November 17th 1941
Saving the Devils - Dubrovnik, Croatia, October 19th 1943
Shuttlecocks of Fate, Dubrovnik, Croatia, 8-September 8th 1943
Defiance Before Infamy - Wormhoudt, France, May 28 1940
Vikings on the Steppes - Ingushetian Province, Russia, October 3rd 1943
Taiga Tigers - Krasny Bor, Russia, March 23rd 1943
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Black Progress Game
description:
Play as an African-American Scientist, Artist, Entertainer, or Explorer as you work your way to the Hall of Fame

Players roll dice and move from their starting corner to the Hall of Fame in the center of the board. Each square has instructions for players to draw cards from the Progress, Heritage, and Hall of Fame draw piles, win or lose points from/to other players, draft cards from or give cards to other players, purchase cards, and move to other areas of the board. The goal is to be the first player to the Hall of Fame.

Family game. Luck driven with mechanics similar to the Game of Life.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation

name: Moon Mullins Automobile Race
description:
A race game for 2-4 players

Players spin to pick first player - highest number wins. each player spins and moves forward. Red and Green dots on the board turn the cars in other directions. Avoid the buses if you can. Players must visit all four corners of the board to win the game.

Board and rules are glued inside of box bottom.
Components:
Spinner (1)
Player tokens (4)

Spinner can be replaced with a 4-sided die.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Racing

name: Game of Robinson Crusoe
description:
Simple race game with a twist. The winner is the last (slowest) player to make it to the beach and so becomes Robinson Crusoe. Red dots move players forward; black dots move players backward.

Components
Spinner (1)
Player tokens / pebbles (4)

Board and rules glued to bottom box. Spinner can be replaced by 4 sided die

Minimal artwork and cover design point to early publication date.
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Sto Auto Race
description:
A tin race circuit for 1-2 players. The winner is the first to travel 100 miles to the finish.

Players have a car and matching color marble. Players attempt to shoot the marble into indents "holes" marked 5 miles or 10 miles in order to advance their car. Additional holes create delays for drivers.

Components:
2 die cast cars - red and blue
2 marbles - red and blue

name: Leap for Life
description:
Players complete to make the most points for 4 successful skydives.

Points are awarded based on landing in a safe area of the board. First player and movement are based on a spinner (which can be replaced by a 4-sided die)

Board and rules are glued to bottom of box.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Don't Wake the Dragon
description:
Don't Wake the Dragon is a two-player microgame in which you take turns attempting to mine for gold in a dragon's lair without waking them up.

Each turn, you roll a d6 to determine how heavy a sleeper the dragon is; if it's a high number, it's a heavy sleeper; if it's a low number, not so much.

After the d6 is rolled, players take turns placing down a card numbered from 1-6, representing how much of a disturbance you created when mining. These cards add up to a total value between the two players, and if a player plays a card that takes the total value above the value of the d6, they must pick up cards equal to the difference between the collective card the d6 value.

The first player to have no cards in their hand is the winner.

—description from the designer

name: The Fort
description: The objective of The Fort is to knock down men consisting of a King, a Queen, their Bishops, and Guards. Players use a cue to push balls into a U-shaped fort with the men placed in predefined positions.

name: Nearly Heroes
description:
A new arena has just been opened to the public and needs groups of brave participants willing to test their mettle and skill in the arts of combat.
Defeat all your enemies and receive ultimate glory as Heroes of the Land. Should you fail, worry not, you will be remembered as Nearly Heroes.

Nearly Heroes is a cooperative game where you and your friends compete in an arena against exotic enemies. The only thing is that our Heroes aren’t quite heroes. None of them are trained or skilled enough to wield the weapons they come across and suffer greatly for their misuse.
They’ve gotten in way over their heads and it’s up to you to lead them to victory together through strategy and a heavy dose of luck.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures

name: Frozen Winds: Seas of Ice
description:
Frozen Winds: Seas of Ice is a fast-paced naval miniatures wargame set in a DaVinci inspired ice age.

The planet has frozen over.
Gale-force winds howl across the ice as you maneuver your ice skiffs to dominate the frigid domain.
Based on ships of the line style naval games, Seas of Ice plays much, much faster.

A two-player game with half a dozen ships can be played out in about 30 minutes.
A six-player game with 20 to 30 boats can run for an afternoon on a kitchen table.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Renaissance, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: You Decide
description:
Our debut game, You Decide, is a roll and move game full of choices! With each move, You Decide which choice gives you the best chance of getting your pawns to Finish, first! Sometimes your choice involves moving an opponent back! Really want to make things interesting? Play the optional "Snake Eye Switch" where you get to switch places with an opponent, and vice versa!

A single You Decide game is for 2 players, but have your guests bring their You Decide game and add up to two more players per game, laying the boards side by side for the ultimate party game!

Will your decisions make YOU the WINNER?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Aus der Zeit des großen Königs
description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 50 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
categories: Age of Reason, Children's Game, Educational
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: A. Anton & Co., Leipzig, Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Airplane Race
description:
The objective of the game is to be the first to get his/her whole field cleared of planes. Each player takes turns spinning a spinner and clearing a hangar of his/her plane which number the spinner lands on. The first to clear all six planes win.

—user summary

name: Die goldene Gans
description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 45 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder the players. Te effects differ according to the chosen mode of transportation of each player. The players may use an automobile, a bicycle, a coach, a horse or travel by foot. Also the result of the dice roll is used differently:
Automobile and bike: the result counts double
Coach and horse: the results count normal.
Pedestrian: 1=0, 2=1, 3=1, 4=2, 5=2, 6=3.
The pedestrians may use the 3 shortcuts, if the reach the appropriate spaces.
The faster the mode of transportation, the worse are the effects of the event spaces. There are no ill effects for the pedestrians at all.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: The Soap Opera Game
description:
In The Soap Opera Game players are aspiring soap opera stars. They roll and move around New York City trying to collect bit acting parts and roles in commercials.

Once a player has enough acting credits they can move to the central area of the board where they act in a soap opera and try to accumulate all the necessary plot elements: sex, health, disaster, marriage, economy, and crime. The first player to get all of these wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The NASCAR Racing Game
description:
The NASCAR Racing Game is a simple racing game. Cars are moved according to the roll of two standard dice. Landing on a green or yellow flag space requires drawing one of the matching cards. Pit cards must be drawn every five laps.

The rulebook includes 16 pages of NASCAR trivia, but this is not used in the game.

name: Rollin Checkers
description: The board is a regular checkers board with indentations for balls to roll into place. At the beginning of the game the balls are placed on the board and the board is moved until all the balls are set in place. Any ball that rolled to the king row is replaced with a larger ball to represent a king and has all the powers of a king in regular checkers. Play then continues with regular checkers rules.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture, Variable Set-up

name: F.1 Grand Prix, circuit de Spa-Francorchamps
description:
F.1 Grand Prix is a game for 2-5 players. It is a true competition of Formula 1 miniatures on the Belgian automobile circuit from Spa-Francorchamps, one of the most beautiful automobile circuit in the world, by his trace and his landscape, that of the Belgian Ardennes.

For to start, each player selects his car and his stand A B C D or E. Each car is placed in the car park stand, and now the game starts by the qualification, in order to know what pilot will occupy the after the trails.

Then the players start to race by drawing cards from a deck to determine how far the race around the track. Some cards force you to draw a card from a second deck which could be an advantage or dis-advantage for your car.

The first player who achieves 5 circuit turns and who goes over the check pattern flag is winner. The others continue to play to know their arrival order.
One suggestion! You can thus make championships in 3, 4 or 5 sleeves attributing for each competition, 9 points for first, 7 points for second, 5 points for third, 3 points for fourth and 1 point for the fifth. You determine thus the Champion of the Champions.

name: Locked Adventures: Ein Weihnachtsfall
description: Your team accepted the invitation of a renowned journalism school to Berlin, where a student turned to you for help: Her friend Christopher suddenly went into hiding because he had got wind of a suspicious matter. Christopher was in the utmost panic and said that it was a matter of life and death, but the police must not be called on under any circumstances! Your investigative talent is more in demand than ever in the new city. You make your way through unknown Berlin to help Christopher. Are you late or can you still provide last-minute help?

name: Instant Numbers
description: Instant Numbers initiates an arithmetic contest in which players race against a 60 seconds timer to score as many points as possible by tackling simple arithmetic.

name: Instant Letters
description:
Players engage in an anagramming contest while racing a 60 seconds timer to score as many points as possible .
Points are allocated based on quality of words formed, and player with highest points after pre-agreed number of rounds wins.

name: Instant Rhymes
description:
In Instant rhymes, players engage in a contest of calling words with correct suffix

At the start of a round, a games master (or player acting as one) calls the active suffix and the first player to call a correct word with that suffix gets the card.
Play continues till pre-agreed number of cards are exhausted.
Player with the most cards at the end of the round wins the game.

-description from designer

name: Instant Songs
description:
Players engage in a singing contest by recalling relevant songs word-lyrics fastest.

On a turn, a games master (or player acting as one) calls a word and fastest player to sing a song gets the card.

Play continues till number of pre-agreed cards is exhausted or reached by a player.

Player with most cards at the end of the game wins.

-description from designer

name: Ruthless: Stranger with a Gun
description:
For decades the Blanco family has run the town of San Luis on the New Mexico border. So, they didn’t take to kindly to John Bannon when he rode into town and made himself the sheriff. Soon the silver mines, saloons and stage-coach were all working for him. Tensions between the Blancos and Bannon were boiling over when a quiet stranger with a wicked gun rode into town. Who will win control of San Luis?

The mini-campaign is loosely based on the film "A Fistful of Dollars" and is structured in quick “acts” that could be played in a single evening.
Both sides face decisions that allow for a great deal of replay value and let the players write their own story in the West....

Players choose their own adventure with one side picking the scenario and the other choosing the set up.
There are a possible 27 different battles that can be played.
The mini-campaign will consist of three of these gunfights.

RUTHLESS, a complete set of western gunfight rules, is also included!
This booklet has everything you need to play!

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Football
description:
The game is played with a ball and two dice, a number die to determine the number of spaces the ball may move (even = straight directions, odd = diagonally) and a special die. The special die has the Letters A (2x), R, C (2x) and N with the following meanings:
A = move ahead
B = move back
C = move ahead and roll again
N = don't move
The spaces on the game board marked with letters also have special meanings derived from the soccer rules.

The game ends after a prearranged time or number of goals, with the player with the most goals winning the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Escape Velocity
description:
In Escape Velocity, players will compete to become the most profitable company by investing in space elevators or mass drivers, establishing colonies on Mars or Ceres, building colony ships destined for Ganymede or Callisto, and helping to industrialize the final frontier.

Each round, players will select and execute actions, pick up and deliver materials, research new technologies, and spend their money carefully. Planets move each round and players will need to watch carefully as they plan their routes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stock Holding, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Victory at Sea: Foch
description:
The four vessels of the Suffren-class were based on the Duquesne-class, though each was built to slightly different standards as lessons were learned from the preceding ship. Their hull form was sleek and graceful, taking a classic cruiser form.
While the Duquesne-class lineage was apparent, the Suffren-class had a much more modern look about them. Armour protection was somewhat better than the preceding class, though speed was reduced as a consequence.

Foch spent the early period of WWII in Dakar as part of Force M and formed part of a force bombarding Italian assets near Genoa.
After the fall of France Foch joined Vichy French forces before being scuttled with other French vessels in late 1942.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Suffren
description:
The four vessels of the Suffren-class were based on the Duquesne-class, though each was built to slightly different standards as lessons were learned from the preceding ship. Their hull form was sleek and graceful, taking a classic cruiser form.
While the Duquesne-class lineage was apparent, the Suffren-class had a much more modern look about them. Armour protection was somewhat better than the preceding class, though speed was reduced as a consequence.
Suffren remained at Alexandria from 1940 to 1943, when she joined the Allied cause.

Suffren, lead ship in her class, operated in the Dodecanese Islands early on in the war before peacefully surrendering to the Royal Navy - in sharp contrast to the fate of many French vessels at Mers-el-Kebir.
Refitted she would join the Allied cause in 1943.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Jeanne d'Arc
description:
Built as a training cruiser for the French Marine Nationale the Jeanne d'Arc was both floating school and combat capable warship.
During WWII she formed part of a flotilla taking French gold to Canada before joining Free French forces in 1943.

The single vessel of the Jeanne d’Arc-class was designed to use the same guns as the Duguay-Trouin-class. She was considered a training vessel and as such didn't require the speed or armour of a cruiser.
Stationed in Martinique, she joined the Allies in 1943, receiving a refit in which her torpedo tubes and aircraft were removed, and improved anti-aircraft armament was fitted. After 1943 she served in the Mediterranean.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Chacal-class destroyers
description:
Also known as the Jaguar-class, Chacal (Jackal)-class destroyers were designed to fulfil a scouting role for fleet battle lines and to attack enemy shipping in the Mediterranean. As a result, they possessed poor endurance, mounted no anti-submarine weapons, and had woefully inadequate anti-aircraft fire, especially in the face of the German Luftwaffe.

The six ships of this class were all named after predators (Chacal, Jaguar, Léopard, Lynx, Panthère, Tigre) and saw wildly varying actions and fates during the war.

This pack enables you to represent three of these vessels on the tabletop.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Richelieu
description:
There were to have been four ships of the Richelieu-class, with the first two laid down in 1935 and the second pair following in 1935.
Gascogne was cancelled and Clemenceau never completed. The last ship followed a modified design which placed one of the turrets aft of the superstructure – the original design had both main armament turrets forward, much like the Dunkerque-class.
Designed as a counter to the powerful Italian battleships being built, the Richelieu was protected against 15-inch shells and mounted eight 15-inch guns of its own, on what started as a 35,000-ton hull. Neither ship of the class was quite finished at the time of the French surrender.

Richelieu, which was almost complete, escaped to Dakar in order to keep here under French control. She came under repeated British attacks that were intended to compel the battleship to join the Free French Naval forces or sink her, thus denying the Axis opportunity to deploy the Richelieu for their own means.
In 1942 she eventually, joined the Allied cause and, after a refit in the USA, was deployed to the Far East to serve with the British fleet for operations against the Japanese - although present at the Battle of the Malacca Strait, she was too far away to directly engage the enemy vessels.

She was part of the force that liberated Singapore in the aftermath of the Japanese surrender in 1945 and later operated in French Indochina before being recalled to France in December 1945.
She saw training duty on and off active-service for the remainder of her existence, eventually being sold for scrap in 1968.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Béarn
description:
In 1923 it was decided to convert an incomplete Normandie-class battleship to a carrier.
Despite a refit in 1935, she was far too slow for fleet operations in World War Two and was demilitarised in 1942.

In 1943 she joined the Free French Naval Force where she served for a time before being converted to an aircraft transport.

Béarn was the only French aircraft carrier to serve in the war – of the two ships of the projected Joffre-class, one was cancelled and the other was not completed.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Surcouf
description:
When launched, the Surcouf was the largest submarine in the world, only surpassed in the Second World War by the Japanese I-400-class submarine.

Her intended role was that of commerce raider and her design was intended to maximise this mission. She had a range of 10,000 miles, could sail for 90 days and was equipped with a Besson MN-411 floatplane in a hanger aft of the tower to scout for victims and spot for her main battery.

Her torpedo outfit included four forward internal tubes, a quad trainable mount aft and a second quad trainable mount aft equipped with lightweight torpedoes. She even had a prison hold for up to 40 captives. However, the most striking aspect of her design was the inclusion of a special, watertight turret forward of the tower which carried two eight-inch naval guns.

Surcouf was a very complex design, plagued with mechanical troubles. She was difficult, slow to dive and rolled badly on the surface in rough seas. She was also so low to the horizon that the effective range of her 8-inch guns was greatly reduced. When war broke out, Surcouf was in the French Antilles and by the time she returned to Brest was in need of repairs. When France fell, Surcouf escaped to England, where she was seized by British sailors. She was subsequently turned over to the Free French who regarded her with pride while the British Admiralty considered her, perhaps unfairly, something of a joke.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Warriors of Orlandia
description:
In Warriors of Orlandia, each player chooses a Warrior card and four Support cards. These cards are used throughout the game to defeat the opposition in a tactical battle.

A player wins the game when either the opposing Warrior is defeated, or they have the highest life at the end of the fifth round. When a Warrior’s Life is 0, that Warrior is defeated.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Grid Movement, Layering

name: Ponto de Vista
description: The leader of the game draws a theme (for example, WILD). The other players then quickly choose between the "point of view" cards in their hands, the one that has the most to do with the chosen theme. Then, the leader chooses one of the cards, and the player who discarded it walks a square on the board. The letter need not be perfect for the topic. The leader usually chooses the most creative, funny or interesting card.

name: Encosto
description:
It is the Dawn of the Temple Vigil! The congregation prays happily ... but, suddenly, some worshipers begin to be demonized! ENCOTSTO! BACKREST! They all scream!
It's time for Exorcism!
The faithful must gather and decide who is Leaning and do Exorcism on him! At the end of the service, who will remain anointed?

A player is chosen as the narrator, he is not part of any of the teams, but he will lead the game as a pastor of the church. The rest are divided into two sides: Backrest and Faithful.
Backers want to drive all church members crazy and win if the number of members is less than or equal to the number of backers. Believers need to exorcise all the backs to win.

Each turn the backrests secretly choose a player to be eliminated and all players vote to eliminate a second player, who can be one of the backrests or another faithful one.

name: Focus: It's a Math Thing
description: Each player chooses a set of colored game pieces (red, yellow, blue). Each tile represents the product of two multiples. Players then randomly selects ten tiles and places them at the correct intersection of the vertical and horizontal lines which represent the multiples. For example, 45 is placed at the intersection of 9 and 5. Each player is awarded ten points for each correct tile placement. The process is repeated until there is a winner with the most number of points.

name: Chem*Mathis*Try
description:
This is an educational game designed to stimulate interest in chemistry, general science, and math in a fun and entertaining way.

Players move around the board while answering questions. One set of cards features questions about the Periodic Table and the other set includes questions about general science and math. The player who circles the game board three times is declared the winner.

Designed for 2-6 players ages 10 and older.

Includes board, cards, pawns, and element symbols.

name: Pokémon TCG: Dragon Majesty Expansion
description:
Noble Pokémon of wing and claw fly high in the Pokémon TCG: Dragon Majesty expansion! Look for Dragon Majesty collections to bring forth a mighty horde of draconic Pokémon: Reshiram-GX, Salamence-GX, Dragonite-GX, and over a dozen more, including Charizard! Their command of fire, battle, and sky will rise to the top for collectors and competitors alike. Get ready to soar with these awesome Pokémon in the special Dragon Majesty expansion!

The Dragon Majesty expansion aims to take the Pokémon TCG in incredible new directions with more Prism Star cards and Pokémon-GX at your service. Dragon Majesty booster packs will not be sold separately, so look for them in special collections.

The Pokémon TCG: Dragon Majesty expansion includes:


Over 70 cards
Over 20 Dragon-type Pokémon
6 Pokémon-GX
2 Prism Star cards
6 full-art cards



—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon Unbroken Bonds Expansion
description:
When you have a partner you can count on, nothing can stop you! The TAG TEAM Pokémon-GX in the Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon—Unbroken Bonds expansion show the colossal power of teamwork, including Reshiram & Charizard-GX, the Ultra Beasts Pheromosa & Buzzwole-GX, and Gardevoir & Sylveon-GX…plus, Lucario teams up with the newly discovered Melmetal! With trust and practice, these Pokémon can tackle just about anything, so check out the amazing Pokémon pairings in the Sun & Moon—Unbroken Bonds expansion!


Over 210 cards
7 brand-new TAG TEAM Pokémon-GX
7 more Pokémon-GX
More than 25 Trainer cards and a new Special Energy card


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Operation Akimbo
description:
WINNER OF BEST WAR THEMED GAME IN THE 2021 52-card game contest ***




OPERTION AKIMBO is the code name for a top secret Allied WWII mission to liberate key areas in northern France & set the stage for a full scale invasion at D-Day. The game is a solo card game using a 2-sided 54 card deck.

You General, must organize the joint effort between the US, Canadian & English forces in this critical operation. Your task is to lay the optimal path through the French country side, organize men and air support & achieve key objectives. Finally, it is critical you deliver all 3 squads to the rendezvous point.

Each turn you will choose 1 card & 1 side of that card to play. One side will be a path through the countryside with enemies to overcome & the other is a completed mission objective, unit forces to deploy, or air support.

You win by completing three 10 card paths, overcoming all enemies by either ground and air troops & completing 15 mission objectives before all cards are used.

The game is fully PnP on BGG and was designed for the 2021 54-Card deck contest.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon Unified Minds Expansion
description:
To stay on top, your team must work as one! In the Pokémon TCG: Sun & Moon—Unified Minds expansion, TAG TEAM Pokémon-GX battle in flawless harmony, including Mewtwo & Mew-GX, Rowlet & Alolan Exeggutor-GX, Espeon & Deoxys-GX, Garchomp & Giratina-GX, Umbreon & Darkrai-GX, and more! True teammates take aim at a single goal—find your perfect partners in the Sun & Moon—Unified Minds expansion!


Over 230 cards
8 brand-new TAG TEAM Pokémon-GX
9 more Pokémon-GX
More than 25 Trainer cards and 2 new Special Energy cards


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pokémon TCG: Champion's Path Expansion
description:
Embark on an exciting new adventure through the Galar region with the Pokémon TCG: Champion's Path expansion! In this special expansion, you'll encounter the region's many Gym Leaders and the Pokémon partners that battle alongside them. There are powerful Pokémon V like Eldegoss V, Lucario V, Duraludon V, and many others. That's not all, as you'll also find massive Pokémon VMAX, such as Drednaw VMAX and Alcremie VMAX. But you're not the only one on the path to the championship—your rivals are determined to make it to the top as well. Hit the Gyms and blaze your own path with the Pokémon TCG: Champion's Path expansion!

Champion's Path booster packs will not be sold separately, so look for them in special collections.


Over 70 cards
Cards featuring recently discovered Pokémon from the Galar region
11 awesome Pokémon V and 3 gigantic Pokémon VMAX
19 Trainer cards



—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dragon Killers (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Dragon Killers is a variant of the Dragon Hunters fan extension created by SCOTT.
The objective of this fan expansion is to allow players to attack the dragon from Dragon Killers stations armed with spears forged with metals from meteorites whose sharp spearheads can pierce the magical beast’s armoured skin. The princess will also favour the heroic victors with a temporary alliance.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Split Trick
description:
The objective of the game is to collect candies – Treat cards – in five suits. Treat cards have various points value and players try not to exceed the value of the Haunt card when collecting Treat suits. Otherwise, the Treat suit is haunted!
The game is played over a series of tricks and winning a trick allows a player to choose which Treat card to take first. After 3 rounds, players total the value of their collected Treat cards and haunted Treat suits score only half of their value.
The player with the most points is the winner.

The new TGC edition have a brand new colorful graphics as well as 3 additional modules: A Co-Op mode, Special Treats and Wild Tricks (total of 18 new cards).

Participated in the BGG 2021 Two-Player Print and Play Game Design Contest.

name: Crook
description:
Crook is a trick taking game that requires each player to bid on the number of tricks they plan to take during a round of play. The person to the left of the dealer leads out by playing one card of any color and play goes clockwise with each player playing one card per turn. Players must “follow suit” by playing a card of the same color that was led out. If they are out of the color that was led, they can play any color including the trump color. The player that wins the trick takes the cards played (they are set aside to indicate a trick won) and then leads out for the next round of play.

The goal of the game is to score the highest number of points. If a player's bid is made exactly (not under or over) add amount bid plus 5 points. If bid is not made, subtract amount bid or the number of tricks taken – whichever is the greater number. This game is easy to play, but becomes very difficult to accurately predict the number of tricks that will actually be taken. The game ends with a special round where each player is dealt one card and each player shows every other player their card by putting it on their forehead (without looking at it). Bids are made and the cards are laid on the table to see who takes the trick.

—description from the designer

name: Ruthless: I Rode with Custer
description:
Ever since that fateful day when George Armstrong Custer’s battalion of the Seventh Cavalry met its fate on the Little Bighorn River, men made careers by selling their stories claiming to be the sole survivor.
By the 1950s the last of these men, as well as the Sioux and Cheyenne participants, were in their twilight years.
They all vied for a chance to tell the tallest tale and have their story become a bestselling book which would dominate the United States understanding of the battle.
Was Custer a barbarian -or- a hero of Manifest Destiny?

You must weave your own exciting story of the battle and seek fame and fortune by fighting your way through the most dramatic moments of the Battle of the Little Bighorn!

This mini-campaign is structured in quick “acts” that could be played in a single evening.
Both sides face decisions that allow for a great deal of replay value and let the players write their own story of the Battle of the Little Bighorn….

Players choose their own adventure with one side picking the scenario and the other choosing the set up.
There are a possible 27 different battles that can be played.
The mini-campaign will consist of three of these gunfights.

RUTHLESS, a complete set of western gunfight rules, is also included!
This booklet has everything you need to play!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Anyday Funnies
description:
In Anyday Funnies, you are a cartoonist rushing to draw a comic strip before you hit your deadline.

Each player gets one play sheet to draw on. 1st player rolls three dice. If you roll a pair or a trio, only you get a bonus.

Starting with the player who rolled, select 1 number from
the dice & draw/write what is on the chart below.

After all players have drawn, X out one deadline clock. The game ends when all clocks are x’d out. Use the scoring chart to determine score.

All players show each other their comic (you get a bonus if you make someone laugh!) The player with the highest point total wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Cook Off: The Card Game
description:
This is a card game where you combine ingredients to make meals. Opponents can sabotage meals by placing flies or hairs in your meal, causing you to lose points. You gain points based on the meal you create, plus any extra ingredients you have added. The first person to reach 20 points wins!

—description from the designer

name: Battle of the Hexes
description:
In Battle of the Hexes, players will take part in a war of spell cards. They play as mages with a set of spells they choose from, who do battle to the death. There are different types of magic as well as different types of spells; and the player must carefully select their strategy and spells to defeat their opponent.

Players must each build a hand of 15 cards, by drawing by turn from a draft of cards. These cards can then be played on different lanes, damaging only what is in their path unless stated otherwise on the card. If no other card is in their respective lane, damage from the cards goes directly to the opposing player’s health. Once a player loses all their health, they lose the game.

General Gameplay:

Gameplay occurs over several stages. Players keep track of whose turn it is through the turn indicator card. They must simply flip it when their turn ends.

Draw Stage:

During the draw stage: All cards sets should be shuffled first. Determine a starting player, that player is dealt the “Destruction Spells” set of cards. Then they will choose one to keep for their hand, and pass the rest of the cards to the opposing player, who will then choose one of their own, and return it to the starting player again. That process should repeat itself until each player has a maximum of 5 cards of that particular set. Any remaining cards should be placed aside for later use in the game. Afterwards, that same process is repeated with the “Summoning Spells” set of cards, followed by the “Alteration Spells” set of cards.

Play Stage:

This stage is where players play the cards they have chosen during the Draw Stage. The starting player from the previous stage starts here. During this stage, players get to use their 6 stamina points to play cards they have in their hand. Each card requires a certain amount of stamina points to be played. Any unused stamina points at the end of this stage cannot be used as extra in the next round. For the first round only: once the player has played all the cards they want, it is then the opposing player’s turn to play their cards in the same manner. Each card type must be placed in the correct area of the battlefield sheet according to their respective type symbols. “Destruction” and “Alteration” cards must remain face down until the Battle Stage starts. Players may stack up as many of these cards in one lane as they want, but only one “Summoning” card is allowed in one lane at a time. Players may draw cards from any of the draw decks at any time during this stage, but it will cost them 1 stamina point.

Battle Stage:

During this stage, the player who played their cards last gets to attack first. The players’ cards will deal damage to the opposing player’s cards only on their respective lanes unless stated - otherwise on the card - and according to their damage points on the card. Damage is done to both sides simultaneously. Cards that belong to the same spell class deal only half damage to each other. Any card that loses all its HP points must be discarded. All discarded cards are returned to their respective draw deck, placed at the bottom of each. If the opposing player’s lane is empty, then damage would go directly to that player’s own HP. Players keep track of how much damage each card is dealt through the red health pieces. One red health piece means the card lost one HP, and so on. Players keep track of their own health through the counters.

Following this stage it is back to the play stage for the opposing player. Whenever players run out of cards, each draw deck is taken and reshuffled, and the players draft cards between each other in another Draw Stage.

name: Black Flag
description:
Black Flag is a nautical theme game, in the game you can choose your role, recruit crew, transport goods, and expand the fleet to dominate the Caribbean.

Cards:

Character card
Pirate: Each time you recruit a crew member, you can get one extra person.
Businessman: Each trade will get an extra 5 gold.
Governor: Can station one or more ships in the port, When a ship is stationed, all income from transactions in the port is attributed to you.

Ship card
Heavy cruiser: 30HP 3DMG 3RNG 1SPD
Light destroyer 20HP 3DMG 1RNG 3SPD
20G/Ship
10G to repair well

Goods Card
Wood 1G Land-Island 3G
Sugar 1G Island-Land 3G
Drapery 2G Land-Island 7G
Rum 1G/5bucket (Each crew member consumes one piece per round)

Ship Equipment Card
Speed card: +1 SPD
Shield card: +3 HP
Cannon card: +2 DMG
3G/card

Crew Card
2G/crew
Used for ship-to-board warfare

How To Play
Choose a ship as your lead ship (Fleet speed depends on the speed of the leader ship)
Initially you will get 100G
Choose your own birth port
In your turn you can choose to move, buy goods, buy/repair ship and attack other players' fleets.

Combat system
Sea War: Cannon attack between fleets, If the HP of the ship is to zero, it will be sunk.
Ship-to-board warfare: Close to the enemy fleet, you can board the enemy ship for close combat. Offset the crew, and the more people win.

How To Win
I.Destroy other players
II.Businessman can earn 1500G to win
III.The governor can occupy 8 ports and win

name: Star Adventure: The Card Game
description:
You board an aircraft with a team of adventurers to perform many trips through the cities of Celestia and recover their wonderful treasures. Your journey will not be safe, but you will attempt to be the richest adventurer by collecting the most stars.

However, in this new game, the captain will draw a card from the pink deck, which is the question deck, basically cards with assumptions of the player, such as "I like pineapples on my pizza". The other players need to guess if it’s a yes or a no.

The players who get it right will be able to get stars from the next island. The players who get it wrong will NOT get stars from the next island.

The captain then draws 1 card from the dark red deck: the deck of destruction. An empty dark red card means that the ship will not face any natural disaster.
Everyone will draw 1 card from the green deck: the escape card.
The captain will then reveal his cards of destruction. They will then try to escape from these natural disasters. The captain will go first.

The first one to get 30 stars will win.

—description from the designer

name: Heroes Tournament
description:
Heroes Tournament is a deck building RPG game featuring multiple heroes and their unique powers. The winner will be crowned as the Ultimate Hero Champion and players must collect 9 out of 13 of their power cards in order to be the strongest hero.

On top of all of the battles between heroes, there will also be monsters lurking about in order to disrupt the process. Heroes can team up with each other until they've reached to the point of death match where they'll have to face each other.

—description from the designer

name: Монополия: Волгоград
description:
Монополия Волгоград, or Monopoly: Volgograd is a revisited version of the classic game of Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the city of Volgograd in Russia.

Buy local businesses and win by bankrupting the other players.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Wer hat dich, du schöner Wald..
description:
Players use magnets to remove items from the forest. If animals are removed, minus points are given. The player tallies up his points at the end and the one with the most points is the winner.

—user summary

name: DICED
description:
A family card game where the roll of the dice, decides a players fate.

Included items:
58 Playing Cards
1 Rule card
1 Playing die

The aim of the game is for players to loose all their cards. Each player is dealt 7 cards at the start of the game. Each player then takes it in turns to roll the die to try and match the number with the number on their cards. If the numbers match, the player can put down the matching cards. If the numbers do not match, the player than has to pick up 1 card from the separate pile. sound simple enough? well... some of the numbered cards have symbols on them that can power certain activities in the game. These symbols include... Role again, next player pick up x4, Change direction, Next player miss a go. These cards can be great to trip up opponents or launch you towards victory. In the game there are also special cards. The 'CHOICE' card allows a player to put down a card, no matter the number they roll. Meaning a player with this in hand can always be saved, If a player is clever they may choose to keep hold of tis card.
The 'STEAL' card will cause wars and arguments. This card allows a player to steal any opponents roll, at any point in the game. Meaning a player can put down their cards and the player that stole the roll can put down theirs. This card can flip a game on its head and launch players into the lead.

A game full of twists and turns, but to win this game do you need luck or skill? we will let you decide.

—description from the designer

name: Iconoclash: Battlegrounds
description:
Iconoclash: Battlegrounds is a stand-alone expansion and features 4 new, original fighters for the Iconoclash system:


Valiant Knight: Press-your-luck with every attack! The Valiant Knight commands an army of champions, and his attack deals more when he draws well from his Valiant Token Bag. But with every draw you risk the attack with a chance he may weaken his attacks or cause them to fail altogether.
Amelia Fortress: Ready to take command of the fight? The undauntable commander of the 6th Armored Brigade will pulverize her opponents with her heavily armed mecha. She tends to pull off her greatest maneuvers when she's on the ropes and has only a handful of options.
Monarch: Prepare to take flight and control the skies! Monarch readies her lance from above to deal extra damage. Monarch will use her magnificent wings to create great gusts and push everything on the board.
Kali: Put on your uwu face! Kali commands an army of alien kittens that she uses to create an adorable minefield. Or she can collect them to create an explosion of kitten power.


In Iconoclash: Battlegrounds you’ll take the fight to the Final Battlefield and the Fallen Field where great battles in ages past have been fought.

name: Bees vs. Bears
description:
Bees vs. Bears is a strategy card game in which you play as a hive of bees, defending your honey against the horde of hungry bears. Each player starts with two honey tokens and tries to outlast the other hives. During the game you use special abilities as well as your army of bee defenders, attempting to simultaneously fend of the bears and weaken the other hives!

Bees vs. Bears is a high action, fast paced game with games averaging 10 - 20 minutes. It can be played with 2-6 people and though the game is easy to pick up, it is hard to master as there are sixty different cards, some with more complicated abilities than others.

—description from the publisher

name: Perplexing Triangle
description: A 3 player, 9-card game. At the beginning of the game, each player will draw 3 random cards from a deck of 9, and look at them. Each card is given a number of cubes that are placed on said card, these cubes serve as health, for example, kings have 6 health cubes, Queens have 5, Jacks have 4, and all other cards have 3. Each round, players have to place 1 or 2 cards of their choosing in their “card placing section”. Each time a player does this, they lose a piece of “health” on each of their placed cards (marked by moving the cube to resemble that its value has decreased by 1, ex: moving 6 to 5). After every turn, each player has to give one of their cards to the player in the clockwise direction. Once a card’s health reaches 0, the card is flipped over to show that it can’t be used anymore, it is then placed in the middle along with its health cube. Once a player’s entire deck is obsolete/can’t be used anymore, they’re out, and the last card standing wins.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Crusade Mission Pack – Plague Purge
description:
This mission pack is a narrative play expansion for the Warhammer 40,000 Crusade campaign system.

Within, you’ll find the rules required to play games of Warhammer 40,000 set in the Charadon Sector, which has become embroiled in war since the arrival of Typhus and the Death Guard at the head of a vast Chaos fleet. This mission pack has been specifically designed for use in narrative play Crusade games, where your campaigning forces can wage war across the Obolis and Lirac Sub-sectors. With plagues running amok and devastating new weaponry being brought to bear on every front, will your Crusade force rise to prominence or buckle beneath the weight of the terrible conflict?

Inside this 112-page mission pack you will find:

- Six new missions each for Combat Patrol-, Incursion-, Strike Force- and Onslaught-sized games, all set within the war-torn Charadon Sector
- A selection of new Plague Purge Agendas, Requisitions, Stratagems, and more

The pack itself is presented in a full Canadian wiro ring-bound book for easy use and reference on the tabletop during games, and comes with an elastic closure.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the contents of this mission pack.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Broken Realms – Teclis
description:
Archmage Teclis leads his Lumineth hosts against the Great Necromancer in a battle to save the realms. Nagash has brought a ghastly era of hauntings upon the Mortal Realms, for the power of death is on the ascendant. Only now, when the hour is darkest, does the light of the Lumineth shine forth. Teclis, aelven god of magic, leaves his beloved dominion of Hysh to make war upon the Ossiarch Empire – but in doing so triggers a counter-attack that may see his sovereign lands destroyed. Who will win this ultimate duel of arcane might?

The next engrossing instalment in the Broken Realms saga moves from Morathi to Archmage Teclis and his Lumineth Realm-lords as they launch a risky venture against the Great Necromancer. The unravelling story will have massive consequences for several factions including the Lumineth Realm-lords, Maggotkin of Nurgle, and forces of Death – once again shifting the balance of power in the Mortal Realms. You’ll find fresh ways to play your games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar, alongside rules for new units, warscroll battalions, and more.

Inside this 152-page hardback book, you’ll find:
-The thrilling tale of the Lumineth Realm-lords’ perilous campaign against the entrenched legions of Death – illustrated with stunning new art.
- New rules for the Lumineth Realm-lords, including a bevy of units from the Hurakan Temple. This book includes the full set of rules and background for every newly-released unit, so can be used alongside the first edition of Battletome: Lumineth Realm-lords.
- Allegiance abilities for the Cities of Sigmar and Lumineth Realm-lords, representing Xintil, a Free City in Hysh, as well as the Great Nations of Alumnia and Helon.
- Rules for Streets of Death – battles in the tight confines of cities across the Mortal Realms.
- Six battleplans and Realms of Battle rules to help you recreate the events and locations from the story.
- A suite of warscroll battalions and rules to enhance your Cities of Sigmar, Maggotkin of Nurgle, Lumineth Realm-lords, Flesh-eater Courts, and Ossiarch Bonereapers.

Important Note:
If you already own a copy of the original Lumineth Realm-lords battletome, Broken Realms: Teclis gives you everything you need to fully update your Lumineth Realm-lords army, in addition to the groundbreaking new lore and artwork. The updated Battletome: Lumineth Realm-lords simply includes the Lumineth content from this book, which makes it a handy compilation if you prefer to keep it all together.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blue's Clues I Spy
description: Players choose one of six game boards to play with together. Each of the boards has ten objects hidden on it. Each hidden object has a card associated with it. Players flip the cards, one at a time, and try to be the first to find the object on the card on the game board.

name: Деловые люди (Business people)
description:
Economic game. Buy cooperatives and equities, collect rent from fellow players. Repeat as necessary until everyone else is bankrupt.

Players take turns in order. A turn begins with the rolling of the dice and moving the piece around the board the corresponding number of squares.

If a player lands on Fortune cell he draws the card from the pile and obeys its instructions. If the player stops on a cell with an unowned cooperative, he can buy the entity for the listed price. He can decline the purchase. In this case, the entity keeping available for the other players. If the cell with the entity already owned by another player, he must pay the owner's rent (the price will be noticed on the card based on the level of the cooperative entity). Also, a board contains the special cells for equities exchange. Each full round on the board the cost of equities change and player can sell them to increase own cash or to buy other equities by a lower price.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Fahrt ins Grune
description: The players start their journey to various leisure activities around the board. The first player to reach space 90 wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Die Bremer Stadtmusikanten
description:
The cards are evenly distributed among the players. One player gets no card, he reads the fairy tale aloud, while emphasizing the bold typed words. Whenever another player finds an image of the emphasized word, he covers it with a cardboard square. The first player to cover all images on his card or cards wins the game.

Curious: The same card wins every time (if the owner makes no mistakes), because the order of the emphasized words in the story never changes. So the winner is already determined with the distribution of the cards.
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: クトゥルフが目覚める前に (Cthulhu ga mezameru mae ni)
description:
Five explorers are trying to prevent the rising of the undersea kingdom of R’lyeh and the awakening of Great Cthulhu with it. To achieve their goal, the Disk of R’lyeh must be destroyed. However, the Starknife – an artefact necessary to the task – has disappeared. One of the explorers must have hidden it! It can be anywhere, and finding it is not a simple thing. The fact that time is of the essence does not leave much to hesitate, either…

Before Cthulhu Awakens (クトゥルフが目覚める前に), the 1st title in ARCLIGHT’s Mystery Portable Series, is a cooperative deduction game set in the Cthulhu Mythos, with simple rules just by flipping cards.

name: Wildak Town
description:
A monopoly-like game set in a village with shops and companies. Players are parents that try to collect as much money and shops to secure the future of their children.

Wildak town is a game of the 50's in wich rolemodels and career choices were different, or in fact in line with that decade. Women/girls do caring and providing jobs and men/boys do hard labor and management. The avarage (Dutch) family in the 30's to 60's consisted of a lot of children and all must contribute in their living.
Besides their jobs, once or twice a year some entertainment came to town; e.a cycling/tour/giro/velodrome and a carnaval/luna-park; both depicted on the gameboard. This is where you can try your luck to earn just that little bit more money this year.

Wildak town likes to be a family game, where everyone can relate to (again; time-appropiate).
To keep it interesting and a family game; time limit for this game is a maximum of 1 or 2 hours, or if all your family members (in the game) are dead.

name: Οι Εφοπλιστές (The Shipowners)
description:
Οι Εφοπλιστές (oi efoplistes) is a board game published by Greek company MIKA in 1991.

The game is a simulation of merchant shipping. It takes place all over the world. Each player has a vessel (or two in a 2-players game) for shipping commodities (food and machinery) from city to city. But they also have to pay attention on weather, fuel management and of course to make the best deals about cargoes.

Take your boats and transport boxes of food and machinery throughout the world. The fastest and most methodical will collect the most money and will be the final winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Victory at Sea: USS Alaska
description:
The Alaska-class fell midway between a heavy cruiser and a battleship, and the United States Navy considered these vessels large cruisers rather than battlecruisers.
They were designed as cruiser-killers, tasked with destroying post-Washington Treaty heavy cruisers. As a result, they were given 12-inch guns, significant armour protection, and could travel at up to 33 knots. They resembled current generation battleships in appearance, with the familiar two forward, one aft main battery turrets, massive columnar mast and a multitude of 5-inch dual purpose guns along the sides of the superstructure. However, they were built to cruiser standards, lacking the armoured belt and torpedo defence of capital ships.

Commissioned late into the war, USS Alaska saw limited service.
Operations included those off Iwo Jima and Okinawa in early 1945, such as anti-aircraft defence in carrier task forces and shore bombardment.
After the war, she participated in the Korean occupation.
She was decommissioned in February 1947.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: USS Iowa
description:
One of the largest battleships ever built.
Based superficially on the South Dakota-class, the USS Iowa had heavier armour and was 200 ft. longer. It was also incredibly fast, due to increased output from the engines, and its greater size allowed it to mount more anti-aircraft guns, making it a formidable prospect for attacking planes. Invariably used as flagships for task forces, the Iowa-class was also supremely equipped to act as escorts for the fast carrier fleets of the Pacific.

During World War Two, USS Iowa transported President Franklin D. Roosevelt across the Atlantic to Algeria, bound for the conference with Winston Churchill and Joseph Stalin in 1943.
Transferred to the Pacific fleet the following year, her operations including the preparatory shore bombardments at Kwajalein and Eniwetok and the screening of carriers around the Marshall Islands.
She was present for the Japanese surrender in Tokyo Bay, serving as the flagship of the Third Fleet under Admiral William F. Halsey.
She would go on to serve in the Korean War before being decommissioned into the “mothball fleet”.
Reactivated in 1984 in efforts to counteract the expanding Soviet Navy she was finally decommissioned after 19 total years of active service in 1990. Today she serves as the USS Iowa Museum at the Port of Los Angeles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: USS Hornet
description:
USS Hornet was a Yorktown class-carrier serving in the Pacific Theatre during World War Two.
She launched the Doolittle Raid (the first air operation to strike the Japanese Archipelago) on 18 April 1942.
She later participated in the crucial Battle of Midway as well as the Buin-Faisi-Tonolai Raid.
As part of the Solomon Islands campaign, USS Hornet was involved in both the capture and defence of Guadalcanal and the Battle of the Santa Cruz Islands.
It was during these latter operations that she was irreparably damaged by enemy aircraft. Abandoned by her crew, she was sunk by an encroaching force of Japanese Destroyers – her sinking marked the last US fleet carrier to have been sunk by enemy action.

Of the Yorktown-class aircraft carriers, built in a series of three, only the USS Enterprise survived the war, with the USS Yorktown sunk during the Battle of Midway.
The USS Enterprise went on to become the most frequently decorated US carrier of the war, even earning the British Admiralty Pennant, the only ship outside of the Royal Navy to do so.
She was finally put out of action in 1945 by a kamikaze attack that severely damaged the hanger deck.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Jim Prentice Electric Whiz Checkers
description:
This game is played like regular checkers except you press the Electric Spindicator when it is your turn. Where it stops determines how many spaces\players they can move:

"0" - player doesn't move - pass to next player
"1" - payer must move one checker one space diagonally forward
"2" - player must move either one checker two spaces or two checks one space each.
"3" - player must move either one checker three spaces, three checkers one space or one checker one space and one checker two spaces.

Continuous jumps are considered one move.

Moving backward and forward between two squares with a king is not permitted on a multiple move.

name: Farms and Factories: Inventions
description:
A shrewd investor builds Greenhouses and Observatories to help her fund critical research. A young business tycoon stumbles upon the Telegraph, catapulting him ahead of his peers. A group of like minded individuals decide the new invention Dynamite might help them... level the playing field. In Farms & Factories: Inventions, everyone has a chance to change the world and maybe score a few points along the way.

In Farms & Factories: Inventions (as in Farms & Factories) players draw and play Action & Building cards from a communal deck until it runs out of cards. Inventions adds a new card type, Tech, which is shuffled into a separate deck at the beginning of the game. Unlike with Actions or Buildings, a player must patent a Tech before it can be played by discarding cards from their point pile. This means each Tech requires careful analysis to decide if it will pay off in the lost points. Tech cards are very powerful however, with lasting effects that can be used as soon as they are played, and often shape a player's strategy.

In additional to 30 unique Techs, Farms & Factories: Inventions adds 35 new Buildings and Actions, adding complexity and strategical depth to the original game.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Take That, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Cardopolis
description:
Cardopolis is a solo or cooperative game where you as mayor (or co-mayor) are responsible for guiding the growth of your city to be the biggest, best city possible while protecting it from disasters!

The game is played in two Stages:
- Town stage
- City stage
During each stage, you will draw cards, play zone and building cards to grow your city, and resolve disasters.

The goal is to build your city to have the greatest Population by the end of the City stage.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Income, Layering, Map Addition, Pattern Building, Pieces as Map, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Prime Ordeal: Genesis
description:
In Prime Ordeal, two or more players take turns drafting armies from a "Spawning Pool" (a face-up collection of Creature and Bonus cards that all players have access to) to get ready for battle. Each creature has a Power Level, represented by a single number. These numbers are added together to form a player's Total Power Level when battling. As the game progresses, so does each player's army and Total Power Level.

To draft (referred to as "Create" in game), players discard combinations of Prime cards from their hands into the Prime card discard pile. Each Creature or Bonus card features a Creation Cost, specifying the combination of Prime cards necessary to create it. The Creation Cost may feature any combination of the following Prime card types: Bug, Sea, Bird, Reptile, Mammal, and Amphibian. Creatures themselves have types that directly correspond to their Creation Cost. Players are encouraged to collect creatures that share types to increase synergy and for better chances at acquiring Bonus cards.

After each player takes a turn Creating, the round concludes with a mandatory, free-for-all style battle. Each player's Power Level is compared and those with the highest or tied for highest Power Level win the battle, while each other player loses a Life.

Players draft in between each battle and the game continues until only one player remains with any Life. The amount of Life chosen before the game will determine how long a game lasts. It is recommended to start players at 7 (short game), 11 (medium-length game), or 13 Life (long game).

This strategic, card-based brawler features a modular design. The core set, Genesis, functions as a standalone game. Players may purchase expansions and shuffle them directly into the core set to change the game entirely. Groups may decide on which expansions to include and which to omit for a customizable gaming experience. Prime Ordeal is traditionally played as a free-for-all; however, its design accommodates team play as well.

-description from publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Alliances, Hand Management, King of the Hill, Variable Player Powers

name: Mingo
description:
The game is designed to help familiarize one with the multiplication table. The objective of the game is to cover numbers on a circular board with their own markers. First player to do so wins the game.

—user summary

name: Metcon: The Metcon Traffic Game
description:
A traffic simulation game to teach road rules to new drivers.

Each player takes a pair of cars and moves them by rolling dice. Road hazards are introduced at numbered squares. Hazards are played out and fines assigned and paid at court.
Event cards give and remove points. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Events, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Player Judge, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Horn of Plenty
description: Horn of Plenty is a trick-taking card game in which four players win tricks by matching colors on cards and also gain generosity tokens by being nice to the other players.

name: Planet of the Pugs
description:
There was a devasted planet called Earth.
Once were habitated by human beings, and not only: then they came.
Pugs. All over it!

Planet of the Pugs is a cooperative game for 2 up to 6 survivors, running time about 20'-30', 8+.

During their turn, players can play up 2 action (a mandatory one + an optional one) then the Pugs run their cards, to determine Devastation.

Mandatory Action:
- Draw 2 cards

Optional Actions:
- Play 1 card from the hand
- Block Devastation – discard 4 copies of the same object to turn down by 1 level the Devastation and take a Special Relic
- Switch Object with other player

World Action:
- Draw many Devastation cards, looking to the players’ cards and to reached level.

Devastation bar has 12 levels and 4 steps.
Each step add a difficulty level like not to talk at all or play cards from other player hand.
The more Devastation bar increase the more World Action will increase too.

Three Ending Game Condition
• SURVIVE: the players get up to 5 Special Relics to create the Final Defense!
• DEATH: a player lose 3 life points
• DEVASTATION: the Devastation Counter reach the Max level

name: Wordsworth
description:
A 2-player word game using the same mechanics as Mastermind.

The Wordmaker (player 1) creates a word at the top of the board and hides it with a screen. The Wordbreaker (player 2) tries to guess the word by placing Yellow pegs in the board to indicate the letter and its position in the word. The Wordmaker than replaces the Yellow pegs with Black or White Pegs to indicate if the correct letter comes before or after the guessed letter. If the letter is guessed correctly, the Yellow peg stays on the board.

Points are scored for the number of tries it takes to guess the word. The player with the lowest total score of all rounds wins.

name: NASCAR: Desktop 500
description:
Start Your Engines! Now you can hold your own series on desktops everywhere!

Players decide on the number of laps they want to complete, and place their car in the lane of their choice. On their turn turn, they spin the spinner to either move their car the number of spaces indicated, or follow the directions of the black flag space indicated. Whoever completes the determined number of laps first wins.

name: FAD
description:
FAD is a 2 player card game that puts you in the heart of gameplay. Score points by doing 'Activities' with your 'Friends', while avoiding any 'Delays'. The first to 100 points wins. The game is available as a print & play product.

Design your own character from a series of pre-made faces (like in a computer game RPG) to bring yourself into the game.

The game is a really fun, super easy to learn, card game with strategy and a little bit of luck.

There are 120 cards including:

x60 Friends cards
x30 Activity cards
x30 Delay card

name: Lakelandopoly
description: How do you make a game about the great city of Lakeland, FL? While it's impossible to include everything, we jammed all the LAKELAND we could into this box. It's full of family fun, outdoor activities, Florida history and of course... lakes, a little something for everyone! Looking for a fun way to experience Swan City? Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy your favorite LAKELAND properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! Get your game on! So choose your token and advance to GO LAKELAND! You may soon be the Mayor...or out of the game for eating too much pizza at the Silver Moon Snack Bar.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Talita
description:
The Talisman Pocket Game

Comes in a paper bag with illustration and title on the front and rules of the game for the war games on the back; The bag is 22 x 14 cm.

The rules describe two simple games, the Target Flight Game and the Capture Ships game.

Contents:

4 cardboard cards with the color-illustrated game boards for the Target Flight game.
8 game boards (2 per card) on the back of the Target Flight Game for the Capture Ships game. I believe the original game came with a small pencil.

name: 16th Avenue: The Country Music Game
description:
In 16th Avenue players try to make it in the country music industry of the 1980s. The board spaces players move through are actual locations in the Nashville area.

Players start as struggling musicians and have to collect four items (e.g. an agent and a publishing contract) to establish a career, at which point they have to collect things such as a US tour and a gold album, etc.; there are four levels of success in all.

The game was self-published under the name "Grabbitt & Hyde."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: King's Coalition
description:
The King, facing unrest at home and abroad, has fired his key advisors. Now, you have an opportunity to assemble a coalition of his subjects to take their place. Maybe you'll unite the political power of an entire class, or perhaps build an alliance across the classes. As more subjects join the court, additional strategies may arise.

In King's Coalition, each class has its own abilities and range of influence. Build your coalition by drafting a card, then discarding one from your hand — but be careful not to give your opponents the exact card they need to make their coalition outpace yours.

You have seven cards in hand to form the strongest coalition to score bonuses that are revealed throughout the game, in addition to trying to create sets and sequences.

The player who can build the strongest coalition will win the king's support...and a place at his side.

name: Corrida dos Bichos
description:
A fun race in which each player represents an animal, but no player knows who is what. Walking with all the animals is a way to confuse the players. The first three to cross the finish line receive medals, but only the player with the most gold medals is the winner. Come on, start the race and don't let them know you're winning.

Each player secretly draws an animal that they must represent and receive three cards.

On their turn, each player must choose one of the cards in his hand to discard and walk the same number of spaces indicated on the card, with the same animal drawn on it. Then he draws a card to replace his hand.

Special cards are used to bring new dynamics to the game.
The player whose animal crosses the finish line first will win.

name: Berlin'84: A Cold War 3! Skirmish Level Wargame in Berlin
description:
BERLIN ’84: Skirmish Rules for Cold War3!

August 1984, after tensions rise the unthinkable has happened!
World War III has started with the Soviet invasion of West Germany.
Berlin is surrounded and left to it’s fate with no possibility of being relieved or replenished, the units stationed in Berlin are in the fight of their lives as they are attacked on all sides by the East German Grenztruppen (Border Guards).
Desperate city fighting ensues.

Take command of either British or East German forces in street to street fighting in Berlin.
Each model represents one model and each side fields sections, with a platoon being the largest force fielded (though a company is do-able just rather large and may require more than two players!).
Each model can move and fight, with a simple wounding system.
Tanks are formidable beasts but can still be brought to their knees by rocket launchers and skill full tactics.

This title is fully compatible with ALL other titles produced by Rooksdown Games and written by Dean Wilson; so any title can be used in conjunction with this book, bringing your games of WWIII to a new level.

SIX (6) unique city fight scenarios are included as well as a full army lists for the (UK) Berlin Brigade including stats for the FV432/30 with 30mm Fox A/C Turret and for the East German Grenz. Regt. With BTR-152’s, T-55am’s and UAZ jeeps with RPG-11 recoilless rifles.

-description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Pays de Vitré-Fougères: Le jeu
description:
Pays de Vitré-Fougères is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the town centers of the Vitré-Fougères, and then go discover all the sectors with 550 questions relating to geography, history, local celebrities....
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Scoop
description:
This game is a trivia game in the paper press world. It has no relation to the game Scoop from 1953.

The aim of the game it to become editor in chief of one of the ten newspaper of the game To achieve this, the player must create a team of journalists in a newspaper to become a section editor and then editor in chief.

At the beginning of the game a player is the advisor and place its pawn in the middle of the board. The first player start the roulette on the board, when its stops, he adjusts the board to be able to enter into a newspaper building. He will then have to answer to a question thanks to a combination of numbers on the board. If he answers right, he places a pawn of his color in the newspaper. He has begun his journalist team. If his answer his wring, he becomes the advisor. The others player can try to answer to the question during the hourglass time. The first that answer become a journalist in the newspaper.

Once all players are journalists in the same newspaper they can proceed the same to access to the chief of section rank. When a player is chief of section he proceeds the same to become editor in chief.

The first to be editor in chief wins.

name: Entlang der Straße der Romanik Eine Quizreise durch Sachsen-Anhalt
description:
A quiz game (600 questions) that requires, as the name suggests, knowledge of Germany's state Saxony-Anhalt.

Players take turns to roll 2 dice and move the number of fields by either one die or by both dice round the track. The player then tries to answer a question determined by the black die (results 1, 2 or 3).

If the question is answered correctly the player receives chips, depending on the color of the field, he landed on. If the answer is wrong, a second player is given the question. A special field (the City of Magdeburg) gives the players the opportunity earning more chips. Everyone has to stay on Magdeburg till the last Player arrives getting each turn Questions with potential more points. Then the second part starts.

The game ends when the first player comes the second time to Magdeburg (different track).

The winner is the player to collect the highest value of chips.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dino Hunt
description: Two players try to remove dinosaurs from the their holes using suction hammers. The first player to achieve one of three goals (remove all the dinosaurs of their colour first, remove more dinosaurs than the other player, or remove the dinosaurs with the most total points) wins the game.

name: Suburbs!
description:
Simple and quick tile-laying discard party game, where parks and cul-de-sacs are not always a good thing, and where chance and strategy play equal parts.

In this uno-meets-domino game, your goal is to get rid of all the cards in your hand before other players, accumulating points each round.

Each card placed changes what can be played and where, so strategy allows you to plan for your hand, while frustrating the plans of other players.

Gameplay:
- Cards represent parts of a road/street – straight roads, bends, intersections, cul-de-sacs and a few parks.
- Each player is dealt a number of cards to their hand, depending on the number of players. One more card is placed face up on the table, as a starter for the neighborhood.
- In your turn, you must lay down a card from your hand that correctly connects to at least one other card on the table.
- There are a few special cards that make other players get a punishment (extra cards).
- First player to get rid of all their cards wins the round, and gets the points from other players’ cards.
- After several rounds, the winner is the first player to get to 200 points. For a quick filler you can also play without scoring, just to see who wins the round.

Suburbs! can be played from 2 to 10 players.

-description from designer

name: Cthulhu Detective
description:
In the "Cthulhu Detective" adventure game, players take up investigations of different tangled cases and mysterious stories. Players are gathering clues, interrogating suspects and matching pieces of information to successfully solve the case.

During each turn, a player chooses one of the cards available this turn.
