These cards can represent a Clue, a Location, Witness Interrogation, Special Action, etc. Using the cards, which were received during investigation, a player discovers what actually happened. The objective is to solve a case in a minimum number of turns.

-description from publisher

name: Verflucht!: Der Hinterhalt
description:
Promotional post card.
Place the ambush postcard next to the creatures display area.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology

name: Alien Mating Calls
description:
Alien Mating Calls is a hilarious party game that combines performing, deduction, and trickery. Your goal in the game is to score points by correctly pairing up with other players - while having the severe and silly limitation of only making alien noises.

The game is played over 6 rounds. A round begins with the first player prepping one of the alien decks and dealing each player one card. The card you get is your alien card for the round, and is kept secret from other players.

Players go around the table once, making a noise they think their alien might make. This is their clue to other players what alien they have. Then players simultaneously begin making their alien noises, during which each player decides to either pair up with another player by fist bumping them, or not pair up. When all players are ready to proceed, players reveal their alien cards.

Players score points based on how they paired up, with maximum points awarded to pairs of players who were alien partners and to single players who did not pair up and didn't have their partner in play. The player with the most points at the end of 6 rounds wins.

Subjective interpretations and the chance of a devious Mimic being in play makes commitment risky, and surprising misunderstandings are common. Optional Mood cards modify player calls, adding more replayability.

-description from designer
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Real-Time

name: Roll 'N Score: Official Toronto Maple Leafs Hockey Game
description: Roll 'N Score is a dice game with rules very much like real hockey. Two teams play against each other. There are power plays, breakaways, and penalties-just like real hockey. As you play, the totals on the dice, when you have rolled them, tell you where to move. The squares on which you land tell you what to do (for example, penalty of " holding" -you go to the penalty box for two turns). Everything your team does-goals, assists and penalties-is written on the scoresheet.

name: Go Adventure
description:
Go Adventure is a family-friendly card game that was inspired by one of the game creators going out on 'adventures' with his son. Sometimes their adventures didn't always go as planned. This hard-learned lesson to pack appropriately gave way to inspire children to also think creatively about going out on adventures. The objective of the game is to fully “pack” the required items needed to go on eight different adventures. The gameplay is simple and straightforward. The cards are brightly colored and cheery. Laughter will certainly ensue.

Players can only play one card during their turn but they have four choices of card type to play. They can play a Required Item card on an adventure thereby 'packing that item'. If the player places the last required item needed to be packed for an adventure, then they get to keep that adventure card pile. This drives the primary objective of the game. The remaining choices purely drive the fun secondary elements of the game. A player can use a Skip-a-Turn card thereby skipping the next player in order. A player can use a Funny Action card, which forces someone in the group to do something fun and silly that relates to the adventure themes. Lastly, a player can use a Random Item card, which can be placed on any of the adventures but the player must make up a story about how that item will be used on the specific adventure. This adds a fun storytelling element to the game. Gameplay continues until all eight adventures have been fully “packed” for and the winner is the player with the most completely packed adventure piles in their possession.

Go Adventure is unique in its mission to get kids thinking about what adventure means to them as well as what needs to be packed to go on adventures. The gameplay is quick, around fifteen minutes, and the storytelling element will continue to provide exciting replayability for families. Any extra inspiration kids and parents find to get out there and go on new adventures is free of charge!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Race, Storytelling

name: Instant Propose: Trash Girl Expansion
description:
For you who are beyond saving.

The Word Expansion for "Instant Propose". Only for Korean.
Invention! Trash Girl(Youtuber) is carefully selected, and KIMKUN(Underdog Games) is only slightly seasoned.
There are 86 Word Cards with a trashy atmosphere.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: フィギュアクイーン (Figure Queen)
description:
The trick-taking game フィギュアクイーン (Figure Queen) was released as part of the publisher ruri ruri games' (るりるりゲームズ) Spring 2019 box of trick-taking games, titled トリテセット4 (Trick Taking Set 4).

In the game, players are judges issuing scores to 5 figure skaters. The cards used in the game have ranks such as 9.50, 7.80, and 5.30, representing scores given to the skaters. As in an Olympic figure skating competition, the highest and lowest scores are omitted, and the other scores issued are averaged to evaluate the skater's performance.

Players bid on which skater they think will perform best over two rounds. The person who most accurately predicts the highest scoring skater will win!
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: Fugu Sushi
description:
In Ｆｕｇｕ　Ｓｕｓｈｉ, the players are sushi chefs rushing to complete the orders of a string of customers. It is up to the player how many order cards they reveal.

The player then flips a sand-timer and attempts to prepare the requested sushi and place it on a serving tray. The players must shape the proper amount of rice; use or not use wasabi as requested; and if the customer orders fugu, the player must use the included plastic knifes and stuffed fugu to cut off the tasty bits and omit the poisonous sections!

Once each player has a chance to serve customers, the player who earned the most points in that round earns 2 overall points and the next player earns 1 overall point. The first player to 5 overall points wins.
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: Hiding Hitler
description:
Hiding Hitler is a turn based card-game with a simple objective. End the game with the Hitler card in your hand or be the player to have eliminated him last.

To achieve this goal, you will use a mixture of Action, Attack, and Instant cards. Action cards provide various utility methods such as drawing cards, stealing cards, or peaking into the deck. Attack cards are how a player attempts to eliminate Hitler. Instant cards are special because they can be played at any time. They can strengthen, weaken, or redirect an attack to another player. A turn consists of unlimited actions, unlimited instants, up to 1 attack and concludes with drawing a card.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: King of the West: Ghost Towns
description: A free print-and-play hidden roles expansion for King of the West.
categories: American West, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Shot Tennis
description: The board is a tennis court with holes in a grid of 4x6 for each half of the court. Players use small plastic tennis rackets to catapult cones into the court. Points differ by the area of the court the cones fall at, e.g. left and right service box is 5 points.

name: La planete fantome
description: Players roll dice and move robots on a circular board divided into sectors. The robot that reaches the planet in the center first wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Whip
description:
A rather larger board game where players back lead token horses with evenly distributed game counters. One player acts as a banker. Horses are placed at the start of the track and move one square at a time if their particular number is rolled by a dice. The winner is the first to finish the race and the banker pays out on that horse. A player can also back a red or blue finish on the respective colour lanes.

The horse names represent English and Irish thoroughbred racehorses from the turn of the 20th Century. The horses were famous at the time for winning the prestigious races on the English calendar.

name: Das Labyrinth
description: The players start at the large space with the arrow. The first player to reach the large space with the black dot wins the game. Direction of movement is determined by a die. The players move 1 space per turn. If a meeple gets on an occupied space, the the first meeple is returned to the starting space.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: KOTH
description:
The board is four concentric rings linked by connector lines. Each players place, move, or jump black or white tokens on the intersections. After each move, all connecting tokens are converted to the color of the active token. The game ends when a token is placed at the center of the circle. The player with the most tokens left is the winner.

—user summary

name: New Techno War
description:
In today's world, where security is a daily challenge and terrorists and serious crime cross borders, having a modern, mobile and flexible army is of paramount importance.

In New Techno War, you will take command of a modern military troop, based on the doctrine of a real army of today, with its equipment, vehicles and real firepower.

In serious scenarios, based on real facts, but also on original and amusing adventures, you will be able to test your tactics to achieve maximum success in a mission.

In order to optimize your chances, this game proposes to introduce into the troops modern technologies, still in test phase, or non-existent. These extensions should allow you to refine or even reinforce your actions. In the basic box, you will already find the new technology of the exoskeleton.

name: Galix in München
description:
Players move on given tracks through the City of Munich to collect 7 different cards on 7 special places. After each move you are asked a question (multiple choice) about Munich. If the answer is correct you earn extra movement. If you meet another player's pawn on the track, you send him back to his starting point.

The Player to be the first on to collect 7 different Cards, wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Stadt Buch Verlag Wolfgang Giesche München

name: Terra Proxima
description:
On the verge of extinction, after years of conflict that has left their planet nearly depleted of its natural resources, the inhabitants of this world have no choice but to leave their home. They’ll accomplish this by using advanced long range spacecraft to journey to the nearest habitable world that will become their new home.


Still stubbornly divided after decades of fighting, the remaining world powers now engage in a final surge for dominance and self preservation as they race ahead to their objective. As time runs out, they now must make a hasty departure from their dying planet. In order to complete their mission, they must obtain the materials necessary to sustain themselves, maintain their spacecraft, and research the science required to navigate their way through the long and dangerous journey that awaits them. In an ironic twist, they may be forced to cooperate with one another while still protecting their own interests. Now the ultimate strategic gamble for survival will require you to be the first to arrive and claim the distant world TERRA PROXIMA...

Terra Proxima, by Bavarian Games, is a push-your-luck, resource management game that will keep you on the edge of your seat throughout gameplay! It’s intense enough to keep experienced gamers excited, but simple enough to be enjoyable regardless of a player’s skill-set! In Terra Proxima, players will travel to different Moons and Planets to gather necessary materials and research the science in order to continue their journey towards Terra Proxima at the center of the board. The first player to arrive on Terra Proxima is the winner of the game. Will you be able to get there first?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Resource to Move

name: Fishhunter
description:
A few anglers are trying to catch the best fish. But somehow your choice of place doesn't seem to be the best to reach the jumping fish.
Fill your fishing net with the best fish before your fellow players do!

Each player receives a game piece and a fishing net. The lake is placed in the center. 5 phases are played. First you draw 2 tiles from the bag. Then you can put one or both tiles back into the bag and draw again. However, this costs one tile from the net. This can be repeated as often as you like.

After that, one tile is placed in the lake based on its coordinates. The other tile is turned over and serves as a time unit. The time unit can also be exchanged in phase 4 for giving up a tile from the fishing net. ⠀⠀

In phase 5, fishing takes place. For each time unit, you may take one step around the lake and cast your fishing rod. Reeling in does not cost a unit of time. You may only cast straight ahead, so you must stand at right angles to the fish. Then the start player marker is passed on and a new round begins. ⠀⠀

In the 3-4 player game, you can save time units and use them later. If a player's net is full, the current round is still played to the end, followed by the scoring. You add up the points of the fish on the fishing net. Who is the best angler?

name: Kaiserreise Wilhelm II
description:
This is a redux of a variant of the renaissance-era Game of Goose (1587) which was themed around the era of Kaiser Wilhelm II and created around the year 1888.

According to the German designer Gerald H Kuhlmann, this appeared to be aimed at appealing to supporters of the Hohenozollern dynasty as they transitioned to the reign of young ruler who took his Grandfather's place and inspired hope of generational change.

In this game, 2 to 7 players rely on dice results to move their pieces around a spiral track toward the middle. The player who arrives first receives the tokens placed there at the start. Along the way, special space actions lead to special events, payments or profits.

When that end is achieved each player receives the tokens on the space of the monarch which was their hidden choice at the start. If players have chosen the same the rewards are split evenly. Any unchosen monarch's tokens are then also distributed evenly.

After all of this, the player with the most tokens (money) wins.

—user summary

name: Flames of War: Firestorm Campaign – Overlord
description:
Firestorm Campaign – Overlord

This campaign is designed to be flowing where the Generals take command from Round 1 and through the supply and reinforcement build-up, make strategic decisions around capturing key ground, denying enemy exploitation routes or attempting sweeping flank attacks. A deliberate inclusion in this game is the full use of Warriors as additional firestorm units; both Allied and German. They can often be the key to an unlikely victory!

Generals have much to ponder, they have to:

Consider how to manage build-up of Allied reinforcements given finite supply availability and congestion around beaches
Placement of Mulberry Harbours
Impact of channel storms experienced in Round 3
Interdiction of German supply routes
Exploitation
And much more…


The campaign has two distinct phases:

Phase 1. D-Day 6 June. Played as a series of ‘Hit the Beach’ and ‘Seize and Hold’ missions. These are described in the handbook and should be adapted to suit local situations. There are two options for the impact of these games on the main tournament or second phase.
Phase 2. Main Tournament. Designed to be played over five rounds and each round comprises a week culminating in the fifth week post invasion from 7 June to 15 July.


The handbook contains all the special rules developed for this game including:

Firestorm reinforcement for both sides
Weather effects
German scattered defenders
Game flow
Game charts
Terrain effects
Town and area defences
Suggested tournament player packs


—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Miraculum
description:
Thousands of years ago, the Book of Eternity was placed on a bridge with four sacred guardians of white and black magic to defend the balance between the forces of good and evil.

The magic that emanates from the book has sparked an ambition among its guardians who now struggle to the death to reach it and be the holder of the power of the book.

Choose your side and help the guardians to take possession of the Miraculum, the Book of Eternity.

Miraculum is a quick game based on the throw of dice to be played in pairs (2x2) or in duel mode (1x1), where you will have to choose between defending white magic or black magic.

You and your opponents will fight to the death to be the new holder of the holy book, the Miraculum.

Each turn, you will have to combine the result of your dice to be able to cast spells to attack, protect, walk, push, trap, poison, heal, reverse position or even summon a werewolf against your enemies.

There are two ways to win the game:
- Killing all wizards of the opposite color by throwing them off the bridge; or
- Arriving and taking possession of the Book of Eternity, the Miraculum.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Profi-Fussball
description: Players create and manage a soccer team by moving on a track wich provides events, opportunities to buy team members and challenges with other players. Money is the essential ressource you can gain or lose according to the events. Team members may be sold by negotiation from player to player. The Player to collect all of his 11 team members and owning the most valuable Team, wins the game.
mechanics: Negotiation, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Fussball-Match Ein Fußballspiel für Heimkicker
description:
A Soccer game for 2 or 4 players. 4 players play simultaneously two 2 player games on both identical boards.

A soccer match is played by rolling one die and moving one of the 11 pawns on the tracks, eliminating the opponent pawns by requiring the same field and moving one own pawn into the opponents goal. After scoring a goal, the game is reset, every player regains his lost pawns. Play continues until the agreed time is up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Salon de Paris
description:
It’s Paris, 1852. You are an artist with big dreams and bigger ambitions. The world’s most famous art show, Salon de Paris, is just around the corner and you are determined to be the most renowned painter hung on its walls! But achieving this won't be easy. You must walk the streets of Paris for inspiration, acquire materials at the market, gain apprentices from the academy, complete paintings in your studio, and listen to the gossip to find out which paintings are being talked about! Will you do enough to paint your way into the history books?

Salon De Paris combines worker placement, action selection, and set collection in a game filled with combos, unique abilities, and a variety of scoring opportunities. Designed for 1-4 players, the game plays in 60-90 minutes and is perfect for players 14 and up.

name: Jolly Tumbler
description: A victorian game of skill. Players try to roll their oblong tumbler into the hole for the highest points without losing it off the board.
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pixie
description: A dexterity game where players throw marbles and try to be the first to 10,000 points.

name: Game of Spin'em
description: Players set a top spinning in the center of the board. If the top starts a spinner to move, player scores the points shown. Player with the highest total wins.

name: Party Freud
description:
A new card game for people who probably need therapy and who love to laugh. (Ahem, everyone!)

Take turns playing "Doc" as players prescribe and treat some modern day ailments with comical solutions. Strengthen your funny bones and see who's the best at helping one another get through life.

The dealer (AKA the “Doc”) starts by dealing each player seven Freud cards. The Doc then draws a Party card and reads it aloud. The Party card will present a modern day ailment.

Players then choose from a range of fake treatment options through the Freud cards and toss them into a pile. The Doc then reads the fake treatment options aloud and chooses their favorite prescription. Plus, our Group Therapy prompts are hidden within the Party cards.

Group Therapy activities include:

Symptom Charades: Using the rules of charades, players act out a range of mood related ailments.
Rapid Response: Similar to categories, players shout out words to fit within a certain category.
Diagnose a Friend: Players identify who amongst the group fits a certain description.
Head Talk: The Doc places a card on their for head and players shout out clues as fast as possible to compete for the most helpful assistant.


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Medical, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Highest-Lowest Scoring

name: Machu Picchu Mystery
description: Explore the ancient Inca city of Machu Picchu in search of the lost tomb of emperor Pachacuti in this at-home escape room.

name: Dreidel Roulette
description:
On a player's turn, they spin the dreidel on the playing board containing 12 wood balls and 16 holes worth between 1-100 points. A player scores points according to the holes they knock the balls into, losing points for knocking balls out of the playing area.

The game consists of 3 rounds, with each round consisting of every player getting 1 turn. Whoever has the most points after those 3 rounds wins.

With the balls and colors both having one of three colors, there are many variants, including getting bonus points for matching certain color balls with their holes in each round.

name: Il gioco del contrabbandiere
description:
Il gioco del contrabbandiere, the Smuggler's Game.

The protagonists of this game are the "financiers" (finanza) and smugglers (contrabbandiere) who, especially from the 50s to the 70s have marked the history, economy and culture of the Como and Ticino area in Lombardy, Italy and Switzerland.

The Smugglers get 3 pawns, the financier brigadier 3 as well. Movements are from 1 point to another.

The Smugglers win if two of them reach a Warehouse on the Italian side.
The Financiers win by catching two Smugglers.

In this game there are no dice, this gives ample space to strategy. In addition there are "event" cards to make sure that everything can change until the last move.

name: KPOP: Becoming an Idol
description:
Calling all K-Pop Fans! You’ve always been in the audience supporting your favorite idols, but now it’s time for YOU to step up onto the stage.

KPOP: Becoming an Idol is a unique and exciting board game where you get the chance to experience life as a K-Pop Trainee. As you travel around the board, you’ll use Story Cards to improve your skills in Dance, Vocal and Rap, visit Clothing Stores and Salons to put together the perfect look, and show off your new skills to the world to start building up your Fanbase.

Once you’ve acquired enough fans to earn a coveted Evaluation Token, you’ll head to the center of the board to face the judge who will test your skills to their limits...and if you’re the first to impress them, you’ll become the next great K-Pop Idol!

—description from the publisher

name: Efteraber: Copy the monkey
description:
In this game, we will become adorable little monkeys who like to move non-stop.

The players will take a card from the deck and imitate the movement indicated on it. The next player will draw a new card and must imitate both the previous movement and the new one that he has chosen. Each player must repeat all the previous movements in the same order.

If a player forgets a move or does them in the wrong order, they are eliminated from the game. The last person standing wins.

There are 32 cards with 8 different types of monkeys.

name: Order & Entropy: Tactical Deckbuilder
description:
Order & Entropy is a competitive 2-4 player science-fantasy card game with immersive strategy, an elaborate art style, and remarkable replay value.

The theme of the game takes influence from our own style of science-fantasy, sociology, philosophy, and psychology.

To win the game, you can eliminate your adversaries or have the most Wisdom Points by the end of the game.

Players can eliminate each other by reducing their opponent's Consciousness Deck and Subconscious Pile to zero using Altric cards to attack them during the game.

At the end of the game, players will count all the Wisdom points on all the cards on their play mat minus their Forgotten Pile and any Banished cards.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Automatic Resource Growth, Chaining, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Solaris, the Celestial Game
description:
A 2-player game where players attempt to complete a full circuit around the board (8 phases) by completing astronomical configurations or by being in an eclipse.

One player moves his golden Sun piece around the outer track of the board. The other moves his white Moon piece around the inner track. The Master Diagram of configurations and the Scoring Chart are in the rules booklet.

name: Flip-it Auto Race and Transcontinental Tour
description:
2 auto race games on a double-sided board. Both use the same flip mechanic where players flip a disc to land on the space they want to move to or the circle which contains the number of spaces to move (depending on board) and try to avoid the spaces with road hazards. First to the end of the board wins.

Components
4 cars
2 flip sticks (Tongue depressors or popsicle sticks)
1 double-sided board
Rules

name: Rund um die Welt in 40 Minuten und weniger
description:
A flight game using the typical Parchisi/Sorry movement system. Players must move their 4 planes from their starting airport and complete a circuit around the track before ending in their L-shaped landing zone near the center.

Players must roll a 6 to move each plane from the airfield. They may move along the inner short cut track if they land on a yellow airfield and roll a 3 or 4 (equal to the number of white spaces in between) to get to the next airfield.

Components
16 metal planes (4 each blue, yellow, black, red)
1 6 sided die
1 game board
Rules glued to inside of cover
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Les chiffres croisés
description:
The principle of the game is quite simple: each player must perform the numbers indicated on cards drawn at random at the start of the game. For that he places numbered pawns on the board he is going to add. The combinations can be crossed on the board, each result being obtained horizontally or vertically.
Players score points for each combination by adding the number of tokens used to the value of the combination made. Whoever has the most points wins.

—user summary

name: Das Grosse Spiel
description:
The game is played on the large playing area with 56 picture panels, which are covered by as many stones. Each player lifts two game pieces and shows the pictures underneath. If the pictures match, the player has already won two stones.

He can also put these stones "at risk". The dice then decides how far the risk disc is turned and this shows whether the stones keep their simple value, are lost or are worth twice as much as before. Lost stones remain on the risk disc and wait for the luckier player.

The player who owns the biggest number of stones at the end of the game win.

—user summary

name: Character Critters
description:
Once upon a time there was an enchanted forest in a magical land where a playful lioness cub happened upon a storybook with the most wonderful tales. Little lioness imagined herself as the main character with a flowing cape and super strength. She showed the book to all her creature friends, who also dreamed of what it would be like to be one of these fabled names. What if all critters could become their favorite characters? With Character Critters game, you can help them reach this dream!

Character Critters is an imaginative drawing game for the whole family. Every round, each player receives a random Character Card and Critter Card and draws the Critter in the style of the Character. What would a horse look like as Rapunzel? How about a kangaroo Santa Claus? Players draw their Character Critters simultaneously and earn points by guessing drawings correctly and having their drawings correctly guessed. There are also Jr. Character cards included for younger players so they can conjure up a scientist penguin or a frog who’s a clown. With over 4,000 possible card combinations, you’ll flex your creativity and make some delightfully unique art each time you play!

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Hockey zu Hause
description:
A tabletop hockey game from the 30s for 2 players and 1 Judge/Umpire. Players compete to score the highest number of goals based on dice roles.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Player Judge, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Toy Store Game
description:
For 2-4 players. Game set up: Toy tokens are placed face down in one pile. Saleslady and rent tiles are placed face up in a second pile. Each player starts with a blank divided into 20 spaces.

Each player spins the spinner and picks up 1 or more of the appropriate tiles as indicated. When a player has filled his card, play stops and points are determined for each type of toy, again based on the results of the spinner. The player with the filled card received 5 bonus points.

The player with the most points wins.

Components:
1 double track spinner
4 blank card sheets
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Mother Goose Game
description:
Players must be the first to spin their way to Mother Goose by matching the color on the spinner to the color of the track.

Board and rules are printed in box
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Traffic: auf der Drehscheibe des Verkehrs
description:
Each player gets 2 delivery trucks and starts from the central parking lot. The players have to pick up goods at the two factories and deliver them to several shops to collect game tokens while minding the traffic rules. Movement is determined by a die. At the roll of a 6 the turntable is rotated one step to change the traffic lights and various traffic signs.

When all goods are delivered and all trucks are returned to the parking lot, the player with the most tokens wins the game.

The traffic signs show that the game was published between 1971 and 1980.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Μακριά γαιδούρα
description:
Based on a traditional outdoor game.

In Long donkey players are divided into two teams. Each team has 4 pawns and one donkey with 8 card slots. Each card slot on the donkeys is divided into two parts: The defense area and the attack area.

The pawns of each team are “climbing” on the attack area of the opposite’s team donkey based on their jump cards. The other team must put a defense card on their donkey’s defense area.

Every slot of a team’s donkey has 1 stamina value by default.
Every single pawn burdens a slot of the opposite team’s donkey by 1 weight value. No defense card needed on that slot by the defending team.

Every 2 pawns burden a slot of the opposite team’s donkey by 4 weight value. The defending team needs at least a +4 defense card on that slot.

Every 3 pawns burden a slot of the opposite team’s donkey by 9 weight value. The defending team needs at least a +8 defense card on that slot.

Every 4 pawns burden a slot of the opposite team’s donkey by 16 weight value. The defending team needs at least the +2 +6 +8 defense cards on that slot.

The end of the game:
When there is less stamina value than the opponent’s weight value on a single slot of a donkey at the end of the turn, the attacking team wins the game!

-description from designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Programmed Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Das doppelt-Sechs Spiel
description:
Game of double Six. After having staked for the pool, the players throw two dice and he who has the most points, begins. The dice under the figures show the number of points, whereas the numbers at the top indicate how much a player shall receive from or pay to the pool. The white stars win, the black stars lose. If a player throws 2 points, he gets half the pool but loses a turn. On the throw of 12 points, the player wins the game and the pool and is the starting player for the next game.

—user summary

name: I Believe!
description: The objective of the game is to be the first person to spell "Mormon". Players travel around a monopoly-style game board, moving and answering questions related to Mormonism. Players received a letter when they answer a question correctly. First to get M, O, R, M, O, and N wins the game.
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Venditio1
description: Players move their pawns by dice and learn about cusomer relationship by solving tasks drawn on special points of the gaming track. Another player (the customer) decides if the task is solved or not. Solving a task settles your progress on the gaming track, failure sets you back. The first player to arrive at the target field wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Player Judge, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Venditio2
description:
Stand-Alone addition to Venditio1 with new tasks.

Players move their pawns by dice and learn about customer relationship by solving tasks drawn on special points of the gaming track. Another player (the customer) decides if the task is solved or not. Solving a task settles your progress on the gaming track, failure sets you back. The first player to arrive at the target field wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Player Judge, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der schlaue Radfahrer
description:
Playes answer questions about typical cyclist traffic situations like "who goes first at a crossing" by laying down cards in suspected order.
The player who gave the most correct answers wins the game.

name: Le 6 à 7
description:
Players take turns rolling dice and placing pegs into holes located on numbers 1 to 6 that correspond to the roll. Each number has one hole, with the exception of 6 which has 12 holes. If the number of a dice shows a number which hole is already filled, the peg on that hole must be removed. The player who is the first to fit all his seven pegs into the holes wins the game.

—user summary

name: Goblin Trek: A Solo Game
description:
A solo game you will lead a group of goblins fleeing from the orcs in search of a new home you have to travel across the table fending off various threats along the way.

An easy to play game with lots of variety to make it different every time you play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tough Times
description:
The year is 1875 - the Wild West! Bandits & Thieves lurk about & before long Stealing & Shootouts begin. But this Wild West has a secret - the powerful Saloon Time Machine where you can erase the present! With a few supplies & a little luck, you may just survive these Tough Times!

Tough Times is an easy-to-learn die and card game for 2-4 players where you acquire and protect items by various methods to achieve stability!

SETUP:

Each player receives 5 Gold, an Invest in Gold card, and a random Job of the West card. Select a player to manage the bank and general store.

General Store cards are placed face-up and all remaining Gold Nuggets and Bars are placed nearby. Shuffle the Lucky Draw cards and place the deck face down. Remove Blizzard, Drought, and Famine from the Frontier Life deck and shuffle the rest into a face-down pile (they act like action cards). Once everyone has had their first turn, the abovementioned cards are shuffled back into the Frontier Life deck.

ON A PLAYERS TURN, THEY WILL:


PRE-ROLL (Optional - The player may do as many of these actions as they wish, in any order).
Buy & Sell Goods & Protect cards with the General Store.
Invest In Gold (Put any amount of Gold on or Take Gold off your Invest In Gold player card).
Pay 1 Gold to the Bank to exchange one of your Frontier Life cards for the top Frontier Life card in the deck.

ROLL (If you have 4 or less Frontier Life cards in your hand.
Roll the die. Draw that many cards from both the Lucky Draw & Frontier Life decks. E.G. Rolling a 1 means you draw 1 from EACH deck.
If you roll a 3, you may also do one of the following: get a lost Job back, free a Captured card, or get free from a Marshal card.

Cards You Draw:
Place Goods & Protect cards face up in front of you.
Secret Stash & Frontier Life cards go in your hand. (Secret Stash cards may be played at any time during the game).


FRONTIER LIFE
Play 1 Frontier Life card by placing it in the discard pile in the center of the table.
Discard down to 5 Frontier Life cards at the end of your turn.



Play continues clockwise with the next player repeating the above steps.

GAME END: A player has Stability when they have the following: Job, Family, Shack, Horse & Wagon & at least 10 Gold. When a player achieves stability, the Last Stand begins.

LAST STAND: an opportunity for opponents to play Secret Stash
cards to disrupt the player with stability.

Secret Stash cards can be played by any opponent in


any order.

There’s no limit on how many Secret Stash cards an


opponent or opponents may play.

If your opponents are unable to disrupt your Stability,


you win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Duelo Horripilante
description:
Duelo Horripilante is a horror themed card battle. Cards come with four powers: Terror, Dread Curse, and Repulsion. There are two playing modes. In the simpler one, you will pick a card and either choose two powers to attack your opponent with, or pick them randomly. The second card must attack with the two powers unchosen so far.
The main mode has each player lay out a row of four face down cards, then choose a different power for each of them. Compare the chosen values – the player with the highest value scores. Special cards can enhance your powers or interfere with your opponents plans.
After four rounds played with four cards each, the player with most points wins the game.

name: A Divorce of Druids and the Division of their Domain
description:
A Divorce of Druids and the Division of the Domains is a game about a druidic dyad splitting up and dividing their domain, which includes a variety of creatures and plants. The druids are torn between taking what they need to form a harmonious land for themselves and leaving their once beloved partner druid with enough to create a harmonious land as well.

Each turn, one player is the Divider while the other is the Decider. The Divider literally cuts the land into two distinct fragments, and then the Decider chooses which to take first.

Each player forms their new domain by gluing these land fragments onto a blank map. Fragments may be divided again using a limited number of additional cuts. After you glue things onto your land, you can colour them in.

Every living thing within your land has a Law determining how it scores at the end of the game. As a half of a druidic dyad, you have been responsible for half of the things within your land, so you only know half of the laws of your land. Your beloved knows the other half.

Throughout the game, you will question your beloved about the other Laws, gaining knowledge about how to score.

—descriptions from the publisher

name: Ski-Spaß Spiel-Spaß
description: Players roll and move their pawns on the skiing tracks of the gameboard and try to collect as many victory points (so called fun tokens) as possible. Events on the track make you gain or lose victory points. The events refer to the international rules of skiing.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ausgetrickst
description:
20 tokens in 5 colours are placed on a 5 to 5 grid. Each player draws a card with a pattern task of 5 tokens in one row. In each turn a player moves one token to a free space. If the situation on the board consists with the pattern task card, the player collects this card and draws a new card.
The player to collect the most cards wins the game.

name: Angel Investors
description:
Create your wealth by investing in startups. Compete and collaborate with your fellow investors to achieve return on investments.

You play on tiles and move around with you pawn. At the end of the game you will count the values of cards each investment got during the game. The play with most points (best deals done) wins.

—description from the designer

name: Skull Fiesta
description:
Skull Fiesta is a light and fun trick-taking game based on Cucumber (Agurk, Gurka).
The most important object is to not win the last trick, and if you can save the most interesting card (Skull or Revolver) to the last trick, then it will be a great surprise for your opponent...or for you!

The combinations of cards changes the end of the game and makes more and more fun and laugh!

—description from the designer

name: Altar Ego
description:
Through divine dexterity and resource (mis)management, it’s up to you to convince villagers to ignore all those other pesky gods and build you the greatest altar the world has ever seen. Y'know...or else.

During a round, one player will roll the dice. Each player, beginning with the one who rolled, must claim one of those dice and may take an action (not necessarily in that order). During your turn, you’ll vie to make your altar the greatest by building on your altar and recruiting villagers, all while trying to sabotage other players’ efforts to build and recruit.

Once a player’s altar collapses or enough chapters are collected by either a player or the kingdom, the player with the greatest altar wins!

name: Planète Rouge
description:
Planète Rouge is a trivia game about the history of the Standard de Liège, the famous Belgian football team.

More than a 1000 questions to challenge local fans of les Rouches.

name: Arena dos Gladiadores
description:
Very little is known about this Brazilian game, other than the publisher blurb:

Gladiators fight each other until only one stands alive. The one who survives is the great winner.

name: Atom@tak
description:
"The aim of the game is to make as many compounds as you can, and to destroy as many of your opponents' compounds as possible. The winner is the person with the highest score (the sum of all the atomic numbers of the elements making up the surviving compounds) at the end of the game." - Description from the instructions.

Atom@tak is a simple card game in which players create chemical compounds in order to score the most points. On a player's turn, they may play cards from their hand to form chemical compounds based on the real electron configuration of the elements involved. Some compounds are poisonous, explosive, or radioactive which can destroy opponents' compounds if they do not have a card to defend against it.

name: Knast Das Gesellschaftsspiel
description:
On his turn as a snob, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. There are opportunities to gain or lose money and there is a risk to be thrown in jail, which has a special track. On his turn as a prisoner, a player rolls one die and moves that number of spaces around the jail track with the opportunity to be released earlier than expected (and return as a snob) or to be sentenced to more time (more rounds) in jail. If the players punishment exceeds 25 years (each penalty measure is cumulative), he's out of the game.

The player who collects as a snob the critical amount of money to buy 2 expensive certificates, wins the game
mechanics: Events, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Pays d'Auge: Le jeu
description:
Gameplay: similar to a goose game, but with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities... of the area.
Players roll a dice to advance on the different circles after selecting their starting point.
The circles all have different colors corresponding to the themes (i.e. a yellow P for Personalities).
Other spaces are "Replay" or "Luck".

'Goal: be the first to reach the spaces with the coat of arms.
On these spaces, collect a photo card by answering the question correctly, get 5 and win.
mechanics: Acting, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ancient Terrible Things: Easy Focus and Doomed Scrawls Promo Cards
description:
Promo cards for Ancient Terrible Things from Spiel 2014.

“Doomed Scrawls” needs "a pair + three of a kind".
Artwork unique to each card hand-drawn by the artist at Spiel 14 Pleasant Company Games booth.

“Easy Focus” rules variant card allowing for a more powerful Focus token effect.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: ASS Mini Nr. 1
description:
Players move their 3 pawns on an abstract track by rolling 3 dice. Even numbers let you move up in the positive zone, odd numbers draw you back in the negative zone.
If your roll exceeds the track, you're bounced back. Once a pawn arrives exctly at the last field in the positive or negative zone, all players count their points of their current positions. The player with the most positive points wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Karma: The Board Game
description:
Karma: The Board Game is a roll of the dice trivia game, involving set collection, negotiation, and cooperation.

The object of the game is to achieve all four levels of evolution, (plant, animal, human and monk) to become a guru and your chance to answer the ultimate enlightenment question.

The story is that your soul has been released from purgatory and as you seek enlightenment, karma may reward or punish your past deeds.

When the game starts each player is given 1,000 karma points. Players can gain further karma by landing on one of 4 different coloured life spaces (blue, green, red, and grey). You can use karma points to pay merit to other players and unlock evolution levels. But beware, losing all your karma points will send you back to purgatory.

At the end of each round of turns all players enter karma negotiation where players can buy, sell and/or swap life space and evolution cards. After karma negotiation is completed the karma wheel is spun. Players with life space cards that match the colour spun receive merit (karma points) from other players.

As you gain merit and life spaces in the game, you are ready for reincarnation to a new level of evolution. Evolution is achieved by acting, miming and pontificating the answers to questions from each of the corresponding evolution levels.

Win the game by being the first to achieve all four levels of evolution, (plant, animal, human, monk), become a guru and answer, act or mime the ultimate enlightenment question!
mechanics: Negotiation, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: ASS Mini Nr. 2
description:
Players roll 2 dice and move one of their pawns over the grid. One die is used for vertical, the other one for horizontal movement. If you can build a line of 3, 4 or 5 pawns (including the other players pawns), each player involved scores points.
Play continues until one player scored the pre-agreed numer of victory points.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ASS Mini Nr. 3
description: A game of tossing in which each player is given 4 numbered tokens (0 to 3). Each round every player lays down one token. Players make successively declarations about the correct sum of the hidden tokens, regarding the value of their own token by placing a small player-token on one of the available numbers (0 to 18). The player with the correct declaration receives all small player tokens. Once one player lost his last own small token, the game ends. Winner is the player to collect the most small tokens.

name: Maison
description:
Known as The game of strategy and logic. Normal play is for 2 players, but there is a 4 player variant.

The object is to eliminate your opponents chips by making as many Maisons (a line formed by 3 horizontal or vertical chips of the same color) and as quickly as possible.

Each player has 9 chips, which are played alternately on any vacant field point. When all 18 chips are placed, with each player moving one chip at a time. A placed chip may not be jumped over.

When a Maison is made, that player may remove one of the opponents chips that is not in a Maison. Play continues until one player is down to 3 chips.

If no Maisons are made in 9 turns, the game is considered a draw.

Also available in Standard, Deluxe and Travel versions.

—user summary
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Batman: Perigo em Gotham
description:
From the publisher blurb:

In this exciting Gotham Danger board game, players must cross the board through the city of Gotham, beating villains such as Harlequin, Catwoman, Poison Ivy and Joker before the other players.

The board consists of 3 levels where players must move until they reach the Joker's Lair. The levels are linked by accesses indicated on the board through the villains' houses. When you conquer the villain of the first level, you are ready to face the next level and villain. The battles between you and the villains take place through a data dispute.

So you need to rely on luck in the dice and special houses to hinder opponents and / or not fall into the Joker 's house, as it will bring you down one level and will hinder your victory!

name: Lavender Fields (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Lavender has been cultivated for centuries in the countryside, the flowers are used either fresh or dried as ornamental decorations to brighten up a room, and the oil from the plant is valued for its medicinal properties. However its most important use is for the production of high quality honey for the beekeepers in the area.Lavender has been cultivated for centuries in the countryside, the flowers are used either fresh or dried as ornamental decorations to brighten up a room, and the oil from the plant is valued for its medicinal properties. However its most important use is for the production of high quality honey for the beekeepers in the area.

Lavander Tiles give the player an extra turn when he add this tile to a field where he already has a farmer.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Juice
description:
Skip, jump and takeover to win the Juice game. Draw cards, show off your math skills and win it all to takeover the city's lemonade industry. Jump over players and steal their tokens to build your empire.

Keep skipping and jumping until you get all of the tokens.

But be careful! Your rivals have their eyes on the same prize and can plan a sneaky takeover with hidden trading rules. Only the bright can truly master the Juice game.

Includes Game Board, 4 Pawns, 60 cards, 20 trading tokens, game money and instructions.

-description from publisher's website

name: Bazar
description:
The great bazaar houses all kinds of products in endless stalls along the streets, surrounded by avid merchants in search of bargains with which to make huge profits. They buy, sell, haggle, and improve the offers of their competitors; they won't waste a single opportunity.

In Bazar, you will take the place of one of those merchants in search of the most profitable deals, but keep an eye on what your rivals are doing,they may have what you need and you can take advantage of it while you derail their plans.

Bazar is a fast and light game, for 2 to 5 players, that combines worker placement, set collection and hand management. And where it will be very important to choose the correct moment for each action.

On each turn, players will move to a new location, where they can carry out their action, or close a deal to get coins. They can also activate characters that can be of great help. At the end of a number of rounds, depending on the number of players, the player with the most coins will be the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Steinmannli
description:
Steinmannli consists of 4 different game variants

1. Solitaire
One player builds a tower of stones as high as possible.

2. Contest
2 to 4 players receive an equal amount of stones and build one tower by adding one stone after the other on a socle. Stones tumbling down must be collected by the player who caused the tumbling. The first player to get rid of all stones wins the game.

3. Clean up
All stones are placed on a wooden board that is placed on a socle. 2 to 4 players remove the stones one by one until the board tumbles down or the last stone has been collected. The player with tho most stones collected wins the game.

4. Seesaw
A small wooden board is placed on a socle. 2 players receive an equal amount of stones and place them one by one on the small board. The player who makes the board tumble down, loses the game.

name: ASS Mini Nr. 4
description: Each of the two players tries to cover his 9 target squares with tokens (16x2 in four colours and shapes) in such a way that a colour and a shape occur only once in each horizontal and vertical row.

name: WAS IST DAS?
description: One player draws a card with an object pictured on the card. The other players may ask questions to the object answered by the card holder with "yes" or "no". If none of the players qot the object after 5 questions, the card holder scores one point, otherwise the player with the correct guess.

name: Panzerschiff: Expansion Set & Cruiser Module
description:
Panzerschiff: Expansion Set & Cruiser Module is an add-on for Panzerschiff 3rd ed. (available separately).
You must own Panzerschiff 2nd or 3rd ed. to use this set. Panzerschiff is an introductory-level tactical WW2 naval wargame for two players.
Famous battleships, battlecruisers, pocket battleships, heavy cruisers, and light cruisers from eight nations are maneuvered into combat, and fire their guns (or launch torpedoes) to sink enemy ships.

Panzerschiff Expansion & Cruiser Module Set contains both of these add-ons, in one package:

Panzerschiff Expansion comes with booklet with rule additions, set of 96 new warships and ship logs, and Reference Card.
Panzerschiff Cruiser Module comes with booklet with rules additions, set of 96 heavy and light cruisers and ship logs, and Reference Card.



The game uses a system based on the system used in Avalon Hill's Bismarck (1st ed.), except with additions and refinements.
You may replay historical or design-your-own WW2 scenarios.

Warships are rated in a variety of categories: bow main guns, stern main guns, port & starboard secondary guns, speed, armor, engineering, fire control, vulnerability to plunging fire, and more.
Players can look at a ship counter and its log sheet, and immediately determine its strengths and weaknesses.

The Panzerschiff game system is low complexity, and will appeal to novices or younger players, as well as to naval game vets who opt for the advanced rules that emphasize fun as well as authenticity.

With the standard game and this set, you will have all the significant warships of WW2 to play with. This new set is now available in PDF format.

WARSHIPS INCLUDED IN PANZERSCHIFF EXPANSION (48)

GERMANY (5): Graf Spee, Admiral Scheer, Lutzow, Prinz Eugen. Admiral Hipper.
GREAT BRITAIN (15): Anson, Howe, Duke of York, Nelson, Repulse, Warspite, Barham, Malaya, Valiant, Resolution, Ramillies, Revenge, Royal Oak, Kent, Cumberland.
FRANCE (2): Suffren, Algerie.
ITALY (3): Duilio, Trento, Trieste.
UNITED STATES (12): Maryland, West Virginia, New Jersey, Wisconsin, Washington, South Dakota, Indiana, Massachusetts, Alabama, Guam, Baltimore, Wichita.
JAPAN (6): Mutsu, Haruna, Hiei, Kirishima, Kako, Aoba.
USSR (3): Arkhanelsk, Kirov, Voroshilov.


WARSHIPS INCLUDED IN PANZERSCHIFF CRUISER MODULE (48)

GERMANY (6): Blucher, Nurnberg, Koln, Konigsberg, Karlsruhe, Leipzig.
GREAT BRITAIN (11): Exeter, York, Norfolk, Dorsetshire, Ajax, Achilles, Leander, Neptune, Orion, Belfast, Edinburgh.
FRANCE (7): Colbert, Dupleix, Foch, Gloire, Montcalm, Galissonniere, Marseillaise.
ITALY (6): Zara, Gorizia, Fiume, Pola, Garibaldi, Abruzzi.
UNITED STATES (8): Boston, Quincy, Canberra, Pittsburgh, Cleveland, Denver, Santa Fe, Montpelier.
JAPAN (4): Kinugasa, Mogami, Kumano, Suzuya.
USSR (4): Gorki, Molotov, Kalinin, Kaganovich.
NETHERLANDS (2): Tromp, Van Heemskerck.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: ASS Mini Nr.5
description: Place numbered point tokens (1-5) in such a way that many victory points are scored.

name: Doppel-Wort
description:
Educational game for family

A double word is one that consists of two separate words making up one word. Clues, riddles really, are on each card. This is read out. The first player to call out the double word, wins a counter and the first to win 5 counters wins the game.

Example of a double word
One word = Bild (German term for picture)
Other word = Schirm (German term for umbrella)
Together they make Bildschirm (German term for screen)

name: Kit
description:
Kit is an easy to learn game and fun for the avid card player or if you're a beginner. Rummy style game where you make kits or runs, make the right combinations, and be the first to go out - then watch your opponents scramble to cut their losses. The goal of the game is to be the player with the lowest score at the end of the 10th round by making your entire hand into kits and/or runs.

The game consists of two 44-card decks. Each deck has four WILD cards and four colors: Blue, Gold, Green, and Purple. Each color has ten cards, 3 through 12. Wild cards can be considered any number or color that you wish. There are also rotating wild cards that change every round. The rotating wild cards depend on the number of cards dealt that round. When 3 cards are dealt, the 3’s are wild, when 4 cards are dealt the 4’s are wild and so on until the last round when the 12’s are wild.

A kit is three or more cards of the same number and can be any color. You can have as many wild cards in a kit as you want. A run is three or more consecutive cards of the same color. A wild card can replace any card in a run. You can have as many wild cards in a run as you want and they can be adjacent to one another.

Dealing:
1. Shuffle both decks of cards together.
2. For the first round deal 3 cards to each player, dealing one card at a time. Note: For each round of play, the number of cards dealt increases by one card. In the second round 4 cards are dealt, in the third round 5 cards are dealt, and so on until dealing 12 cards to each player in the final round. The dealer position rotates after each round.
3. Place the remaining cards in the center of the table and turn over the top card. The stack of cards is the draw pile and the card turned up is the start of the discard pile.

Playing:
1. The player to the left of the dealer goes first and play continues clockwise.
2. Start your turn by taking the top card on the discard pile or drawing a card.
3. Complete your turn by discarding one card.
4. Continue to make kits and/or runs until you are able to go out.
5. Going out: Once all of the cards in your hand are part of a kit or run, lay down all of your cards face up on the table before discarding your last card.
Note: you must be able to make kits and runs from the exact number of cards dealt in the round. You must have one card left to discard. You can go out on your very first turn.
6. Once a player has gone out, all other players have one final turn. Start your turn as normal and after discarding, lay down your kits and runs. Any cards that do not fit in a kit or run will count toward your score.
7. The cards that are in kits and runs do not count toward your score. Players add up only their unused cards. The card values are equal to the number on the card and Wild cards are worth 20 points. The player that goes out first gets a score of -5. The scorekeeper records and adds up the score for each player.
8. The player to the dealer’s left shuffles all of the cards and deals the next round.
Note: Increase the number of cards dealt by one card and keep track of the rotating Wild cards

-description from designer

name: Tremble, Humans! Card Game: Spiel 2018 Promo cards
description:
A set of four convention promo cards:

Essen - Reward: 5, Industrial Centre / Europe

Nuremberg - Reward: 5, Scientific Centre / Europe

Columbus - Reward: 5, Scientific Centre / North America

Indianapolis - Reward: 5, Cultural Centre / North America
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Full pott
description:
The cup is placed in the middle of the board (number 7) and all the markers are placed besides the board (a "bank").

When it is your turn, you roll the two dices and put one of the marker (from "the bank") in the matching circle (from 2 to 11).
If that circle is already filled, then the player empties it by taking all the markers (putting them into personal stash).

When a player hits 7, the player has to pay one "owned" marker into the cup.
When someone hits a 12, that player gets all markers in the cup.

When all the markers in "the bank" are gone, then it is all reversed: when you hit a number: remove a marker from that number (as long as there are markers left).
When you hit a 7, you have to put one of your markers in the cup.
Hit a 12, and you get all the markers in the cup.
The winner is the one with most markers, when all are gone from the board (and from the bank).

No strategy, pure luck

—user summary

name: Abbadon's Gate Trading Card Game
description:
Abbadon's Gate Trading Card Game is a multi-dimensional trading card game that fuses collectible playing cards with tabletop elements such as dice and a multi-tiered battlefield for limitless amounts of strategy development, deck customization and hours of fun.

In a game of Abaddon's Gate, your goal is to use a combination of Character, Attack, Defense and Item Cards to develop a battle strategy to advance across the battlefield and defeat your opponent by reducing their Health Points to zero. You can also obtain special Quest Cards that can help turn the tide of the game and help you reign as champion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Trading

name: The Showdown: Cowboys and Bandits
description:
The Showdown is a one versus one strategy card game. Pick your side, the Sheriff or the Outlaws and use their unique strategies to stomp your opponent. The Sheriff likes to focus on teaming up with other cowboys to group up and save the day, while the Outlaws will use any dirty tactics they can to win. The Showdown is a deck builder that allows you to think on the fly. Use cowboys or bandits to attack your opponents life total. Whoever's life total hits zero first loses! Use gold to buy cards from the black market and craft your win condition on the fly!

—description from the description
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Pierian Court
description:
The Royal Bard is Dead!

Hark ye! By Decree of the Monarchy, all who seek to become the Royal Bard shall gather in court to test words and wits. Don't be a bum, whether rhyme or hum, and weave a tale sending your competitors in fits!

In Pierian Court, you and your fellow players act as poets competing for the coveted role of Royal Bard. You take turns playing word cards, completing poems by fulfilling specific poetry style criteria. Once completed, you perform your poem for the Court! After being read aloud, your peers then judge for quality and performance. You receive points based on votes. Whoever obtains the most points at the end of the game wins! Congrats ye Royal Bard!

—description from designer

name: Das Natur Spiel
description:
Players earn the right to move their pawns by answering questions about nature (water, plants, sun) correctly. Movement is done by a die roll. Players want to arrive at 3 special points on the grid track to collect 3 different certificates. Opposing pawns may be temporarily blocked or moved back.
Whoever collects 3 cerfificates wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: ヒモトキ (Himotoki)
description:
ヒモトキ (Himotoki) is a 2 player abstract game from Japan. Players thread a cord through holes in a board that stands between them, so that polygon shapes are formed on both sides. With only ever seeing one side, the first player to successfully declare that they have made exactly four polygons, combining the shapes made on both sides, is the winner.

The board is 21cms square, and shows a pentagon pattern on both sides, with a hole at each point and another hole in the centre. The players hold the board up between them, and take turns to thread the red cord back and forth between the holes. In doing so, the thread starts to outline small shapes, triangles and polygons, as it criss-crosses itself.

Players must use deduction and understand the patterns they can't see, so that when exactly four shapes are made, they can declare and win the game.

By passing the cord through the same hole twice or more, it might confuse the other player as to how the shapes are being formed.

If the players think that too many shapes have been made, they can declare and start over, with no winner that time.
user summary

name: Smurfs: The Lost Village
description:
Can you find the lost village before the other Smurfs?

The race is on to find the lost village. Smurfs must try to stay ahead from other Smurfs by taking shortcuts and double moves. But watch out for Gargamel and Azrael, as they will set you back in your quest.

—description from the back of the box

Smurfs The Lost Village Board Game is a great way to have fun with kids. Simple colour-based game mechanics are easy to learn, and with shortcuts and hazards along the way, the path to the lost village is more fun than ever!

—description from the publisher

name: Shark Hunt
description:
In Shark Hunt!, you and your friends are patrolling the beach for sharks that have been taking bites out of the beachgoers. You will roll a die that will indicate the movement of the sharks. Then, all the hunters will move their boats in pursuit. If a shark reaches a boat, the shark attacks and attempts to sink the boat, gaining points for the sharks! If a boat reaches a shark, the hunter attempts to capture the shark, gaining points for that hunter! If a shark makes it to the coast, they attack a beachgoer, gaining points for the sharks! It is a battle for beachfront supremacy!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Nautical
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement

name: Golem Races
description:
Ruparstein is a land that didn’t stand out from the rest of the world until their rulers decided to export their national entertainment: the golem races. Nowadays it’s a very widespread sport with lots of racers and an anxious and unconditional audience. Skilful gnomes prepare their iron golems, necromants stitch up bodies together to create their ultimate flesh golem, dwarven conjurers sculpt stone to give birth a solid runner, and a hundred other participants wait for their call to the start line. The best runners have been called. It is now the time to make your coach a rich man and to catapult him to golem’s glory.
—description from the rulebook

The game is played by a referee and multiple racers. Players create individual golems, primarily by random roll. Play then proceeds in turns, each turn spans four distinct phases. During Phase 1, players determine initiative (who will go first that turn. During Phase 2, players move their pieces in initiative order. During Phase 3, players check for mechanical problems. During Phase 4, the referee adjusts the board as needed. The game ends when the first player - the winner - crosses the finish line.

The game is provided as a PDF rules document with suggestions on common items that can be used as game components.

—user summary

name: Cra Diavolo, or, "That Ferocious and Insolent Toad"
description:
Brigand or Patriot? Sworn enemy of King Tadio Polo and his Ferach allies, the legendary Cra Diavolo is the focus of resistance against the sovereign of Nepolise. Let Todoroni rebels join battle!

An unofficial expansion for Flintloque Reloaded.

—description from the rulebook
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: The Guns of Cra Diavolo, or, "The artillery of King Polo takes flight"
description:
"Remember to act with surprise and strike suddenly. We must destroy the King's guns without fail."

- Cra Diavolo


Scenario for Flintloque Reloaded, for two players.

—description from the rulebook
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Run Like the Wind, or, "Flight is the best defense"
description:
"As my old Sarge used to say back in the Witchlands; ‘He who fights and runs away, lives to fight another day’."

- Cra Diavolo


Flintloque Reloaded Scenario (for two players)

—description from the rulebook
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: The Devil's Roost, or, "When the going gets tough, the tough get going"
description:
"Messieurs, today you have the opportunity to make a great service to our country, or to die in the attempt."

- Generale Champignon


Scenario for Flintloque Reloaded for two, three, or four players.

—description from the rulebook
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: By the Shimmering Sea, or, "Three Orcs in a Boat (To Say Nothing of the Dog)"
description:
"Well blow me down and gouge out me eye if them ain't pansy elves in them girly uniforms yonder!"

- Marine Jack Tarr


Scenario for Flintloque Reloaded (for two or three players).
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Elongo
description:
Elongo is a colourful and skillful 2-4 player tile game that reflects the life of the Maasai tribes of Kenya and Tanzania.

Players take turns laying 2 tiles and features on the tiles may be claimed or abandoned. Players compete for tile features that allow them to place their Zebu cattle, sheep and goats when features are completed.

The player who places all of their stock of animals in an enclosure is the winner.

—description from publisher

This is a tile laying game. 2 tiles are laid in each players turn, .

name: Love Links
description:
Love Links is a 2-4 player game that lets players create and wear bracelets made of precious metals and jewels.

Players place 2 bracelet links during their turn, joining to links already placed by other players according to the properties of links already played.

If a bracelet is completed then the player receives points according to length of the bracelet, the metal in the bracelet, the jewels and its other features. And the player receives the bracelet to wear!

—description from the designer

The player with the most points after all bracelet links have been played wins.

name: Triple-T
description:
The game board is nine tic-tac-toe fields in a 3x3 grid. Whoever manages to lay a line of three fields wins - but only one of the nine quadrants. It's not that easy at all: The opponent determines which quadrant you are allowed to play on with his previous move. In this way he can prevent one of his lines from being interrupted.

—user summary

name: Peter Powell's Pop Trivia
description:
The Board is a track from 1975 up to Number 1. Players must answer trivia questions on the UK pop scene for 1960 to 1986. Up to 4 players get their own question book. There are 2,500 questions in the game which is a good number and enhances replay ability.
Before the start each player writes down 10 song titles and keeps that secret.

As you move up the board (usually by rolling a die) you will land on one of 9 types of squares.

IN CONCERT - Pick another player. Pick a number from 1 to 10. That player now has to mime the title on his secret list with the number you chose. You get 2 minutes to get the song title.
BLANK SPACE - You are told a question. Get it right, you can have another turn. Get it wrong and you end your turn.
COVER VERSION - Choose another player and select a number from 1 to 10. That player now reveals the song on his list. You must then sing two consecutive lines in the song. Get it right and you get another turn, Get it wrong and you end your turn.
HYPE - Guilty of illegal song placement. End your turn and go back to Start.
BAN - Having a song banned from the radio is a sure sign of selling lots of copies. Move up 10 spaces on the board.
END OF TURN/FREE GO - No question to answer and continue your turn.
REMIX - Ask a question to any other player from your question book. If that player he stays where hew is. If he gets it wrong he moves 6 spaces down the board.
THE TOP TEN - No dice movement. Instead you answer a question correctly to move 1 space up the board. Get it wrong, you stay where you are. If you are on Square Number 2 you must answer 2 consecutive questions to get to Number One. If you get there first, you are the winner.

The game was an advertising item for Pepsi.
Peter Powell (b.1951) was a very popular BBC Disc-Jockey. His image is on the cover.

—user summary

name: Katzekartonen
description:
In Katzekartonen, two players compete to end the game with the most cats in the boxes of their color. Play occurs in two phases: first, there is the "Experimental Design." Place boxes of your color into the lab room game board. But be careful, your opponent may place their boxes inside yours, Changing an opportunity for you to score to one for them.

Once all the boxes are placed, it's time for Cat Herding! Try to place more cats in your boxes than your opponent. But cats are tricky, and rarely stay where they're placed! Place a cat beside another, and it will jump to another box, which may cause the next cat to jump, which can cause the next... It could be a whole cascade of chaotic cats. Can you tame the chaos to herd more cats I to your boxes and force your opponent to cause a "Cuckoo Kitty" and end the game?

This game utilizes a unique take on the tile-laying genre by adding a layering component and a secondary movement round. Its "strategic chaos" gameplay makes it fun for veteran "crunchy" players and new gamers alike.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Layering, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: 大怪獣ヴェナタス VS 強欲な異能建築家 (Dai kaijuu Venatas vs Goyouku na inou-kenchikuka)
description:
大怪獣ヴェナタス VS 強欲な異能建築家 (Daikaiju Venatas vs Goyoku na inou-kenchikuka) is a game from Japan with players constructing properties and sending monsters to destroy the opponents' buildings.

Over 6 rounds, players place cubes in the different sectors of the city. As buildings are constructed, the land prices rise in the sectors. Then the players send Godzilla crashing around, which brings down land prices. Then they sell the buildings if they have the matching cards in hand. Unsold buildings stay in place, risking destruction next turn.

There are caps on the number of buildings to be built or sold, and the cap rises over the game.

At the end of the game, the player who's made the most profit is the winner.
user summary

name: The Treasure Trials
description:
The Treasure Trials are an ancient contest to obtain four keys to unlock the final prize. Treasure hunters will journey through an island jungle while overcoming dangerous trials, uncovering magical artifacts, setting traps, and undoubtedly turning to thievery.

Keys are primarily obtained through mini-game trials such as racing to stack all of your dice, attempting to roll a six within six seconds, and knocking over a tower of dice! You can also obtain keys by buying them off the market with the coins you find or steal.

You group of 2-6 treasure hunters will learn the game quickly, but playstyles will emerge as differing strategies are claimed. Will you protect your coins to buy keys off the market? Hone your skills as a thief? Or seek advantages to aid you in the trials?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Flicking, Push Your Luck, Stacking and Balancing, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Agents of Kingdom
description:
What kind of game is it?

The game is played by moving the pieces on the board in the manner of Shogi or Chess. 7 different secret orders are dealt face down, and the player who moves his pieces the fastest to fulfill his secret order wins the game. The secret orders can be as simple as occupying three red squares (which can be occupied by moving pieces and entering red squares), or as complex as having the hero piece, which is one's alter ego, defeated first among all players (usually, the player loses when the hero piece is defeated).

Therefore, for example, if you forcibly aim at a red square that is not necessary, other players may find out about your secret order and interfere with it, and if you unnaturally leave the pieces that protect the heroic pieces empty, they will also find out and it will be difficult to achieve your secret order. The key to the game is how to approach the secret mission secretly and inconspicuously.

The board may be unfavorable, but...

There are two special squares on the board: the red square is a recruiting base and the yellow square is a treasure base. When you occupy a recruiting base, you can add your own pieces to it every turn. When you occupy a treasure base, you can draw strategy cards that allow you to perform special moves such as double moves.

These recruiting bases and treasure bases are the conditions for many secret orders, so you have to guess whether other players are simply occupying them to gain an advantage in the game, or whether they are actually close to achieving their secret orders.
