IJA Infantry Squad Regular (10 men with SMG and LMG)* 123 pts
IJA Infantry Squad Regular (10 men with SMG and LMG)* 123 pts
IJA Grenadier squad Regular (14 men with SMG and 3 light mortars)* 218 pts
Suicide anti-tank team Regular (one man with lunge mine)* 20 pts
Suicide anti-tank team Regular (one man with lunge mine)* 20 pts
Medium Machine Gun team Regular 50 pts
Medium Mortar team Regular 65 pts
Veteran Chi-Ha medium tank 162 pts Total: 999 pts


– Description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Speedo
description:
Speedo is a three-player group size game similar to Spao, involving both removal and placement each turn for a deeper game.
Start: The board starts empty. White places a white ball on any hole.
Play: Players take turns:

removing a movable ball of any colour, and
placing two balls (one of each colour not removed) at any two playable points.


End: The game ends when the pyramid is completed. Each player counts the sizes of their visibly connected groups and multiplies their counts together. Highest score wins.

Like Spao, each game will last exactly 30 moves. Unlike Spao, hidden connections do not count, and the combined removal and double placement leads to more complex and dynamic board positions.

name: Plucky Penguins: Merry Christmas Promo
description: Merry Christmas promo card, reading: Santa Penguin gives you 2 fish and wishes you a Merry Christmas!

name: Galleys: Lepanto 1571 – Fast Play Rules for 16th century galley warfare
description:
Rules for refighting the great galley battles of the 15th and 16th century in the Mediterranean.

The rules include all types of galley from the smallest right up to the giant Galleases of which only a few were built but were the dreadnought of their day.
Both cannon fire and boarding rules are included.

—description from the publisher

1/1200 scale models to go with these rules are available from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Flitter
description: A card game about capturing the attention of hummingbirds. Draw in the most valuable birds
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Galleon 1500-1600: The Spanish Armada
description:
These rules cover the Spanish Armada period in the Atlantic.

These are designed for 1/400th scale model ships.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF ships sheets for England, Spain and Portugal. Race built galleons, Great ships and Carracks are available from the publisher.

—description from the publisher

Several ship models are available from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Rules
description:
This set covers 1860 to 1890 and covers the time before quick firing guns and destroyers, torpedoes and machine guns on ships.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF of ship sheets for British, French and Italian ships, reload counters and speed counters available from the publisher.

–description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War I

name: Albania: The Epic Italian Invasion of Greece
description:
This is a two player wargame covering the titular invasion. It is a divisional game, according to the rules, and turns are one week each. A map scale is not given.

The rules leave a lot of basic movement and combat procedures unspoken (it is stated that familiarity with other games is assumed). Many rules are devoted to the difficulties of moving, fighting, and supplying units in the mountainous terrain.

The game generally lasts for 12 turns but may be extended up to 16 by the Italian player at a cost of 15 victory points per turn. Victory points are earned by eliminating opposing units, holding certain cities, and (for the Italians) exiting certain parts of the map.

Fixed reinforcements enter on the second turn and the Italians may bring in optional reinforcements later at a cost. A few British units and RAF support may appear later as well.

The game can be combined with Egypt: David vs. Goliath – The Italian-African Campaign and Crete, Gibraltar, & Malta.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Zone of Control

name: Ironclads 1860-1918: South American Wars
description:
Ironclads 1860-1918: South American Wars covers the South American Wars of Independence.
These include ship sheets by pdf for Spain, Chile, Peru, Ecuador, Argentina, Brazil, Mexico, Uruguay, Paraguay and Venezuela.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF ship sheets for ships, reload counters and speed counters available by email from publisher.

1/1200 scale models to go with these ship sheets are available from the publisher

name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Gulf of Riga 1917
description:
This set covers the fascinating little war between the Germans and Russians in 1917.
With Russia crumbling and in a revolutionary state the Germans tried to push into the gulf of Riga to support their armies while the Russian navy tried to stop them. While the Germans appear to have overwhelming power with many dreadnoughts the Russians have vast mine barriers and the shallow waters of the Gulf of Riga on their side. Russian shore batteries are also very effective while they are manned by loyal crews. Ship sheets for both the Russian Baltic fleets and the Russian Army shore batteries as well as the German navy are included.

A5 size booklet Rules come with shooting charts and turning circles. PDF ship sheets for Russian ships and batteries and German ships, reload counters, speed counters and fortifications sheets to cover the Turkish defences. These rules also cover naval war in limited visibility, forts and shore defences, mines, and crew quality.

—description from the publisher

1/1200 scale models also available from publisher
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Turkey 1914 to 1917
description:
This covers the war with Russia in the Black Sea as well as the allied bombardment of the Dardanelles.
See if you can force a passage through to Constantinople and end the war or the ultimate prize can you sink the Goeben...

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF ship sheets for Britain, France, Russia, Turkey and Bulgaria ships, reload counters and speed counters are available by email from the publisher.

You don't need the main Ironclads 1860-1918 rules to play this war-game as all relevant rules are included in this set.

—description from the publisher

1/1200 scale models also available from publisher
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Ironclads 1860-1918: American Civil War Supplement
description:
These also include mines, visibility and night fighting and include ship PDF sheets for both the Union and Confederacy.
These rules also cover naval war in rivers, limited visibility, forts and shore defences, mines, spar torpedo boats and interaction with land forces.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF ship sheets for Union and Confederate ships, reload counters and speed counters are available from the publisher.

The main Ironclads 1860 - 1918 rules are not needed to play this war-game as all relevant rules are included in this set.

–description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: The Sun Traffic Game
description:
A board game from the 1930's that teaches Australian children road safety as they travel from home to school and return home again. Up to 4 players follow a numbered path of red or yellow squares along a road that crosses train, tram and other intersections. Movement is by throw of a dice and landing on a red square will incur a penalty. First to return home is the winner

Produced most likely as a supplement in "The Sun News Pictorial" which was a popular morning tabloid newspaper distributed in Melbourne and Victoria, Australia.

The game states the following " This game is made available by the Sun News Pictorial in co-operation with the National Safety Council for the promotion of a better understanding of traffic rules and regulations among children".

A second and probably original version was produced by the National Safety Council of Australia and differs slightly in the text in the left column and in the advertising signage near the train and playground

—user summary;;

name: Zeitreise durch das 20. Jahrhundert
description:
The game aims to encourage players to talk about certain topics. The players (2 players each as a team if there are more than 4 players) move their game pieces over an abstract plan with colour fields and collect colour cards. These cards can be used on communication fields with corresponding colours. Blue communication fields allow to describe a typical word from the 20th century and the other players have to guess this word. On red squares, players are asked to comment on one of 4 topics. Whoever has solved the tasks in all colours can enter the target field. Points are awarded for tasks solved, words guessed and the first player at the finish line.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Krimihaus
description:
In a four-story house, a series of crimes happens that need to be solved. The players move through the house as investigating commissioners and search for the perpetrators on the basis of their written work assignments. The house can be variably rearranged for each game, so it always remains exciting. Reading comprehension, reading speed and reading are promoted playfully.

But also for children who are not yet reading, the game is not too short, because the cards are read to them.

Logical thinking and reasoning are trained, as the criminal is deduced from circumstantial evidence and the solution is determined.

—user summary
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Events, Storytelling, Track Movement

name: Würfle dich gesund
description:
The game is about dealing with the appetite for apples, chocolate, cigarettes, alcohol, medications and drugs. First, you put together your game piece from cards. Turning them over reveals the inner life, the organism, of the character on which the "stimulants" circulate. In addition to the luck of the dice, tactics also play a role in determining whether the character is in bad shape or whether you can help him break bad habits or get a grip on his alcohol problems.

There are situations in which health is put at risk or promoted.
To win you must have done the following things:

you must have your own token on all the colored consumption playing fields
you must not have a token on any of the sickness playing fields
you must not have any more tokens on the black points or the supply bag
the products on the target fields must be converted into apples.


—user summary

name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Battle of Lissa Supplement
description:
The Battle of Lissa and The Crimean War.

These also include fortifications and shore bombardments and include ship sheets by pdf for Italy, Austria, Russia, Britain and France as well as the major forts in Sevastopol.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF ship sheets for British, French and Italian ships, reload counters and speed counters available from publisher.

You don't need the main Ironclads 1860-1918 rules to play this war-game as all relevant rules are included in this set.

–description from the publisher

name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Pre Dreadnought Wars Supplement
description:
Ironclads 1860-1918: Pre Dreadnought Wars Supplement cover from the Spanish American wars, The Sino Japanese wars and TsuShima and include crew quality and ships sheets by pdf.

A5 size booklet Rules come with turning circles.
PDF ship sheets for Japan, Russia, China, Spain, Britain and America ships, reload counters and speed counters available by email from publisher.

Several ship models are available from the publisher.

name: strategie
description:
One player has the task of arming Austria and defending it successfully at the national borders against a deployment of the Western and Eastern powers (2 other players).
The available units are divided into infantry, pioneers, artillery, tanks, transport vehicles and aircraft with different moving ranges. Austria starts with 11 units of infantry and can gain new units if the Austrian Parliament agrees (random decision). The Western and Eastern powers must each combine their initially scattered units into formations and march to the Austrian border.
The Western and Eastern powers win if Austria cannot stop a march on the border. Austria wins if the last parliamentary decision has been taken.

—user summary

name: Sumos al Ataque
description:
Every year the best sumos fighters meet, in search of winning 2 of 3 matches, a card game that simulates sumos fights, pushes your rival, knocks him down, gets energy by eating, and prevents the referee from disqualifying you for doing trap.

How do you play? Each player chooses three actions, has two meeples (sumos), and a maximum of four cards in hand, from which they draw from a deck and discard the ones they use.

How do the players do the actions described with the cards?
With the cards moving to his meeple (sumo), he can attack, push, knock down, cheat, he can also draw a card or reserve it to play later.

How do you win?
There are three victory conditions, the one who takes the sumo off the floor, the one who shoots a sumo twice, the one who gets caught cheating.

Cada año los mejores peleadores de sumos se reúnen, en busca de ganar 2 de 3 enfrentamientos, un juego de cartas que simula las peleas de sumos, empuja a tu rival, derríbalo, obtén energía comiendo, y evita que el arbitro te descalifique por hacer trampa.

¿Cómo se juega? Cada jugador escoge tres acciones, cuenta con dos meeples (sumos), y cuatro cartas máximo en mano, de las cuales va sacando de un mazo y descartan las que usen.

¿Cómo hacen los jugadores las acciones descritas con las cartas?
Con las cartas mueven a su meeple (sumo), puede atacar, empujar, derribar, hacer trampa, también puede sacar carta o reservarla para jugar después.

¿Cómo se gana?
hay tres condiciones de victoria, el que saque al sumo de la duela, el que tire dos veces a un sumo, el que lo cachen haciendo trampa.

name: Ironclads 1860-1918: Scenarios Vol 1
description:
Ironclads 1860-1918: Scenarios Vol 1 This set of rules includes one scenario for each of the following sets of rules, Ironclads 1860 to 1918:

Lissa and the Crimea,
American Civil war,
South American wars of independence,
Pre dreadnought wars,
Turkey in the black sea ,
The gulf of Riga 1917.


There are some additional rules and ship sheets included in this set.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War I

name: Fast Play WWI Fleet Actions: Jutland 1918 Scenario
description:
These rules are for use with very large scale fleet actions. They give the possibility of refighting an action as large as the battle of Jutland in just a few hours.
They include full information to fight with the ships that existed at the time in the squadrons they were actually in.
Counter sets for each squadron are available by email once you have bought the rules.

What if Jutland had been refought in 1918 as the German High Command wanted to.
By this time both fleets were vastly different to those that fought at Jutland in 1916.
The British had 12 major warships with 15” guns and the Germans had their own 15” gunned dreadnoughts available. The British also had two whole units of aircraft carriers with torpedo dropping planes. The Germans had shore based aircraft and Zeppelins.
Rules include all ships in the Grand fleet and the High Seas Fleet as they were in 1918 as well as aircraft, submarines and aircraft carriers.

A PDF file of ship counters is also available by email from the publisher.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Fast Play WWI Fleet Actions: Mediterranean Navies Scenario
description:
These rules are for use with very large scale fleet actions. They give the possibility of refighting an action as large as the battle of Jutland in just a few hours.
They include full information to fight with the ships that existed at the time in the squadrons they were actually in. Counter sets for each squadron are available by email once you have bought the rules.

These cover all the navies of the Mediterranean including navies of France, Italy, Austria Hungry, Turkey and some British and German ships.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Cinder Shire
description:
Cinder Shire is a competitive collection game made for 2 to 4 players.

You and your friends have all received a letter with an offer of glorious treasures and wealth to the first one to complete a full collection of magically imbued artifacts.

In Cinder Shire, you and your friends will delve deep into a magical abandoned dungeon that can imbue lost artifacts with its magic.

Every Attempt to map out the dungeon has lead to failure, some say that the magic makes the walls shift when no living soul is within.

Be the first to complete a full gear set and claim the key to the castle and all that lies within.

But be careful the dungeon can sense your presence, each time you enter, the dungeon will react.

Use the magical items you've collected to your advantage or to your friends' disadvantage.

Cinder Shire comes with 19 different consumable cards 54 unique gear cards each providing a unique ability or effects all with custom-made high fidelity artwork especially made to make Cinder Shire the most unique board game on the market
Each game has been carefully assembled to provide the most immersive experience of a fantasy medieval experience.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Income, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pieces as Map, Push Your Luck, Race, Resource to Move, Semi-Cooperative Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Aduanas y aranceles
description:
Game of economy, about world trade, ships, exports and imports, empires are destroyed and now they are forced to trade to prosper, they have been transformed into countries, each one has a resource, to trade.

How do you play and win the game?
Each country produces a resource, has two ships, each one has a personal board with its customs area and character card. The objective is to send ships to other countries to buy resources, or if you go to islands you can steal resources, and then unload them at customs, these resources are exchanged for resource cards, the first country that collects three cards wins.

How do players trade?
If a ship arrives in a country, it has the option of buying resources, which are guided by the market price. If there are many resources it will be sold cheaply and if there are few resources it will be sold high.

What are the players doing?
Each player must send ships, to gather the resources or play the event cards (war, tariffs, exchange) that will serve to ruin the plans of the other countries, when you gather the resources that the resource cards ask for, you take it.

Juego de economía, sobre comercio mundial, barcos, exportaciones e importaciones, los imperios están destruidos y ahora están obligados a comerciar para prosperar, se han transformado en países.

¿Cómo se juega y gana el juego?
cada país produce un recurso, cuenta con dos barcos, cada uno tiene un tablero personal con su zona de aduana y carta de personaje. El objetivo es enviar barcos a otros países para comprar recursos, o si va a islas puede robar recursos, para después descargarlos en la aduana, estos recursos se canjean por unas cartas de recursos, el primer país que junte tres cartas gana.

¿Cómo comercian los jugadores?
si un barco llega a un país tiene la opción de comprar recursos, los cuales se guían por el precio del mercado, si hay muchos recursos se venderá barato y si hay pocos recursos se venderá caro.

¿Lo que hacen los jugadores?
cada jugador deberá enviar barcos, para juntar los recursos o jugar las cartas de evento (guerra, aranceles, intercambio) que servirán para arruinar los planes de los demás países, cuando juntes los recursos que pide las cartas de recursos, te la llevas.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Economic, Educational, Nautical

name: Operation Market Garden: Scenario 2 – Attack of Panzer Brigade 107: For Rapid Fire! Rules
description:
German attempts to secure the Bailey Bridge crossing of the Wihelmina Canal at Son.

A merger of the events of the 19th and 20th September.

The PDF also includes vehicle and gun statistics for the Reloaded version of Rapid Fire rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Operation Market Garden: Scenario 3 – Assault on the Waal: For Rapid Fire! Rules
description:
The Allied attempt to secure a bridgehead over the river Waal at Nijmegen.

The PDF also includes vehicle and gun statistics for the Reloaded version of Rapid Fire rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Operation Market Garden: Scenario 4 – The Final Push: For Rapid Fire! Rules
description:
The Allied dash to clear the way to the Arnhem road bridge and link up with the Poles at Driel.

The PDF also includes vehicle and gun statistics for the Reloaded version of Rapid Fire rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Operation Market Garden: Scenario 5 – Charge of the Paras: For Rapid Fire! Rules
description:
1st Airborne’s attempt to break through to 2 Para’s precarious hold of the Arnhem road bridge.

The PDF also includes vehicle and gun statistics for the Reloaded version of Rapid Fire rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Operation Market Garden: Scenario 6 – Out of Ammunition: God Save the King – For Rapid Fire! Rules
description:
Colonel Frost must hold on to their bridgehead until reinforced by the rest of the the Division.

The PDF also includes vehicle and gun statistics for the Reloaded version of Rapid Fire rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Metal Mickey: All Around the House Game
description:
Each player receives 13 figures to be placed on a 6x6 board (the house) with point from 3 to 8. The figures are placed alternately. They have to be placed horizontally or vertically in line with the previous figure. No other piece may be on this line. As soon as a player can no longer place a piece according to the rules, the other player wins the game with as many points as the last square he occupied. The player to score at least 17 points by winning several games wins the match.

—user summary

name: Blumenwiese
description:
The players are walking on the flower meadow and want to pick flowers. Before one can be taken away, however, a flower of the same color must first be brought to bloom in another part of the meadow.

When all the flowers have been picked, the game is over. Whoever has picked the most flowers is the winner. If the number is the same, the corresponding players have won together.

—user summary

name: HypoVision
description:
The players move their game pieces across 3 islands and are asked questions on the topics of economy, banking, sport, art, environment and "Hypo-Bank", the correct answers to which earn points. Changing the islands increases the multiplier for the points paid out (1x, 2x, 3x). In addition, there are events that influence the score. The game ends after a previously agreed playing time or when a certain score has been reached by a player. The player with the most points wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mobility
description:
The aim of the game is to keep greenhouse gas emissions from transport as low as possible in real-life examples. The means of transport available in the game are bicycle, train, underground, tram, ferry, electric car, bus, hybrid car, conventional car or plane, each of which has its specific CO2 equivalent per person-kilometre. The players should now find a suitable solution for the annual mileage in a case study of a fictitious person (commute to work, holidays, leisure time, excursions). The player or game group that proposes a practicable solution with the lowest emission wins the game. Different large wooden cubes are used for a vivid representation of the emissions.

—user summary

name: Mondgewitter
description:
You place cards with clouds, green and yellow moons, lightning or black holes in a spiral on the crescent moon. In your turn, you lay a maximum of three cards and move your figure. Edges must match when you lay cards. If you cannot or do not want to lay cards, you draw a card. Restrictions apply to the laying of the individual motifs. Cards laid during the turn determine the movement range of the piece. At the end of the spiral, you turn around; on clouds, opposing pieces are captured and special rules apply again for some motifs. In a game of two, you win if you are not at the end of the spiral, otherwise you win if you have moved the furthest.

—user summary

name: Scots Raid: A Solo Game
description:
Set in the Dark Ages you command a small force of Scots raiding across the border into the lands of the Anglo-Saxons, the game is played over two scenarios the raid itself and the escape as you try to outrun the pursuing Anglo-Saxon forces.

Ideal for 28mm figures but can be played in any scale as long as the figures are individually based.

Simple to play but the random events should make every game different.

Turn Sequence:

Activate Scot forces
Activate Anglo-Saxon forces
Roll for Anglo-Saxon reinforcements
Roll for random events


—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Flames of War: Hungarian Starter Force – Assault Gun Battery
description:
In 1944 Stalin’s Red army is on the attack.
While it throws the Germans out of Byelorussia, it also goes about defeating Germany’s allies; Finland, Romania and Hungary.
The Romanians hold off the first Soviet attacks, but a second massive offensive in August 1944 sees them overwhelmed. They surrender and swap sides to fight alongside the Soviets.
Meanwhile, the Finns also fight for their survival as the Soviets attempt to steamroll them out of the war. They fight the Soviets to a standstill and agree a peace, but are forced to to turn on the Germans.
Then three massive Soviet Fronts turn on Hungary, defended by six German and Hungarian armies. The great red sledgehammer is soon swinging, as the Soviets and Romanians launch an assault toward Budapest. Axis armoured forces attempt to stop the encirclement of the city. This savage and bitter struggle will last for 100 gruelling days.

—description from the publisher

name: States of the USA
description: Players identify states based on their flag, capitol, shape, or landmark. If a player correctly identifies a state, they get to answer a trivia question about the state.

name: ベストフレンドShiitake. (BestFriendShiitake.)
description:
BestFriendShiitake. is a special version of BestFriendS; a game that players can get to know more about each other by trying to come up with the answer that would best satisfy the question giver. The BestFriendShiitake. includes a special supplement book written by Shiitake., the Japanese popular fortune teller, and can be enjoyed as a psychological test.

In this game, players take turns one by one, and become a question giver. The giver draws a question card randomly from the draw pile, and announces the question written on it. There are questions like "What do I think is the must have food for picnic?" or "What do I want?" Other players write the answers that would most please the question giver according to the giver’s character and taste, and submit it to the giver. For example, you could write sandwitches, rice balls, or summer rolls for must have food for picnic.

When everyone's answers are submitted, the giver shuffles the answers and then looks at them secretly. This is the best moment in this game! Looking at the answers everyone wrote to please you makes you happy and blushing.

The giver ranks the answers depending on their subjectivity, reveals and announces the answers from the least accurate without identifying who has written what. It would be more fun if you comment when you reveal an answer. Lastly, announce the best one. Only the person who wrote that answer claims it, and they get the question card as a point.

Keep doing this, and the game ends after certain rounds. The person with the most question cards is the winner.

name: Ostfriesen Roulette
description:
Each player receives 5 dice. Whoever has dice left at the end loses, everyone else wins.
A player starts by rolling 2 dice. If he throws a double, he must take them back. If he throws different numbers, they remain and he may throw one more of his remaining dice or pass. Then the other players follow. Every time a 6 is thrown, that die is removed from the game. If a number occurs twice, the player must take these dice back into his hand and it is the next player's turn.

—user summary

name: Daniel und seine Freunde
description:
The players move their game pieces along a route by rolling the dice and experience some events from the life of the prophet Daniel. In addition, 2 non-player figures move, the lion and the fire, which prevent the players from moving forward. On the way, lion cards and name cards can be collected, which bring additional points at the end of the game. The game ends when 2 players or 1 player and the lion figure have reached the goal, for which points are awarded. The player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Strategie 2000
description:
Like in Chess, 2 players sit opposite each other and lead their pieces from an oil company (tankers, pipelines, oil tanks, drilling rigs, company boss and general manager) on an 8x8 board. The figures are assigned short (1 or 2) steps or long (any number) steps. At the beginning of each turn, a player receives income for some of his remaining figures and can then move 2 figures, but must pay for their movement. Opposing pieces are captured as in chess, but can be bought back. As soon as his group leader has been defeated or the player can no longer pay for piece movement, he loses.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Income, Pattern Movement, Static Capture

name: 90 Jahre IDT
description:
The players roll the dice and must bring their two pieces to the finish. Other pieces can be captured and have to start again. The player may decide which of his figures is moved. Events flavoured by IDT company lurk along the way. The player who gets both pieces to the finish line wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Walk'n'Wag
description:
Your dog scratches at the door, their whole body wiggling with anticipation. They look back at you, tongue falling out of their mouth as they grin eagerly. Your best friend knows you are busy, and they have been very patient… but now it is time for a nice, long walk.

This is a solo game about walking good dogs, trying to tire them out while keeping them as happy as possible. Choose one of the eight dogs available, or follow simple rules to create your own! Randomized card draw and weather patterns mean you'll never take the same walk twice.

To play, all you need is a deck of playing cards, a pencil and paper, and a copy of the game.

Your dog has two stats: Satisfaction and Energy.


Your Walk ends when your Dog has 0 Energy and 10 Satisfaction, OR if you flip over every card.
Be careful! If your dog’s energy would ever drop below 0, they instead lose 1 Satisfaction!
If your dog’s Satisfaction would ever rise above 10, they instead gain 1 Energy!
At the end of the Walk, give yourself 1 point for every point of Satisfaction your Dog has, and subtract 1 point for every remaining point of Energy that your Dog has.
10 Points is a perfect score!

name: Running With a Mouthful of Toast
description:
Your lousy alarm clock didn’t wake you up when it was supposed to - or did you hit the snooze button too many times? You can’t remember, and at this point, that’s not important!

Because you’re about to be late for school!

Quick, get dressed, grab your bag, and don’t forget to nab a piece of toast on the way out (even in these dire circumstances, the importance of breakfast can’t be understated)!

Running With a Mouthful of Toast is a one-player game blending the silliness of Saturday morning cartoons with a handful of screwball anime tropes.

Place 11 cards face-down in a row. Place one Joker at either end of the row of cards, and the other at the opposite end. Place your token on one of the Jokers. This is your home. And see that other Joker, all the way at the other end of the row? That’s your school. You know the route well, but that doesn’t mean you’re gonna make it without any unexpected complications.

Your Time starts at 5, and it’ll go down steadily, as it is known to do. You’ll want to track this number accordingly, perhaps with a die, a piece of paper, or your phone, but be warned - if it hits 0 before you make it to school, you’ll be sent to detention!

name: Wargaming in Egypt and the Sudan
description:
There's something about Victorian colonial exploits that stirs the blood.
Grim faced, khaki clad infantry faced by overwhelming numbers of tribesmen who know no fear and take on troops armed with modern rifles, artillery and machine guns while they themselves have only hand held weapons.
In the Sudan it is all there - the 'fuzzy-wuzzies' of Kipling, the Indian, Egyptian and Sudanese troop types, the renowned Highland infantry, the 21st Lancers, the Camel Corps, the Naval Brigade, the Gatling gun, gun boats, arid terrain, the River Nile - marvellous stuff!

The aim of this book is to provide the reader and war gamer with some idea as to how the campaigns were fought and how they might be re-created on the table top.

This scenario booklet covers three campaigns:

the Nile Campaign 1882,
the Gordon Relief Expedition 1884-1885 and
the Re-conquest of the Sudan 1895-1896


–description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Hack Slash Loot
description:
This expansion comes with a ton of new content and new mini games to keep the game fresh and funky every time you play it. You will be greeted by 3 new heroes: Rogue, Brawler, and the Artificer. There are also new dungeon tiles to explore, events to defeat, more pets to love, and spells to learn.

NEW CONTENT
CHEAT CODES: It has a new Cheat Chest in which you must pick the lock to even open it. If you open the chest, you will be granted with a very powerful cheat code.

WANDERING MONSTERS: These monsters can make an appearance and really shake things up. When you draw this Monster Enhancer, you must draw a Wander Monster which truly can be at any level of difficulty.

CRAFT: You can now craft in the dungeon. Merge 2 treasures together to create 1 stronger treasure!

NEW CO-OP RULES: There are now better rules for trading items in the dungeon as well as assisting in combat with other heroes.

BONUS EXPANSION SUNKEN TREASURE
This is a bonus expansion that you may include into your game. This includes a new hero; the Beast Tamer.

FISHING: You can now fish on water spaces in the dungeon. If you are able to catch these fish, you may feed them to your pets. This will transform your pet into a strong monster with a greater bonus stat. Of course, this is temporary and your pet will then transform back at the start of the next floor.

SUNKEN TREASURES: You can even gain new treasures by fishing, one of which is the powerful artifact THE 7 SEAS SWORD!!!!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Word for Word
description:
Each player takes five face-down letter tablets after shuffling. Divide black tablets equally between all the players. Players then take turns placing black tablets on the board, leaving at least one square (including diagonally) between tablets. Players then take turns making words on the board using the letter tablets, ensuring that the word fits between two black tablets. Each tablet in a completed word scores one point. Highest score wins the game.

—user summary

name: Ho-Mo
description:
The game is similar to Chess or Draughts. The game board is a 17x25 square grid with red lines demarcating the center circle and penalty areas, hence resembling a soccer field. Five squares on each half of the playing field has a ball. Each player has 11 pawns. Players move alternately and the objective is to move the players directly behind the ball squares. There is no moving ball in this game.

—user summary

name: Abduction!
description:
(from the rulebook)
They're here!
Abduction is a set of fast play Sci-Fi rules. They are set in a near future America, in a time when alien encounters have become common, and fights between American defence forces and alien snatch squads are everyday occurences. These rules are designed to recreate these encounters; fighting small skirmishes between a dozen or so human figures and a handful of aliens.

Published as 16p A5 booklet, also containing a quick reference sheet.

name: Bog-a-ten
description:
Being a lively distraction for gentlemen and ladies not of a nervous disposition, involving cards and miniature figurines.

The game is an expedition towards the mystical temple of Bog-a-ten. Parties travel from island to island, encountering prehistoric monsters, traps, and other enemies.

The game started as a convention game at Salute '97 (miniature wargaming convention), but the rules were published as an A4 spiral-bound rulebook, counting 18 pages.

Each player starts with a party onboard a small ship. Movement by ship is between islands. Once the party sets foot on an island, an encounter can occur, a trap can be found, etc. The goal of the game is to reach the island with the temple, and trying to escape again, upon which the game is won by that party.

The whole game is played on a table with scenery, miniatures, etc.

—description from the publisher
publishers: HLBS Publishing (The Honourable Lead Boiler Suit Company)

name: Might and Main
description:
These rules are designed for wargaming naval battles of the medieval age in the seas of Western Europe. The rules aim to give the feel of the period, whilst being simple and fast-playing. Book-keeping has been kept to a minimum and the types of ships involved have been simplified into broad categories.

—description from the rulebook

name: Scutarii: Tournament Edition
description:
Scutarii: Tournament Edition is a complete miniatures system for the Age of Antiquity.
Covering the period from 3000 B.C. to 1450 A.D., Scutarii brings to gamers a fast-paced system with all the detail designed to resolve large scale battles within three to four hours.

Covers all the major and minor weapons and tactics
Can use any basing and scale from other popular rulesets
Get a conclusion within three to four hours
Designed for scenario and tournament play
Complete point system and various optional rules
Full army lists included
Nine complete scenarios included: Hydaspes, Raphia, Pharsalus, Nemea, Marathon, Asculum, Callinicum and more!
Conversion tools for using other popular army lists
Weather, terrain and strategic movement


–description from the back of the book

name: Eagle's Prey: Advance & Retreat – Regimental Rules for the American Civil War 1861-1865
description:
Eagle's Prey: Advance & Retreat Regimental Rules for the American Civil War 1861-1865 is a complete and comprehensive supplement for the Age of Lincoln and the American Civil War!

Advance & Retreat allows players to refight the struggle the Union!

Refight the battles or create new ones with our scenario generation tools
Allows for a 20,000 man game to be completed in 3-4 hours
Can be used with any scale and no rebasing needed
Covers the various factions and forces list
Features HRG’s Terrain Generation system
Follows historical organization and unit capabilities
Includes a Scenario generator and player aid tools
Rated Leaders for Brigade and Division command
Command Brigade Level or regimental action
Includes a scenarios with more available online Features Naval rules for transports
Can be used with CASEMATE & CANNON Civil War Naval Rules


–description from back of the book

name: Pirate Raid
description:
A simple skirmish game each players commands a small group of pirates raiding a Caribean village.
The villagers and any relief force are controlled by the rules.

Be the one to bring home the most loot and win the game.

Turn sequence:

At the start of each turn randomly decide the order that the players will activate in, which ever player is last draws a random event card and immediately plays it.
The players then take it in turns to move their figures fight combats and so on, after everyone has moved any defenders or relief force troops are moved.
From the start of turn 5 the player who is moving last instead on drawing a random event card rolls on the relief force table and places any troops as required.

name: Wild West Gunfight
description:
A simple game to recreate the gunfights common to most westerns and that even occasionally happened in real life.
Each player is assigned a force of about six figures and off you go.

Designed for 28mm figures but will work fine with what ever figures you have, could be played as a one against one game or, with an umpire, larger multi player games where everyone has a different objective.

Turn sequence:

Each player places their figure cards in a pile in front of themselves face down in the order they want to activate them in, the top card being the one they want to activate first.
Randomly decide who moves first then activate figures alternately until all figures have been activated.


—description from the publisher / rulebook

name: みっしょんずかっぷ！！ (Missions cup!!)
description:
みっしょんずかっぷ！！ (Missions cup!!) is a set of party games from Japan, packaged in a take-away bubble cup. The package has a deck of cards with a variety of speedy tasks to do using the range of materials provided; strings, clay, chips, dice and so on.

Players turn up one of the cards and race to complete the task first and claim the card. The first to get five cards wins the game.

The tasks include things like tiddlywinks into to the cup, making up a picture (such as a face) using the bits, using the dice to make totals.

The publisher says:
Complete the mission instantly!
Make use of the wide variety of items!
An action party game in a cup!
Turn over the cards and carry out the missions depicted on them!
Turn over the cards and perform the mission! If you complete the mission, you get a card!
Get 5 cards and you win!
There are standard items like dice and chips, as well as more unusual items like clay and string!

ミッションを瞬間クリア！
種類豊富なアイテムを駆使しよう！
カップに入ったアクションパーティーゲーム！
カードをめくって、描かれたミッションを実施！
達成したらカードをゲット！
5枚ゲットしたら勝利！
ダイスやチップなど定番のものから、粘土・ひものような珍しいものまであります！
publisher's summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Humor, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Flicking, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Schuss auf's Tor!
description:
The players roll three dice and split up the result to move one or more figures and the ball. The figures may move in any direction. The ball only moves straight away from a figure placed immediately behind the ball. Most soccer rules are simulated in the game.

The player who gets the most goals in a fixed time span (for example 2 x 30 minutes) wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Monstropoly Battle Card Game
description:
In this game set in the universe of the stage personas of the Finnish Metal Band Lordi, every card is a monster. You, as a player, are trying to make a team of monsters that can help you most effectively slaughter your opponent's monsters.

The first phase of the game is played by playing single monsters from the players' hands and comparing "Force." The highest force wins. The winner of that match up (Or "round") draws a card from the top of the deck and decides to keep either it and one of the played cards, or both played cards, yielding the one remaining card to the loser.

When the entire deck is depleted and both players have their teams, they check to see point totals. A whole "Team" Based on its lead characters is worth Ten points, incomplete teams are only worth one point per character(For a maximum of four) if you have no complete teams, you lose automatically. The hands are broken up into their teams and incomplete ones are compiled into another deck.

The player with the least points starts the team battles by playing one card from one team and may only use this team until it is gone, same with the enemy player. A third card is drawn from the deck to determine weapon values of both cards. The highest total force still wins. The game ends when all teams have been returned to the deck and the player with the most points wins the battle.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mythology

name: Two Stand To Fall
description:
You and your partner stand against a terrible Crisis.

It shouldn’t have been anything new; the two of you had surpassed many hardships before, and forged a bond stronger than steel together. Together, you were supposed to be powerful.

But this time, things went horribly wrong. Even with your strengths combined, your last battle was certain to end in your defeat.

And so, your partner made the ultimate sacrifice: they sent you back to safety, while they stayed to fight the Crisis alone.

Two Stand To Fall is a solo storytelling game about people who would sacrifice for each other, in the face of a world that seeks their destruction.

Perhaps they live, in spite of the world. Perhaps they die, and are forever separated.

But there is a chance you both will come out alive. Therefore, you must try.

name: Board Game of Kaaba
description:
As technology advances, interpersonal communication is weakening by the day.
Children are drowning in a digitalized world while their parents have their hands full with their smartphones.
Therefore, we decided to develop an educational board game to teach children and adults about the Islamic faith through fun and games and to strengthen their relationship and communication with each other.
Especially in this day and age, where there is only ignorance or half-knowledge about Islam, we want to bring light into the darkness with this game.
With this game we also want to address non-Muslims in particular, so that they can gain an insight into Islam.

Gameplay:
The game’s design is that the Kaaba has to be circumnavigated seven times. Circling with the pawn is accomplished by answering questions on Islamic topics. The questions are divided into five difficulty levels. The more difficult the question, the more steps you can take if you answer it correctly. If a player, for example, correctly answers a question from category two, he or she can take two steps forward with the pawn.

Winning:
The goal of the game is to be the first to circle the Kaaba seven times with the pawn. The pawns are moved counterclockwise around the Kaaba just as is the case with the real Kaaba in Mecca. A circle (orbit) occurs every time the player has passed the starting position.

–description from the publisher

name: Capturing Caesar's Camp: A Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command
description:
Capturing Caesar’s Camp is a Pint-Sized campaigns for Chain of Command, designed to be played using the campaign handbook At the Sharp End and the Blitzkrieg 1940 Handbook.
A thirty-two page PDF, Capturing Caesar’s Camp contains an overview of the events of May and early June 1940. as the German panzers dashed across Northern France and the Low Countries, trapping the Allies at Dunkirk and forcing their evacuation. However, not all of the British forces withdrew across the Channel. To the South of the Somme, the 51st Highland Division remained to fight alongside their French comrades in the hope that a new defensive line could be formed and a second Britsh Expeditionary Force sent to continue the war.
This campaign focusses on the actions on the Somme, with the British, supported by French guns and armour, attempting to crush a bridgehead held by the German 57th Infantry Division. If the Highlanders can push the Germans back across the Somme, the much anticipated Weygand Line may become a reality and the German advance South checked.
The campaign is a total of Six game tables with the duration running between five and nine games.
Briefings are provided for both sides, along with measurable objectives, period maps, force and support option listings and everything you need to play this campaign through to its conclusion.

–description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Weed-opoly
description:
Weed-oploy is the board game where you tractor through the marijuana farm and try to reach End At Stoned first. Succeed and you become the head weedopolist.

Players role a 6 sided die to move around the board. Spaces have isntructions for players to follow. Other players will try to slow you down with "Take-a-Hit" cards. But the "Bad Brownie" cards will give you the opportunity to drive ahead. The "Take a Hit" cards will ask you to "Name at least 5 slang words for Marijuana" or successfully perform tongue twisters. "Bad Brownie" cards come in three categories: SOLO, DUET and ALL PLAY. Some of the challenges include: DUET: "You are staying up late, name places that are open 24 hours a day, compete with another player to name the most". SOLO: "Exercise isn't your thing, name 8 things that inflate". ALL PLAY: "You have the munchies, name types of pies, last player to name one moves up 3 spaces."

To win you will need a few baggies of luck and the ability to answer category questions mistakes. The winner is declared the Head Weedopolist and is entitled to all the rights and privileges it implies.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: C4ISR System
description:
Hex-and-counter, Red v. Blue, brigade/battalion-level wargame of modern land tactical actions, with the emphasis on title's Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Knowledge, Information, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance. Even the basic game requires players to place and move Information Nodes so that their other units can be given orders.

Advanced rules allow the sides to advance beyond the WW II=level paradigm of the basic game, e.g., replacing hierarchical communications trees with true networks that have redundant paths.

Game is in Chines; professionally done eight-page English translation, and two pages of charts, provided.

name: Svavelvinter: skuggspelet
description:
In 2013 came the role-playing game "Svavelvinter" where "skuggspelet" is included and can be played as a separate board game.
In Trakoria, powerful and mysterious forces are constantly moving in the shadows, forces whose scheming affects the unaware inhabitants of the archipelago don´t know anything about. To recreate this feeling "Skuggspelet" is used.
A player has won when a shadow power has achieved dominance in a number of key spheres. On a board with 15 spheres, for example, five can be named key spheres and dominance in three of them is required for victory.

—user summary

name: Quest for the Antidote: King's Decoy Promo Card
description: This promo card was for the limited-edition first print run of Quest for the Antidote. The King’s Decoy meddling card, has a special code in the lower right-hand corner of the card to distinguish it.

name: Cruel Seas: Drache – helicopter carrier
description:
The Drache started as a seaplane tender built in Hamburg for the Royal Yugoslavian Navy in 1928. She was converted into a minelayer in 1937. Captured by the Germans in 1941, the Kriegsmarine renamed her the Drache (dragon) and converted her back to a Flugzeugbergungsschiff – an aircraft rescue ship. Drache underwent a refit back to being a minelayer in the spring or summer of 1942 and was moved to the Aegean. She was re-equipped with two 105 mm (4.1") guns, five 37 mm and six 20 mm cannons. A rear platform was added with space for 240 mines on four rails. The Kriegsmarine renamed her Schiff, but she is better known as Drache so the name is retained here. The large flat rear deck made her suitable to test the concept of a helicopter carrier – the world’s first – using a Flettner Fl 282 Kolibri (Hummingbird) as a spotter aircraft.

The Kolibri was the world’s first naval helicopter. It was unarmed but the Kriegsmarine intended to use it for submarine spotting. It could also be used for artillery spotting and reconnaissance.

Pack contains 1 resin & metal vessel and game cards. The full rules for fielding Drache (and helicopter) in Cruel Seas can be found in the Close Quarters supplement
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Movement Template, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Cruel Seas: Sturmboot 42
description:
This was a larger version of the original river-crossing sturmboot with an internal engine capable of transporting a platoon rather than a single section. They were also used in enclosed seas such as the Mediterranean and Baltic.

Contains 4 metal boats and game cards.

–description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Movement Template, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Cruel Seas: Elco Barge-Busters
description:
In the summer of 1943, the primary mission of the PT boats was to interdict Japanese supply lines by shooting up the enemy landing craft (referred to as barges by American reports) being used to transport supplies. It was at this point that Pacific PT boats were upgraded to have 40 mm/37 mm cannon on the bow and stern. Three old Elco 77’ boats were converted into barge-busters by stripping off the torpedoes and adding extra armour, radar and more MGs.

Contains 2 resin and metal vessels and game cards.

–description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Movement Template, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Cruel Seas: LCS(L) – Fairmile H
description:
The LCI(S) was a Fairmile H wooden design using the same prefabrication techniques used in their Dog Boats. It was designed as a cheap-to-make raider transport. Around 40 were built in 1942. Some were converted to LCS(L) support gunboats.

Contains 2 resin and metal vessels with ship cards.

–description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Movement Template, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Cruel Seas: Small Sampans
description:
A player who fields ‘tiny boats’ in Cruel Seas will find their use most entertaining and will undoubtedly make his opposing commander very worried indeed! The great strength of such vessels is their size but this makes them equally vulnerable to all manner of incoming fire.

As the Japanese merchant marine became ever more depleted the humble Sampan became the main fallback for the Imperial Japanese war machine, delivering vital cargoes of men and equipment.
Small sampans must be taken in squadrons of three – meaning only one dice is used for all three.

Contains 6 metal boats and game cards.

–description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Movement Template, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Kharkov, May 1942: The Last Disaster
description:
May 1942 saw the first major, considered offensive by the Red Army in the war against Germany. Expectations were high, with four Soviet armies aiming to encircle the German Sixth Army and to recapture the fourth largest city in the Soviet Union. Those expectations were dashed within a fortnight by the German Army’s ability to absorb the offensive and launch a counteroffensive of its own which, in its turn, encircled two Soviet armies.

Kharkov, May 1942 – The Last Disaster is a miniature wargames campaign system, designed for two to four players, covering these events. It is designed for games in which a stand represents a platoon or in which the main unit of manoeuvre is the battalion. Suitable rules would include Spearhead, Blitzkrieg Commander, Command Decision: TOB, A Fistful of Tows, Rapid Fire Reloaded and others, including those which wargamers may have written themselves.

The system generates fifty or so hours of gaming spread over ten to fifteen individual battles which are fought over six to fifteen daily campaign turns. The number of turns is flexible and determined by whether either player can encircle the enemy’s forces. Progress in the campaign is measured along campaign tracks representing the two major axes of attack with a number of battlefield ‘spaces’. Each turn players decide whether to attack or not and then which parts of their total forces they commit to any ensuing battle. Battles will generally be around a brigade or regiment of four to eight battalions on each side. The results of each on table battle determine the speed of advance on the main campaign map.

The book includes

a brief history of the campaign
background information useful in adapting the system to different sets of rules and suggestions for additional optional rules
a comprehensive set of Appendices covering
the Tables of Organisation and Equipment to platoon level for all divisions and regiments involved (around forty regimental sized formations)
a record of the At Start forces and reinforcements
a chart to track the position and composition of forces on each attack axis
19 colour terrain squares of the battlefields (based on nearly 600 square miles of original 1930s maps) which can be used to generate 570 six feet by four feet tabletops
a Campaign Quick Reference Sheet
a colour A4 Campaign Map
a set of suggestions to convert the system to Bob Cordery’s Portable Wargame rules




100 A4 pages with 20+ colour illustrations.


– Description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Commandments Card Game
description:
A family gin-rummy style game where players take turns drawing and discarding cards while trying to get a set of the ten commandments, but watch out for rebellions and the greatest commandment cards that can make and break sets of commandments quickly.

Collect one each of the Commandment cards before anyone else - including a Greatest Commandment card. Get a dreaded Rebellion card and start over. Designed with color coded cards

—user summary

name: Svengali
description:
Part of the Child's Play card game series, Svengali, the psychic's game is a card game where players try to use their psychic abilities to transmit information about their cards to the other players who must either receive a mental image, or simply deduce the clues. Cards feature two shapes of different sizes in two different colors and player get points for correctly guessing the four attributes of a card one at a time, but are penalized by drawing more cards for wrong guesses.

—user summary

name: Jolly Roger Arithmetic
description:
Actually four games in one, Jolly Roger is part of the Child's Play card game series.

Cards show various pirate themed pictures on the back sides and jolly roger flags featuring math problems on the other. Families can enjoy snap style games, where players take turns playing cards one at a time until the last two cards match (or any in the pile) depending on which side you choose to play with. In the snap game modes, the player who collects the most cards wins.

Jolly Roger Arithmetic also features the new Jolly Roger game where players take turns playing cards one at a time trying to be the last pirate with cards but a ransom card valued 1 - 4 causes the next player to lose 1 - 4 extra cards unless they can pass along another ransom (which can be played by either side). In the Jolly Roger plunder modes, the last player to still hold any cards wins.

--user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Pirates

name: Of the Gods: A Game of Dueling Deities
description:
The gods are always looking for a chance to squabble, and nothing provides a better excuse than human war. As the armies face off, the gods are looking on with interest. Whose army is the worthiest of glory? Whose army will they descend from the heavens to join in battle? And most importantly, whose army will reign victorious and attract the favor of the gods?

Goal: In this 2-player hand management duel-game, earn the most Victory Points by winning Battles and assembling the greatest Pantheon, gathering more copies of each god than your opponent.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Quizine
description: Quizine is a food trivia game played in teams (recommended) or individually. You move along a track, and have to answer questions or fulfill tasks printed on cards, depending on the kind of field you landed on. Tasks include drawing a food or cooking related item, and explaining an item without mentioning it. Correct answers or correct guesses from your teammates move your pawn forward, and the goal is to reach the central field first.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Pick 1
description:
Pick 1 is a card game in which you try to get rid of your hand cards as early as possible. Cards either show a number and one of three colors, or a penalty in one of the colors.
In each turn, one card from the stack is flipped open. Each player simultaneously picks a matching card from their hand (matching means: same color or same number/penalty). All chosen cards are then revealed. The player who played the highest card in the same number as the open card gets all the penalties, which are either to draw cards from the stack or to steal a card from another player.
When one player gets rid of all their cards, everyone gets points for the cards still left in their hand (number cards count their value, penalty cards count 10 points). When a player hits 100 points, whoever has least points, wins.

name: 上海蒼龍-チャイニーズ人狼- (Shanghai Blue Dragon - Chinese Werewolf -)
description:
上海蒼龍チャイニーズ人狼 (Shanghai Blue Dragon - Chinese Werewolf -) is a werewolf game from Japan.

A game based on the original werewolf game Mafia.

The game is set in the 1920's in the Shanghai concession, and the battle between the mafia and the police has been incorporated into the world of wargames. The players are divided into three camps: mafia, citizens and outlaws. The game is played in the same way as a regular werewolf game, but with the added bonus of having a weapon of choice for each position. In addition, the game progresses faster because there are players in all camps with the ability to kill. It is a werewolf game with 'half the time, twice the deduction'.

人狼の元である「マフィア」をアレンジしたゲームです。
舞台は1920年代の上海租界。
暗躍するマフィアたちと警察の戦いを、人狼ゲームの世界に落とし込みました。
プレイヤーはマフィア・市民・アウトローの３陣営に分かれて戦います。進行は普通の人狼と同じですが、全役職が陣営の他に武器の有無というパラメーターを持つため深い推理が必要です。また、殺害能力を持つ役職が全陣営にいるため進行も早くなります。
まさに「時間は半分、推理は２倍」の人狼です。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Variable Player Powers

name: Impetus Warbook 2: 43 BC to 1100 AC
description:
Impetus Warbook 2 includes 95 army lists for Impetus second edition.

VOLUME 7: ROME AND THE EMPIRE
Early Roxolani Sarmatians (310 BC-99 AD), Nabataean Kingdom (312 BC-106 AD), Pre-Islamic Arabs (300 BC-633 AD), Kushan (135 BC-270 AD), Early Germans (100 BC-240 AD), Dacians (60 BC-318 AD), Ancient Britons (55 BC-75 AD), Later Parthian (53 BC-227 AD), Early Imperial Romans (29 BC-197 AD), Moors (25-696 AD), Alans (50-1307 AD), Jewish Revolt (66-135 AD), Caledonians (75-211 AD), Later Roxolani (100-400 AD) and other Sarmatians (310 BC-400 AD), Kingdom of Axum (100-960 AD)

VOLUME 8: ROME CRISIS AND FALL
Middle Imperial Romans (197-284 AD), Early Visigoths or Thervingi (200-419 AD) or Early Vandals (200-442 AD), Early Ostrogoths (200-493 AD), Early Sassanid Persians (224-532 AD), Alamanni (241-506 AD), Later Germans (241-495AD), Early Frankish (241-496 AD), Palmyra (260-273 AD), Later Imperial Romans (West) (285-409 AD), Later Imperial Romans (East) (285-378 AD), Later Armenian (252-627 AD), Huns (356-570 AD), Patrician Romans (409-476 AD West) (378-493 AD East), Middle Visigothic (419-478 AD), Later Visigothic (479-711 AD), Early Merovingians (481-714 AD)

VOLUME 9: BRITANNIA
Picts (Cruithni) (211 BC-842 AD), Scots-Irish (50 BC-841 AD), Early Post Roman British (407-537AD), Early Anglo-Saxons 442-660 AD, Later Post Roman British (538-1054 AD), Early Welsh (600-1100 AD)

VOLUME 10: ANCIENT FAR EAST
Shang Chinese (1600-1046 BC), Western Zhou (1045-771 BC), Yayoi Japanese (800 BC-250 AD), Eastern Zhou (770-481 BC), Early Warring States (480-355 BC), Later Warring States and Qin Empire (355-202 BC), Xiongnu (200 BC-216 AD), Western Han (206 BC-24 AD), Early Goguryeo Korean (37 BC-299 AD), Eastern Han (25-220 AD), Xianbei (93-430 AD), Three Kingdoms Wei (220-265 AD) & Shu Han (221-263 AD), Three Kingdoms Wu (229-280 AD), Yamato Japanese (251-793 AD), Later Goguryeo Korean (300-688 AD), Northern and Southern Dynasties (307-589 AD)

VOLUME 11: STEPPE PEOPLES
Central Asian Turkish (550-740 AD), Avars (553-826 AD), Khazars (650-965 AD), Magyars (650-997 AD), Uighurs (744-1330 AD), Khurasanian (820-1000 AD), Pechenegs (850-1122 AD)

VOLUME 12: ARMIES OF ISLAM
Arab Conquest (622-632 AD), Rashidun Arab (633-660 AD), Ummayyad Arab (661-750 AD), Early Abbasid Arab (750-835 AD), North African Dynasties (789-1148 AD), Later Abbasid Arab (836-945 AD), Daylami Dynasties (930-1090 AD)

VOLUME 13: JUSTINIAN AGE
African Vandal (442-535 AD), Early Lombards (490-584 AD), Early Byzantines (493-578 AD), Italian Ostrogoths (493-561 AD), Later Sassanid (531-627 AD)

VOLUME 14: AGE OF CHARLEMAGNE
Old Saxons & Bavarians (531-804 AD), Maurikian Byzantines (579-650 AD), Lombards in Italy (584-774 AD), Thematic Byzantine (651-962 AD), Later Anglo-Saxon (661-1016 AD), Bulgars (675-1237 AD), Early Andalusians (710-765 AD), Later Merovingian and Charles Martel Franks (715-768 AD), Charlemagne Franks (768-814 AD), Vikings (789-1071 AD), Rus (860-1054 AD)

VOLUME 15: YEAR 1000
Later Lombards (774-1053 AD), Norse Irish (840-1100 AD), Sicilian Arabs (878-1091 AD), Principality of Hungary (997-1099 AD), Pre Feudal French (898-1050 AD), Eastern Franks and Ottonians (898-1125 AD), Normans in Normandy (911-1072 AD), Nikephorian Byzantines (963-1042 AD), Anglo Danish (1014-1075 AD), Konstantinian Byzantines (1042-1071 AD), Early Feudal Papal States (1049-1085 AD), Normans in South Italy (1042-1139 AD)

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Grimdark Future: Arena – Season 1
description:
Grimdark Future: Arena is a hex-combat miniatures game set in a war-torn sci-fi future, which is played using 28mm miniatures.
The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging sci-fi duels for new and experienced players alike.

This is a fast-paced combat game played on a hex-board with 3-7 models per side, featuring customizable warbands and special strategies and objectives.
The game also comes with rules for how to play without a hex-board, requiring no printing at all if you prefer.

The printable paper miniatures are formated for easy printing, cutting and folding, and they come with 1 color scheme, as well as with a black border version of all miniatures.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight

name: Energiekonferenz
description:
Energy Conference is an environmental quiz game. In a semicircle you move your wooden figure from one field to the next. The distance is 18 fields. To move one field further, you have to answer a randomly selected question about the field topic correctly. These questions are summarized for each of four topics on a card and color-coded. In the case of difficult fields, you can call an energy conference with all players already present on the field in order to get to the bottom of the next three questions together or in competition with each other. If you are totally stuck, you can use a joker card, but it can only be used twice per player.

—user summary

name: Grimdark Future: Arena – Season 2
description:
Grimdark Future: Arena is a hex-combat miniatures game set in a war-torn sci-fi future, which is played using 28mm miniatures. The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging sci-fi duels for new and experienced players alike.

This is a fast-paced combat game played on a hex-board with 3-7 models per side, featuring customizable warbands and special strategies and objectives. The game also comes with rules for how to play without a hex-board, requiring no printing at all if you prefer.

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight

name: Fire at Sea: Bitter Enemies
description:
A seen on Little Wars TV, Fire at Sea: Bitter Enemies allows you to refight all of the major battles between Germany’s Kreigsmarine and the Royal Navy!

These fun, action-packed rules allow you to play several engagements in an evening.
Hunt down the mighty Scharnhorst or fight your way through the English Channel in a series of battles.
Whether you are brand new to naval miniatures games or a veteran, these rules offer a fresh look at gaming the classic naval battles of World War Two!

You must combine skill and luck to defeat your most bitter enemy on in the North Atlantic, Arctic Ocean or off the coast of Uruguay!

YOU ARE IN COMMAND!

Turn Sequence:

Movement Phase - alternate
Shooting Phase - simultaneous
Damage Control Phase - try to recover from damage
Morale Phase - for ships that got damaged


Fire at Sea: Bitter Enemies includes the game rules and the following 16 scenarios, most of which contain multiple scenarios and can be played as mini-campaigns.

Battle of the River Plate
Battle of Narvik
Operation Rhine (Sink the Bismarck!)
The Channel Dash
Bear Island
Battle of the Barents Sea
Battle of North Cape


–description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Cloak & Fang
description:
Cloak & Fang is a competitive game for 2-4 players in which each player takes on the role of a fledgling vampire, competing for control over a small town. Control requires power, and gaining power involves manipulating the town's residents in order to feed upon their blood. Before the night is done, one vampire will stand above the rest, claiming this corner of the world for themselves!


Be a puppet master, charming and commanding the populace
Compete to gain the most influence and power
Choose your strategy to outsmart and outplay your opponents


The goal of Cloak & Fang is to feed upon residents in order to gain the most blood points before the night ends. In order to do this, it is in each player's best interest to manipulate the residents of the town to increase the number of blood points they have. This is done differently per resident, based on their individual preferences. Each player will be attempting to change the state of the town to gain an advantage over the other players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Worker Placement

name: Lemonade Tycoon
description:
Lemonade Bosschief is about providing a fun and tailored challenge to kids and adults. By providing dynamic challenges (handicaped play) that can change from game to game, Bosschief makes it possible to see your kid grow with the game all the while providing real and fun challenge to kids and adults.

The advanced rules also provide a nice challenge for adult-adult pairings.

Focused on simple rules, variety and tons of player interactions, Bosschief introduces players to novel auctions that include push-your-luck and bluffing mechanics and an innovative grid navigating auction that's fresh and exciting. The game also presents a simple 'program' movement deduction mechanic and a guess-outguess mechanic aiming to deny your opponent's goals from being achieved.

The advanced rules also provide a nice gateway experience of action planning, denial and mayhem.

All of this with little set-up time, quick and clear rules and short play time. (45-60 minutes) With amazing artwork engaging gameplay and adapted challenge Tycoon is here to quench your thirst for a challenge and create a thirst for board games in your kids.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Earth Sentinel
description:
The Earth Sentinel board game celebrates the important connections that exists in nature and between all of earth’s ecosystems, occupants, and man.

The Earth Sentinel board game is played on a 10 by 10 grid representing the earth and 50 chips for each player. Your chips represent your resources.

There are three game plays possible on your Earth Sentinel board; the linear green belts, the conglomerations belts, and the wood wide web.

Linear green belts - The object is for each player to plant as many trees as possible by having the highest number of consecutive treeples: 3 consecutive chips (1 point); 6 consecutive chips (3 points); and 9 consecutive chips (5 points).
Conglomeration belts - The object is to minimize the number of unutilized chips left on the board at the end of the round by making sure your chips form triples before the round ends. Value of conglomerated chips on the board are counted incrementally.
Wood wide web - The object is for each player to form the highest number of consecutive chips per row. Points are calculated by calculating the difference in the highest number of consecutive chips for each player.


—description from the designer

name: Come And Play The Game
description:
The players have to lead their basketball teams (4 game pieces) from their preliminary round locations in Germany to the final city of Cologne. To do this, they roll the dice and drag the pieces across a map. Whoever beats another figure (or their own) sends them to a basketball game, which is decided by a simple dice roll.

The winner gets to move on, the loser has to wait for the next opponent. On gray squares an event card is drawn, which also contains information about German cities.

The first player to arrive in Cologne with 2 figures wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Ein Indio darf den Tag nicht verschlafen
description:
Each player has 2 game pieces (José and a donkey), both of which he must bring to the target field. After rolling the dice, you can move your donkey or your José. On event fields (with "typical" actions of an Indio boy) you can earn or lose money, have to sit out, move forward or back.
The target field (the sea) can only be reached by both game pieces by rolling a 3.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Phalanx
description:
PHALANX simulates a battle between two armies from the Iron Age.

The players take the role of generals facing each other on the field of battle, trying to destroy the enemy’s troops and pushing them out of the battlefield.

The player play cards that can act as reinforcements (sending more troops into the fray) or as orders (to direct the ones already on the battlefield).

Destroying your enemy’s troops will give you victory at the end of the day, but beware! A single enemy troop that manages to cross the battlefield and reach your command tent will force you to retreat, leaving your opponent master of the battlefield!

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Moving Multiple Units, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid

name: Hartz Dir Einen
description:
Players move their game piece by rolling the dice along a path from start to finish. On the way there are fields on which event cards must be drawn. These cause suspension, additional movement forward or backward. The satirically conceived texts reflect the "reality" of the unemployed. Guess who wins the game....

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Think Global
description:
The players each write down 6 terms for pictures with environmental scenes. The more matches with the terms of the other players are achieved, the more points are distributed. The winner is the player with the highest point total at the end of the game.

—user summary

name: Dead Man Blues
description:
In this game you play the role of a musician and aspiring bandleader: starting in New Orleans in the early days, then playing the clubs in Al Capone’s Chicago, and trying to hold a big band together in New York or the West Coast in the Swing era. Your aim is to be remembered, after you’ve gone, as the greatest jazz musician of all time.

The game-play is mainly conducted through 3 types of Contract cards: Work - to earn money and reputation; Musicians - to grow your band; and Habits, which reduce your life expectancy. You can also compete with other players in Battle-of-the-Bands contests.

When the game ends, everyone dies! The player with the highest posthumous reputation wins the game.
—description from publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Negotiation, Open Drafting

name: Cradle - Sword & Sorcery -
description:
Cradle - Sword & Sorcery - is a two player deck-building card game from Japan. The first deck is S1 Sword & Sorcery. Each player has their own deck and build a particular set from it before they begin. The publisher recommends some different builds for easy through to hard play. The artwork is fairly mature and the publisher suggest age 15+ for players. The publisher has revised some card text and powers on their website since the decks were originally produced.

The publisher says:
Cradle is set in a distant celestial world where a race of beings with a similar culture and appearance to our own thrive.

A few years ago, a great and tragic war took place there.

The war between the powerful "Academies" and the "Earth Incoming Faction" of the Beastmaster has taken much and left new embers.
