You take the role of a hero character and fight against your opponents' heroes. Your role as a hero is to grow your party, command your party correctly and win!

Cradleは、私たちと似た文化、姿形を持つ種族が繁栄する、遠い天体を舞台としています。
そこでは、今から数年前に悲惨で大きな戦争が起こったばかりです。
権威ある”学府”と、獣相の”土着信派”の戦争は多くを奪い新たな火種を残していきました。

Cradleは対戦型のデッキ構築ゲームです。
あなたはヒーローキャラクターとなり、対戦相手のヒーローと戦いを繰り広げます。
ヒーローとしてのあなたの役割は、"パーティを育てること"、"パーティを正しく指揮すること"、"勝利する事"です！
user summary
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Cradle - Faith & Fallen -
description:
Cradle - Faith & Fallen - is the second deck in a two player deck-building card game from Japan. The first deck is Cradle - Sword & Sorcery -. The second deck F1 Faith & Fallen integrates with the first deck S1, however the publisher recommends using opaque sleeves for play as the card backs are different.

Each player has their own deck and build a particular set from it before they begin. The publisher recommends some different builds for easy through to hard play. The artwork is fairly mature and the publisher suggest age 15+ for players. The publisher has revised some card text and powers on their website since the decks were originally produced.

The publisher says:
Cradle is set in a distant celestial world where a race of beings with a similar culture and appearance to our own thrive.

A few years ago, a great and tragic war took place there.

The war between the powerful "Academies" and the "Earth Incoming Faction" of the Beastmaster has taken much and left new embers.

You take the role of a hero character and fight against your opponents' heroes. Your role as a hero is to grow your party, command your party correctly and win!

Cradleは、私たちと似た文化、姿形を持つ種族が繁栄する、遠い天体を舞台としています。
そこでは、今から数年前に悲惨で大きな戦争が起こったばかりです。
権威ある”学府”と、獣相の”土着信派”の戦争は多くを奪い新たな火種を残していきました。

Cradleは対戦型のデッキ構築ゲームです。
あなたはヒーローキャラクターとなり、対戦相手のヒーローと戦いを繰り広げます。
ヒーローとしてのあなたの役割は、"パーティを育てること"、"パーティを正しく指揮すること"、"勝利する事"です！
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Achtung, Kurve!
description:
A dice roll decides the starting point and the used vehicle for each player. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach the town hall and return to his starting space while minding the traffic rules wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mit der "Ukraina" durch die UDSSR
description:
The players start and end their flight in Aschchabad. Movement is determined by a die. If a player reaches a city, he misses a turn. The last player to return to Aschchabad wins the game.

This game was released for the 40th anniversary of the October Revolution 1917.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Ministerium für Volksbildung der DDR, Verlag Junge Welt

name: Wer wird Kanzler?
description:
The players move their figure (candidate) around the game board to collect money, get publicity, build their election team and advertise their program by collecting markers for each aspect. Movement is determined by a die. If a player lands on a space marked with a "?" he has to draw an event card that may benefit or hinder him.

If a player has collected markers of 50 points for each aspect, he gets to place a delegate on a free dot in the center of the game board. If a delegate is surrounded by three delegates of another color, he is replaced by a delegate of this color.

The first player to get 10 delegates on the game board wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Judgement: A 9 Card Deckbuilding Game
description:
Children who act out of line are expected to prove whether they're worth keeping alive by killing a wild beast with nothing but their fists and their wits.

You palm the rock you smuggled in. Will you be able to survive this unjust "trial"?

Judgement is a 9 card solitaire deckbuilding game. Unlike in most deckbuilding games, when a card is "destroyed" it's not gone forever. Instead, it's rotated 180 degrees and can be purchased later. To win the game, you have to deal enough damage to kill the beast before it can kill you.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Timber Timmy
description:
Each player gets a hammer (hammer head is hollow) with which he has to collect colored plastic hats in the correct order as quickly as possible. The order of the five colors is determined by a revealed card. The first player to collect 5 cards wins the game.

—user summary

name: The Consultants
description:
A fun strategy game in which players choose to play one out of 4 different consultants. Each consultant carries their own ability that players can build their strategy on. In the game, players manage their actions at the expense of working hours of which each player only has a limited amount for each round. Thus, resource management will be a key factor to win the game. Working hours can be used for lobbying politicians, getting an intern to receive additional working hours, receiving effect cards, or acquiring courses and projects which will educate your character and provide you with additional income. While the game is round based, players can also take an active role, even if it is not their turn, by playing effect cards or participate in auctions for either projects or courses.

The base game can be played in three different versions. Which allow players to opt between an asymmetrical and symmetrical gameplay or change the numbers of components in the game to adjust the difficulty of play.

While the game mechanics require a strategic mindset, the actual theme of the game is a satire about the consulting industry. Effects like “Auditor” who is displayed as a blind person and approves important documents with his stamp, should remind players how shady the industry can be (Auditing firms caused the financial crisis in 2008 because they assigned ratings without evaluating them properly).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Income, Investment, Market, Resource to Move, Turn Order: Auction

name: Paint the Town Red: Vengeance Will Be Yours
description:
A scenario, based on a classic Clint Eastwood Western.

The mining town of Lagos a remote mountain place in Inyo County. The local townsfolk fear the return of three notorious outlaws who they helped send to prison years ago, and when a mysterious gunfighter rides into town unannounced, the citizens of Lagos beg him for help. But the gunfighter, known only as “the Stranger” is not here by coincidence. He has a mission of his own....

To play this scenario, you’ll need 13 cowboy miniatures and a small Western town. There are a dozen characters in this game, each with a custom character card. Assign each player in your game the role of an Outlaw or a Citizen. There is also a card for the Stranger, but he will appear randomly throughout the story and may be controlled by either side.

Before the game, each player will be asked to revisit a decision from earlier in the film, providing an opportunity for you to write a new ending to the movie!

—description from publisher
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Riding Shotgun: A Ruthless 5 Act Campaign
description:
This mini-campaign is structured in five “acts,” or quick scenarios playable in a single evening.

There is a map-based component to this game, representing a cat-and-mouse chase between the Cowboys and the Earp posse.

The Cowboy mission is to escape Cochise County for the relative safety of either the New Mexico Territory or Sonora, Mexico. The Earp player will attempt to track the bandits and bring them to justice before they can flee their jurisdiction!

Divide the players into two teams:
One is given the Cowboy Briefing and the other receives the Earp Briefing. Each team should read and record their decisions before reading or playing each new scenario. Players should refrain from studying individual scenario details beforehand (this preserves some surprises!)

At the end of each act, any characters that were killed are permanently removed from the campaign.

—description from the scenario
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Anyotas
description:
Anyotas is a game based on the Congolese myth of the brotherhood of the leopard men. To which are grafted other mythical characters from the African pantheon such as Mami Wata, the Marabout, Anansi, Ibeji, the Witch Doctor, among others.

The game pits two teams: the Originels against Anyotas.
The latter are hiding among the inhabitants of one of the African cities. At nightfall, they work together to attack a poor Originel. Then when the day comes, they pretend to be just an innocent Originel.

The goal of the game is simple:

For the Anyotas eliminate all Originels during the night phases. When the Originels become outnumbered, the Anyotas win the game.
For the Originels, unmask all Anyota before you are outnumbered. Thanks to their spirit of deduction but also with the help of Originels with powers such as the Marabout, the Hyena Trainer, Mami Wata etc ...


So can you survive the onslaught of the fierce Anyotas?

– Translated description from the publisher
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Kopf & Würfel
description:
Players move around the track to the center of the board by forming the longest words possible.

To start the game, the first player rolls the die from the Start circle and moves to their first circle. They must then roll again and all players must try to form a word in that category, using the first letter indicated by the dice roll according to the table printed on the game board. The player with the longest word wins and moves his piece the same number of spaces as the letters in the word.

The first person to the center of the board wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Massel
description:
Each player receives 20 tiles, which he wants to get rid of as quickly as possible by rolling 2 dice.

You can get rid of a token by a matching roll in a not yet filled number compartment. If the number you roll matches a compartment that is already full, you must take all the tokens out instead.

The player who gets rid of all his tokens first is the winner.

name: The Wolves of St Augustine: A scenario for Modern & Tales of Horror
description:
Lieutenant Daniel Dulle and his squad from the 95th have been tasked with blowing up the bridge at Villa Verde to cover the retreating flank of the army.
Normally this would be a job for the Royal Engineers, but a group of French dragoons are in hot pursuit.

This is a scenario for Fistful of Lead: Horse & Musket

–description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: საფეხბურთო მენეჯერი (Football Manager)
description:
საფეხბურთო მენეჯერი (Football Manager) is designed for 2-4 people.

Travel the world of football, follow the rules of FIFA, meet rebellious fans, famous football agent will help you buy the players you want, negotiate with your rivals and make transfers.
Manage your budget, buy famous players and compete with your rivals according to the number of stars they own.

Goal of the game: collect one or more teams (10 football teams), develop them by buying a coach, a federation, earn income, bankrupt your rivals and WIN !
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: ბიზნესმენი (Businessman)
description:
ბიზნესმენი (Businessman) allows players to take the first steps in business and prepare for the many challenges in life.

The goal of the game is to buy more shares than all other players, bankrupt opponents, and accumulate the most capital.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Nuke Trick
description:
Nuke Trick is a trick taking card game with a few twists. As the commander of a World War III superpower you need to use all the weapons at your disposal in this all-out-war to control rare earth minerals, oil and strategic industries.

Players start with a hand of cards. Each round/trick is a battle over a few battleground cards placed in the middle of the table. The winner of the trick gets first pick on what battleground to conquer which is then placed face-up in front of that player. Then the 2nd best player in the trick gets to conquer a card etc.

Besides classical trick-taking strategies one must consider what continent the battleground card belongs to (set collection), what actions are triggered when you conquer the card (e.g. change current trump), if you can complete a nuke (which functions as “super trump”), if there are industries, oil, rare earth minerals or support to research space or drone warfare (worth dominance points) and if there is a strong resistance (negative points). The card you play in the current trick will be a new battleground card for the upcoming trick which must also be factored in when choosing what card to play.

The player with the most dominance points at the end of the game is the winner.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Rani: Can you Save the Queen of Punjab?
description:
The story takes place in the backdrop of British Raj in India. Rani, the Queen of Punjab was on her way to Amritsar along when she was attacked by a group of feisty rebels. Her Royal Guard defended her valiantly and safely brought her to an abandoned warehouse. Unfortunately, that warehouse was in an area under the British control and they were already looking for an excuse to pursue Rani.

The game is a battle between the two players. One player has to rescue Rani and her guards; the other player is the British soldiers trying to capture Rani.

If Rani can make it outside the warehouse to the truck with the keys, she wins! If the British capture Rani and kill her guards, they win.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Different Dice Movement, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Joker Joker Joker
description:
Based of the game show of the same name, Joker Joker Joker is a card based quiz game for the whole family to enjoy.

Each turn three category cards are flipped to mimic the game show's giant slot machine. These cards show jokers or numbers corresponding to question categories. Depending on how many times a category shows up in the slot cards, a question of that category's value increases from 50 to 100 to 200 (or 100 to 200 to 500 for jokers). Correct answers award points, but wrong answers give the next player a shot at the points. During a question round when a player reaches $500 they get to play the final prize round to end the show.

In the prize round the three slots are filled with a prize card from three decks of prize cards of varying values, and players can push their luck to turn over the slots one by one. Prizes accumulate for the player and cards reset as they push their luck until they reveal a devil card, choose to stop, or reach $1000 which gives them the big bonus of $5000.

The goal of the game is to have the most money after each player has had a turn as the master of ceremonies and at least one turn as a contestant.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Il Gioco della Gallina
description:
Learn the cycle of the seasons, the sustainable lifestyle, the Slow Food association and the Presidia around the world.

Each square includes a test: answer a question, mimic, draw, stand still for a turn or roll the dice. Memory, ingenuity and imagination make your chicken run faster than that of the other players. The first chicken to cross the finish line ... wins!

—user summary
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Track Movement

name: Tinunjoc: Pays Catalan
description:
Tinunjoc Pays Catalan is a board game representing a course in the Pyrénées-Orientales department through its three valleys, the coast and the mountain.

The players start from the sea in the northeast to arrive in the southwest on the sacred mountain of the Catalans, the Canigou, preferably the first! The course is punctuated with pitfalls and nudges, incredible twists and turns (11 Adventure boxes) and 12 question boxes to test your knowledge of the Catalan country and above all... learn while having fun!

The winner is the first player to reach the Canigou.

110 questions of 2 levels of difficulty all the same!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Crossroll Hong Kong X Animal Inc
description:
Crossroll Hong Kong X Animal Inc is a crossover expansion set which creatively merges the two NightDreamer games and add two more unique game experiences.

Crossover expansion adds more player interaction and risk management to the already strategic Crossroll Hong Kong mechanism.

Pyramid expansion uniquely merges secret identity to roll and write mechanism.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Die kleine Hexe / Neues vom Räuber Hotzenplotz
description:
Contains Die kleine Hexe: nach dem Buch von Ottfried Preußler and Neues vom Räuber Hotzenplotz.

In Die kleine Hexe - following the children's book of Ottfried Preußler with the same name, each player will play the little sorceress once. The little sorceress tries to break the evil witches operations. So she attempts to burn the grimoires and witches' brooms. That child, whichs acts best, will win.

In Neues vom Räuber Hotzenplotz players get as many coins as possible from the treasure of the bandit Hotzenplotz; game ends if all coins are gone.

name: Honey Runner
description: Honey Runner is a card game that uses the cards as templates to direct a Honey Bee to a central flower where they collect honey to take back to the bee hive. The goal of the game is to be the first player to collect three honey cards.

name: Մաֆիա (Mafia)
description:
In Մաֆիա ("Mafia"), teams compete against each other to see which team can find all of its agents first.
The "don" or the "cop" gives a one-word hint that can refer to several words on the board.
Team members try to guess the words, avoiding guessing the words of the opposing team.
At the same time, everyone avoids killers.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Communication Limits, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Quitter
description:
The card game for people that like to pretend they are quitting social media.

Quitter has two decks. The first is the Scroll deck. This represents using social media. You draw from this at the END of your turn, constantly thwarting your own attempts to use all your cards and end with an empty hand.

The second is the Real Life deck. You have to earn draws from this deck. It's a mixed bag, but each good card reduces the amount of cards you need to draw each turn. Some of them also have power ups that help you get rid of your cards quicker.

Share Content to collect Reacts and then spend that emotional currency to draw from the Real Life deck. The more Real Life cards you have on the board the less Content you'll have to draw at the end of each turn. When you end a turn with no cards in hand and no draw requirement you win the game by being a Quitter.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Interrupts, Move Through Deck

name: Ars Bellum II
description:
The basic module contains

1 rulebook of 17 pages with the principles of the game and many illustrated examples
1 player aid
1 board of 108 pawns and markers to play the English and French armies of the campaign
4 scenarios:
the battles of Abbeville (23 August 1346),
Oisemont (23 August 1346),
Gué de Blanquetaque (24 August 1346) and
Crécy (26 August 1346)

4 A3 cards


—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Die lustige Reise um die Welt
description:
The players roll the dice and move their game piece over a network of paths to collect six different pieces each. These are initially face down and you should remember the ones that another player was not allowed to take. The first player to return to the starting field with 6 different pieces wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: The Happy Shell Farmer
description:
An Australian board game from the 1920's that depicts rural Australia farming life and advertises Shell oils and lubricants.

Players start at a homestead in the center of the board and follow a path that passes various farming activities such as ploughing, milking, harvesting and shearing before returning to home. Each Farming task is accompanied with advice on which Shell oil or lubricant is needed.

Players move by spin of a teetotum and if a player lands on a red square he must detour to one of the farming activities, after they reach the activity they return to the main path and continue with the spin of the teetotum. The player to reach home (square 100) by exact count is the winner.

—user summary

name: Constructo Quiz
description:
The players have to guess a word secretly written down by the game leader based on information about individual letters. The earlier you give a correct guess, the more points you get. Mistakes are penalized with a point deduction. After an agreed number of words, the game leader is changed. Whoever has the most points at the end wins.

—user summary

name: Deckel drauf
description:
On a 3x3 board with 9 numbered squares, the goal is to win rounds by covering the most squares with tiles. First, 9 of a player's 27 pieces are randomly placed on the squares at the same time. Then the players take turns to draw 2 pieces each from the bag and place them one after the other in the squares 1-9. Then the players take turns, there are two possibilities: Either move one of your own stones as you wish, or cover a square in which there are exactly 5 of your own stones, no matter how many opposing stones are in it. If no more fields can be covered, the game ends, whoever has covered more fields wins the round, with 3 won rounds you win the game.

—user summary

name: 2020: The Best Year Ever
description:
2020: The Best Year Ever (The Game) is a “2020 themed” board game. It cleverly uses the events of 2020 to draw players together based on their common experience of the year. “Play cards” encourage players to “act out” common (and their own) 2020 experiences while “Point cards” memorialize well known AND little known events of 2020 while helping OR hurting a player’s “score.” Using unconventional (and fluid) game rules, players are kept involved and “off balance” (much like we all were during 2020) as each game unfolds differently depending on the cards drawn.

2020: The Best Year Ever (The Game) uses dice, a spinner, and unique cards hat guide players through 2020 related challenges, activities and conversations while players collect (plus and minus) points until the games ends - at any moment - in one of several possible ways. The player with the highest points at the end wins.
mechanics: Acting, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Quadzzles
description:
The six 1.5-inch cubes are lasercut from white wooden hardboard. They are sent unassembled in 36 pieces. Simply friction-fit the sides together into six cubes and you are ready to play.
Roll or shuffle the cubes and place randomly in the tray. Use one letter from adjacent (top) “quads” to make words of at least three letters, in either direction. Words can start anywhere. Write down all your words.

After three minutes, compare all words to opponents’ words. Remove duplicates and illegal words. Score only the unique words, one point per letter. The player with the highest score wins.

—description from publisher

name: Desolation Dungeon
description:
In Desolation Dungeon you can play as either The Dungeon master or one of the heroes.

The Dungeon Master begins the game by laying out room cards with hidden traps and monsters and rooms in a way that will hinder the Hero’s on their journey to steal your loot!!! During the hero's turn, the players can choose up to 3 separate actions to search the dungeon, fight the monsters and escape with the loot.

Play continues until the Dungeon Masters has collected 10 hero souls or there is one hero left with 12 treasure points.

The game is for 2-5 players with multiple game scenarios and a solo variant for playing by yourself as the hero. Currently the stand alone version of the game is 165 cards with one expansion of 20 cards (10 for the hero, and 10 for the Dungeon master).

—description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Pieces as Map, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: The Glorious First of June: a scenario for Far Distant Ships
description:
The Glorious First of June - Le Bataille du 13 Prairial An 2 is a scenario pack covering the battle known to the British as the Glorious First of June, and to the French as La Bataille du 13 prairial an 2, 1st June 1794.

In which Admiral Lord Howe attempts to defeat a French fleet under Rear Admiral Villaret-Joyeuse seeking to protect a vital grain convoy heading to France from North America.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Selva: La fuerza de la Naturaleza
description: Selva is a Chilean Trading Card Game in which players pitch the forces of nature against each other. Turns are split into two phases, a day phase and a night phase, in which different kinds of animals can attack, depending on their natural habits. You can try to block attacks against you, and you will try to increase the number of resource cards on the table to be able to add more cards to your layout. The goal is to reduce your opponent(s) Alpha animal to 0 life points.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Environmental

name: Hegemon: A Wargaming Campaign in Ancient Greece
description:
Hegemon: A Wargaming Campaign in Ancient Greece is set circa 340BCE and pits Macedon against Persia with Greece as the battlefield.
It is specifically designed for DBA 3.0 but is likely to be easily adapted to other sets of rules which cater for battles of around ten to 20 units.

The campaign features a point to point map of Greece. Each turn represents a year and consists of a winter administration phase and two campaign seasons.
Campaigns are likely to last three to five years (although a spectacular failure could see a campaign concluded in a single year) and likely to feature an average of three battles per year.

During winter players spend their budget to bribe/persuade Greek city states in a variety of ways to make them amenable to a player's plans and to buy new elements to reinforce armies in the following year.
During each of the two campaign seasons players move their army or armies on the map and invade hostile Greek states, the armies of which are played by the opposing player.

The winner of the campaign will be the player who allies the greatest number of Greek states, or at least renders them neutral, by the time either Macedon or Persia cannot field an army sufficiently strong to continue.

Although written with this specific hypothetical campaign as its basis, the campaign mechanisms are portable to other eras and armies, with the requirement only that the player create an appropriate point to point map of the area of operations. The article includes half a dozen ways in which to vary the original campaign and brief notes suggesting other historical conflicts of the classical period which might be simulated.

The article is fourteen pages long and incorporates a campaign map and a budget tracking graphic.

Finally it also presents a very simple methodology for resolving battles in a DBA style using any flat surface and 30 or so dice of different colours. This will allow the player to experiment with the campaign framework without committing himself to six to twelve DBA battles.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Butter
description:
Butter is a quick and engaging card game with simple rules but wide-ranging strategy. Once you have a few singles games under your belt, try team play! The rules change slightly, but the strategy explodes with so many more possibilities.

The game centers around adding number cards to your stack so they sum to 18, which is called buttering your stack. You earn one point for every card you butter. Use Slice, Churn, Spoil, and Butter cards to steal, swap, and bust your and other player's stacks.

To win, score the most points in three rounds!

—description from publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Tipping Guam
description:
The island of Guam is in a perilous situation. Thanks to the courage of one brave elected official who was willing to speak up, we now know that the island of Guam is actually a lily pad precariously floating in the Pacific Ocean. If the balance of the island is not altered significantly, Guam will tip and capsize. Both military bases panic and begin to ship all of their resources to the other side of the island, so their side will not be under water if the island capsizes.

Tipping Guam is a two player game in which each player will try to move their personnel and equipment to the opposite side of the island, strategically placing them on their opponent’s tipping points. If all the tipping points of your opponent’s side of the island have pieces on them, you win the game!

An entry into the 2021 Two Player Game Design contest.

name: Battle for Diratia
description:
Are you a fan of realistic fantasy? A connoisseur of Sci-Fi, space travel, and wargaming? Or even a GM looking for an exciting RPG system with constant updates?
Then Battle for Diratia (Aka BFD) is for you!

This system is made by two veteran GMs who, tired of switching system mid-campaign, decided to make a more versatile system. Characters that feel human, a unique universe and a system that is ever evolving and contemporary. BFD as a combat system can adjust to every group, every setting, style of play, and player.

You will never have to learn another ruleset. BFD works for 3v3 skirmish, for immersive roleplaying, and for 1000v1000 total warfare.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Medieval, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing

name: Կինոգետ (Film Critic)
description:
Each round consists of 4 questions.
If you answer the question incorrectly, you stop
Players who answer all 4 questions correctly will participate in the Random round which will decide the winner of that round.

The game contains:

328 playing cards about 70 most famous Armenian movies,
a book of movie lists (2 copies),
as well as the rules of the game.


The interactivity of the game is provided by the QR codes included in the playing cards, which, after being scanned, will show information (video, sound bites etc...) about the card.

The cards contains the following

Guess the movie according to the mentioned phrase (150),
continue the popular secret speech (60);
According to the presented picture, guess the film (30);
According to the presented music, guess the film (30);
prompt your teammates (30) of the movie according to the keyword;
List the films with the participation of the actor (28).
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Այլ կերպ (Another way)
description:
Այլ կերպ ("Another way") is a team-based game where players have to guess words.

Gameplay:
One player draws a card, explains to his teammates the 7 words written on the card one at a time, without using identical words nor the translation of that word into other languages. Each guessed word is 1 point.
1 minute is allowed.

The team with the most points win.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Word Game

name: Card Night: Classic Games, Classic Decks, and The History Behind Them
description:
Learn when to hold 'em and when to fold 'em with Card Night, a collection of 52 classic card games, including rules and strategies.

Featuring step-by-step, illustrated instructions, and two indexes that organize each game by difficulty and number of players needed, Card Night includes directions for playing all the most popular card games, including Hearts and Bridge, Rummy and Go Fish.

In addition to providing the rules of standard game play, Card Night also details the fascinating stories and peculiarities behind some of the world's most famous card decks, some of which were used as currency, tools for propaganda, and even as a means for sending coded messages.

Offering one game for each week of the year, Card Night is the go-to companion for weekly game nights, long car rides, and rainy days spent at home. Wow your friends and family with your game playing prowess and keep them entertained with fascinating details from playing card history.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Havoc Wuzhuang Temple
description:
This picture book and game tells the story of Havoc Wuzhuang Temple. The master and disciples came to Wuzhuang Temple. The disciples stole and ate the ginseng fruit and were detained by Zhenyuan Immortal. Monkey King had to seek help from all over the world, and finally invited Guanyin Bodhisattava to save the ginseng fruit tree.

Different adventure levels combined mathematical knowledge into the game to help children enlighten thinking, master knowledge, develop good habits of independent learning and active thinking. 6 games correspond to 6 education points: Understand the use of multiplication table; Recognize area; Understand the division; Observe the crystallization phenomenon. It also includes the logical ability training activity and logical reasoning training activity.

To win 6 levels of the game:

Steal Ginseng Fruit: Infer the numbers in the grid and get 8 different numbers, mark the numbers with color to show the Ginseng Fruit image
Eat the Manfruit: Complete the puzzle, take out the manfruit cubes one by one, and restore the puzzle to a rectangle for 3 times
Cover up and trick Taoist: Based on the information on the card, infer who told the truth and who lied, then infer who ate the ginseng fruit and who hide the manfruit
Fight with Immortal Zhenyuan in the Mountain：Flip the pieces and beat your opponent, the player with more pieces on the board wins
Get the Magic Water to Save the Immortal Tree: Complete the tree puzzle, mix the powder and water, pour the solution onto the tree and observe the crystallization phenomenon
Immortals Gather and Taste the Fruit: Tuck the required number of rubber bands on the card to ensure the ginseng fruits can be evenly divided as required. The first one finishes 3 cards wins the game.


After player complete each level, insert the manual card to the corresponding page in the passport comes with the game. The first one who collects all 6 manual cards and fills the passport is the winner of the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Children's Game, Math, Memory, Novel-based
mechanics: Events, Memory, Movement Points, Set Collection, Storytelling

name: Pantone: The Game – Mini-Expansion
description: A mini-expansion consisting of three new character cards (Rick Sanchez, Princess Leila, Little Marmaid) and 14 swatch cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Druid Master
description:
Welcome to The Druid Master, a tabletop game that will teach you the healing power of medicinal herbs.
An educational fast paced cards game for 1-4 players.

"You are in the middle of the forest, wrapped in the reassuring embrace of nature, and as a Druid you hold and master the ancient art of healing the various ailments, which affect the human body, with the herbs, plants and trees that surround you.

And so different people will come looking for you who need your help but, beware, you are not alone!

There are also other experienced Druids who compete with you to cure these patients.

You will have to prove that you can treat them better than your rival Druids, so that you will be proclaimed the one and only Druid Master!"

The game consists of 8 rounds where players will have to treat patients with the plants at their disposal.

The plants are represented by cards, which describe the benefits of the plant in percentages.

7 plant cards are drawn at the beginning of the game and 2 at the beginning of each turn.

You can use from 1 to 3 plant cards, in combination, to try to cure the patient as much as possible.

(You can study best combination hidden by the proper player screen)

Each turn an event card is drawn that affects all players (famine, harvest day...).

There are also effect cards: one for each player, to be played in the best moment of the game, to take an advantage on the other players or to hinder them.

name: Lace Warfare: Tactical Level Combat in the Age of Reason
description:
Lace Warfare: Tactical Level Combat in the Age of Reason primarily covers the Austrian Succession, Seven Years War, French and Indian War, and American War of Independence, but can also be employed for the War of the Grand Alliance, War of the Spanish Succession, and the Great Northern War.

Lace Warfare uses miniature model soldiers on a table laid out with model terrain, along with dice, rulers, and various markers.
There is no bookkeeping involved in these rules. All changes in status can be represented on the table by markers, stand positions etc...
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: La Valse des Masques
description:
La Valse des Masques (The waltz of masks)

16th century. You are the head of one of the 4 most respected and powerful noble families in Venice. You must use your power to maintain your family's influence and power in the Great Council. The future Doge must be in your favour! Use every trick in the book and reach the highest levels to rule the Republic of Venice!
Waltz of the Masks is a card game of actions, placements and combinations.

Objective of the game :
The main objective is to have the most influence points, and therefore usually the most "revealed" cards in the highest position, before the end of the game. The higher a "revealed" card is, the more influence value it has for the final count. Thematically, a high card is an advisor who influences the upper echelons of the city.

Players play cards in rows and push cards from the bottom row to the top. Cards can be played face up to perform card effects or face down to hide these effects until they come into force later in the game. Players cannot play the same card as the previous player, or the same card as the last player of the previous turn if you are the first player of the turn.

—description from publisher


Vous êtes à la tête d’une des 4 familles nobles les plus respectées et puissantes de Venise. Vous devez user de votre pouvoir afin de conserver l’influence et la puissance de votre famille au sein du Grand Conseil. Le futur Doge doit vous être favorable!
Usez de toutes les filouteries et atteignez les plus hautes sphères afin de régner en maître sur la République de Venise!
La Valse des Masques est un jeu de cartes d'actions, de placement et de combinaisons.

Objectif du jeu :
L’objectif principal est d’avoir le plus de points d’influence, et donc en général le plus de cartes “révélées” dans la position la plus haute, avant la fin de la partie.
Plus une carte “révélée” est haute, plus elle a de la valeur en influence pour le décompte final. Thématiquement, une carte haute est un conseiller qui influence les hautes sphères de la cité.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Medieval, Political

name: Mindfulness Game
description:
Mindfulness Games for Kids, Therapy Card Games: 3 Games in 1 Box, Fun Family Games That Teach Mindfulness, Social and Emotional Skills, Therapy Tools for Counselors and Teachers

Guess: A pack of cards with questions on each. Each player takes turns guessing how well they know their child/siblings. Every correct answer gets a sticker. The player with the most stickers wins!

Connect: A pack of cards with topics on each. Connect with your family members by answering the questions on a variety of topics. Every correct answer gets a sticker. The player with the most stickers wins!

Experiment: A pack of cards with a set of tasks and experiments. Everyone takes turns participating in the tasks. Each task shows how many points (stickers) the task is worth. The player with the most stickers wins!

—description from publisher

name: And Action!
description:
And Action is a competitive card game about making movies for 2-6 players that takes 45-60 mins to play. You are a producer, racing to create and release movies by which you will earn fame.

In And Action, you collect sets of a script, actor, actress and director to form and release movies. Each character belongs to one of the specific genres: Action, Comedy, Mystery & Romance. You earn fame based on the genre of the script and character cards.

In addition, you can trade with other players, discard to/pick from a talent market and use event cards to reach your goal. Play the advanced version with Award Cards for even more variety. The producer with the highest fame at the end wins!

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Total Control Wrestling
description:
Total Control Wrestling! The game where you decide how the storylines unfold on TV!

Total Control Wrestling provides players with an entire game system focused on a wrestling promotion with a weekly TV show. Every week, the show builds on the characters, storylines, feuds, and angles of the previous shows. It’s like watching your favorite weekly wrestling show on TV. You never know what will happen, who will show up, or what matches you may see. But one thing is for sure… it will lead to a knock-down, drag-out, feud-settling match down the road!

Create your own wrestlers or use those included in the game to get right into the action! The random creation process allows you to generate a wrestler’s physical stats, never knowing what you may get. Will it be a giant? Or a luchador? Then you decide the wrestler’s style and attributes to fit the prototype. Alternately, players can disregard the random process and assign any stats and attributes as they see fit, making the wrestler of their dreams! Perhaps you want to make replicas of the stars you watch on TV? You can do that, too!

The game system allows players to customize and use whatever elements they want and disregard the rest. Players can track everything built into the game system or use the most basic aspects for matches. Only want to use the Match Charts to determine winners in one-off matches? You can. Want to leave out the XP and Character Progression? You can do that without affecting the rest of the game. If detailing all the Feuds is too much work, leave that out and let the charts tell the stories from one show to the next. For the ultimate experience, get out some paper and pencils and run an entire promotion, keeping track of every stat, win, loss, storyline, angle, and feud from beginning to end.

The Chart Manual guides the general action of the TV show. However, players add the details, develop the personalities, and use their own creativity to enhance the show as it tells the stories from week-to-week. Angles, interviews, and scenarios will build Feuds between rivals until they can settle it once-and-for-all in the ring. New feuds will emerge, old feuds will re-start, wrestlers will turn on each other, and more! The game system provides the methods and means, but it is up to you to decide how and why it happened.

You have Total Control!
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Air Flix: Dunkirk – Battle Pack
description:
Be part of one of the pivotal moments of modern military history with Evacuation Mode. Allied forces are desperately trying to get home, with Spitfire squadrons providing cover overhead but quickly running out of fuel, how many lives can they save?

The Dunkirk battle pack is a standalone game and contains:


The Dunkirk 3’ x 3’ Neoprene Battle Mat
Plane Minatures & Acrylic Discs
3 Supermariine Spitfire
3 Messerschmitt Bf 109
2 Boulton Paul Defiant
2 Heinkel He 111
2 Barrage Balloons

10 Pilot Cards
6 Ace Pilot Cards
1 Fuel Tracker Board
1 Bombing Map
10 Bomb Tokens
2 Squadron Boards
2 Ranging Sticks
5 Combat Dice
Scenario rules for Evacuation Mode


—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Aufgepasst!: Ein Verkehrsspiel
description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 80 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events or traffic rules hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Kugelblitz
description:
65 balls are filled into the funnel-shaped top part of the ball tower and randomly distributed on the five vertical lanes, where they remain stacked.

In the base plate, below these stacks of balls, there are sliders with troughs in which the lowest ball in each case can be pulled out to one or the other player. The aim is to get as many balls of the same color as possible on one's own side in each turn. The winner is the player who has the most balls at the end - regardless of color.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Children's Game

name: Meister Lampe und seine Familie
description:
In the game, 32 bunny cards, each with 8 bunnies of one player color, are face down. The player whose turn it is rolls the die once and may reveal a card on a 5 or 6. If it is a card of your own color, you may keep it, otherwise you put it back face down. You may then continue to reveal cards until another player rolls a 5 or 6. If you roll a 1, you lose a bunny if you have collected an odd number of cards. The first player to collect 8 bunnies wins the game.

—user summary

name: Planevo
description:
The game deals with personality development and the experience of happiness. Players move along a life path, starting at birth, through childhood, adolescence, adulthood, always on the way to happiness. The movement of the game pieces is controlled first by a dice and later by cards. The cards also contain texts with positive and negative experiences, which materialize green happiness stones and / or black ballast stones that you carry in a backpack. At some points in the game, only a certain amount of ballast may be carried. If you have too much, you have to go back and try to get rid of the ballast. In addition, you collect suns and stars on a characteristic board, which in turn must be filled to a certain degree to be allowed to enter the target field. The winner is the one who could collect the most stars.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Wortklaubereien
description:
The players have a bag with tactile plastic letters. A term with words of 3, 4 or 5 letters is revealed. Everyone now searches in their bag - without looking inside - for the matching letters and lays them out. The first player to do so receives the term card. The player who has collected the most cards wins the game.

—user summary

name: Dunlop Tennis-Cup
description:
A tennis game in 3 difficulty levels for beginners, advanced and professionals. Played with a plastic chip that is flicked over the net with a "racket". The difficulty levels are:
Beginner: The chip must be flicked into the opponent's court. For a mistake the opponent gets a point. With 10 points you win a game, with 2 games you win a match.
Advanced: The game is played according to table tennis rules. In addition, there are fields in the opponent's area on which you can make direct points.
Professionals: It is played according to tennis rules. In addition, there are fields in the opponent's area on which you can make direct points.

—user summary

name: Weißt du noch...?: Die 50er
description:
The theme of the game is to put events from the 1950s in the correct chronological order and bring memories to life with narration.

Text and picture cards (movie posters) are shuffled separately and stacked. Each player gets one movie poster card and three text cards and places them in front of them. The cards must now be put in the correct order, for this you may look at the date on the back of the movie poster. Once everyone has laid out an order, the players take turns presenting the events; memories and stories come into play. You get one point for each correct card, in case of doubt the year counts. Whoever has the most points after an agreed number of rounds wins.

—user summary

name: Berge
description:
Players are given mountain cards in 3 categories (difficulty of climbing the mountains), which they must work through to the end of the game. You move your figure through Switzerland by rolling the dice and can climb your mountains (dice test). If this succeeds no later than the 3rd time, you get paid a bonus. In addition, a question is asked, the correct answer also earns a bonus. If other players come to your mountain, they have to pay a fee. Further fields trigger events that cost or bring in money. The player who has completed all the mountain cards may run back to the combined start/finish field. Here there are again bonuses for the first, second and third player. The player who has collected the most money wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Income, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Icosium
description:
Test your knowledge of Algeria while having fun. 2,000 questions including 70% related to Algeria. 5 categories of questions: history, geography, culture & traditions, sport, gastronomy

Each player places his pawn at the door to Algeria matching his color. Movement around the board is determined by whether a player can answer the question alone, with help, or not at all. The first player to make it round the board back to his starting point wins the game.

Alone or in a team, the goal of Icosium is to be the first to tour the 48 Wilayas by correctly answering the five categories of questions.

–Description from the publisher
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Election Night in America
description:
Election Night in America is a 2 to 4 player game where you are a candidate running for the Presidency.

Each player chooses a party and a candidate to run for office. It is up to you to strategize and balance four types of influence, represented by cards: finance, social media, religion, and politics. You will need to navigate the political landscape by rolling dice to avoid scandals and your opponent's schemes. Using influence, you will attempt to win electoral votes for each state.

Will you have the political clout to win the 270 electoral votes to become president?

You will be able to find this game available on KICKSTARTER this fall.

—description from publisher

name: Temple Challenge
description:
Inspired by the lost pyramid temple cities found deep in the Rain Forest, this game takes on a character of it's own. If you have ever played the game Aggravation, then think how much more fun it would be playing it in 3D!

The Temple Challenge game is approximately 12 inches square by 2 & 1/4 inches tall. Comes with 4 sets of 4 matching marbles, instructions, and a set of dice.

Up to 4 players at a time can play Temple Challenge, each player gets 4 marbles to try and win by making it to the top and out of the Temple.

The end of the game comes when a player gets all of their marbles to their home row.

"—description from the publisher"
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: You've Lost Your Marbles!
description:
50 marbles of each color are provided but the game may be played with less marbles as long as both sides start out with an equal amount.

To play this game you start by rolling a dice to see who will go first. Each player will then roll the dice twice for each move to be made, but only moves marbles after the second roll.

The first roll is the determining number.

In the second roll there are three possibilities. If the second number is less than the first roll, you have to give your opponent the amount of your colored marbles you rolled the first time.

If the second roll is higher, then you subtract your first role from the second and take that many of your opponents marbles or take your own colored marbles back along with any of your opponents to complete the number amount.

If you roll the same number both times (same dice combination), you get to take the total of both roles of your opponents colored marbles or a combination of yours and your opponents to match the total number.

If you roll the same total numbers again, then you pass the turn on to your opponent without moving any marbles at all.

The game ends when one side has lost all of their own colored marbles.

"—description from the publisher"

name: Corona Downs
description:
First, all the marbles are placed on the board behind the start line. Marbles will be moving to the right or counter clockwise during play. Two dice are rolled to determine the odds for each marble racer from the inside track to the outside track. For instance, if on the roll for marble racer number one a 5 and a 2 are rolled then the odds for that racer is 7 to 1.

The house starts with $1,000,000 (Million Dollars) and each player starts with $100,000 each to place bets on the racers. (This starting amount can be changed).

Each racer is worth $1,000 a race (again this amount can be changed or even randomly set by the roll of the dice) Example, if a player loses on a racer, they lose a thousand bucks! But if they win on a racer they get paid whatever the odds are on that racer: Example, if the racer has odds of 5 to 1 then they win $5,000. A player can place bets on more than one racer at a time.

The dice are rolled for each racer until one racer crosses the finish line. One designated player can roll all the dice for the game or each player can take turns.

The end of the game comes when someone loses all their cash or when a set number of races are run as determined by the players before the start of the game.

With this game you have the option to even make up your own rules, maybe you have some good ideas for how to set up betting for this game.

"—description from the publisher"
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Ushuaïa
description:
Ushuaïa is a family game inviting you to explore the world and its riches and protect the environment, while having fun.

Each explorer moves around the photos on the board and takes on different challenges to earn exploration tokens and complete their mission sheet.
There are 4 types of challenges: our world, exploration, surprising planet and preserving the earth.

The explorer who fills his/her mission card first (6 tokens) is the winner.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: ASL Comp: French Algeria – Djebel Fighters 1954-1962
description:
It is high time that YOUR tactical-level gaming IQ be put to the test in some of the roughest terrain every fought over in this contest of European will and North African stealth ...
long before the West truly grasped the capabilities of a new kind of foe.
This brings more never before published CH military art to the fore, as the ALN and post Indochina French paratroopers slug it out...in a never-ending battle that lasted until 1962.

—description from the publisher

Scenarios:

Jump on the Traitors - Besbessa Mechta, July 3rd 1956
End of a Convoy - Northwest of Oum-Ali, November 29th 1956
Operation 423 - Oued-Adb-er-Rahmane, May 21st 1957
No Time To Talk - Djebel Ouasta, January 11th 1958
Chased Through the Woods - Beni-Mezzeline Forest, February 14th 1958
Are These Harkis? - Beni-Mezzeline Forest, February 14th 1958
Dropped Into Hell - Djebel Mouadjene, south of Souk-Ahras, April 29th 1958
In the Swirling Mass - Djebel Mouadjene, south of Souk-Ahras, April 29th 1958
Cross Border Retaliation - Djebel Harraba, Tunisian Border, May 26th 1959
After the Cease-fire - Near Boualam, April 14th 1962
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Leaping Letters
description:
The librarian has locked up all the "naughty books" in the library. The books have to make three-letter words that match patterns to collect library cards. The book with the most library cards gets a key card. Five key cards lets the book escape.

OVERVIEW

Using letters on the cards in your hand and the common “community” cards, form three-letter words in a specific pattern. These patterns are found on each letter card.

Play in rounds, collecting library cards and exchanging them for keys. At the start of each round, return all the library cards to a common pile. On each turn, a player can perform one action:

Use one of their letter cards to form a word -or-
Exchange one letter card and immediately play it if possible


After forming a word, collect a library card worth the value of the word formed. Count the point value of the word formed and grab a library card of equal value. Most letters are worth 1 point, a few worth 2 points and X and Z worth 3 points.

When one player eliminates all their cards, the round is over. The person with the most library card points will get a key. If there is a tie, all tied players get a key. Once all the keys have been dispensed or one player has collected five keys, the player with the most keys wins.

SOLO GAME PLAY
Deal three community cards. Deal yourself ten letter cards. Attempt to use all of your cards to form words. You are allowed a maximum of three exchanges. Win by playing all cards.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Spelling

name: Jump Off: The game for horse lovers
description:
The Jump Off board represents an equestrian show-jumping arena. The board is a hex grid.

Players set out 18 jumps to make their own course for the horses to jump over. Six player pieces are included in the box, but more players can play by adding their own pieces. The game includes trivia cards with equestrian-related questions. The questions are divided into six difficulty levels for players to decide what they want to study. Four of the levels are designed to help the player prepare for the British Horse Society exams (Stage 1 to stage 4), and the game is associated with the British Horse Society.

The players move and answer questions to go over the jumps. The first player to the end of the course wins. Special cards also affect the players' progression.

—user summary
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Noten-Würfel
description:
The players try to form permissible note rows with 10 dice on which notes instead of numbers are shown in a maximum of 3 rolls. For each die that could not be used, one of the 45 question cards must be answered. Plus points are awarded for valid rows of dice and correctly answered questions, minus points for incorrectly answered questions. The player with the most points wins.

Noten-Würfel can be played in teams or with 2-4 players.

name: Freibeuter
description:
Trading game back to the time of sailing ships and the great port cities as a transshipment point for all goods of this earth - but beware of the pirates, you do not want to lose the precious cargo.

Transporting goods from port to port brings more revenue the longer the distance. There are 2 ways to earn ducats, either from your own cargo or from the cargo of your fellow players, which you take from them with the help of the buccaneers. The routes are always determined anew, if a ship has reached a target port, thereby one can equip a ship also again. Each ship must be moved once per turn, the range depends on the wind.

A game turn consists of influencing wind direction, setting buccaneer courses, moving merchant ships, moving buccaneers, passing a marker. The winner is the first to reach the agreed ducat sum e.g. 10,000.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Connections, Movement Points, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: イチからファーム (Ichikara Farm)
description:
Micro deck building game where you try to build the best farm possible.

Players start as a rancher (a single card).
Each turn you play as many cards as you want (hand limit is 3) and then make a purchase and rinse and repeat.
Game ends when the purchase deck is exhausted.

Players deck out their farm with ranches and flower fields (which produces more gold), or with animals like monkeys and deer that help to steal from your opponents.
Hiring carpenters and hunters will help you to grow your wealth faster or to prevent the opponent's animals from creating mischief in your farm.

Accumulate enough gold to build attractions or a zoo to earn precious victory points!

—user summary
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Ownership

name: Classic Car
description:
Classic Car is similar to Monopoly. Here you don't collect roads but cars to earn money with them. The players roll their figures over a circuit, can acquire possession cards and must accept events (losses and profits). Some fields (e.g. the foreclosure, the restoration) intervene more strongly in the possession than one is used to from Monopoly. There are several ways the game ends:

A player gives up
A player shows a joker card, hoping to have the most money at the moment.
An agreed playing time is over


In any case, the richest player wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn

name: Beethoven
description:
Players collect tiles from the Lifeometer to compose the best symphony they can. Meanwhile, their movement around the Clock dial translates to the fifty-six years of Beethoven's life. When one player completes their symphony, composing enters the final stages before scoring in the Veneration (of Beethoven's life).

The game has three distinct game levels (Early, Middle and Late Periods) and scoring develops in each game, Players score points for the qualities of their symphony; the most points wins the game.

—description from publisher

name: Professor Noggin's Horse
description:
The game is a trivia contest between the players. Players roll the dice to see who will answer first. Then, the next player draws a card and rolls the dice to see which trivia question to ask of several available questions. If the first player correctly answers the question, they get to keep the card for the rest of the game. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Trivia

name: HorsePLAY
description:
HorsePLAY involves action, challenges, answering trivia, miming, drawing, and possibly singing. The game involves a set of cards in a box, along with a timer, a die, and pencil and paper.

A player draws a card, and reads the action or question to the player whose turn it is. The kinds of actions each card can be are: Champion (high point-value questions with visual clues), Gallery (questions involving a picture), Crossroad (deciding between two scenarios), Trivia/Busking/Adventure (roll to see if you are asked a trivia question, or must perform an action) and Brain Teaser (answer a riddle).

The actions are worth varying amounts of points. The scorekeeper records the points, and the winner is whoever has the most points when the players decide to end the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Acting, Paper-and-Pencil, Singing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Poeticamente
description:
Do you want to try your hand at an enigmatic and creative game, for lyricists of all ages?

The winner is whoever is faster to compose a themed phrase or poem, in which the initial letters of words or verses recompose a name. (acrostic game)

The theme papers are mixed and covered in the center of the table, even in several bunches. Keep the name card and the marker close at hand. Each competitor must get some pieces of paper and a pen.

The youngest writes on the name card, in the column, the letters of a name (the chosen name must be at least 4 and maximum 9 letters and can be a personal name but also a common name of thing, person, animal, etc.). He then puts the card in the center of the table, showing it to the other players. Then he draws a theme map, places it face up next to the name card and the game begins. The first among the competitors who writes a sentence adhering to the subject of the drawn theme map, consisting of words or verses which, read in order, begin with the letters of the name of the ticket, wins the heat. If the sentence is not relevant to the theme, the second fastest player wins, and so on. The winner earns the drawn theme map. The game continues in the same way with a new round (the player following the first one in clockwise order will draw).

The winner is the one who wins the most theme maps at the end of one or two laps (at the choice of the competitors). In the event of a tie, a play-off takes place.

—user summary

name: Sette Sfide
description:
A fun collection of strategy games in a practical format, for many one-on-one challenges, wherever you want and with whoever you want. Are you ready? Choose the game, take the marker and think about the right move!

The pack contains 7 boards on which the boards of the following classic abstract games are shown: GOMOKU - NIM - DOTS & BOXES - SNAKES - MAMMA VS PAPPA - CHINESE WALL.

GOMOKU It is an ancient strategy game also called "five in a row". The players take turns marking a square with their symbol (eg "O" and "X"). The first player to get five of their own symbols aligned, horizontally, vertically or diagonally, wins the game.

NIM It is an ancient game of unknown origins. The players take turns erasing one or more cans from a single row. They must remove at least one jar and can remove any number of cans from the same row. The last player able to move wins.

DOTS & BOXES It is a "pencil and paper" game with countless variations. How to play The two players take turns drawing horizontal or vertical lines between two adjacent points. If a player completes the fourth side of a square, he marks that square with the initial of his name (or a letter of recognition) and must immediately draw another line (as if it were an extra turn). When all squares have been filled, the player who has captured the most squares is the winner.

SNAKES It is the "pen and paper" version of an old video game. How to play It is played on a 7 x 7 point matrix. The first player starts from the green "S" point in the upper left, while the other starts with the red "S" point in the lower right, as shown in the image. Players take turns growing their snake, extending it one segment at a time by drawing a horizontal or vertical line from the previous point to an adjacent one. The first player unable to move loses.

MOM VS PAPPA It is a "pen and paper" strategy game: the aim is to recreate the word MOM for one player and the word PAPPA on the grid for the other. At the beginning of the game, the players decide who plays for PAPPA (inserting the letters P and A) and who for MOMMA (inserting the letters Me A). On his turn, the player inserts one of the two letters of his word in any box, without having to use the same letter every turn. The player who is the first to spell his word horizontally, vertically or diagonally wins the game.

CHINESE WALL is a simple and fun game. The aim is to be the last player to create a wall that spans three territories.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Saltalettera
description:
A word game for everyone!
Move on the board by jumping from one tile to another, choose the right letters and write the longest word! A game of language skill and strategy to train the minds of young and old.

Mix the letter tiles and arrange them in the center of the table forming a 5x5 square. Each player takes a marker, a word-form board and a joker triangle. Procedure The youngest player places the black placeholder on a letter-card of his choice. Each player then chooses a letter (present in the selected tile) and writes it on their word-form board (in one of the circles). Then the next player moves the placeholder onto another letter-card adjacent to the previous one (the movement can take place by one step). The process is repeated up to that the players have not completed the six letters on their wordform board. At this point the players, within 30 seconds, must write a meaningful word using their transcribed letters. Each player will earn as many points as there are letters in the written word. The score achieved by each player must be written in the corresponding space on the scorecard. Jolly Triangle During a round, players can play the joker by placing the triangle of their color on the active letter-tile: in the word formation phase, they will be able to use a letter present in that tile an infinite number of times. New round The trailing player takes the placeholder and starts a new round in the same way as the previous one. The game continues and ends when a player reaches 20 points (or more or less at the players' choice). He will be the winner!

—user summary

name: Feeling: Le emozioni in gioco !
description:
An intriguing party game, which stimulates empathy between players. Tell an episode you lived and imagine the moods you felt: will others be able to guess them?

The youngest player starts and briefly tells a real fact that he has experienced or an imaginary situation that could happen to him, without naming the emotions he felt. In the situation described, he must imagine the prevailing emotions he felt before, during and at the end of what happened. He then writes on his card (with the erasable marker) the number 1 in correspondence with the emotion he felt before, the number 2 in correspondence with the emotion he felt during and the number 3 in correspondence with the emotion that he has tried in the end. All this, taking care not to show your card to your opponents. In the meantime, the other competitors also proceed to mark the emotions they imagine on their cards was able to try the narrator before, during and at the end. At this point, the emotion cards are revealed and scores are calculated by comparing the narrator's emotion card with those of the competitors. The game continues in the same way: the new narrator will be the next in a clockwise direction to the last hand, Warning: if during the story the narrator names an emotion (for example he says "I was very anxious before the exam") game and the turn passes to the next competitor.

Each competitor earns 1 point for each emotion right in the right time position within the story. He receives a 3-point bonus if he guesses all three emotions in the right order. The narrator earns 1 point for each of the emotions guessed by the contestants. Each player keeps his score by taking the appropriate tokens. The winner is the one who has scored the most points after 1 or 2 laps (at the competitors' choice).

name: Lettera Velenosa
description:
Have you ever tried to write a sentence avoiding the letter A? An original party game that trains your creative writing skills, but beware: you don't have to use the poisonous letter!

The youngest player begins, placing the letter marker above the letter board in any position (but which frames one of the letters well) and then moves it on the board by one or two steps (at his discretion, but only in horizontally or vertically). At this point he draws a subject map and the game begins. All competitors, within the time of an hourglass, must write (each on their own slate) a complete sentence of at least 5 words, which is inspired by an element of the map-subject caught and in which the letter indicated by the letter-marker: this will be the "poisonous letter": At the end of the round, the competitors who have managed to write a meaningful sentence earn a point for each word used in the composition (articles, prepositions and other monosyllables are not counted). If a player realizes that he has used the poisonous letter, he does not score points and also loses all those previously earned.

At the end of a round, the hand passes to the next player and the procedure is repeated. The game ends when one of the competitors reaches 50 points (depending on the agreements between the players.) If the subject maps run out, they are reshuffled. Wildcard If a player draws a subject map with a joker, instead it is played at the Letter Catcher. The player who drew the Jolly map draws another subject map to establish the theme of the test. Therefore, within the time of the hourglass, all competitors must write a complete sentence (of at least 5 words), which is inspired by an element of the subject-map drawn and is made up of as many words starting with the indicated letter. For each word that begins with the indicated letter, they earn one point.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: X-Job
description:
Baker, hairdresser, blogger, speleologist. In this fun party game, the goal is to make people guess the mysterious profession.
The secret to winning? Never be too explicit!

Each competitor takes a marker and a slate. The X-Job papers are mixed and placed covered, in bunches, in the center of the table. The spinner is kept close at hand.

The oldest player begins the dealer's turn. He draws an X-Job card (without showing it to others) and turns the spinner which will determine, based on the color released, which will be the job to guess: if, for example, the color pink comes out, he will have to guess the job which in the paper is in correspondence of the pink color. If, after a spin of the spinner, the smiley face comes out, the dealer has the right to choose a trade of his choice, writes it on the slate and can decide to block an opposing player for a turn.

Then he will say aloud the key skills of the mysterious profession and, based on his experience, he will try to provide first clue about the mysterious profession to the other players, but trying not to be too explicit. Each player writes his solution on the slate (without being seen by the others) and then the answers are checked.

If no one guesses, the dealer gives a second clue and then a final clue. Scores are awarded based on the number of clues revealed. The dealer will earn points if only one of the players has guessed the mysterious trade.

The winner is whoever reaches 30 points first.

—description from publisher

name: Nomen
description:
Find as many words as possible in a category and with the same initial letter, but beware, there are unpredictable rules: an animal with two identical letters, a food with at least one double?

The youngest player who discovers a letter map and an activity map begins. After the competitors have read the contents of the maps, spin the spinner which will indicate a category. At this point the hourglass starts and all the players must write on their slate as many words as possible that begin with the letter of the map drawn and that respect the specific indications of the map-activity. Also, the written words must belong to the category indicated by the spinner.

After the round, another starts and so on until a player reaches 100 points (or more, or less, at the choice of the players before the game): he will be the winner of the race. Each player scores 3 points for each "original" word (not written by anyone) and 1 point for "non-original" words (written by one or more players). The points are marked and updated on the appropriate card with the erasable marker.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Lessicando
description:
Do you really know the meaning of the words you use?
Find out with this fun party game in which competitors compete to formulate the definition of more or less difficult words: the winner is whoever is more convincing!

Procedure For each round there is a player who acts as a reader. The reader turns the spinner and draws a vocabulary card. He turns the hourglass and the other competitors will have to write a definition of the word on the card that corresponds to the color indicated by the spinner, while the reader searches the dictionary for the exact definition of the word. At the end of the time, each player votes for the most suitable definition but he can't vote his own), placing his vote token on the corresponding slate.

At this point the reader reads the definition of the dictionary and decides which is the best definition. The author of the best definition earns 3 points. In addition, each player earns 1 point for each vote received by his definition, even if it is incorrect. The points are marked in the appropriate form. The winner is whoever has scored the most points after a full round (i.e. after all players have taken their turns as player). Competitors can decide, before starting the race, to make the game last two, three or more laps.

The challenge: If the spinner indicates the wedge with the little face, the word card is not drawn but the reader indicates an opponent to challenge and the game is played in the following way: the reader chooses a word of his choice (taken from the knowledge base) and search the dictionary for the correct definition. He writes two definitions on his own slate, one right and one wrong, trying to trick the opponent. The opponent chooses the definition. If he gets it right, he wins 3 points, otherwise 3 points go to the player.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Action Timer, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Judge, Voting

name: Inventions
description:
Shuffle the cards and place them randomly face down on the table. The youngest player turns over two cards. If these form a couple, the player keeps the cards and keeps on playing, otherwise he/she turns them back over and it is the following player's turn. The game ends when there are no more cards on the table. The player with the most cards at the end wins.

Invention timeline: Shuffle the cards and place them randomly face down on the table. The youngest player turns over two cards.
