If these form a couple, the player keeps the cards and keeps on playing, otherwise he/she turns them back over and it is the following player's turn. The game ends when there are no more cards on the table. The player with the most cards at the end wins.

The chronological timeline chart contains the names of the inventions from the oldest to the most recent. The matched pairs can be placed in chronological sequence, from the oldest to the most recent one, forming a time line of the inventions and their inventors.

name: MasterBluff
description:
The player on the left of the dealer starts by discarding one or more cards of the same family and saying it out loud. Whoever discards a card may lie about the object of the card, but must declare that the cards are all of the same family (for example: "two elves'; "two wizards'; "two witches'; "three fairies'; "three ogres'; "three jesters" and so on ... ). lf no one challenges the truth of the declaration, the cards are put in the discard pile and the game passes to the next player who continues to discard cards of the same family as those declared by the previous player (for example if the previous player had declared "two fairies'; the next player can declare to discard, for instance, "four fairies").

When it's their turn, each player can play the exchange token that allows them to change the card family to be discarded from the one declared by the previous competitor. The exchange token, once played, must be set aside.

After a player discards and declares the family group of their cards, any of the opponents may, if they believe the declaration to be false, call out "Bluff!. At this point the truth of the declaration is verified by checking the discarded cards with two possible outcomes: if the declaration is true, the player who called out "bluff" will be penalized by getting all the cards from the discard pile. If the player's declaration was false, the player who lied gets all the cards from the discard pile.

The player who discards all their cards first wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Fantasia
description:
Mime, narrator or graphic designer? A challenge that tests expressive skills, intuition and creativity.

The youngest player begins and draws an inspiration card and tums the spinner. The spinner indicates, in the outer circle, a theme (for example cinema), while in the inner circle, an action to be performed (for example, mimic). The player then has 20 seconds to find a subject that is consistent with the theme and inspiration card. He/she then writes the identified subject on the small board, without showing it to others. Subsequently, he/she has a minute to have the other players guess the written subject using the action indicated by the spinner. At the end of the round the scores are calculated and the game continues. The next player will be the one on the right of the last one to spin the spinner.

In addition to defining the theme (cinema, sports, art, music, occupations and literature), the spinner indicates one of the following tests: drawing (with the large board and erasable marker and without using letters), verbal explanation,(without pronouncing the words in the solution) and miming 9 (without uttering any words). When the spinner indicates the chain segment, the player must invite another player to play his/her turn, and to freely choose one of the three skills above indicated.

The winner is the one who first reaches 10 points (or more, or less, as decided by the players at the beginning of the game). In case of a tie, a play-off round will follow.

—user summary

name: Sci-Fi Rescue: A Solo Game
description:
Rescue a scientist from a disintegrating space station while fending off assorted nasty animals.

This is a follow on to several previous games (Sci-Fi Escape: A Solo Game, Sci-Fi Return: A Solo Game) but can be played as a stand alone game.

Ideal for 28mm figures but any size will do as long as they are individually based.

Turn Sequence:

Activate your forces
Activate any creatures
Roll for random events
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Koszos Fred Kártyajáték
description:
Koszos Fred kártyajáték (Dirty Fred Card Game) was manufactured in small scale in 1985, Hungary. The game combines the excitement of poker, the simplicity of ulti (a Hungarian card game), and the charm of knock rummy. The game consists of the beloved characters of the famous writer, Jenő Rejtő. Some provide special powers, like Koszos Fred (based on the character Piszkos Fred, or Dirty Fred in English). Players are trying to achieve the most points, by collecting red cards and hitting other player's cards.

"It is advised to sign the back of the Koszos Fred card, so in case of drawing it, one can easily acquire him. Obviously we do not take responsibility for the resulting fistfight, missing teeth, or broken limbs/skulls."

name: Samana
description:
There are two game versions, one for 2 and the other for 4 players.

In the 2-person game, you move your pieces from your base across a 6*10 board by rolling the dice (1, 2, 3) and try to capture enemy pieces and bring them to your base.
The player who has the last remaining game pieces wins.

In the 4-person game, you play on a 6*6 board and try to knock other players' pieces off the board by rolling the dice. The last player to have game pieces left wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Static Capture

name: Ein Hindernisrennen mit 6 Würfeln
description:
Each player rolls 6 dice and decides which results to keep and which dice to roll again. The end result is entered into the results table. Each player gets 7 turns. In line 1 all dice with show a "1" are added. The same counts for line 2 to 6. For an entry in Line H one has to roll a sequence of 1-2-3-4-5-6 to get 42 points. If the result of a turn can't be used in any line, one line has to be canceled.

After 7 turns the added results are entered in Line S. The Player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

name: Funny You Should Ask!
description:
The shortest player automatically becomes the game boss. This makes him or her supreme ruler over any discrepancies that may occur during play. Once you have finished arguing over who gets which colour, place the playing pieces on the Start space and give each player a set of A, B, C, and D answer cards.

The game boss becomes the first reader. The reader draws a card from the question box and poses it to the player on his or her left—who is now called the subject. All players then predict which option (A, B, C, or D) on the question card they think the subject will choose by placing one of their answer cards face down in front of them. For yes or no questions, A is yes and B is no.

All players who correctly guessed the subject’s answer move ahead one space for every option on the question card (if there were two options, they move ahead two spaces; if there were three options, they move ahead three spaces; and if there were four options, they move ahead four spaces). The subject moves ahead one space for every player who predicted his or her answer correctly (if one person predicted correctly, the subject moves ahead one space; if two people predicted correctly, the subject moves ahead two spaces, etc.).

Ask Again, Switch Places and Just Kidding cards can make the player move forward or back as well.

The first player to reach the Finish space, wins.

The Game Includes: 1 Question Box with 432 Questions,
8 Sets of Answer Cards (A, B, C, & D),
8 Playing Pieces, Game Board and
Set of Instructions
mechanics: Movement Points, Take That, Track Movement, Voting

name: Rätsel Spaß
description:
A game leader reads out question cards (usually joke questions), and the other players answer.
Example:
Question: what is in the middle of the city of Ulm?
Answer: The letter "l"
The player who guesses correctly receives the question card. Whoever has collected the most question cards wins the game.

—user summary

name: Konzentration
description:
In the game there are 192 picture cards with different concrete pictures and graphic patterns, matching cards are marked by the same back. In the game, you decide on such a group and must now find the two or three exactly identical cards or those cards that belong together for a logical reason, such as the two halves of a kangaroo. To check, turn the pairs over, they now show the same geometric symbol. The player who finds the most sets in a certain given time wins the game.

—user summary

name: Zombie Brains
description:
Zombie Brains is a race to build a zombie and get a brain – whilst hopefully using your brain to prevent your fellow zombies doing it before you! You can try and get a matching zombie or build a zombie from the parts of different zombies, the choice is yours, although a matching zombie does have tactical advantages!

All players get 5 cards to start with, there are two types of cards, body part cards (head, torso, legs and brains) and action cards. Any head, torso and leg cards are placed face up on the table and the action cards (and brain card) are hidden in the players hand. When it's a players turn they can either play a body card or an action card. The action cards include 'zombie attack', 'steal a brain', 'make all other zombies heads roll' plus a few more zombie cards.

The game ends when a player has built a whole zombie, head, torso, legs and a brain. The other players can deny the brain when revealed which makes that zombie loose their brain and has to keep going. Unless they have a matching zombie (the three parts 'belong' together). Then the brain denied card is useless and the whole zombie has won.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Memory, Zombies
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Kleine Schätze
description:
In the game are different treasures and 18 different cards in three different sizes, on them are 2, 3 or 4 treasures. These cards are shuffled and stacked separately, the top one is revealed, everyone has a crystal stone, the treasures are in the bag. 6 treasures lie face up, the player on his turn tries to arrange them so that they match the card exactly, for missing he may reach into the bag three times to find them. Missing treasures go into the open supply. Once he has fulfilled a card, he takes it and reveals the next one, the correct treasures go back into the bag. The crystal is to be used once to win a card. Once all the cards have been dealt, the winner is the one who has the longest chain, or the one who has the highest sum of card values. A more difficult game variant is given.

—user summary

name: Sum Fun!
description:
Sum Fun! mixes bingo with math problems and is for ages 4-8. It is played more-or-less the same as Bingo without the use of bingo balls. Instead, cards are drawn with a mathematical equation on them and the player must figure out the answer and mark it correctly on their own board. When someone gets four in a row correct in any direction, they are the winner. This is a simplified version of Smarty.

—user summary

name: Smarty
description:
Smarty mixes bingo with math problems and is for ages 4-8. It is played more-or-less the same as Bingo without the use of bingo balls. Instead, cards are drawn with a mathematical equation on them and the player must figure out the answer and mark it correctly on their own board. When someone gets four/five in a row correct in any direction, they are the winner.

—user summary

name: Astro Buds: Space Adventure Board Game
description:
Astro Buds is a simple and fun travel-size board game for kids and families to play along with our new space race! The game has everything you need – rocket ships, magic moons, space adventures, room for your own imagination, and most importantly - a chance for quality time without screens! Plus, it’s the perfect size for traveling on and off planet. Assemble your astro buds and join the fun!

Players roll the dice, and pick up event cards as they race their way through space. The first player to gather 1000 stars and return to the Earth, wins!

—description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Dice, Math, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Track Movement

name: Baalveer and the Evils of Bhayankar Pari
description:
Objective: Players need re-conquer Pari Lok by defeating Pari Bhayankar and reaching Rani Mahal. During this journey players earn points on reaching milestones and the players with maximum points wins.

Scenario: Bhayankar Pari has escaped from prison and now seeks revenge!
She, along with her minion Tauba Tauba, has wreaked havoc on Pari Lok by capturing Rani Pari and is on her way to attack Rani Mahal.
The Rani Pari beckons players to rise as potential Baalveers to be and use the powers of the 7 Paris to defeat the evil forces of Bhayankar Pari and save Rani Mahal from destruction.

Contents: Game Board: 1 Paristhiti Cards: 30 Prashna Cards: 30 Baalveer Jadooi Dand Card: 1 Pari Cards: 43 Pari Shakti Reference cards: 6 Dice: 1 Cutout pawns: 6 Tokens (Hero points): 15 Pawn bases: 9 Instruction manual

Gameplay: The game is divided into 4 phases and players earn Hero points on freeing Rani Pari, acquiring Maha Pari Shastra, Imprisoning Pari Bhayankar, and on reaching Rani mahal. During this course in each phase, they have to answer questions and perform actions, collect Pari cards and use the all-important Balveer Trump Card. The player with the maximum Hero points qualifies to win as Baalveer!

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Rebus Reale
description:
Rebus Reale (which could be translated as “Royal Rebus”, but also as “Real Rebus”) is a game in which players use richly detailed figures cards, marking tokens (to highlight desired subjects on the cards) and letter tiles, to create rebuses of different lengths.

Points are awarded for composing rebuses (the longer ones are worth more points) and for being the first to find the solution to other players’ rebuses.

This game is in Italian only.

A box of Rebus Reale contains:
- 1 game board
- 40 figures cards (4 wild cards)
- 100 letter tiles (92 letters and 8 “star” joker tiles)
- 1 bag to keep letter tiles
- 7 round tokens to mark the subjects on the cards
- 1 30sec sand timer
- 1 series of black-on-white number tiles for the numerical formulas of the rebuses
- 1 series of white-on-black number tiles to keep track of the scores
- 1 rulebook

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Real-time, Word Game
mechanics: Deduction, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Meine Pferde und ich
description:
Players move their figure along a circuit by rolling the dice and collect horse cards, answer questions about horses and can hold small races. The player who has collected the most valuable cards in total wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Winter Mage
description:
A Table Top Card Based Dungeon Crawler designed to be customized.

Each player has a party of 7 Heroes in the first version. Their Mage which is the most important character and then 6 Hybrids which fight along with the Mage against the opposing player.

The board is made up of 30 by 24 tiles and has a number of control points which a player can win by moving their units there.

Each player has two decks of cards. Firstly, their Skill deck which each turn will give their mage access to more abilities and resources to cast spells and play items etc., Secondly, they have their Spell deck which is played from the hand which has Spells Items and Summoned units that the Mage can cast depending on what stage of the game you are in and what resources the Mage has available.

The party of Hybrids move around the board trying to gain control of the control points and battling the opponents party all while ultimately trying the defeat the opponents all powerful Mage.

The first version is made up of 126 cards which is a two player deck and comes with the 2 player 300 point party board.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Movement Points, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Deathchase
description:
Deathchase is a scifi/mad max themed car-combat race game.
From their Action-boards all Players secretly and simultaneously select their Action (which Gear they want to drive in) which they want to take each round. They can choose between burning fuel, driving fast and farthest but do not prepare Equipment and even suffer accuracy problems while attacking or to drive slower, save fuel, prepare equipment and carry out attacks with more accuracy - but the fastest gear always goes first.

So the players have to tactically weigh their options. They can pull of maneuvers to gain sensation-points that give them access to upgrades, countermeasures or better weapons. Attacking is a major part of the game because each damage loads up the nitroboost on the players car.

The game ends when one of the Players cars is completely destroyed (beyond repair) or one has crossed the finish line and wins this way.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Track Movement

name: Cleric and Serf (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
The serfs are the backbone of the farming community around the city of Carcassonne, harvesting the fruit of the land, but every family wishes to have its own family priest. The rise in the numbers of young men wishing to become men of the cloth has increased calls by the clergy for more cloisters across the land.

New reward tiles for the Barn that removed the most farmers from a field and for the most cloister built. Cloister tokens for who most completed a cloister.

—description from designer
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Elections!
description:
Elections! is a deckbuilding game in only 18 cards. 2 players will compete on an electoral campaing to be the best political party and win the elections.

Each player starts the game with a deck of 3 cards. And better cards can be purchased from a market of 12 cards. The game ends when the elections! card appears, the player with more votes is the winner.

You will need some luck, good strategy and manage money, popular support and votes, the 3 resources of the game.

What kind of politician you will become? One that makes great promises or buys dirty support?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Gatekeeper
description:
Gatekeeper is a game where players pick a hero and attempt to capture gates with the goal of becoming the Gatekeeper. To do this players must use die rolls, abilities, and spells to capture the center gate. Once a player is gatekeeper they will then become very powerful, and the rest of the players must team up to destroy the GK. One unique aspect of the game is that the board turns, giving players a plethora of strategies to get an edge on their opponents. Each board position gives way to new paths and opportunities. Use your hero's strengths to your advantage to devise a plan to capture and hold the center gate so that you will be deemed victorious... but do not get to eager, as any game of Gatekeeper can turn in an instant. With a bit of luck, wit, determination, and the roll of a die, you could kill the gatekeeper and conquer the gates yourself.

The game is a fantasy game where you pick a hero and attack gates to get bonuses and ultimately capture the center gate. Once you capture the center you must survive against the rest of the players as they team up to take the center gate from you. If you survive you win!

Each turn you will take your hero's trait card and roll a die to see what trait/ability you get to use this turn. Then you will have the opportunity to roll your dice to attack a gate. Your hero will have bonuses on some gates and will destroy them easier than others, if you capture a gate you will unlock abilities that can be used to further attack more gates on other turns. Your turn ends when you attack the gate.

When a player captures the center they become Gatekeeper, then for the next three turns all of the other players team up and try to kill them. To do this they can use special gate abilities called keeper attacks. To increase your chances at winning, you need to be prepared for the Keeper attacks that will be used against you. If you survive the three rotations you win the game, if not, you are out of the game and players reset the board and attempt to capture center again.

To win, you need to survive or be the last man standing!

—description from publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, King of the Hill, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game

name: Horsin' Around
description:
A trivia game about horses. The game board has two sides, a cross-country course and a steeple chase course. The game can be played on either side of the board, but the goal is always to finish ahead of the other players.

Movement is decided by a combination of dice and answering trivia questions. The player is asked a question, and they add the dice value to the value of the correctly-answered question to get their movement for the turn. A player can usually opt out of the trivia, but that will slow down their movement to just the die roll. An incorrect answer ends the player's turn without advancing.

When an obstacle is in the way, the player must answer a trivia question to advance past the obstacle.

The first player to cross the finish line wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: International Jump Off
description:
This is a showjumping game approved by the British Show Jumping Association (BSJA). The game includes a board, plastic model horses with removable riders, obstacles for placing on the board for jumping, dice, and question cards.

Players score points along the way to the final post. Hazards such as walls, gates, water jumps, and fences must be overcome.

It appears that the prefix "International" was possibly added late in the production to distinguish it from the 1983 game "Jump Off". In photographs of vintage "International Jump Off" boxes, the "International" term appears to be affixed with a sticker, rather than printed on the box itself.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: ACTION WW2 Aerial Combat
description:
These rules are designed for 1:300 scale aeroplane models (although other sizes could be used) to represent a WW2 aerial combat from small dog fights to large bombing missions.
The rules give a simple to play, fast paced game with the opportunity to represent almost any WW2 aerial scenario.
The rule book is 48 pages long.
The quick reference sheet is 4 pages (2 pages cover most of the rules, 1 page for bombing and 1 page for AA).
A sheet of markers is provided that can be printed out and used to get you started although we also make sets of plastic markers and these are highly recommended.

Included are 96 aeroplane charts for all the major nations (27 British, 9 French, 19 German, 9 Italian, 16 Japanese and 25 USA).

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: ACTION Wild West Rules
description:
These rules are designed for 28mm figures (although other sizes can be used) to represent a gun fight in a wild west town.

The rules give a fast paced game in the style of wild west film rather than a representation of a "real" gun fight.

You can play with any number of characters, games with 5 to 10 characters per side usually last between 1 and 2 hours depending on the scenario.

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Sixo
description: To begin two rings are placed together on the table, the sides which connect the hexagonals matching. The remaining rings are divided among the players. In turn, players add on 1 ring at a time, trying to connect each ring with 2 sides if possible. Each time a player lays down a ring with 2 sides connecting he scores 1 point; 5 points if if 3 sides connect with other cards. If a player manages to close off a ring with his hexagonal, he scores 2 points. Player with the most points wins.

name: Presume Nothing
description:
Welcome to Victorian England

A killer is on the loose and could be closer than you think. Clear all of the suspects to find the killer, but watch out — they're also on the hunt for you.

Presume Nothing is a deduction and hidden identity game for two players. Each player receives a role known only to them. Their role determines their available moves and path to victory.

[from the publisher / box back]

A grid of 25 cards with illustrated faces is placed on a table, representing the Killer, the Inspector, and potential victims. Every turn, each player chooses from a set of actions, which will narrow down the choices of who the various players might be. Eventually either the Inspector will correctly deduce the Killer, or 6 other characters will be murdered by the Killer.

—user summary
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Variable Player Powers

name: Scribe: Das Rechtschreibspiel
description:
Players move their game piece from start to finish. The player whose turn it is draws a practice card with a task from German grammar and must solve the task in order to be able to move his figure further. On special fields, one receives a knowledge question or draws an action card and must solve this task. Correct solutions bring the figure further in the direction of the goal, with wrong solutions you have to move the figure backwards.
The player who reaches the goal first with his figure wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Trivia, Word Game

name: Dragon Hunters (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
In good times, when the land breeds plenty, tales of dragons are written off as myths. But during the hard times, dragons are blamed for all sorts of ills. Men would often erect huge dragon slaying machines in the countryside in the hopes of being able to brag to their grandchildren about the success in hunting down the winged terror haunting the skies.

This expansion will add:
Tiles with ballistas and catapults and trebuchets.
Black boars, white sheep and brown cows

Very rough rules:
Each player gets one sheep and one cow. If playing with Forests, they get a black boar/pig as well.
Expansions required = P&D.
Tiles are shuffled into the supply.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Ars Bellum II: Scénarios "Campagne pour un trône"
description:
This expansion for Ars Bellum II contains

a scenario booklet with 6 pages of historical explanations to play the 3 main battles of the campaign for the conquest of the throne of England: Fulford Bridge, Stamford Bridge and Hastings (1066)
counters for the Saxon, Norman and Viking armies
1 A4 card and 2 A3 cards representing the battlefield of the historical sites


—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame

name: CARBONIQ
description:
CARBONIQ is a game of 100 cards that will allow you to compare the incomparable, will play with your received ideas to demystify the subject of the carbon footprint.

Is it better to redo your decor or spend your Sunday on Netflix? What is the worst for the planet?

Thanks to a funny and colorful universe, which covers all aspects of life, and to figures derived from real scientific data, the CARBONIQ game gives you all the cards to sustainably reduce your impact on the climate, with friends or family!

Gameplay:
After making up their carbon year, each player will have to try to improve their record in order to win the game. To do this, you will need to demonstrate strategy and bluff, but also be able to estimate the impact of your daily actions.

Each card represents an action: buy a smartphone, eat a big burger or go on holiday to Poitiers ... The carbon emission of this action is marked on the back, which allows you to compare in a fun way everything that makes up our daily life.

The more talented a player is in estimating the carbon impact of their actions, the more chance they have of improving their carbon year (or increasing that of others) and of winning the part. But beware: at any time, another player can give a very carbonated gift that risks tipping the scales!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Ancano
description:
Ancano is a game created by certified and experienced yoga instructors to help children understand and express their anger in a creative and playful way. It also helps to develop interpersonal skills, positive self-expression, and healthy relationships with parents.

Each player takes turns rolling the dice and going down the journey. The game has 60 cards in total. There are 24 round shaped discovery cards that help children explore anger and build awareness. The discovery cards also consists of three different levels with 8 cards in each level. Next, are 18 diamond shaped activity cards that help kids understand what is underneath their anger. Lastly, there are 18 star shaped adventure cards.

Players roll the dice and move along the track, earning heart tokens. These tokens can be used to move the players - or their opponents. The first player to the finish square wins the game.

name: Hunting Monsters
description:
Hunting Monsters is a boardgame based in a world where the supernatural is normal.
It is a coop, resource management game with a hint of hidden agenda and wargaming.
Imagine XCOM blended with Supernatural (the tv-series).
categories: Fantasy, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Storytelling, Worker Placement

name: Hand of Gold
description:
Hands of gold is a collection style card game where 2 to 6 players are digging through a 70 card deck looking for gold cards to reach the required gold to win.

On any player's turn, they can use any or all of the effect cards in their hand by placing them on the discard pile. All players (regardless of whether they played any effect cards or not) can draw 1 card or more if they played the "EXTRA" effect card at the end of their turn.

The deck contains the exact amount of gold so it is impossible for the deck to run out of cards without anyone winning.

There are also varying amounts of effect cards allowing players to steal cards, draw more, skip turns, force players to return gold back to the deck, re-order the top 3 cards, trade cards, look in other players hands, and a card that allows you to block any of these effects (including blocks themselves).

The game ends when a player reaches the required amount of gold which is different depending on the number of players playing:
2 Players: 30 Gold
3 Players: 20 Gold
4 Players: 15 Gold
5 Players: 12 Gold
6 Players: 10 Gold

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Math, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Command Cards, Lose a Turn, Take That

name: Tacoe
description:
The wooden game Tacoé is composed of a black tinted MDF game board with 8 balls of billiards in phenolic resin, very pleasant and aesthetic. This family wooden game is played by 2 players.

The rule of the game is simple: players must align 3 balls of its color horizontally or vertically.

Before starting the game, the balls are arranged according to the photo opposite. Each player chooses a color (black or white). In turn, players move a ball from one square in any direction except diagonally. During the game, instead of moving 1 ball of its color, the player can move a special ball (red or yellow). These balls can grow one or two adjoining balls of the same colors. You can't push 2 or more balls of different colors.

Careful! A ball pushed by one player cannot be pushed back into the previous position by the other on the next move.

—user summary

name: Horseplay
description:
Horseplay was originally designed in the 1980s, then published online in 2014.

The game uses a square 9x9 grid as a playing area. Players begin in the middle of one side of the board, called the "paddock." Letter tiles are placed on alternating tiles on the grid, with empty spaces between each tile.

The players then use chess-style movement to collect the letter tiles before ending the round in a designated corner of the board. Once a player lands in a corner square, the "stables," their play is ended and they must wait for other players to finish.

At the end of the game, the players spell a word with the tiles they have collected. The highest scoring tile wins. Players who did not end in a "stable" get no points.
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Spelling, Square Grid

name: Bezaubernde Jeannie
description:
The players start at the corners of the game board and try to reach the center space. Movement is determined by a roulette wheel. If the result is a number, the player moves the corresponding number of spaces. On the result of a "Jeannie" the player draws a card and a certain player is blinked to another section of the game board. If another player occupies an space in this section, he is blinked back to his starting space. This is also true, if a player is thrown out by another player moving on his spot. The first player to reach the center space wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Meow! The Cult of Cat: Tantrum House Promo Cards
description:
2 promo cards included in Tantrum House kickstarter for Meow: The Cult of Cat.

Tantrum card: Pretend to throw a tantrum
House card: Imitate a house

—user summary

name: Camp Pinetop: Tantrum Houseboat Promo Card
description:
Promo card offered through Tantrum House kickstarter campaign.

The Tantrum Houseboat is a new green-tent map card.

name: We're Doomed: Quarantine promo
description:
offered through Tantrum House kickstarter.

Keep this card face up.
Containment protocol requires all players to immediately cover their mouths.
For the rest of the game, any player caught not covering their mouth loses all tokens.
Starting...now.

—user summary

name: Quinella
description:
Players bet on horses to get chips.

The game is played using a deck of proprietary cards called "KUATRO cards", which have three color squares on each card. The colors correspond to colors of the game pieces (the horses): red, green, yellow, and blue. The cards may have three different colors, or may have more than one square with the same colors.

Any number of players may play, but one player may act as the "bookie" and take bets from the others. Stacks of poker chips may be used to place bets. The players may bet on which place the horses will end the race.

After selling tickets, the horses are placed. The bookie draws cards until at least two colors are the same on a card. Horses are placed on the post in the order that drawn cards with 2 or more colors show up.

Then the race starts. The booke draws cards and reads off the colors on each card. The horses are moved one space for each time its color is called. The race continues until three horses cross the finish line. The players receive payout based on the odds of the tickets they purchased at the start of the game. The winner has the most chips.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Merry Men (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
A band of outlaws have taken to hiding out in the forests around Carcassonne, stealing from the rich
and giving it to the poor. Or at least that’s how the story goes…

A brawling tournament takes place among who has the majority of Woodsman in the forest with the Merry Men Camp. Who will get to be the Champion of the brawling will get 2 points for each forest tile. Moreover, the player who completes the largest Forest will get 1 point for each completed forest at the end of the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Bibi Blocksberg: Der blubbernde Hexenkessel
description:
Players must help Bibi Blocksberg brew the witch's potion. With her familiar voice and funny sound effects, witch potion brewing becomes even more realistic.

Bibi's bubbling witch's cauldron offers two variants for the young witches: In "Remember-me witch potion," Bibi Blocksberg forgets the named ingredients for her cauldron potion due to excitement. The players must therefore listen carefully to which and how many of the 36 ingredients Bibi needs. If all the elements are correctly thrown into the cauldron, the familiar Hex-Plingpling sounds and Bibi has passed her test. In the "Shoo-shoo witch's potion" variant, Aunt Mania makes it a little more difficult for the players: Together with Bibi, they play against the clock. The various ingredients are scattered all over the room, have to be collected and brewed into an exam potion at witch's speed. If they don't manage to finish the witch's potion in time, the cauldron will explode and Bibi will fail her exam.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Memory

name: Schatzsuche
description:
A treasure is hidden under the cups. If you are smart, you will remember where the gold pieces are. Because a good memory and consideration are the key to success.

The arrow of the wheel of fortune points to a shape. Now choose a cup of the same shape: if there is a gold piece under it, keep it. If it's a chip, you'll have to pay a fine and the treasure will move.

At the end you count your riches - and the one who was the most attentive will win.

—user summary

name: Crossed Lances: Jousting Rules – For the Tourne'
description:
Have wondered what it would have been like to compete in a joust and a grand mounted melee?
If so then these rules could be the made for you.
Crossed Lances has two games within one rule set. The first game deals with the jousts you will make, with as many as eight players around one table with as many as 4 tilts in use.

The game is based around the principal of easy to play, quick to play, be realistic in the outcome and above all be enjoyment for all.
Crossed Lances is a great family game, it is a very good war-game and is a very much needed history lesson for the children, who are the future of war gaming.
These rules cover the potential hits that can be made in both the joust and the mounted melee’, each using the hit tables provided, whilst retaining the thrill of speed and power.

—description from the publisher

name: менеджер kлига КХЛ
description:
менеджер kлига КХЛ, KHL League Manager

The Principle of the game is simple: you are the manager of the club.
Your task is to organize and support the hockey team:

Hire players
work with staff
Do whatever it takes to reach your ultimate goal


The game will never follow the same scenario because every time a player/manager will have different hockey players.
In addition, the "Bonus" cards will turn the game in a completely unpredictable way during the game.
There is no dice, and the result depends more on your logical and strategic abilities, and a bit of luck.
All this makes the "KHL League Manager" a truly interesting and exciting game that you want to play again and again!
The game is designed for two, four or six players.

You will gain a better understanding of the mechanics of transfers, the specifics of recruiting squads, but you will also follow the KHL matches with even greater attention!

name: I Condottieri
description:
Do you want to meet the great leaders of history? Players can embark on a real journey through history from Antiquity to our times. It is possible to come across questions, anecdotes and curiosities in the journey of Alexander the Great to conquer the world, in the extraordinary kingdom of Ramses II or browse in the Empire of Genghis Khan. Without forgetting Giuseppe Garibaldi, the battles of Napoleon or the great Julius Caesar.

A of traps, cards and numbers. Also an intelligent way to discover or rediscover these great generals.

Quiz with 6 categories of questions on the subject of the game in addition to Junior questions for children. Turn the cards over and find out which question category you will need to answer.
But watch out ... there could be the Unexpected card and off to the clash between the players to get the point!

The game begins by choosing the dealer, then the player immediately to his left turns over a card from the category / contingency deck.

If a category card is drawn, the dealer or another player takes a card from the question deck and asks the question based on the category drawn. In case of correct answer, the player who answered takes the card (which is worth 1 point) and places it in front of him. The player continues to draw categories / contingencies until he misses a question or until the unexpected card forces him to fold.

If an unexpected card is drawn, the player will have to do what the card requires and something positive or negative can happen. For example, being able to steal a point from an opponent, choosing the category for the question but also having to give a point to another player, etc. etc.

The first player to reach the required number of points wins the game.

—user summary

name: Mad Mullah & Operations in Darfur
description:
Mad Mullah & Operations in Darfur is an expansion for Setting The East Ablaze!

It details 5 British campaigns against Muhammad `Abd Allāh al-Hasan (otherwise known as the "Father of Somali nationalism" for the Central Powers, the "Emir of the Somali" for the Ottomans, "Mad Mullah" in the British empire) and his Dervishes between 1901-1920

It contains:

Detailed background,
10 scenarios,
maps,
orbats,
Army lists for StEA...
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War I

name: Vino
description:
Do you want to know more about wine, but you are not a sommelier? Players can embark on a real journey into the much loved world of Wine, discovering information within everyone's reach! It is possible to come across questions, anecdotes and curiosities in the wines of the world, vines and wines of our peninsula; in the art that is an integral part of the wine world and in the tools & characters that create the nectar of the gods! It is also necessary to add all the food and wine heritage that characterizes the sweet good living of those who love wine!

Quiz with 6 categories of questions on the subject of the game.
Turn the cards over and find out which question category you will need to answer.
But watch out ... there could be the Unexpected card and off to the clash between the players to get the point!

The game begins by choosing the dealer, then the player immediately to his left turns over a card from the category / contingency deck.

If a category card is drawn, the dealer or another player takes a card from the question deck and asks the question based on the category drawn. In case of correct answer, the player who answered takes the card (which is worth 1 point) and places it in front of him. The player continues to draw categories / contingencies until he misses a question or until the unexpected card forces him to fold.

If an unexpected card is drawn, the player will have to do what the card requires and something positive or negative can happen. For example, being able to steal a point from an opponent, choosing the category for the question but also having to give a point to another player, etc. etc.

The first player to reach the required number of points wins the game.

—user summary

name: Il Chianti Classico
description:
Players can embark on a real journey to discover this corner of Tuscany. Among sayings, tools and wines, the story of this great wine-growing area is told, one of the most important in the world. It is also possible to come across famous people among questions of history, anecdotes and curiosities: from Leonardo to Michelangelo, from Machiavelli to the great noble families of wine, from Giovanni da Verrazzano to Kenneth Branagh!
We must add the questions of pappa ciccia and wine that tell the sweet good life of our beautiful Tuscany.

Quiz with 6 categories of questions on the subject of the game.
Turn the cards over and find out which question category you will need to answer.
But watch out ... there could be the Unexpected card and off to the clash between the players to get the point!

The game begins by choosing the dealer, then the player immediately to his left turns over a card from the category / contingency deck.

If a category card is drawn, the dealer or another player takes a card from the question deck and asks the question based on the category drawn. In case of correct answer, the player who answered takes the card (which is worth 1 point) and places it in front of him. The player continues to draw categories / contingencies until he misses a question or until the unexpected card forces him to fold.

If an unexpected card is drawn, the player will have to do what the card requires and something positive or negative can happen. For example, being able to steal a point from an opponent, choosing the category for the question but also having to give a point to another player, etc. etc.

The first player to reach the required number of points wins the game.

—user summary

name: Хоккей
description:
Хоккей ("Hockey") is a board game for two.

Lead your hockey team to victory by scoring as many pucks as possible.
In addition to the playing field, the package includes multi-colored chips, as well as 2 numbered cubes.

name: Rodeo No. 1
description:
Rodeo No. 1 is described as a party game, there can be as many players as you want. Players compete in rodeo events to earn winnings.

The game involves several events, to be played in order:
Barrel Racing
Calf Roping
Team Roping
Steer Wrestling
Bareback Bronc Riding
Saddle Bronc Riding
Bull Riding

The first event is played with one turn by each player. The rest of the events are played in order the same way. Then, the players play through the list of events two more times to make three total "go-rounds".

The board has different sections where scoring is marked. Riding events are scored as points. Barrel Racing and all other events are scored as seconds. The Barrel Racing event is played in the center of the board.

Gameplay involves drawing cards to determine what horse will be ridden, rolling dice to determine movement, and drawing cards for penalties.

The player with the most winnings at the end of the game wins.

—user summary

There can be no more challenging a contest than that for the RODEO COWBOY; he is called to the limits of his abilities. In this daring game we get a glimpse into his world. It came from a Rodeo Cowboy who knows the thrill of the contest and the conquest. We challenge you To Win The Grand Championship. It is a game that will challenge you and your friends through every event!

—description from the back of the box

name: Win at the Races
description:
The goal of the game is to win four races, and collect seven horses.

Maintenance fees ("stable bills") take a cut from your winnings, but you can lose money on races and still win the game.

Players draw cards to determine stable bills. Rolling dice determines movement. Different race cards give game parameters like the condition of the track, claiming prices for horses, and odds for bettors.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pointapoint
description:
This is a horse racing game played on a felt game board.

Each player is assigned a horse. The dealer turns over cards to move horses. The color on the cards corresponds to the color of the horse to move, and the number of marks on the card indicates the distance to move.

Each player has four certain number of "whips" to play. If the player uses a whip, their next movement value is doubled.

Cards are reshuffled and continue to be drawn until a horse wins.

Obstacles include fences and water jumps. If a player's horse lands in one of the penalty spaces, it may lose a turn or be removed from the game.

The first horse to the finish line wins the game.

—user summary

name: Divitote
description:
One player is selected as the "tote operator", basically the bookie.

After the players place their bets, a set of cards is used to determine the first and second place winners. The cards are viewed through another card with a window, which reveals the race results.

The money is distributed based on the bets placed.

The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.

name: Pony Race
description:
The first horse to cross the finish line wins.

This game is a simple spin-and-move racing game. When the race starts, the spinner is used to determine which horse moves and by how much it moves. There are penalty and bonus movement sections of the board.

—user summary

name: ATLAS: a novel family card game
description:
The word “atlas” in everyday language means a collection of maps. But it is in literature the name of a Greek god. It is the product design to theme the narrative of conservation of planet earth in Greek mythology through introducing the titan Atlas who guards the earth by carrying it on his shoulders.

The goal of the card game is to be the first gamer to play all of the cards in your hand in a round, OR to score the highest points accumulated over a certain number of rounds.

We have match cards and action cards.
Match cards are played by matching according to the three elements each match card carries:
The continent, Africa, Europe, Asia, Americas, Australia & New Zealand;
The category of living things, land, water, air animals, and plants; and
The species.
Matching could be done:
Within your own hand;
Draw from pile; or
Pick up a played card.
Action cards, SKIP, REVERSE, TRADE and ATLAS (Joker) are for strategy moves.

We have end game bonus in the form of:
Priority in competition for the match card played; and
Forming an identical pair with another match card, either drawn from pile or played by another player, that is the same in continent and species with the only match card left on hand.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Trading

name: Goal!: The World Famous Football Game
description:
This football-themed game is an authentic reproduction of a 1950s card game.

Players move the ball about the "pitch" in accordance with the cards the play. While skill in the choice of cards played is important, the element of chance is never lost like in real football.

—user summary

name: Nonsens
description:
A communicative entertainment game. Each player tells the best one-minute stories based on two given words. The player who can tell the best stories without using a forbidden word gets a chip. The player who has 5 chips first wins. The three terms are determined with three dice.

—user summary

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Broken Realms – Kragnos
description:
As the tide of Death magic suffusing the realms recedes in the wake of Teclis' retribution, Alarielle undertakes a grand ritual to seed the Mortal Realms with resurgent life energy. But with new growth comes the sundering of an ancient prison and the release of a forgotten deity – Kragnos, the End of Empires. Enraged by aeons of captivity, Kragnos' rampage across Ghur leads to the metropolis of Excelsis. Already tainted by the attentions of Slaanesh's servants, only unlikely alliances will save the city from its doom.

The Broken Realms saga concludes in the fourth and final chapter. As the city of Excelsis comes under attack from Gordrakk's Waaagh! and Kragnos himself, it will take more than the return of a legendary Seraphon hero to turn the tide.

Inside this 136-page hardback book, you'll find:


The story of Alarielle's Rite of Life, how it awoke a forgotten god, and the epic siege of Excelsis
Warscrolls for a host of new gods and champions - including Kragnos, the twin aspects of Slaanesh’s Newborn, Warsong Revenants, and witch hunters Galen and Doralia ven Denst
New rules for Gloomspite Gitz, including three suites of allegiance abilities, updated warscrolls, and more
Even more rules content for Cities of Sigmar, Skaven, Beasts of Chaos, and Sylvaneth, designed to represent these forces in the story
Updated warscrolls for Alarielle the Everqueen and the venerable Lord Kroak
Six exciting battleplans that chronicle the rise of Kragnos, and rules to play them as a narrative campaign
Realms of Battle and Streets of Death rules depicting the locations from the story


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Eichhörnchen, pass auf!
description:
The players have to help the squirrel transport a nut home - so you have to juggle the squirrel up the tree and back down again without losing its nut. To do this, pull the ends of the string as needed. When playing in pairs, it's the other person's turn when the nut falls into one of the holes. The winner is the first person who manages to make the squirrel climb up and back down with the nut.

—user summary

name: Doppel-Moppel
description:
Four animals (lion, bear, kangaroo and penguin) each comes in 6-fold. At first cursory glance, they all look the same and you have to look closely to see that the lion has swapped its crown for sunglasses. Only two animals of each species are really identical and those are the ones to find. But to do this, you can't just look at the animal discs, you have to rearrange the piles of discs according to precisely specified rules.

—user summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time, Sports

name: Horseland: Saut d'obstacle
description:
Horseland: Saut d'obstacle, Horseland Show Jumping

Welcome to the Horseland Ranch!
Meet Sarah, Rosa, Marie and all their friends and get ready for the funniest show jumping competition you have ever entered.

Goal:
Complete the show jumping course as quickly as possible, accumulating as few penalties as possible.

Gameplay:
Players use the colored horseshoes to move matching their color with the board colors. Placing them on the board first, then moving horse and rider along the path created.
Horseshoes played are then removed.
Unused horseshoes are placed in the equestrian school and can be used by other players.
When players jump an obstacle for the first time they put a bar of their color, but must neigh every time, or they lose their bar.

Win:
When a player has placed the 10 bars she/he is done, other players continue until they got rid of their 10 bars.

—user summary
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Mortal Gods: Thrakian Roster & Gifts Card Set
description:
This set contains a total of 43 cards made up of Roster Cards to be used to build your Thrakian Lochos (warband), 10 Gift Cards specially designed to be used with a Thrakian force and a Thrakian reference card.

There are enough cards in this set to make a varied force.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Mortal Gods: Kushite Roster & Gifts Card Set
description:
Absorbed into the vast Persian Empire the Kushite's bring a different type of warrior to the ancient battlefields of Mortal Gods. These fighters can be taken as part of a Persian Sataba, as a stand-alone faction or as mercenaries in a Greek lochos.

This set contains a total of 28 cards made up of Roster Cards to be used to build your Kushite Warban' and 10 Gift Cards specially designed to be used with a Kushite (or a Persian) force.

There are enough cards in this set to make a varied force.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Mortal Gods: Omens, Gifts & Injury Card Set
description:
This set contains 63 Cards in total, including 30 Omens, 30 Gifts and 5 Injury Cards to be used for Mortal Gods. They can also be used by any faction in the game.

Omen Cards
Ancient Greek culture was steeped in tradition, belief and superstition, considered both bad or good with many of these varying from region to region. A vulture flying the wrong way across a battlefield has caused engagements to end abruptly with all participants packing up and returning to their cities. This element has been added to Mortal Gods with the inclusion of the Omens Deck, with the Omens being read as the game progresses.

During play whenever a red Omen marker is taken from the Draw, the player who drew it takes the topmost Omen card from the Omen deck. He then reads the card description aloud before following the rules on the Omen card immediately.

Gifts Cards
In ancient times extraordinarily rare or lucky objects— or people with extraordinary strength or speed—were thought to be gifts from the Gods.
Gifts can be given to a warrior in one of two ways: they either have Gifts already included in their Roster card which is reflected in their initial points value, or you can purchase Gifts for the Warriors of your Lochos by spending roster points to obtain them.

Both Heroes and Companions can be given Gifts. To do this simply include the points value as indicated on the individual Gift cards while rostering your Lochos. You can give a warrior as many Gifts as they have actions and, unless stated on the card, you may only use one Gift per activation.

Injury Cards
Only Heroes gain Injury cards.

If a Warrior sustains more damage than their Resistance score they would usually be removed from the game. Instead Heroes take a Courage check. If it is successful he finds the courage to carry on and takes the top Injury card. The Injury card imposes a penalty for the rest of the game as detailed on the card. If the Hero fails this Courage roll, or already has an Injury card, he is removed as normal from the game. If the damage sustained by the Hero in this instance is caused via critical damage they are automatically dispatched.!

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Mortal Gods: Persian Roster & Gifts Card Set
description:
This set contains a total of 46 cards made up of Roster Cards to be used to build your Persian Sataba (warband), 10 Gift Cards specially designed to be used with a Persian force and a single Persian reference card.

There are enough cards in this set to make a varied force.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Mortal Gods: Ancient Greek Roster Card Set
description:
This set contains 97 Greek Roster Cards, including Phalanx Cards to be used to build your locos (warband). They can also be used as Greek Mercenaries or troops from any of the city-states.

There are enough cards in this set to easily make two forces. They are the same Roster Cards as in the Mortal Gods core box set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Mortal Gods: Athenian Card Set & Rules Booklet
description:
Athenian Card Set & Rules Booklet will provide you with the specific cards and the city-specific rules you need for adding Athenians to your core game of Mortal Gods, including rules for the mighty hero Adronikos, the Defender of Athens.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Mortal Gods: Spartan Card Set & Rules Booklet
description:
This will provide you with the specific cards and the city-specific rules you need for adding Spartans to your core game of Mortal Gods, including rules for the mighty hero Meonas the Harvester, of Sparta.

16-page rules supplement for using a Spartan force as your Lochos
24 x Spartan Roster Cards
5 x Spartan Gift Cards
3 x Spartan Omen Cards

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Outposts (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Tales of dragons harassing the countryside has been told since time immemorial. Dragons have once again been sighted in the countryside and there are rumours that these dragons are destroying more than the livestock in the fields. The nobles of Carcassonne has garrisoned a number of guards in the outposts dotting the countryside in the hopes that the guards there will protect the people in the countryside from the dragons.

Outpost will protect followers from Dragon. A player can sacrifice a follower deployed on an Outpost as a Guard on behalf of the followers that should have been eaten by the Dragon.

—user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: A Pilot's War
description:
Feel the need for speed!

"A Pilot's War" is a free, pnp, solo game, which allows you to step into the cockpit of a Fighter jet and experience the thrill of conducting combat missions above enemy territory.

The base game includes two planes, the F-14 Tomcat and the Panavia Tornado. You will fly bombing missions above the Red Sea and Eastern Germany. Survive 20 missions and earn ranks and medals.

This fast paced, action focused game was inspired by Gregory M. Smith's "The Hunters" and Markus Salo's "F-14 Tomcat" and brings the narrative-driven games into the jet age.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Rendezvous im All
description:
A card game in which you collect rocket parts, assemble them into a rocket and launch it with the matching countdown cards. The opponents can interrupt the launch or cause destruction of the rocket. The player who has collected the most points by assembling and successfully launching rockets wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Late Roman Supplies: A Solo Game
description:
Northern England in the late 4th century was not a good place to be a Roman, you must escort a supply convoy while fending of attacks from Pictish warriors.

A solo game ideal for 28mm figures but any scale will do as long as the figures are individually based.

Easy to learn but with enough variables to make it still interesting and challenging after multiple games.

Turn Sequence':

Activate all Roman forces
Activate all Pictish forces
Roll for Pictish reinforcements
Roll for random events


—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Illuminare
description:
Illuminare is an abstract game consisting of only 12 playing cards. Each card is numbered from 1-12 and is divided into 4 quadrants. One player plays as suns and the other as the moons. The cards quadrants have either suns, moons, or stars, with the stars serving as victory points.

The game lasts 3 rounds. In each round, players are dealt 2 cards each. They simultaneously choose 1 to give to the opponent. After passing a card, they each play a card simultaneously. the player with the lowest numbered card plays first.

When playing a card, it must be placed out into the "grid" of cards (which begins with 1 starting card) and each card must be played adjacent to another card in the grid. Players are trying to place their cards so more of their symbols (moon or sun) surround the quadrants with stars. When a Star area is completely surrounded, the players count their symbols surrounding the stars and the player with the most scores the number of stars as victory points.

—description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid

name: Decoratifs
description:
Decoratifs is an abstract card game for 2 players consisting of only 12 cards with art deco aesthetics.

The cards are divided into 4 quadrants, each quadrant contains 1 to 3 of either of two symbols in the game. The players are trying to create areas of their connected symbols. At game's end, each player compares their 3 largest areas, the player who has more large areas wins.

The game consists of 6 rounds. In each round, players play a card from their hands simultaneously. The cards are numbered from 1-12. The player with the lower number takes the first turn. On your turn, you must place your card so that one of its corners overlaps the corner of a card in the "grid." You may overlap up to 2 different cards. No card, however, may have more than 2 of its corners covered up.

After playing a card, you replenish your hand by taking one of two face-up cards that were flipped at the start of the round. If you played first this round, you must take the higher numbered card.

After all 12 cards have been added to the grid, players check their three largest areas and the winner is determined.

—description from designer

name: Ginga-X: Berivov System
description:
Ginga-X A solitaire space adventure game.
Players choose their ship from a list of pre-built ones, or build their own, then explore the star system!
Navigating the spaceways, battling alien ships, and gathering resources along the way, players must try to accomplish goals while balancing their ship's stats for maximum results.

Each turn is divided into 5 steps:
1. Check for Alien Attack: (based on your ship's Stats, an enemy may appear!)
2. Check Risk: (the more 'unbalanced' your ship's Stats, the more dangerous your travels will become! A perfectly balanced ship is considered to be in Harmony, and will yield amazing discoveries.
3. Move (optional): the ship may be moved to an adjacent sector or remain in its current position.
4. Check Sector FX: Compare the ship's Risk with the Sector's benefits/dangers!
5. Gather: the ship must gather as much of a chosen resource from the Sector as possible!

Ginga-X is fully expandable with new Star Systems and new Alien Ships, as well as new Pre-Built player ship options.

The Berivov System includes the following 6 Sectors:
1. Planet Orpha
2. The Ruby Zone (field)
3. Planet Seirama
4. Planet Jenice
5, Berivov (pulsar star)
6. Planet Arkizon

—description from designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution

name: A Terrible Time: The Banned Deck
description:
100 cards featuring the most offensive and downright evil things we can think of.

-description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: A Terrible Time: The Movies Expansion
description:
100 cards with Art, Facts, and Performance Challenges centered around the vapid, artistically bankrupt, soul-shattering world of movies.

Include such topics as "prequelitis", "plot holes" and "looking into the Ark of the Covenant".

-description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: A Terrible Time: The Video Games Expansion
description:
100 cards with Art, Facts, and Performance Challenges centered around the twitchy, frustrating, life-destroying world of video games.

Include such topics as "losing your thumbs", "chainmail bikinis", and "escort missions"

-description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Video Game Theme

name: A Terrible Time: The TV Expansion
description:
100 cards with Art, Facts, and Performance Challenges centered around the hopelessly immature, endlessly repetitive, and brain-meltingly stupid world of TV.

Include such topics as "reality shows", "Cosby sweaters" and "actors in blackface".

-description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Elusion Escape
description:
In this game, a team of 4-8 players work together to solve puzzles using clue cards and solution cards. The game ends when all puzzles on the table are solved, or if the final round ends and the last puzzle remains unsolved.

Not everyone wants to leave, though. Traitors will slow down your progress, doing their best to keep their identities hidden until the right time.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Matching, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Trading, Traitor Game

name: Kettle of Fish (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
The fishermen working along the streams and rivers around Carcassonne have decided to form a guild to safeguard their interests. Fishing in the rivers after all is a different kettle of fish than working on the farms and in the forests.

Four new icons for the Rivers:

Oyster: to have a double turn
Chivarly: to upgrade your follower
Fisherman Guild: like the pennants for the cities
Fish Trade: another trace counter type
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Top Ten: Jeu de démo gratuit
description:
NOTE: This is a free 14-card promo game, which can be played on its own or added to the base game.

Your goal in Top Ten is to survive five rounds, so you and your fellow players need to figure out how to get things in order!

To start the game, place a number of unicorn tokens on the game board. Choose one player to be the round's chief. That player gives all players a random card numbered 1-10, then they read one of the five hundred theme cards included in the game, e.g., "Batman wants to replace Robin to fight the bad guys. Create a new duo 'Batman and ...' from the worst to the best." The chief looks at their number, then gives an answer based on their number. If they have a 1, they want to give the worst possible suggestion; if a 10, the best; if a 5-7, somewhere in the middle.

Each other player then gives an answer to this theme based on the number they were dealt, then the chief needs to decide who has the lowest number, then the next lowest, and so on. For each mistake, the chief flips a unicorn token over to its poop side.

If all the unicorns have left by the end of the fifth round, leaving you with nothing but poop, then you lose. Otherwise you win!

name: Das lustige Wettlauf-Spiel
description:
The players roll their figure over a course towards the finish line. Advantages and disadvantages lurk along the way. A restart may also become necessary. The first player to reach the finish line exactly wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Chief, My Chief
description:
2 years ago, we introduced true "Reverse Deck-building" to the world in the form of Shake Up. Today and for the first time ever, we introduce the concept of true "Shared Deck-building" - Everyone plays on the same single deck with the same hand, and yes everyone has a part in building this same single deck.

In the Azure Peninsula, civilization has not tamed the breathtaking yet deadly nature it offers. Isle whales would crush entire towns in their passing, and river wyrms swallow whole camps. Yet every so often, a tiny hamlet or a cosy little village would spring up atop a hill. In our story, the village chief has just passed on, leaving a chaotic mess of younger heads to run the place. The Tool Master needs stone to craft useful items for everyone, while the Culinary Chief feeds the group, the Scouting Lead goes out with his party to patrol and scour for materials, and the Commander protects the walls and its inhabitants.

They are but a tiny settlement with limited people. How will the different leaders work together to utilize their resources? Too much of one resource will cause some leaders to not be able to do what they have to do, and too little of anything could spell doom for everyone. A single deck represents the village, and players take on the roles of the various leaders. They must balance their own needs with those of other leaders in order to survive and thrive amidst a harsh land. Every leader is important!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Breach: Escape the Space Station
description:
Life on a space station can be an exhilarating experience. That can all change in an instant when things go awry.

You are part of the space station's crew when all heck breaks loose. With limited access to supplies and weapons your only hope is to make it to the escape pods. Unfortunately, the way there is riddled with blocked passages and invaders looking to destroy you. Finding the escape pod access areas is your only hope!

As the crew, you must run the corridors, gather supplies, and locate the escape pods while fighting off the invaders. It is your choice how you play. Do you all work together, is it an all out fight to escape, or do you use your fellow crew to find the pods and then abandon them.

Players roll to move through the station, discovering new sections and paths, items to use and encounters to battle or avoid.

Game ends when 1 player reaches an escape pod, all do, or the station is destroyed. Depends on how the players choose to setup the game.
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Valyrian Draft Starter
description:
Experience the power struggles, terrifying battles, and subtle intrigues of A Game of Thrones: The Card Game with an entirely new format: draft. By combining fixed Valyrian Draft Starters with algorithmically randomized Valyrian Draft Packs, you and up to seven of your friends can carefully draw together a variety of cards to create a deck and pursue victory. To experience the game of thrones in an entirely new and unpredictable way and play with some of the cards from the War of Five Kings cycle before anyone else, there’s no better option than to start a draft.

A Valyrian Draft Starter includes an assortment of general cards, including economy, plots, and agendas that can form the basis for any draft deck.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based, Political
mechanics: Alliances, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Rising Star Football
description:
Rising Star Football Edition, the board game of dreams, where you have the chance to play out a footballer's career of your own. Compete against your opponents to earn points, money and fame all in the hope of having the greatest career and becoming Rising Star champion!

This sports based role-playing game allows individuals to play out a footballer's career. They compete in matches, have contracts and sponsorships, work with an agent and take part in different events.

Matches use the match dice to decide the scores and players roll against each other. Match Event cards can be used to impact the final score. Contracts allow the players to earn money and they can change contracts by being transferred or entering negotiations where their agent's ability (if they have one) comes into play.

With varied tiles that require different actions and lots of cards to read aloud this game brings all the components of a footballer's life into a board game and gives a fun competitive environment for friends and families to play.

Players roll the game dice to move around the board. Depending on where they land, different events occur. They could land on a variety of match event tiles where they have to play out a match against an opponent in the hope of defeating them and gaining points. They could appear in the press and draw a press card to read what the papers are saying about them, impacting their fame. They might enter contract negotiations and use their Agent's ability to enhance the amount of contracts they are offered. There are many different events that occur as the player goes through each season and this can change the storyline of that player as well as impact their career in positive and negative ways.

The length of game varies depending on how many seasons players wish to play. This is decided at the start of the game and one trip around the board is equal to one season. The game ends when all players have completed the agreed upon number of seasons.

Throughout each player's career their goal is to collect Points (won by participating in Matchdays, Reserves, Derby Day and Cup Final events), earn money by improving their contract, gaining sponsorships and getting transferred and gain fame by appearing in the press. The referee keeps track of the scores and the winner is the player with the highest career score. The scoresheet has a simple formula for calculating the winner at the end of the game and the results are announced in reverse order crowning the winner Rising Star Champion.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Lose a Turn, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Track Movement

name: Evergreen Forest (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
The woodsmen working within the forests around Carcassonne have formed a guild to share information regarding the best spots to harvest woodland produce. However, the main goal of the guild is to ensure that the forests around Carcassonne remain forever evergreen, guaranteeing the livelihood of the woodsmen for generations to come.

Four new icons for the Forests:
Cherry: to have a double turn
Chivarly: to upgrade your follower
Woodsman Guild: like the pennants for the cities
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Solar Scourge
description:
Solar Scourge is a free two or more players sci-fi wargame designed to be simple to play yet strategically challenging.

The game is designed to use 6 mm miniatures.

Set two hundred years in the future.
After a disastrous first contact with the Skyilth the Human Hegemony is desperately trying to defend its remaining contacts from waves of constant attacks.

—description from the publisher

name: Dice Lords: A Collectible Trading Dice Game
description:
A blown up version of fantasy chess.

Each player moves and attacks with one creature each turn. Each creature has their own unique stats (health points (HP), movement, and attack) that they use to deal damage to the opponent's creatures. When a creature receives damage, that creature will turn down to the face with the appropriate HP showing. Once a die is defeated, the player that defeated the die places it in the scoring area until the end of the game, where they would then roll to find out who won.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement

name: Hostile Environment: Walk Solobot AI
description:
This is an Artificial Intelligence system deck to order enemy units around in Walk, so you may play solo or co-op against the enemy.

The rules work through a deck of 40 cards that tell enemy units, where to go and what to do.

There are three sets of instructions on every card. One set gives orders to patrolling units unaware of the player. The other two sets of orders are for aware units attacking the player's units, separated by the size of the Walks (Light/Reg Vs Large/Behemoth).

Patrol instructions include: Sweeping the area for the player, Patrolling objectives, Checking suspicious behavior, etc...

Attack instructions include: Rushing the player, Flanking, Various types of attacks, etc...

Each card includes: Compass directions, Dice rolls, Player to attack, and Hit Locations. There are also playing card symbols on each card to be used for variable actions or objective orders in the case of multiple objectives.

For each enemy activation, the player draws a card for that enemy unit. The card gives the enemy order or orders, sometimes requiring multiple cards to be drawn to show what direction the enemy moves, and also which player to attack.

H.E.: Walk Solobot AI is quick to learn and gives you a good fight. The enemy might just surprise you!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: MechaForce: Tactical Combat Game
description:
The streamlined tactical combat game of giant armored mecha.

The MechaForce rulebook is a very concise and streamlined 7 pages and gives you details on Mecha Construction, Pilot Advancement, Movement, Firing, Brawling, Conventional Forces, and more.
To play the game you will need tokens and a map with a hexagonal grid.
You may alternately play with miniatures and model terrain.

This purchase includes both a PDF version suitable for reading on your computer, iPad or iPhone and a special 'PocketMod' PDF version for printing.
The PocketMod version lets you create your own 4.25" x 2.75" sized game books from a single sheet of paper.
Take a copy to read on the go, and print one to give to each player at the table.

—description from the publisher

name: Five Gems
description:
Five Gems is designed to be a fun economic PnP game that can be played by adults and children.
There are 5 gems all worth different values in the market: ruby, sapphire, emerald, topaz, and diamond.
Players must Trade Up and purchase gems from their starting 2 cards to build a stockpile of gems.
It's a game that can be played multiple times to learn which gems are more valuable, which cards to keep and which to trade away.

The player who earns the most types of gems over the determined number of rounds is the winner.

How to Play:
Exchange phase:
Each player starts off with a very small collection of gems on their cards.
The start player rolls the 3 dice, then from the trade marker the dice are placed around the board counting away from the trade marker.
The start player sets the market by choosing one of the exchange rates. Everyone trades 1 of their cards by following the exchange rates in that segment trying to collect more sets of a gem type.
When they trade their card they draw a number of new unrevealed cards as stated by the exchange rate and add them to their collection. The next player then becomes the start player, and continues over several rounds.

Purchase phase:
Players that have collected a certain amount of coins on their cards can buy some extra cards hoping to get more gems.

Scoring:
Count up all the gems on the cards for each type. Whomever has the most majority of each Type is the winner.
Rings on cards will break ties.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Print & Play
publishers: popipopo games (ぽぴぽぽゲームズ)

name: Pâtée impériale: Deuxième service
description:
First expansion for “Pâtée impériale”

Adds three modules:

- fifth player
- the ambitious: each player will have now objectives to fulfill to gain more points
- the plotters: new courtesans with new tricky actions
